Are you really Harry Potter? Oh — well, I thought it might be one of Fred and George’s jokes, And have you really got — you know . . . So that’s where You-Know-Who — ?

Wow,

So you must know loads of magic already.  Horrible — well, not all of them. My aunt and uncle and cousin are, though. Wish I’d had three wizard brothers.

Five, I’m the sixth in our family to go to Hogwarts. You could say I’ve got a lot to live up to. Now Percy’s a prefect. Fred and George mess around a lot, but they still get really good marks and everyone thinks they’re really funny. You never get anything new, either, with five brothers. I’ve got Bill’s old robes, Charlie’s old wand, and Percy’s old rat. His name’s Scabbers and he’s useless, he hardly ever wakes up. Percy got an owl from my dad for being made a prefect, but they couldn’t aff — I mean, I got Scabbers instead.
. . . and until Hagrid told me, I didn’t know anything about being a wizard or about my parents or Voldemort — What?
I’d have thought you, of all people —
I’m not trying to be brave or anything, saying the name, I just never knew you shouldn’t.  See what I mean? I’ve got loads to learn. . . . I bet, I bet I’m the worst in the class.
You won’t be. There’s loads of people who come from Muggle families and they learn quick enough.

Nothing, that’s why it’s such big news. They haven’t been caught. Probably ’cause it’s you, isn’t it? Mind you, they’d have to dig me up first, because Mum would’ve killed me. Anyway, you can ask Dad yourself this evening. We’re staying at the Leaky Cauldron tonight too! So you can come to King’s Cross with us tomorrow! Hermione’s there as well!
Mum and Dad dropped me off this morning with all my Hogwarts things.
Excellent! So, have you got all your new books and stuff?

Look at this, Brand-new wand. Fourteen inches, willow, containing one unicorn tail-hair. And we’ve got all our books — What about those Monster Books, eh? The assistant nearly cried when we said we wanted two.

Well, I’m taking more new subjects than you, aren’t I? Those are my books for Arithmancy, Care of Magical Creatures, Divination, Study of Ancient Runes, Muggle Studies —
What are you doing Muggle Studies for?  You already know all about Muggles!
But it’ll be fascinating to study them from the Wizarding point of view,
Are you planning to eat or sleep at all this year, Hermione?
I’ve still got ten Galleons, It’s my birthday in September, and Mum and Dad gave me some money to get myself an early birthday present.
How about a nice book?
No, I don’t think so, I really want an owl. I mean, Harry’s got Hedwig and you’ve got Errol —

Later,

— that I’ll be a good boy and stay in the castle?
What?”
Why would I go looking for someone I know wants to kill me?

Session-222.Scene: The Pocket Sneakoscope spun rapidly and glowed in Ron's hand, indicating untrustworthiness.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I need to talk to you in private,
Go away, Ginny,
Who d’you reckon he is?
Professor R. J. Lupin,
How d’you know that?
It’s on his case,
Wonder what he teaches?
That’s obvious, There’s only one vacancy, isn’t there? Defense Against the Dark Arts.
Well, I hope he’s up to it, He looks like one good hex would finish him off, doesn’t he? Anyway . . . What were you going to tell us?
Harry, Oh, Harry . . . you’ll have to be really, really careful. Don’t go looking for trouble, Harry —
I don’t go looking for trouble, Trouble usually finds me.
How thick would Harry have to be, to go looking for a nutter who wants to kill him? No one knows how he got out of Azkaban, No one’s ever done it before. And he was a top-security prisoner too.
But they’ll catch him, won’t they?
“What’s that noise?”  It’s coming from your trunk, Harry,
Is that a Sneakoscope?
Yeah . . . mind you, it’s a very cheap one, It went haywire just as I was tying it to Errol’s leg to send it to Harry.
Were you doing anything untrustworthy at the time?

No! Well . . . I wasn’t supposed to be using Errol. You know he’s not really up to long journeys . . . but how else was I supposed to get Harry’s present to him? We could get it checked in Hogsmeade, They sell that sort of thing in Dervish and Banges, magical instruments and stuff. Fred and George told me.
I’ve read it’s the only entirely non-Muggle settlement in Britain —
Yeah, I think it is, but that’s not why I want to go. I just want to get inside Honeydukes!
What’s that?

It’s this sweetshop, where they’ve got everything. . . . Pepper Imps — they make you smoke at the mouth — and great fat Chocoballs full of strawberry mousse and clotted cream, and really excellent sugar quills, which you can suck in class and just look like you’re thinking what to write next —

But Hogsmeade’s a very interesting place, isn’t it? In Sites of Historical Sorcery it says the inn was the headquarters for the 1612 goblin rebellion, and the Shrieking Shack’s supposed to be the most severely haunted building in Britain —
— and massive sherbet balls that make you levitate a few inches off the ground while you’re sucking them,
Won’t it be nice to get out of school for a bit and explore Hogsmeade?
’Spect it will, You’ll have to tell me when you’ve found out.
What d’you mean?
I can’t go. The Dursleys didn’t sign my permission form, and Fudge wouldn’t either.
You’re not allowed to come? But — no way — McGonagall or someone will give you permission — — or we can ask Fred and George, they know every secret passage out of the castle —
Yeah, I expect that’s what McGonagall will say when I ask for permission,

Oh, Ron, don’t talk rubbish, Black’s already murdered a whole bunch of people in the middle of a crowded street. Do you really think he’s going to worry about attacking Harry just because we’re there?
Don’t let that thing out! Get out of here!
Ron, don’t!
D’you think we should wake him up? He looks like he could do with some food.
Er — Professor? Excuse me — Professor?
I suppose he is asleep? I mean — he hasn’t died, has he?
I’m not,
New teacher,  “What were you saying, Malfoy?”
Really,
“Ron,” “be careful . . .”
We must be nearly there, “Great,” I’m starving. I want to get to the feast. . . .
We can’t be there yet,
So why’re we stopping? What’s going on?
Ouch! Ron, that was my foot!
D’you think we’ve broken down?
Dunno . . .
There’s something moving out there, I think people are coming aboard. . . .
Hullo, Neville,
No idea — sit down —
I’m going to go and ask the driver what’s going on,
Who’s that? Who’s that?
Who’s that? Who’s that?
Ginny?
Arthur, what are you doing?
I was looking for Ron —
Not here! I’m here!
W-what?
Are you okay?
Yeah, What happened? Where’s that — that thing? Who screamed?
No one screamed,
“But I heard screaming —”
What was that thing?
Harry?
Well — that thing — the dementor — stood there and looked around (I mean, I think it did, I couldn’t see its face) — and you — you —
You went sort of rigid and fell out of your seat and started twitching —

And Professor Lupin stepped over you, and walked toward the dementor, and pulled out his wand, But the dementor didn’t move, so Lupin muttered something, and a silvery thing shot out of his wand at it,  and it turned around and sort of glided away.
I felt weird, Like I’d never be cheerful again. . . .
But didn’t any of you — fall off your seats?
No, Ginny was shaking like mad, though. . . .
“Fine,”

Pass the marmalade,
But —

When you’ve all finished deciding whether I’m going to die or not!

No,

Why?
原文无此句 But then, I — I remembered those dementors.
Well . . . yeah, Professor Lupin, you know the dementors —
Why?
Professor Snape’s very interested in the Dark Arts,

By the sound of it — everywhere. Dervish and Banges, the wizarding equipment shop, Zonko’s Joke Shop, into the Three Broomsticks for foaming mugs of hot butterbeer, and many places besides. The post office, Harry! About two hundred owls, all sitting on shelves, all color-coded depending on how fast you want your letter to get there! Honeydukes has got a new kind of fudge; they were giving out free samples, there’s a bit, look — We think we saw an ogre, honestly, they get all sorts at the Three Broomsticks — Wish we could have brought you some butterbeer, really warms you up —
What did you do? Did you get any work done?
No, Lupin made me a cup of tea in his office. And then Snape came in. . . .
Lupin drank it? Is he mad?
We’d better go down, you know, the feast’ll be starting in five minutes. . . .

Please, sir, the werewolf differs from the true wolf in several small ways. The snout of the werewolf —
You asked us a question and she knows the answer! Why ask if you don’t want to be told?

Why couldn’t Black have hidden in Snape’s office, eh? He could have finished him off for us!

Brilliant!
Okay, team, let’s go for it!
Stand aside, you silly girl . . . stand aside, now. . . .
That was the scariest thing I’ve ever seen in my life.

Session-245.Scene: Harry's broomstick was destroyed when it crashed into the Whomping Willow after he fell from it.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What happened?
What happened? What happened? Are we doing a replay?
Where is Wood?

Dumbledore was really angry, I’ve never seen him like that before. He ran onto the field as you fell, waved his wand, and you sort of slowed down before you hit the ground. Then he whirled his wand at the dementors. Shot silver stuff at them. They left the stadium right away. . . . He was furious they’d come onto the grounds. We heard him —
Then he magicked you onto a stretcher, And walked up to school with you floating on it. Everyone thought you were . . .
Did someone get my Nimbus?
Er —
What?
Hmm . . .
And?
And it hit — it hit — oh, Harry — it hit the Whomping Willow.
And?
Hmm . . . It — it doesn’t like being hit.
Professor Flitwick brought it back just before you came around,

Session-246.Scene: Lupin revealed to Harry that dementors affected him more due to the horrors of his past.

Dialogue.Dialogue: If Snape’s teaching Defense Against the Dark Arts again, I’m skiving off, Check who’s in there, Hermione.
It’s okay!
Oh no, I’ve already finished it!
No, The tree smashed it to bits.
Did you hear about the dementors too?
Yes, Why? Why do they affect me like that? Am I just — ?
Why did they have to come to the match?
Azkaban must be terrible,
But Sirius Black escaped from them, He got away. . . .
But if the dementors come to another Quidditch match, I need to be able to fight them —
We can do all our Christmas shopping there! Mum and Dad would really love those Toothflossing Stringmints from Honeydukes!

Session-247.Scene: Fred and George gifted Harry the Marauder's Map, a secret tool for navigating Hogwarts and its hidden passages.

What’s that supposed to be?
And what do I need with a bit of old parchment?
Don’t tell me —
And you know how to work it? “You’re winding me up,”

Session-248.Scene: Harry discovered a new ink figure labeled with his name on the Marauder's Map, mimicking his actions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Dissendium! Lumos! Mischief managed!

Session-249.Scene: Ron recounted how an Acid Pop from Fred had once burned a hole in his tongue, leading to a walloping from his mother.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Ugh, no, Harry won’t want one of those, they’re for vampires, I expect,
How about these?
Definitely not,
Harry! What are you doing here?
Wow! you’ve learned to Apparate!
’Course I haven’t,
How come Fred and George never gave it to me! I’m their brother!
But Harry isn’t going to keep it! He’s going to hand it in to Professor McGonagall, aren’t you, Harry?
No, I’m not!
Are you mad? Hand in something that good?
If I hand it in, I’ll have to say where I got it! Filch would know Fred and George had nicked it!
But what about Sirius Black? He could be using one of the passages on that map to get into the castle! The teachers have got to know!

He can’t be getting in through a passage, There are seven secret tunnels on the map, right? Fred and George reckon Filch already knows about four of them. And of the other three — one of them’s caved in, so no one can get through it. One of them’s got the Whomping Willow planted over the entrance, so you can’t get out of it. And the one I just came through — well — it’s really hard to see the entrance to it down in the cellar, so unless he knew it was there . . .

See? I’d like to see Black try and break into Honeydukes with dementors swarming all over the village. Anyway, Hermione, the Honeydukes owners would hear a break-in, wouldn’t they? They live over the shop!

Yes, Look, Harry still shouldn’t be coming into Hogsmeade. He hasn’t got a signed form! If anyone finds out, he’ll be in so much trouble! And it’s not nightfall yet — what if Sirius Black turns up today? Now?
He’d have a job spotting Harry in this, Come on, Hermione, it’s Christmas. Harry deserves a break.
Are you going to report me?

Oh — of course not — but honestly, Harry — Seen the Fizzing Whizbees, Harry? And the Jelly Slugs? And the Acid Pops? Fred gave me one of those when I was seven — it burnt a hole right through my tongue. I remember Mum walloping him with her broomstick. Reckon Fred’d take a bit of Cockroach Cluster if I told him they were peanuts?

Session-250.Scene: Harry revealed that he heard his mother screaming every time a dementor got near him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where is everyone?
Gone! It’s the first day of the holidays, remember? It’s nearly lunchtime; I was going to come and wake you up in a minute.
You really don’t look well, you know,
I’m fine,
Harry, listen, you must be really upset about what we heard yesterday. But the thing is, you mustn’t go doing anything stupid.
Like what?
Like trying to go after Black,
Harry?

I can hear my mum screaming and pleading with Voldemort. And if you’d heard your mum screaming like that, just about to be killed, you wouldn’t forget it in a hurry. And if you found out someone who was supposed to be a friend of hers betrayed her and sent Voldemort after her —

There’s nothing you can do! The dementors will catch Black and he’ll go back to Azkaban and — and serve him right! You heard what Fudge said. Black isn’t affected by Azkaban like normal people are. It’s not a punishment for him like it is for the others.
So what are you saying?
You want to — to kill Black or something? Harry? Harry doesn’t want to kill anyone, do you, Harry?
Say You-Know-Who, will you?
— so obviously, the Malfoys knew Black was working for Voldemort —

— and Malfoy’d love to see you blown into about a million pieces, like Pettigrew! Get a grip. Malfoy’s just hoping you’ll get yourself killed before he has to play you at Quidditch. Harry, please, please be sensible. Black did a terrible, terrible thing, but d-don’t put yourself in danger, it’s what Black wants. . . . Oh, Harry, you’d be playing right into Black’s hands if you went looking for him. Your mum and dad wouldn’t want you to get hurt, would they?   They’d never want you to go looking for Black!
I’ll never know what they’d have wanted, because thanks to Black, I’ve never spoken to them,
Look, it’s the holidays! It’s nearly Christmas! Let’s — let’s go down and see Hagrid. We haven’t visited him for ages!
No! Harry isn’t supposed to leave the castle, Ron —
Yeah, let’s go, and I can ask him how come he never mentioned Black when he told me all about my parents!
Or we could have a game of chess, or Gobstones. Percy left a set —
No!

Session-251.Scene: Hagrid sobbed onto Harry's neck upon opening his cabin door.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid, what is it?
What’s this, Hagrid?
Hagrid!
You’ll have to put up a good strong defense, Hagrid, I’m sure you can prove Buckbeak is safe.
What about Dumbledore, Hagrid?
Listen, Hagrid, you can’t give up. Hermione’s right, you just need a good defense. You can call us as witnesses —
I’m sure I’ve read about a case of hippogriff-baiting, where the hippogriff got off. I’ll look it up for you, Hagrid, and see exactly what happened.
Er — shall I make a cup of tea? It’s what my mum does whenever someone’s upset,
We do like them!
Yeah, they’re great! Er — how are the flobberworms?
Oh no!
Is it awful in there, Hagrid?
But you were innocent!

Session-253.Scene: Fact: Harry found a disgusting hippogriff conviction case from 1722.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Here’s something . . . there was a case in 1722 . . . but the hippogriff was convicted — ugh, look what they did to it, that’s disgusting —
Look, No!

Session-254.Scene: Harry received a Firebolt broomstick anonymously, causing excitement and suspicion among his friends.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oi! Presents! Another sweater from Mum . . . maroon again . . . see if you’ve got one. What’s that?
Dunno . . .
I don’t believe it, Who sent it to you?
Look and see if there’s a card,
Nothing! Blimey, who’d spend that much on you?
Well, I’m betting it wasn’t the Dursleys.
I bet it was Dumbledore, He sent you the Invisibility Cloak anonymously. . . .
That was my dad’s, though, Dumbledore was just passing it on to me. He wouldn’t spend hundreds of Galleons on me. He can’t go giving students stuff like this —

That’s why he wouldn’t say it was from him! In case some git like Malfoy said it was favoritism. Hey, Harry Malfoy! Wait till he sees you on this! He’ll be sick as a pig! This is an international standard broom, this is!
Which?
I know, I know who it could’ve been — Lupin!
What? Lupin?
Yeah, but he likes you, And he was away when your Nimbus got smashed, and he might’ve heard about it and decided to visit Diagon Alley and get this for you —
What d’you mean, he was away? He was ill when I was playing in that match.
Well, I was there, cleaning out the bedpans on that detention from Snape, remember?
I can’t see Lupin affording something like this.
What?
Don’t bring him in here!
Who sent it to you? Who sent you that?
No idea, There wasn’t a card or anything with it.
What’s the matter with you?
No idea, but it’s a bit odd, isn’t it? I mean, this is supposed to be quite a good broom, isn’t it?
It’s the best broom there is, Hermione,
So it must’ve been really expensive. . . .
Probably cost more than all the Slytherins’ brooms put together,
Well,
Who cares? Listen, Harry, can I have a go on it? Can I?
I don’t think anyone should ride that broom just yet!
What? GET — HIM — OUT — OF — HERE!
I forgot about that! I never wear those socks if I can help it. . . .
You’d better take that cat out of here, Hermione, Can’t you shut that thing up?
He’s not looking too good, is he?
It’s stress! He’d be fine if that big stupid furball left him alone!

Session-255.Scene: Trelawney, claiming to have foreseen it, joined the Christmas feast after abandoning her solitary luncheon.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Dunno,
Coming?
No! I want a quick word with Professor McGonagall.
Probably trying to see if she can take any more classes,

Session-256.Scene: Hermione's suspicion of Sirius Black's involvement in the broom's delivery led to her informing Professor McGonagall.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Scurvy cur,
No,
What? Why?
Strip it down?
There’s nothing wrong with it! Honestly, Professor —
What did you go running to McGonagall for?
Because I thought — and Professor McGonagall agrees with me — that that broom was probably sent to Harry by Sirius Black!

Session-257.Scene: Hermione haughtily marched off after Ron and Harry's exchange.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Still looks ill, doesn’t he?
What d’you reckon’s the matter with him?
And what are you tutting at us for?
Nothing,
Yes, you were, I said I wonder what’s wrong with Lupin, and you —
Ah,
If you don’t want to tell us, don’t,
Fine,
She doesn’t know, She’s just trying to get us to talk to her again.

Session-258.Scene: Harry heard his father's voice for the first time while practicing the Patronus Charm.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What!
Okay,
How does it work?
What does a Patronus look like?
And how do you conjure it?
Right,
Expecto Patronum, Expecto Patronum. Expecto Patronum, Expecto Patronum
Oh — yeah — Expecto Patronum, Expecto Patronum. Expecto Patrono — no, Patronum — sorry — Expecto Patronum, Expecto Patronum — Did you see that? Something happened!
Yes, Expecto Patronum! Expecto Patronum! Expecto — Expecto Patronum! Expecto Pat — EXPECTO PATRONUM! EXPECTO PATRONUM!
Sorry,
Yes . . . It’s getting worse,
I do! I’ve got to! What if the dementors turn up at our match against Ravenclaw? I can’t afford to fall off again. If we lose this game we’ve lost the Quidditch Cup!
Ready,
Expecto Patronum! Expecto Patronum! Expecto — Expecto Patronum! Expecto Pat — EXPECTO PATRONUM! EXPECTO PATRONUM!
I heard my dad, That’s the first time I’ve ever heard him — he tried to take on Voldemort himself, to give my mum time to run for it. . . .
Oh — yeah — Ah,
No! I’ll have one more go! I’m not thinking of happy enough things, that’s what it is. . . . Hang on. . . .
Expecto Patronum! Expecto Patronum! Expecto Patronum! EXPECTO PATRONUM! EXPECTO PATRONUM!
Can we have another go? Just one more go?
Fine, Professor Lupin? If you knew my dad, you must’ve known Sirius Black as well.
Nothing — I mean, I just knew they were friends at Hogwarts too. . . .

Session-259.Scene: Wood imitated Professor McGonagall's severe voice about keeping the Firebolt.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How’s she doing it?
What!

Getting to all her classes! I heard her talking to Professor Vector, that Arithmancy witch, this morning. They were going on about yesterday’s lesson, but Hermione can’t’ve been there, because she was with us in Care of Magical Creatures! And Ernie Macmillan told me she’s never missed a Muggle Studies class, but half of them are at the same time as Divination, and she’s never missed one of them either!
I’m not buying anything Malfoy thinks is good,

Session-260.Scene: Lupin revealed the horrifying process of the Dementor's Kiss, where a soul is sucked out.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You said it’s harder if there are loads of them,

What!
What!
What!
He deserves it, Yes, For . . . for some things . . .

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sorry, Professor —
I can have it back? Seriously?
She gave it to you? Excellent! Listen, can I still have a go on it? Tomorrow?
Yeah . . . anything . . . ,  You know what — we should make up with Hermione. . . . She was only trying to help. . . .
Okay,

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oddsbodikins,
I got it back,
See, Hermione? There wasn’t anything wrong with it!

I’ll take it! I’ve got to give Scabbers his rat tonic.
Can I sit down, then?
I suppose so,
How are you getting through all this stuff?
Oh, well — you know — working hard,
Why don’t you just drop a couple of subjects?
I couldn’t do that!
Arithmancy looks terrible,
It’s my favorite subject! It’s —
LOOK! LOOK!
What!
LOOK! BLOOD! HE’S GONE! AND YOU KNOW WHAT WAS ON THE FLOOR?
N-no,

Session-263.Scene: Scabbers' death led to a heated argument where Hermione felt unjustly blamed for various incidents.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Okay, side with Ron, I knew you would! First the Firebolt, now Scabbers, everything’s my fault, isn’t it! Just leave me alone, Harry, I’ve got a lot of work to do!
He bit Goyle for us once! Remember, Harry?
Yeah, that’s true,

I’m staying out for a bit; Ron wants a go on the Firebolt, Here you go,

Dialogue.Dialogue: Did you see his face? He can’t believe it! This is brilliant!
Yeah, reckon so,
Pity you can’t attach an extra arm to yours, Malfoy, Then it could catch the Snitch for you.

Session-266.Scene: Malfoy, Crabbe, Goyle, and Flint were caught disguised as dementors in a scheme to sabotage Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Expecto Patronum!
Yes! Yes!  Yes! Yes!
The dementors didn’t affect me at all! I didn’t feel a thing!
Right,

Dialogue.Dialogue: Did you even come to the match?
Of course I did, And I’m very glad we won, and I think you did really well, but I need to read this by Monday.
Come on, Hermione, come and have some food, I can’t, Harry. I’ve still got four hundred and twenty-two pages to read! Anyway . . . He doesn’t want me to join in.
If Scabbers hadn’t just been eaten, he could have had some of those Fudge Flies. He used to really like them —
Can’t you give her a break?
No, If she just acted like she was sorry — but she’ll never admit she’s wrong, Hermione. She’s still acting like Scabbers has gone on vacation or something.

Session-268.Scene: Ron believed Sirius Black slashed his curtains with a knife, causing him to wake up in terror.

Dialogue.Dialogue: AAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRRRRRRRRRRGGGGGHHHHH! NOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!
Black! Sirius Black! With a knife!
Here! Just now! Slashed the curtains! Woke me up!
Look at the curtains! I tell you, he was here!

Session-269.Scene: Sir Cadogan readily admitted to letting a man into Gryffindor Tower, bypassing the password.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’re you doing?
I’m telling you, I saw him!
Professor McGonagall told us to go to bed!
Woke me up! In our dormitory! With a knife! Woke me up!
I’m telling you —

Session-270.Scene: Ron had become a celebrity due to his encounter with Black.

Dialogue.Dialogue: D’you reckon we should tell someone?

We know he’s not coming in through Honeydukes, We’d’ve heard if the shop had been broken into. . . . I was asleep, and I heard this ripping noise, and I thought it was in my dream, you know? But then there was this draft . . . I woke up and one side of the hangings on my bed had been pulled down. . . . I rolled over . . . and I saw him standing over me . . . like a skeleton, with loads of filthy hair . . . holding this great long knife, must’ve been twelve inches . . . and he looked at me, and I looked at him, and then I yelled, and he scampered. Why, though? Why did he run?

He must’ve known he’d have a job getting back out of the castle once you’d yelled and woken people up, He’d’ve had to kill the whole House to get back through the portrait hole . . . then he would’ve met the teachers. . . .

Session-271.Scene: Neville fled the hall to escape his grandmother's amplified, scolding Howler.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Run for it, Neville,
Ouch! Oh — thanks, Hedwig.
He probably wants to hear all about Black! All right, Hagrid! S’pose you want to hear about Saturday night, do you?

Dialogue.Dialogue: What are they for, Hagrid?
What?
What about her?
— ate Scabbers!
Hagrid, we should’ve helped as well — sorry —
If she’d just get rid of that cat, I’d speak to her again! But she’s still sticking up for it! It’s a maniac, and she won’t hear a word against it!

Session-273.Scene: Hermione threatened to reveal Harry's map if he went to Hogsmeade again.

Well, Filch hasn’t done anything about the passage into Honeydukes. . . .
Harry! Harry, if you go into Hogsmeade again . . . I’ll tell Professor McGonagall about that map!
Can you hear someone talking, Harry?
Ron, how can you let him go with you? After what Sirius Black nearly did to you! I mean it, I’ll tell —
So now you’re trying to get Harry expelled! Haven’t you done enough damage this year? So how about it? Come on, last time we went you didn’t see anything. You haven’t even been inside Zonko’s yet!
Okay, But I’m taking the Invisibility Cloak this time.

Session-274.Scene: Harry explained that Snape had delayed him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s me,
What kept you?
Snape was hanging around. . . .

Session-275.Scene: Harry revealed his presence to Malfoy after Crabbe accidentally pulled off his invisibility cloak.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Even the Hogwarts ghosts avoid it, I asked Nearly Headless Nick . . . he says he’s heard a very rough crowd lives here. No one can get in. Fred and George tried, obviously, but all the entrances are sealed shut. . . .
Leave him to me,
Very haunted up here, isn’t it?
Harry! you’d better run for it! If Malfoy tells anyone — you’d better get back to the castle, quick —
See you later,

Dialogue.Dialogue: “I don’t know, Professor.”
No,
No,
SHUT UP!
“I told you to shut up about my dad!” “I know the truth, all right? He saved your life! Dumbledore told me! You wouldn’t even be here if it wasn’t for my dad!”
“Spare bit of parchment,” “No!”
“No,”

Do you know them?
It’s my fault, I persuaded you to go. Lupin’s right, it was stupid, we shouldn’t’ve done it — Come to have a good gloat? Or have you just been to tell on us?
“No,” “No,” I just thought you ought to know . . . Hagrid lost his case. Buckbeak is going to be executed.

Session-278.Scene: Hermione's sudden disappearance puzzled Harry and Ron during their Charms lesson.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “Where’s Hermione gone?”
