She could’ve done with a Cheering Charm on her too,

Session-279.Scene: Hermione confessed that thoughts of Malfoy had caused her to miss Charms class.

Dialogue.Dialogue: W-what? Is it time to go? W-which lesson have we got now?
Divination, but it’s not for another twenty minutes, Hermione, why didn’t you come to Charms?
What? Oh no! I forgot to go to Charms!
with
I don’t believe it! Was Professor Flitwick angry?
You know what, Hermione? I reckon you’re cracking up. You’re trying to do too much.
No, I’m not! I just made a mistake, that’s all! I’d better go and see Professor Flitwick and say sorry. . . . I’ll see you in Divination!

Session-280.Scene: Hermione angrily declared that she was leaving Divination class after Professor Trelawney insulted her skepticism.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I can’t believe I missed Cheering Charms! And I bet they come up in our exams; Professor Flitwick hinted they might!
I thought we weren’t starting crystal balls until next term,
Don’t complain, this means we’ve finished palmistry, I was getting sick of her flinching every time she looked at my hands.
Well, honestly . . . ‘the fates have informed her’ . . . who sets the exam? She does! What an amazing prediction!
Flibbertigibbet
Yeah, there’s a burn on this table, Someone’s spilled their candle.
This is such a waste of time, I could be practicing something useful. I could be catching up on Cheering Charms —
I don’t need help, It’s obvious what this means. There’s going to be loads of fog tonight.
Oh, for goodness’ sake! Not that ridiculous Grim again!
“Fine!” “Fine!” “I give up! I’m leaving!”

Session-281.Scene: Harry's exasperation peaked as Oliver Wood repeatedly emphasized the crucial point difference needed to secure the Quidditch Cup.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I KNOW, OLIVER!

Session-282.Scene: Harry frantically woke Ron to confirm his sighting of Crookshanks and a large dog outside.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I can’t work, I can’t concentrate, You’re going to be fine,
You’ve got a Firebolt!
Yeah . . . ,
Ron! Ron! Wake up!
Huh?
I need you to tell me if you can see something!
What? What’re you on about?
Down here —

Session-283.Scene: Malfoy maliciously grabbed the tail of Harry's Firebolt broom, hindering his pursuit of the Snitch.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “You —”
Go! Go! Go!  YES!

Session-284.Scene: Fudge revealed that he was at Hogwarts to witness Buckbeak's execution on behalf of the Committee for the Disposal of Dangerous Creatures.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,
Does that mean the appeal’s already happened?
Then you might not have to witness an execution at all! The hippogriff might get off!
Why’d you stop me? Did you see them? They’ve even got the axe ready! This isn’t justice!
As long as Hagrid keeps his head this time, and argues his case properly, they can’t possibly execute Buckbeak. . . .
Nope,

Session-285.Scene: Ron confessed to fabricating a vision during his divination session.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, Wish she’d hurry up . . .
How’d it go?
Rubbish, Couldn’t see a thing, so I made some stuff up. Don’t think she was convinced, though. . . .
Meet you in the common room,

Session-286.Scene: Professor Trelawney, in a trance-like state, delivered a prophecy about the Dark Lord's return.

Dialogue.Dialogue: A hippogriff,
Yes,
No!
No! It looks fine, it’s — flying away. . . .
S-sorry?
You — you just told me that the — the Dark Lord’s going to rise again . . . that his servant’s going to go back to him. . . .
But you just said it! You said the Dark Lord —

Session-287.Scene: Hermione retrieved the Invisibility Cloak from the passageway under the one-eyed witch.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Buckbeak lost, Hagrid’s just sent this.
We’ve got to go, He can’t just sit there on his own, waiting for the executioner!
Sunset, though, We’d never be allowed . . . ’specially you, Harry. . . .
If we only had the Invisibility Cloak. . . .
Where is it?
. . . if Snape sees me anywhere near there again, I’m in serious trouble,
Yeah, If he sees you. . . . How do you open the witch’s hump again?
She hasn’t gone to get it? Hermione, I don’t know what’s gotten into you lately! First you hit Malfoy, then you walk out on Professor Trelawney —

Session-288.Scene: Hermione unexpectedly discovered Scabbers hiding inside a milk jug.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s us, We’re wearing the Invisibility Cloak. Let us in and we can take it off.
Hagrid Hagrid
Hagrid
Hagrid
Ron! I — I don’t believe it — it’s Scabbers!
What are you talking about? What? Scabbers, what are you doing here? Scabbers! No cats! There’s nothing here to hurt you!

Session-289.Scene: Hagrid urged Harry, Ron, and Hermione to leave despite their protests.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid
We’ll tell them what really happened —
They can’t kill him —

Session-290.Scene: Scabbers, writhing in terror, escaped Ron's grasp and scampered away, initiating a chase toward the Whomping Willow.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid,
We can’t, He’ll be in worse trouble if they know we’ve been to see him. . . .
How — could — they? How could they?
Come on, Scabbers, keep still, What’s the matter with you, you stupid rat? Stay still — OUCH! He bit me!
He won’t — stay — put — What’s the matter with him?
Crookshanks!
Scabbers — NO!
Ron!
Get away from him — get away — Scabbers, come here — Gotcha! Get off, you stinking cat —
Lumos! Ron!
Harry — we’ve got to go for help —
No! That thing’s big enough to eat him; we haven’t got time —
We’re never going to get through without help —
If that dog can get in, we can,
Oh, help, help, please . . . Crookshanks! How did he know — ?
He’s friends with that dog, I’ve seen them together. Come on — and keep your wand out —

Session-291.Scene: Harry followed Crookshanks through a secret tunnel that Fred and George had deemed inaccessible.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s Ron?
This way,
Where does this tunnel come out?
I don’t know. . . . It’s marked on the Marauder’s Map but Fred and George said no one’s ever gotten into it. . . . It goes off the edge of the map, but it looked like it ends up in Hogsmeade. . . .

Session-292.Scene: Hermione gripped Harry's arm tightly enough to cause numbness.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry, I think we’re in the Shrieking Shack.
Ghosts didn’t do that,
Ron — are you okay?
Where’s the dog?
Harry, Harry, it’s a trap —
What — He’s the dog . . . he’s an Animagus. . . .
Harry!
Harry,
Did you hear me? You’ll have to kill all three of us!
Why’s that? Didn’t care last time, did you? Didn’t mind slaughtering all those Muggles to get at Pettigrew. . . . What’s the matter, gone soft in Azkaban?
Harry! Be quiet!
HE KILLED MY MUM AND DAD! No
Argh! NO YOU DON’T! Get out of the way!
You killed my parents, The whole story? You sold them to Voldemort. That’s all I need to know.
I understand a lot better than you think, You never heard her, did you? My mum . . . trying to stop Voldemort killing me . . . and you did that . . . you did it. . . .
WE’RE UP HERE! WE’RE UP HERE — SIRIUS BLACK — QUICK!
Professor, what’s going on — ?
I DON’T BELIEVE IT! You — you —
— you and him!
I trusted you, and all the time you’ve been his friend!
Harry,
“Get away from me, werewolf!”
Ages, Since I did Professor Snape’s essay. . . .
“Both,”
I’m not, If I’d been a bit cleverer, I’d have told everyone what you are!
Dumbledore hired you when he knew you were a werewolf? Is he mad?
AND HE WAS WRONG! YOU’VE BEEN HELPING HIM ALL THE TIME!
If you haven’t been helping him, how did you know he was here?
You know how to work it?
You wrote — ?
How d’you know about the Cloak?
What? No, we weren’t!
No one was with us!
One of us!
What? What’s Scabbers got to do with it?
What? What’s my rat got to do with anything?
What d’you mean — of course he’s a rat —

Session-294.Scene: James Potter risked his life to save Severus Snape from Remus Lupin's werewolf form after Sirius Black tricked Snape into approaching the Shrieking Shack.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You’re both mental.
Ridiculous!
Peter Pettigrew’s dead! He killed him twelve years ago!
You’re nutters, both of you, I’ve had enough of this. I’m off.
There were witnesses who saw Pettigrew die, A whole street full of them . . .
But Professor Lupin . . . Scabbers can’t be Pettigrew . . . it just can’t be true, you know it can’t . . .

Because . . . because people would know if Peter Pettigrew had been an Animagus. We did Animagi in class with Professor McGonagall. And I looked them up when I did my homework — the Ministry of Magic keeps tabs on witches and wizards who can become animals; there’s a register showing what animal they become, and their markings and things . . . and I went and looked Professor McGonagall up on the register, and there have been only seven Animagi this century, and Pettigrew’s name wasn’t on the list —
This place is haunted!
Shh!
My dad too?
But how did that help you?
What sort of animal — ?
So that’s why Snape doesn’t like you, because he thought you were in on the joke?

Session-295.Scene: Black revealed that Fudge had inadvertently provided him with the Daily Prophet photograph that exposed Pettigrew's whereabouts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor Lupin could have killed me about a hundred times this year, I’ve been alone with him loads of times, having defense lessons against the dementors. If he was helping Black, why didn’t he just finish me off then?
Expelliarmus!
We attacked a teacher. . . . We attacked a teacher . . . , Oh, we’re going to be in so much trouble —
I’m still not saying I believe you,
Come off it, Are you trying to say he broke out of Azkaban just to get his hands on Scabbers? I mean . . .
What about it?
Look, Scabbers probably had a fight with another rat or something! He’s been in my family for ages, right —
We — we’ve been taking good care of him!
He’s been scared of that mad cat!
What do you mean?
And why did he fake his death? Because he knew you were about to kill him like you killed my parents! And now you’ve come to finish him off!
Then I should’ve let Snape take you!
THAT’S NOT TRUE! HE WAS THEIR SECRET-KEEPER! HE SAID SO BEFORE YOU TURNED UP. HE SAID HE KILLED THEM!
What are you going to do with him if I give him to you?
Professor Lupin? Can — can I say something?
Well — Scabbers — I mean, this — this man — he’s been sleeping in Harry’s dormitory for three years. If he’s working for You-Know-Who, how come he never tried to hurt Harry before now?
Er — Mr. Black — Sirius? If you don’t mind me asking, how — how did you get out of Azkaban, if you didn’t use Dark Magic?
The guards say he’s been talking in his sleep . . . always the same words . . . ‘He’s at Hogwarts.’
I let you sleep in my bed!
NO! You can’t kill him, You can’t.
I know, We’ll take him up to the castle. We’ll hand him over to the dementors. . . . He can go to Azkaban . . . but don’t kill him.
Get off me, I’m not doing this for you. I’m doing it because I don’t reckon my dad would’ve wanted his best friends to become killers — just for you.
He can go to Azkaban, If anyone deserves that place, he does. . . .
That’s better,
What about Professor Snape?
And me,

Session-296.Scene: Sirius tentatively offered Harry a life beyond the Dursleys after his name was cleared.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You’re free,
Yeah, I knew that,
Leave the Dursleys?
Are you insane? Of course I want to leave the Dursleys! Have you got a house? When can I move in?
Yeah, I mean it!

Session-297.Scene: Pettigrew, as a rat, slipped through Ron's manacle.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Expelliarmus! “Stay where you are!” “Sirius, he’s gone, Pettigrew transformed!”
What did he do to him?
“I don’t know. . . .” “We’d better get them up to the castle and tell someone,”
“Come —”
“Sirius,

Session-298.Scene: Hermione used a time-turner to potentially save more than one innocent life.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I need to see the headmaster,
WHAT?
Minister, listen! Sirius Black’s innocent! Peter Pettigrew faked his own death! We saw him tonight! You can’t let the dementors do that thing to Sirius, he’s —
YOU HAVEN’T! YOU’VE GOT THE WRONG MAN!
Minister, listen, please, I saw him too. It was Ron’s rat, he’s an Animagus, Pettigrew, I mean, and —
WE’RE NOT CONFUNDED!
Professor Dumbledore, Sirius Black —
Professor!
— he escaped when Professor Lupin turned into a werewolf —
— he’s a rat —
— Pettigrew’s front paw, I mean, finger, he cut it off —
— Pettigrew attacked Ron, it wasn’t Sirius —
Professor Lupin can tell you —
But —
But you believe us.
But —
Good luck? Three turns? What’s he talking about? What are we supposed to do?
Quick! Quick!
“Here —”
“Ready?
“What are we doing?” WHAT?

Session-299.Scene: Hermione confessed she had been secretly using a Time-Turner provided by Professor McGonagall for extra study time.

Dialogue.Dialogue: In here!
WHAT?
We’ve gone back in time, Three hours back . . .
But —
Shh! Listen! Someone’s coming! I think — I think it might be us!
Footsteps across the hall . . . yes, I think it’s us going down to Hagrid’s! Are you telling me, that we’re here in this cupboard and we’re out there too?
Yes, I’m sure it’s us. It doesn’t sound like more than three people . . . and we’re walking slowly because we’re under the Invisibility Cloak — We’ve gone down the front steps. . . .
Where did you get that hourglass thing?

It’s called a Time-Turner, and I got it from Professor McGonagall on our first day back. I’ve been using it all year to get to all my lessons. Professor McGonagall made me swear I wouldn’t tell anyone. She had to tell them that I was a model student, and that I’d never, ever use it for anything except my studies. . . . I’ve been turning it back so I could do hours over again, that’s how I’ve been doing several lessons at once, see? But . . . Harry, I don’t understand what Dumbledore wants us to do. Why did he tell us to go back three hours? How’s that going to help Sirius?
There must be something that happened around now he wants us to change, What happened? We were walking down to Hagrid’s three hours ago. . . .
This is three hours ago, and we are walking down to Hagrid’s, We just heard ourselves leaving. . . .
Dumbledore just said — just said we could save more than one innocent life. . . . Hermione, we’re going to save Buckbeak!
But — how will that help Sirius?

Dumbledore said — he just told us where the window is — the window of Flitwick’s office! Where they’ve got Sirius locked up! We’ve got to fly Buckbeak up to the window and rescue Sirius! Sirius can escape on Buckbeak — they can escape together!
If we manage that without being seen, it’ll be a miracle!
Well, we’ve got to try, haven’t we? Doesn’t sound like anyone’s there. . . . Come on, let’s go. . . .

Session-300.Scene: Harry and Hermione overheard Hagrid greeting their cloaked, time-traveling selves at his front door.

Dialogue.Dialogue: If anyone’s looking out of the window —
We’ll run for it, Straight into the forest, all right? We’ll have to hide behind a tree or something and keep a lookout —

Okay, but we’ll go around by the greenhouses! We need to keep out of sight of Hagrid’s front door, or we’ll see us! We must be nearly at Hagrid’s by now! Right, We need to sneak over to Hagrid’s. . . . Keep out of sight, Harry. . . .
Let us in and we can take it off.

Session-301.Scene: Hermione referenced Professor McGonagall's warnings about the dangers of wizards meddling with time.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This is the weirdest thing we’ve ever done,
Let’s move along a bit, We need to get nearer to Buckbeak!
Now?
No! If we steal him now, those Committee people will think Hagrid set him free! We’ve got to wait until they’ve seen he’s tied outside!
That’s going to give us about sixty seconds,
No! Don’t you understand? We’re breaking one of the most important Wizarding laws! Nobody’s supposed to change time, nobody! You heard Dumbledore, if we’re seen —
We’d only be seen by ourselves and Hagrid!

Harry, what do you think you’d do if you saw yourself bursting into Hagrid’s house? Exactly! You wouldn’t understand, you might even attack yourself! Don’t you see? Professor McGonagall told me what awful things have happened when wizards have meddled with time. . . . Loads of them ended up killing their past or future selves by mistake!
Okay!
We’re about to come out!

Session-302.Scene: Harry momentarily mistook his own Patronus for his father.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry,
Come on! Where are you? Dad, come on —
Look! Did anyone see you?
Yes, haven’t you been listening? I saw me but I thought I was my dad! It’s okay!
Harry,
I knew I could do it this time, because I’d already done it. . . . Does that make sense?
Harry,

Session-303.Scene: Harry conjured a Patronus that drove away dementors, showcasing very advanced magic.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Right, We’ve got about forty-five minutes until Dumbledore locks the door to the hospital wing. We’ve got to rescue Sirius and get back into the ward before anybody realizes we’re missing. . . .
D’you reckon he’s up there yet?
Look! Who’s that? Someone’s coming back out of the castle!
Hermione! The executioner! He’s gone to get the dementors! This is it, Hermione —

Session-304.Scene: Black stared weakly at the hippogriff in disbelief.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Whoa! He’s there!
Stand back!
“Get on — there’s not much time, Okay, Buckbeak, up!

Session-305.Scene: Hermione anxiously urged Harry to return to the hospital wing before Dumbledore secured it.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We’ve got exactly ten minutes to get back down to the hospital wing without anybody seeing us — before Dumbledore locks the door —
Okay, let’s go. . . .

Session-306.Scene: Hermione monitored the time with a sense of urgency regarding Sirius's situation.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Peeves! In here!
Sirius

Session-307.Scene: Hermione calculated that three turns of something would suffice before midnight.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “Three minutes, Harry!”
Hermione — what’ll happen — if we don’t get back inside — before Dumbledore locks the door?
We did it! Sirius has gone, on Buckbeak. . . .

Session-308.Scene: Harry and Hermione nervously consumed chocolate under Madam Pomfrey's watchful eye while awaiting the outcome of the unfolding events.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Really — they’ll wake everybody up! What do they think they’re doing?

Session-309.Scene: Snape angrily accused Harry and Hermione of assisting in an escape, despite Dumbledore's assurance that the door had been locked.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry? Why are we in here? Where’s Sirius? Where’s Lupin? What’s going on?
You explain,

Session-310.Scene: Snape had shared the information about Lupin's werewolf status with the Slytherin students earlier that morning.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
That’s wonderful!
What?
What? Why?
I’m going to see him,
— doesn’t sound like there’s anything we can do —
I don’t care. I still want to see him. I’ll meet you back here.

Session-311.Scene: Lupin revealed that Snape had exposed his werewolf status at breakfast, prompting his resignation.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I just saw Hagrid, And he said you’d resigned. It’s not true, is it?
What? The Ministry of Magic don’t think you were helping Sirius, do they?
You’re not leaving just because of that!
You’re the best Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher we’ve ever had! Don’t go!
How d’you know about that? What else could have driven the dementors back?
You told me Moony, Wormtail, Padfoot, and Prongs would’ve wanted to lure me out of school . . . you said they’d have thought it was funny.
It didn’t make any difference, Pettigrew got away.
Professor Dumbledore — yesterday, when I was having my Divination exam, Professor Trelawney went very — very strange.

Yes . . . her voice went all deep and her eyes rolled and she said . . . she said Voldemort’s servant was going to set out to return to him before midnight. . . . She said the servant would help him come back to power.  “And then she sort of became normal again, and she couldn’t remember anything she’d said. Was it — was she making a real prediction?” But — I stopped Sirius and Professor Lupin from killing Pettigrew! That makes it my fault if Voldemort comes back!
I don’t want a bond with Pettigrew! He betrayed my parents!

Last night . . . I thought it was my dad who’d conjured my Patronus. I mean, when I saw myself across the lake . . . I thought I was seeing him. It was stupid, thinking it was him, I mean, I knew he was dead.

Session-312.Scene: Vernon begrudgingly permitted Harry to attend the Quidditch World Cup due to his fear of Sirius's potential intervention.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So what?
She did put enough stamps on, then,
So — can I go then?
You’ve seen her, She’s my friend Ron’s mother, she was meeting him off the Hog — off the school train at the end of last term.
It’s a sport,
Normal for us, you know, owl post. That’s what’s normal for wizards.
Only after Dudley finished with them,
“Okay, I can’t see the World Cup. Can I go now, then? Only I’ve got a letter to Sirius I want to finish. You know — my godfather.”
Well — yeah, It’s been a while since he heard from me, and, you know, if he doesn’t, he might start thinking something’s wrong.
Well, all right then.

Session-313.Scene: Dudley repeatedly checked his backside due to lingering trauma from a previous magical encounter.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er, I think so,

Session-314.Scene: Uncle Vernon's rant was abruptly cut short by an unknown event.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I know, Maybe — er — the traffic’s bad, or something.

Session-315.Scene: Mr. Weasley excitedly expressed interest in the Dursleys' "eclectic" electric fire with a plug.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They — they’ve tried to get here by Floo powder, Mr. Weasley? Can you hear me? Mr. Weasley, it’s Harry . . . the fireplace has been blocked up. You won’t be able to get through there.
They’ve got an electric fire,
What are we doing here? Has something gone wrong?
It’s upstairs,
Yep, that’s Dudley.
the Burrow! the Burrow!
Well . . .’bye then,
It doesn’t matter, Honestly, I don’t care.
See you, See you,
the Burrow!

Session-316.Scene: Fred and George had spent the summer seeking a test subject for their Ton-Tongue Toffee invention.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What is it? What was it?
Yeah, he is, Mr. Weasley,
Why don’t you show Harry where he’s sleeping, Ron?
He knows where he’s sleeping, in my room, he slept there last —
We can all go,
Well, Right.

Session-317.Scene: Ginny blushed when Harry grinned back at her.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What is it?

Mum found this stack of order forms when she was cleaning Fred and George’s room, Great long price lists for stuff they’ve invented. Joke stuff, you know. Fake wands and trick sweets, loads of stuff. It was brilliant, I never knew they’d been inventing all that . . .

Only, most of the stuff — well, all of it, really — was a bit dangerous, and, you know, they were planning to sell it at Hogwarts to make some money,  and Mum went mad at them. Told them they weren’t allowed to make any more of it, and burned all the order forms. . . . She’s furious at them anyway. They didn’t get as many O. W.L.s as she expected.
Hi, Percy,
We’re not thundering, We’re walking. Sorry if we’ve disturbed the top-secret workings of the Ministry of Magic.
What are you working on?
That’ll change the world, that report will,

Session-318.Scene: Ron lamented Pigwidgeon's name, as the owl no longer responded to any other name.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Shut up, Pig, Fred and George are in here with us, because Bill and Charlie are in their room, Percy gets to keep his room all to himself because he’s got to work.
Er — why are you calling that owl Pig?

Yep, Ginny named him, She reckons it’s sweet. And I tried to change it, but it was too late, he won’t answer to anything else. So now he’s Pig. I’ve got to keep him up here because he annoys Errol and Hermes. He annoys me too, come to that.
Where’s Crookshanks?
Out in the garden, I expect, He likes chasing gnomes. He’s never seen any before.
Percy’s enjoying work, then?

Enjoying it? I don’t reckon he’d come home if Dad didn’t make him. He’s obsessed. Just don’t get him onto the subject of his boss. . . Mr. Crouch is of the opinion . . . Mr. Crouch was telling me . . . They’ll be announcing their engagement any day now.
Have you had a good summer,  Did you get our food parcels and everything?
Yeah, thanks a lot, They saved my life, those cakes.
And have you heard from — ?
I think they’ve stopped arguing, Shall we go down and help your mum with dinner?

Session-319.Scene: Harry considered sharing his recurring scar pain and disturbing dream with Ron and Hermione.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What is this?
So — have you heard from Sirius lately?
Wow — hope it does this time!

Session-320.Scene: Mrs. Weasley used the Summoning Charm to extract Ton-Tongue Toffees from Fred and George's pockets.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, very good.
You have to pass a test to Apparate?
Er — Splinched?
Were they okay?
But Bill and Charlie and Percy can all do it?
Walk? What, are we walking to the World Cup?

Session-321.Scene: Mr. Weasley detailed the logistical challenges of transporting wizards to the World Cup while avoiding Muggles.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So how does everyone get there without all the Muggles noticing?
What sort of objects are Portkeys?

Session-322.Scene: Amos Diggory proudly recounted Cedric's Quidditch victory over Harry Potter to the group.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — yeah,

Session-323.Scene: Mr. Roberts unwittingly described a wizard in a kilt and poncho to Mr. Weasley.

Dialogue.Dialogue: A twenty, Ah yes, so it is. . . . I don’t know, these little bits of paper . . .

Session-324.Scene: A witch accidentally stepped on a slug while scolding her son.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — is it my eyes, or has everything gone green?
Like we’d say anything else surrounded by that lot.
I wonder what the Bulgarians have got dangling all over their tents?
Let’s go and have a look,
Krum,
What?
Krum!
He looks really grumpy,
‘Really grumpy’? Who cares what he looks like? He’s unbelievable. He’s really young too. Only just eighteen or something. He’s a genius, you wait until tonight, you’ll see.

Session-325.Scene: Bill's Brazilian penfriend sent him a cursed hat after he cancelled their exchange trip due to financial constraints.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who d’you reckon they are? They don’t go to Hogwarts, do they?

’Spect they go to some foreign school, I know there are others. Never met anyone who went to one, though. Bill had a penfriend at a school in Brazil . . . this was years and years ago . . . and he wanted to go on an exchange trip but Mum and Dad couldn’t afford it.

Session-326.Scene: Mr. Weasley unsuccessfully tried to start a fire with matches, scattering splintered ones around him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Met a few people, You not got that fire started yet?
Come here, Mr. Weasley,
They’re what?

Session-327.Scene: Harry generously bought Omnioculars for Ron and Hermione despite Ron's initial reluctance due to his financial limitations.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Been saving my pocket money all summer for this,
Wow, look at these!
Wish I hadn’t bought this now,
Three pairs,
No — don’t bother,
You won’t be getting anything for Christmas, For about ten years, mind.
Fair enough,
Oooh, thanks, Harry, And I’ll get us some programs, look —

Session-328.Scene: Ludo Bagman used Sonorus to amplify his voice before the Quidditch World Cup match.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Dobby?
Sorry, I just thought you were someone I knew.
Yeah, I am,
How is he? How’s freedom suiting him?
Why? What’s wrong with him?
Why not?
Paying? Well — why shouldn’t he be paid?
Well, it’s about time he had a bit of fun,
Why’s he sent you up here, if he knows you don’t like heights?
So that’s a house-elf? Weird things, aren’t they?
Dobby was weirder,
Wild! I can make that old bloke down there pick his nose again . . . and again . . . and again . . .
‘A display from the team mascots will precede the match,’
Slimy gits,
What are veel — ?
Harry, what are you doing?
Huh?
Honestly!
Excellent!
There you go, for the Omnioculars! Now you’ve got to buy me a Christmas present, ha!
That’s him, that’s him!
Hawkshead Attacking Formation,
What? But Levski’s got the Quaffle!
Harry, if you’re not going to watch at normal speed, you’re going to miss things!
They’re going to crash!
Look at the referee!
Time-out! Ah, come on, he can’t play like that, look at him —
He’s seen the Snitch! He’s seen it! Look at him go!
They’re going to crash!
They’re not!
Lynch is!
He’s got it — Krum’s got it — it’s all over!
What did he catch the Snitch for? He ended it when Ireland were a hundred and sixty points ahead, the idiot!
He knew they were never going to catch up! The Irish Chasers were too good. . . . He wanted to end it on his terms, that’s all. . . .
He was very brave, wasn’t he? He looks a terrible mess. . . .

Session-329.Scene: Harry used Omnioculars to watch the Quidditch World Cup match in slow motion with play-by-play commentary.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That’s sick, That is really sick. . . .
What happened? Ron, where are you? Oh this is stupid — Lumos!
Tripped over a tree root,
What’s that supposed to mean?
Hermione’s a witch,
You watch your mouth!
Never mind, Ron,
Where’re your parents? Out there wearing masks, are they?
Oh come on, let’s go and find the others.
C’mon,
I’ll bet you anything his dad is one of that masked lot!
Well, with any luck, the Ministry will catch him! Oh I can’t believe this. Where have the others got to?
Er — what?
Beauxbatons,
Sorry?
They must go to Beauxbatons, You know . . . Beauxbatons Academy of Magic . . . I read about it in An Appraisal of Magical Education in Europe.
Oh . . . yeah . . . right,
Fred and George can’t have gone that far,
Ah, no, I don’t believe it . . . I’ve lost my wand!
You’re kidding!
Maybe it’s back in the tent,
Maybe it fell out of your pocket when we were running?
Yeah, maybe . . .
What happened? Why can’t she run properly?
Bet she didn’t ask permission to hide,

You know, house-elves get a very raw deal! It’s slavery, that’s what it is! That Mr. Crouch made her go up to the top of the stadium, and she was terrified, and he’s got her bewitched so she can’t even run when they start trampling tents! Why doesn’t anyone do something about it?
Well, the elves are happy, aren’t they? You heard old Winky back at the match . . . ‘House-elves is not supposed to have fun’ . . . that’s what she likes, being bossed around. . . .
It’s people like you, Ron, who prop up rotten and unjust systems, just because they’re too lazy to —
Let’s just keep moving, shall we?

Session-330.Scene: Harry, entranced by the veela's dance, almost jumped from the Top Box into the stadium.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Did I tell you I’ve invented a broomstick that’ll reach Jupiter?
Honestly! I reckon we can just wait here, you know. We’ll hear anyone coming a mile off.
Well — there’s a sort of riot going on,
At the campsite . . . some people have got hold of a family of Muggles. . . .
Not exactly on top of things, Mr. Bagman, is he?
He was a great Beater, though, The Wimbourne Wasps won the league three times in a row while he was with them.
I hope the others are okay,
They’ll be fine,
Imagine if your dad catches Lucius Malfoy, He’s always said he’d like to get something on him.
That’d wipe the smirk off old Draco’s face, all right,
Those poor Muggles, though, What if they can’t get them down?
They will, They’ll find a way.
Mad, though, to do something like that when the whole Ministry of Magic’s out here tonight! I mean, how do they expect to get away with it? Do you think they’ve been drinking, or are they just —

Session-331.Scene: Fact: Winky found Harry's wand in the trees after someone conjured the Dark Mark.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hello? Who’s there? MORSMORDRE!
What the — ?
Who’s there?
Harry, come on, move!
What happened?
It’s the Dark Mark, Harry! You-Know-Who’s sign!
Voldemort’s — ?
Harry, come on!
DUCK!
We didn’t do that!
We didn’t do anything! What did you want to attack us for?
Over there, There was someone behind the trees . . . they shouted words — an incantation —
Hey — that’s mine!
That’s my wand! I dropped it!
I didn’t drop it there, anyway, I missed it right after we got into the wood.
It wasn’t her! Winky’s got a squeaky little voice, and the voice we heard doing the incantation was much deeper! It didn’t sound anything like Winky, did it?
No, It definitely didn’t sound like an elf.
Yeah,
But she was frightened! Your elf’s scared of heights, and those wizards in masks were levitating people! You can’t blame her for wanting to get out of their way!

Session-332.Scene: Ron suggested Draco Malfoy's father was likely one of the masked "nutters" supporting You-Know-Who.

Dialogue.Dialogue: She didn’t do anything — she was just in the wrong place at the wrong time!
She didn’t run amok! She just picked it up off the ground!
Look, can someone just explain what that skull thing was? It wasn’t hurting anyone. . . . Why’s it such a big deal?
I told you, it’s You-Know-Who’s symbol, Ron, I read about it in The Rise and Fall of the Dark Arts.
I don’t get it, I mean . . . it’s still only a shape in the sky. . . .
What? What are Death Eaters?
Yeah, Dad, we met Draco Malfoy in the woods, and he as good as told us his dad was one of those nutters in masks! And we all know the Malfoys were right in with You-Know-Who!
But if they were the Death Eaters, why did they Disapparate when they saw the Dark Mark? They’d have been pleased to see it, wouldn’t they?
So . . . whoever conjured the Dark Mark . . . were they doing it to show support for the Death Eaters, or to scare them away?

Session-333.Scene: Mr. Weasley realized an article about the Dark Mark incident implicated him and his Ministry office.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mrs. Weasley, Hedwig hasn’t arrived with a letter for me, has she?
All right if I go and dump my stuff in your room, Ron?
Yeah . . . think I will too, Hermione?
Yes,

Session-334.Scene: Harry's scar had ached on Saturday morning, prompting him to confide in Ron and Hermione.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’s up, Harry?
There’s something I haven’t told you, On Saturday morning, I woke up with my scar hurting again.
But — he wasn’t there, was he? You-Know-Who? I mean — last time your scar kept hurting, he was at Hogwarts, wasn’t he?
I’m sure he wasn’t on Privet Drive, But I was dreaming about him . . . him and Peter — you know, Wormtail.   I can’t remember all of it now, but they were plotting to kill . . . someone.
It was only a dream, Just a nightmare.
Yeah, but was it, though? It’s weird, isn’t it? . . . My scar hurts, and three days later the Death Eaters are on the march, and Voldemort’s sign’s up in the sky again.
Don’t — say — his — name!
And remember what Professor Trelawney said? At the end of last year?
Oh Harry, you aren’t going to pay attention to anything that old fraud says?

You weren’t there, You didn’t hear her. This time was different. I told you, she went into a trance — a real one.   she said the Dark Lord would rise again . . . greater and more terrible than ever before . . . and he’d manage it because his servant was going to go back to him . . . and that night Wormtail escaped.
Why were you asking if Hedwig had come, Harry? Are you expecting a letter?
I told Sirius about my scar, I’m waiting for his answer.
Good thinking! I bet Sirius’ll know what to do!
I hoped he’d get back to me quickly,
But we don’t know where Sirius is . . . he could be in Africa or somewhere, couldn’t he? Hedwig’s not going to manage that journey in a few days.
Yeah, I know,
Come and have a game of Quidditch in the orchard, Harry, Come on — three on three, Bill and Charlie and Fred and George will play. . . . You can try out the Wronski Feint. . . .
Ron, Harry doesn’t want to play Quidditch right now. . . . He’s worried, and he’s tired. . . . We all need to go to bed. . . .
Yeah, I want to play Quidditch, Hang on, I’ll get my Firebolt.
Boys.

Session-335.Scene: Mrs. Weasley declared that Ron's new maroon, lace-trimmed dress robes were actually for formal occasions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Ron, Ron, you don’t reckon Sirius has been caught, do you?
Nah, it would’ve been in the Daily Prophet, The Ministry would want to show they’d caught someone, wouldn’t they?
Yeah, I suppose. . . .
Look, here’s the stuff Mum got for you in Diagon Alley. And she’s got some gold out of your vault for you . . . and she’s washed all your socks. What is that supposed to be?
Mum, you’ve given me Ginny’s new dress,
What
You’ve got to be kidding, I’m not wearing that, no way. Never.
I’ll go starkers before I put that on,
Well, they’re okay! Why couldn’t I have some like that?
I’m not wearing that, no way. Never.
Why is everything I own rubbish?

Session-336.Scene: Someone allegedly attempted to break into Mad-Eye Moody's house the previous night.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who is Mad-Eye?

Session-337.Scene: Charlie hinted at a future event he would be involved in, but kept it secret from Percy.

Dialogue.Dialogue: A bit of what?
Thanks for having us to stay, Mrs. Weasley,
Yeah, thanks for everything, Mrs. Weasley,
Mum! What d’you three know that we don’t?

Session-338.Scene: Malfoy implied that the Weasley family was unaware of important Ministry news due to Arthur Weasley's perceived low status.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Bagman wanted to tell us what’s happening at Hogwarts, At the World Cup, remember? But my own mother won’t say. Wonder what —
Shh!
So he thinks Durmstrang would have suited him, does he? I wish he had gone, then we wouldn’t have to put up with him.
Durmstrang’s another Wizarding school?
Yes, and it’s got a horrible reputation. According to An Appraisal of Magical Education in Europe, it puts a lot of emphasis on the Dark Arts.
I think I’ve heard of it, Where is it? What country?
Well, nobody knows, do they?
Er — why not?
There’s traditionally been a lot of rivalry between all the magic schools. Durmstrang and Beauxbatons like to conceal their whereabouts so nobody can steal their secrets,
Come off it, Durmstrang’s got to be about the same size as Hogwarts — how are you going to hide a great big castle?
But Hogwarts is hidden,
Just you, then, So go on — how d’you hide a place like Hogwarts?
It’s bewitched, If a Muggle looks at it, all they see is a moldering old ruin with a sign over the entrance saying DANGER, DO NOT ENTER, UNSAFE.
So Durmstrang’ll just look like a ruin to an outsider too?
Maybe, or it might have Muggle-repelling charms on it, like the World Cup stadium. And to keep foreign wizards from finding it, they’ll have made it Unplottable —
Come again?
Well, you can enchant a building so it’s impossible to plot on a map, can’t you?
Er . . . if you say so,
But I think Durmstrang must be somewhere in the far north, Somewhere very cold, because they’ve got fur capes as part of their uniforms.
Ah, think of the possibilities, It would’ve been so easy to push Malfoy off a glacier and make it look like an accident. . . . Shame his mother likes him. . . .
It was, Look at this, Neville. . . .
We saw him right up close, as well,
Don’t remember asking you to join us, Malfoy,
Eat dung, Malfoy!
What are you talking about?
Either explain what you’re on about or go away, Malfoy,
Ron! Reparo!
Him! Get to me! ? As if!
Hi, Hagrid!
Oooh, I wouldn’t fancy crossing the lake in this weather,

Session-339.Scene: A delighted first-year boy mouthed "I fell in the lake!" and gave a double thumbs-up to his brother, Colin.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Says who? Hope they hurry up with the Sorting. I’m starving.
Hi, Colin,
Er — good,
Er — yeah, all right, Brothers and sisters usually go in the same Houses, don’t they?
Oh no, not necessarily, You’d think they’d be together, wouldn’t you? Where’s the new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher? Maybe they couldn’t get anyone!
Oh hurry up, I could eat a hippogriff.

Session-340.Scene: Hermione was horrified to learn that Hogwarts employed over a hundred unpaid house-elves.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That’s not the song it sang when it Sorted us,
Sings a different one every year, It’s got to be a pretty boring life, hasn’t it, being a hat? I suppose it spends all year making up the next one.
Oh hurry up,
’Course it is, if you’re dead,
About time,
Aaah, ’at’s be’er,
Why? Wha’ ’appened?
Yeah, we thought Peeves seemed hacked off about something, So what did he do in the kitchens?
There are house-elves here? Here at Hogwarts?
I’ve never seen one!
But they get paid? They get holidays, don’t they? And — and sick leave, and pensions, and everything?
Oh c’mon, ’Er-my-knee, Oops — sorry, ’Arry — You won’t get them sick leave by starving yourself!
Slave labor, That’s what made this dinner. Slave labor.
Treacle tart, Hermione! Spotted dick, look! Chocolate gateau!
Hmph!
Why?

Session-341.Scene: Harry learned that Mad-Eye Moody, who Ron's father assisted that morning, would be their new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Moody? Mad-Eye Moody? The one your dad went to help this morning?
Must be,
Wha’ ’appened? What happened to his face?
Dunno,
Death toll?
Yeah, Yeah, a thousand Galleons . . .
Come on, we’ll be the only ones left here if you don’t move.

Session-342.Scene: Neville's foot unexpectedly broke through a trick step on a Hogwarts staircase.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who’s this impartial judge who’s going to decide who the champions are?
Dumbledore knows you’re not of age, though,
People have died, though!
What d’you reckon? Be cool to enter, wouldn’t it? But I s’pose they might want someone older. . . . Dunno if we’ve learned enough. . . .
Shut it, you,

Session-343.Scene: Seamus proudly displayed his Ireland rosette on his headboard.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mental, I might go in for it, you know, if Fred and George find out how to . . . the tournament . . . you never know, do you?
“S’pose not. . . .”

Session-344.Scene: Hermione haughtily declared she found better ways to stand for elf rights.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Today’s not bad . . . outside all morning, Herbology with the Hufflepuffs and Care of Magical Creatures . . . damn it, we’re still with the Slytherins. . . .
Double Divination this afternoon,
You should have given it up like me, shouldn’t you? Then you’d be doing something sensible like Arithmancy.
You’re eating again, I notice,
I’ve decided there are better ways of making a stand about elf rights,
Yeah . . . and you were hungry,

Session-345.Scene: Professor Trelawney irritatedly insisted that Harry had been born under the influence of Saturn despite Harry's lack of interest.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry!
What?
Born under — what, sorry?
No, I was born in July.

Session-346.Scene: Ron's crude joke about Uranus earned the class a significant homework assignment.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ve got two Neptunes here, that can’t be right, can it?
Aaaaah, when two Neptunes appear in the sky, it is a sure sign that a midget in glasses is being born, Harry. . . .
Can I have a look at Uranus too, Lavender?
Miserable old bat, That’ll take all weekend, that will. . . .
Lots of homework? Professor Vector didn’t give us any at all!
Well, bully for Professor Vector,

Session-347.Scene: Moody transformed Malfoy into a bouncing ferret as punishment for attacking Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
Get stuffed, Malfoy, C’mon, Ron. . . .
You know your mother, Malfoy? that expression she’s got, like she’s got dung under her nose? Has she always looked like that, or was it just because you were with her?
Keep your fat mouth shut, then,
No, missed.
The what?

Session-348.Scene: Ron declared that Hermione was ruining the best moment of his life.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Don’t talk to me,
The what?
Because I want to fix that in my memory forever, Hermione! you’re ruining the best moment of my life!
Don’t tell me you’re going back to the library this evening?
Got to, Loads to do.
But you told us Professor Vector —
It’s not schoolwork,
What was it like?
The what?
Doing what?
We haven’t got him till Thursday!

Session-349.Scene: Moody demonstrated the effects of the Unforgivable Curses on spiders in front of the fourth-year Gryffindors.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You know why Snape’s in such a foul mood, don’t you?
Yeah, Moody. I reckon Snape’s a bit scared of him, you know,
Imagine if Moody turned Snape into a horned toad, and bounced him all around his dungeon. . . .
Been in the —
Library. C’mon, quick, or we won’t get decent seats.
What, aren’t you staying?
Er, my dad told me about one. . . . Is it called the Imperius Curse, or something?
Stop it!
Avada Kedavra,

Session-350.Scene: Neville displayed the same horrified expression he wore during Moody's Cruciatus Curse demonstration.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hurry up,
Not the ruddy library again?
No, Neville. Neville?
Neville, are you all right?
Yes,
What was that about?

Session-351.Scene: Ron characterized Moody's confrontational approach as attacking first and asking questions later.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wouldn’t Moody and Dumbledore be in trouble with the Ministry if they knew we’d seen the curses?
Ah, Attacks first and asks questions later — look at his dustbins. Balderdash.
Shall we get our Divination stuff, then?
I s’pose,

Session-352.Scene: Neville displayed unusual pride after Moody recognized his Herbology skills.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Neville?

Session-353.Scene: Ron and Harry collaboratively invented tragic predictions for their Divination homework.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I haven’t got a clue what this lot’s supposed to mean,
You know, I think it’s back to the old Divination standby.
What — make it up?
Yeah, Next Monday, I am likely to develop a cough, owing to the unlucky conjunction of Mars and Jupiter. You know her — just put in loads of misery, she’ll lap it up.
Right, Okay . . . on Monday, I will be in danger of — er — burns.
Right then, we’re seeing the skrewts again on Monday. Okay, Tuesday, I’ll . . . erm . . .
Lose a treasured possession,
Good one, Because of . . . erm . .Mercury. Why don’t you get stabbed in the back by someone you thought was a friend?
Yeah . . . cool . . . because . . . Venus is in the twelfth house. And on Wednesday, I think I’ll come off worst in a fight.
Ah, Okay, I’ll lose a bet.
Yeah, you’ll be betting I’ll win my fight. . . .

Session-354.Scene: Harry angrily struck his forehead with his fist after reading the letter.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hedwig! About time!
She’s got an answer!
What does it say? He’s flying north? He’s coming back?
Harry — Harry — what’s up?
I shouldn’t’ve told him!
What are you on about?

It’s made him think he’s got to come back! Coming back, because he thinks I’m in trouble! And there’s nothing wrong with me! And I haven’t got anything for you, you’ll have to go up to the Owlery if you want food.
Harry
I’m going to bed, See you in the morning.

Session-355.Scene: Harry placated an indignant owl by threatening to use a different messenger.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry You didn’t imagine your scar hurting and you know it.
So what? He’s not going back to Azkaban because of me.
Drop it,

Session-356.Scene: Harry partially resisted the Imperius Curse by arguing with its command internally before physically fighting it.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But — but you said it’s illegal, Professor,
The way he talks, you’d think we were all going to be attacked any second.

Yeah, I know, Talk about paranoid . . . No wonder they were glad to get shot of him at the Ministry. Did you hear him telling Seamus what he did to that witch who shouted ‘Boo’ behind him on April Fools’ Day? And when are we supposed to read up on resisting the Imperius Curse with everything else we’ve got to do?

Session-357.Scene: Ron implied Hermione's admiration for Cedric stemmed from his good looks.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Brilliant! It’s Potions last thing on Friday! Snape won’t have time to poison us all!
Cedric?
Diggory, He must be entering the tournament.
That idiot, Hogwarts champion?
He’s not an idiot. You just don’t like him because he beat Gryffindor at Quidditch, I’ve heard he’s a really good student — and he’s a prefect.
You only like him because he’s handsome,
Excuse me, I don’t like people just because they’re handsome!
Lockhart!

Session-358.Scene: Hermione revealed that the Heads of the participating schools were judges due to injuries sustained during a past tournament.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who’s avoiding you?
What’s a bummer?
TRIWIZARD TOURNAMENT Thought any more about trying to enter?
Harry You know, I bet we could do them, Harry. We’ve done dangerous stuff before. . . .
Who are the judges?

Well, the Heads of the participating schools are always on the panel, because all three of them were injured during the Tournament of 1792, when a cockatrice the champions were supposed to be catching went on the rampage. It’s all in Hogwarts: A History. Though, of course, that book’s not entirely reliable. A Revised History of Hogwarts would be a more accurate title. Or A Highly Biased and Selective History of Hogwarts, Which Glosses Over the Nastier Aspects of the School.
What are you on about?
House-elves! Not once, in over a thousand pages, does Hogwarts: A History mention that we are all colluding in the oppression of a hundred slaves!
No, of course not,
That’s because they’re uneducated and brainwashed!
Why d’you have to keep changing owls?
Hedwig’ll attract too much attention, She stands out. A snowy owl that keeps returning to wherever he’s hiding . . . I mean, they’re not native birds, are they?
Thanks, Hedwig,

Session-359.Scene: Dennis Creevey mistook the approaching Beauxbatons delegation for a flying house.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nearly six, How d’you reckon they’re coming? The train?
I doubt it,
How, then? Broomsticks?
I don’t think so . . . not from that far away. . . .
A Portkey? Or they could Apparate — maybe you’re allowed to do it under seventeen wherever they come from?
You can’t Apparate inside the Hogwarts grounds, how often do I have to tell you?

Session-360.Scene: Madame Maxime specified that her horses were accustomed to drinking only single-malt whiskey.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Skrewts,
Well, if they’re any bigger than this lot, even Hagrid won’t be able to handle them, That’s if he hasn’t been attacked by his skrewts. Wonder what’s up with them?
Maybe they’ve escaped,
Oh don’t say that, Imagine that lot loose on the grounds. . . .

Session-361.Scene: Fact: Ron expressed disbelief that Hermione dismissed Viktor Krum as just a Quidditch player.

Dialogue.Dialogue: For heaven’s sake, Ron, he’s only a Quidditch player,
Only a Quidditch player? Hermione — he’s one of the best Seekers in the world! I had no idea he was still at school!
Really,
I’m getting his autograph if I can, You haven’t got a quill, have you, Harry?
Nope, they’re upstairs in my bag,

Session-362.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that the Goblet of Fire would select champions by magically returning the names of the most worthy candidates.

Dialogue.Dialogue: The what?

Session-363.Scene: Fred and George were ejected from the golden circle by an unseen force and sprouted long white beards after ingesting an aging potion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Anyone put their name in yet?
All the Durmstrang lot, But I haven’t seen anyone from Hogwarts yet.
Me, I would’ve if it had been me . . . wouldn’t have wanted everyone watching. What if the goblet just gobbed you right back out again?
What?
I’m not sure this is going to work, you know, I’m sure Dumbledore will have thought of this.

Session-364.Scene: Angelina Johnson revealed she had entered her name into the Triwizard Tournament.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Listen!
You’re kidding!
Are you seventeen, then?
’Course she is, can’t see a beard, can you?
Well, I’m glad someone from Gryffindor’s entering, I really hope you get it, Angelina!
What’re we going to do today, then?
We haven’t been down to visit Hagrid yet,
Okay, just as long as he doesn’t ask us to donate a few fingers to the skrewts.
I’ve just realized — I haven’t asked Hagrid to join S.P. E.W. yet! Wait for me, will you, while I nip upstairs and get the badges?
What is it with her?
Hey, Ron, It’s your friend . . .

Session-365.Scene: Ron wondered aloud about the accommodations for the Beauxbatons students.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What d’you reckon’ll happen to the ones who aren’t chosen? Reckon they’ll go back to school, or hang around to watch the tournament?
Dunno, Hang around, I suppose. . . . Madame Maxime’s staying to judge, isn’t she?
Where are they sleeping, then? Oh good, hurry up,

Session-366.Scene: Hermione unearthed a large talon in her beef casserole during lunch with Hagrid.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Go on, Hagrid!
But Harry set Dobby free, and he was over the moon about it! And we heard he’s asking for wages now!

Session-367.Scene: Hagrid applied a pungent eau de cologne in an attempt to impress Madame Maxime.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid, what’s that?
Is that aftershave?
Eau de cologne? Hagrid?
And what’s with the hair and the suit?
Look!
He’s going up to the castle with her! I thought he was waiting for us!
He fancies her! Well, if they end up having children, they’ll be setting a world record — bet any baby of theirs would weigh about a ton.

Session-368.Scene: Ron loudly expressed his disbelief when Cedric Diggory was chosen as the Hogwarts champion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So do I! Well, we’ll soon know!
No surprises there!
It’s her, Ron!
Oh look, they’re all disappointed,
No!

Session-369.Scene: Moody speculated that a skilled wizard used a Confundus Charm to deceive the Goblet of Fire into accepting Harry as a fourth champion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You know I didn’t.
You know I didn’t.

Session-370.Scene: Harry explained to Cedric that he had not entered his name into the Goblet of Fire.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I s’pose, Ah . . . okay,

Session-371.Scene: The Fat Lady mistook Harry's utterance of "Balderdash" for the password to the Gryffindor common room.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Balderdash,

Session-372.Scene: Lee Jordan draped a Gryffindor banner around Harry like a cloak.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I didn’t,
I’m not hungry, I had enough at the feast — I didn’t, I don’t know how it happened. I’m tired! No, seriously, George — I’m going to bed —

Session-373.Scene: Hermione brought Harry a stack of toast held in a napkin.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hello, I brought you this. . . . Want to go for a walk?
Good idea,

Well, of course I knew you hadn’t entered yourself, The look on your face when Dumbledore read out your name! But the question is, who did put it in? Because Moody’s right, Harry . . . I don’t think any student could have done it . . . they’d never be able to fool the goblet, or get over Dumbledore’s —
Have you seen Ron?
Erm . . . yes . . . he was at breakfast,
Does he still think I entered myself?
Well . . . no, I don’t think so . . . not really,
What’s that supposed to mean, ‘not really’?
Oh Harry, isn’t it obvious? He’s jealous!
Jealous? Jealous of what? He wants to make a prat of himself in front of the whole school, does he?

Look, it’s always you who gets all the attention, you know it is. I know it’s not your fault, I know you don’t ask for it . . . but — well — you know, Ron’s got all those brothers to compete against at home, and you’re his best friend, and you’re really famous — he’s always shunted to one side whenever people see you, and he puts up with it, and he never mentions it, but I suppose this is just one time too many. . . .
Great, Tell him from me he’s welcome to it. . . . People gawping at my forehead everywhere I go. . . .

I’m not telling him anything, Tell him yourself. It’s the only way to sort this out. That’s not funny, That’s not funny at all. Harry, I’ve been thinking — you know what we’ve got to do, don’t you? Straight away, the moment we get back to the castle?
Yeah, give Ron a good kick up the —

Write to Sirius. You’ve got to tell him what’s happened. He asked you to keep him posted on everything that’s going on at Hogwarts. . . . It’s almost as if he expected something like this to happen. I brought some parchment and a quill out with me —
Come off it, He came back to the country just because my scar twinged. He’ll probably come bursting right into the castle if I tell him someone’s entered me in the Triwizard Tournament — How?

Harry, this isn’t going to be kept quiet, This tournament’s famous, and you’re famous. I’ll be really surprised if there isn’t anything in the Daily Prophet about you competing. . . . You’re already in half the books about You-Know-Who, you know . . . and Sirius would rather hear it from you, I know he would.
Okay, okay, I’ll write to him, Whose owl am I going to use? He told me not to use Hedwig again.
Ask Ron if you can borrow —
I’m not asking Ron for anything,
Well, borrow one of the school owls, then, anyone can use them,

Session-374.Scene: Harry received extra homework from Professor Flitwick after struggling with Summoning Charms.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s really not that difficult, Harry,
Wonder why that was, Still — never mind, eh? Double Potions to look forward to this afternoon. . . .
ignore them, ignore them,

Session-375.Scene: Harry and Malfoy simultaneously cast jinxes at each other after Malfoy insulted Hermione.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh very funny, really witty.
Harry!
Furnunculus!
Hermione!

Session-376.Scene: Hermione fled, deeply upset by Snape's callous remark about her appearance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We attacked each other at the same time!
Hermione! Look!

Session-377.Scene: Harry expressed his displeasure at receiving more publicity.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, really amazing, What do they want photos for, Colin?
Great, Exactly what I need. More publicity.

Session-378.Scene: Hedwig expressed her displeasure by cutting Harry with her talons and flying to the rafters.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wand weighing?
Er —

Session-379.Scene: Rita Skeeter used a Quick-Quotes Quill to automatically record Harry's statements, twisting them for sensational effect.

Dialogue.Dialogue: A what?
Er —
I didn’t, I don’t know how my name got into the Goblet of Fire. I didn’t put it in there.
But I didn’t enter,
I haven’t really thought . . . yeah, nervous, I suppose,
Well . . . they say it’s going to be a lot safer this year,
Er,
I didn’t enter,
No,
I have NOT got tears in my eyes!

Session-380.Scene: A school barn owl delivered mail to Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You’ve had an owl,
Oh — right,
And we’ve got to do our detentions tomorrow night, Snape’s dungeon,

Session-381.Scene: Harry wrongly assumed people were taunting him about his mother's death.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, that’s right! I’ve just been crying my eyes out over my dead mum, and I’m just off to do a bit more. . . .
Oh — right — sorry,
Ignore it, Just ignore it, Harry.
I didn’t start this, It’s his problem.
You miss him!
Miss him? I don’t miss him. . . . Wronski Feint,”

Session-382.Scene: Hermione blushed slightly when suggesting a potential rendezvous with Ron at the Three Broomsticks.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What about Ron, though? Don’t you want to go with him?
. . . well I thought we might meet up with him in the Three Broomsticks. . . .
No,
Oh Harry, this is so stupid —
I’ll come, but I’m not meeting Ron, and I’m wearing my Invisibility Cloak.
Oh all right then . . . but I hate talking to you in that Cloak, I never know if I’m looking at you or not.

Session-383.Scene: Hermione considered involving villagers in S.P.E.W. while in the pub.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I look like such an idiot, sitting here on my own, Lucky I brought something to do. You know, maybe I should try and get some of the villagers involved in S.P. E.W.,
Yeah, right, Hermione, when are you going to give up on this spew stuff?
When house-elves have decent wages and working conditions! You know, I’m starting to think it’s time for more direct action. I wonder how you get into the school kitchens?
No idea, ask Fred and George,

Session-384.Scene: Hagrid secretly instructed Harry to meet him at his cabin at midnight while using the Invisibility Cloak.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look, it’s Hagrid!
Hello,
Can your eye — I mean, can you — ?
Why does Hagrid want me to meet him at midnight?
Does he? I wonder what he’s up to? I don’t know whether you should go, Harry. . . . It might make you late for Sirius.

Session-385.Scene: Harry stealthily navigated past bewitched badges with messages of 'POTTER STINKS'.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Thanks!

Session-386.Scene: Hagrid sported a flower resembling an oversized artichoke in his buttonhole while attempting to comb his hair.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, What’s up?
What’re you showing me?
... I Hagrid, what — ?

Session-387.Scene: Sirius communicated with Harry via fire from a wizarding house he had broken into.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Balderdash!
Sirius — how’re you doing?
I’m — . . . and now Hagrid’s just shown me what’s coming in the first task, and it’s dragons, Sirius, and I’m a goner,
What?
Yes — he — what?
Karkaroff got released? Why did they release him?
Okay, But . . . are you saying Karkaroff put my name in the goblet? Because if he did, he’s a really good actor. He seemed furious about it. He wanted to stop me from competing.
— you and the rest of the world,
What? Karkaroff’s trying to kill me? But — why?
Yeah,
So . . . so Voldemort could have found out about the tournament? Is that what you mean? You think Karkaroff might be here on his orders?
Looks like a really good plan from where I’m standing, They’ll just have to stand back and let the dragons do their stuff.
Yeah,
Go! Go! There’s someone coming!

Session-388.Scene: Harry angrily threw a badge at Ron, hitting him in the forehead.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who were you talking to?
What’s that got to do with you? What are you doing down here at this time of night? Does he?
Sorry about that, Should’ve realized you didn’t want to be disturbed. I’ll let you get on with practicing for your next interview in peace.
There you go, Something for you to wear on Tuesday. You might even have a scar now, if you’re lucky. . . . That’s what you want, isn’t it?

Session-389.Scene: Hermione desperately hoped to keep Harry alive until after his dragon challenge.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Let’s just try and keep you alive until Tuesday evening, and then we can worry about Karkaroff. ‘Talon-clipping by charms . . . treating scale-rot . . .’ This is no good, this is for nutters like Hagrid who want to keep them healthy. . . . ‘Dragons are extremely difficult to slay, owing to the ancient magic that imbues their thick hides, which none but the most powerful spells can penetrate . . .’ But Sirius said a simple one would do it. . . .
Let’s try some simple spellbooks, then,

Well, there are Switching Spells . . . but what’s the point of Switching it? Unless you swapped its fangs for wine-gums or something that would make it less dangerous. . . . The trouble is, like that book said, not much is going to get through a dragon’s hide. . . . I’d say Transfigure it, but something that big, you really haven’t got a hope, I doubt even Professor McGonagall . . . unless you’re supposed to put the spell on yourself? Maybe to give yourself extra powers? But they’re not simple spells, I mean, we haven’t done any of those in class, I only know about them because I’ve been doing O. W.L. practice papers. . . .
Hermione, will you shut up for a bit, please? I’m trying to concentrate.
Oh no, he’s back again, why can’t he read on his stupid ship? Come on, Harry, we’ll go back to the common room . . . his fan club’ll be here in a moment, twittering away. . . .

Session-390.Scene: Harry prioritized seeing Cedric over attending class on time.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione, Go on, I’ll catch you up.
Harry, you’ll be late, the bell’s about to ring —
I’ll catch you up, okay?

Session-391.Scene: Harry surreptitiously used a spell to rupture Cedric's bag, causing its contents to spill.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Diffindo!
Cedric, the first task is dragons.
Dragons, They’ve got four, one for each of us, and we’ve got to get past them.
Dead sure, I’ve seen them.
Never mind, But I’m not the only one who knows. Fleur and Krum will know by now — Maxime and Karkaroff both saw the dragons too.
It’s just . . . fair, isn’t it? We all know now . . . we’re on an even footing, aren’t we?

Session-392.Scene: Moody commanded Diggory to leave, singling out Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — Professor, I’m supposed to be in Herbology —

Session-393.Scene: Harry realized he needed Hermione's help with the Summoning Charm to retrieve his Firebolt.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione, Hermione — I need you to help me.
What d’you think I’ve been trying to do, Harry?
Hermione,
Concentrate, Harry, concentrate. . . .

What d’you think I’m trying to do? A great big dragon keeps popping up in my head for some reason. . . . Okay, try again. . . . Well, that’s good, just as long as it’s not drawn-out. I don’t want to suffer.

Session-394.Scene: Harry successfully summoned a dictionary after Hermione jokingly threatened him with a dragon.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That’s better, Harry, that’s loads better,
Well, now we know what to do next time I can’t manage a spell, threaten me with a dragon. Right . . . Accio Dictionary!
Harry, I really think you’ve got it!
Just as long as it works tomorrow, The Firebolt’s going to be much farther away than the stuff in here, it’s going to be in the castle, and I’m going to be out there on the grounds. . . .
It’s all right, Just as long as you’re concentrating really, really hard on it, it’ll come. Harry, we’d better get some sleep . . . you’re going to need it.

Session-395.Scene: Harry dropped his fork onto his plate while rising from the table.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Okay,
Good luck, Harry, You’ll be fine!
Yeah,

Session-399.Scene: McGonagall's hand trembled as she directed Harry to Madam Pomfrey for treatment.

Forget it. Forget it, There’s nothing to cry about!
You two are so stupid!

Session-401.Scene: Karkaroff gave Harry a score of four, igniting Ron's fury.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You were the best, you know, no competition. Cedric did this weird thing where he Transfigured a rock on the ground . . . turned it into a dog . . . he was trying to make the dragon go for the dog instead of him. Well, it was a pretty cool bit of Transfiguration, and it sort of worked, because he did get the egg, but he got burned as well — the dragon changed its mind halfway through and decided it would rather have him than the Labrador; he only just got away. And that Fleur girl tried this sort of charm, I think she was trying to put it into a trance — well, that kind of worked too, it went all sleepy, but then it snored, and this great jet of flame shot out, and her skirt caught fire — she put it out with a bit of water out of her wand. And Krum — you won’t believe this, but he didn’t even think of flying! He was probably the best after you, though. Hit it with some sort of spell right in the eye. Only thing is, it went trampling around in agony and squashed half the real eggs — they took marks off for that, he wasn’t supposed to do any damage to them. It’s marks out of ten from each one, Not bad! I suppose she took marks off for your shoulder. . . . Looking good!
Ten? But . . . I got hurt. . . . What’s he playing at?
Harry, What? Four? You lousy, biased scumbag, you gave Krum ten!
And you,

Yes,

Just as long as he didn’t import those skrewts illegally or anything,
Blast-Ended Skrewts, Worst that can happen is Hagrid’ll have to get rid of the skrewts. Sorry . . . did I say worst? I meant best.

Okay,

Okay,
Good service!

Ashamed? But — Winky, come on! It’s Mr. Crouch who should be ashamed, not you! You didn’t do anything wrong, he was really horrible to you —
Can’t house-elves speak their minds about their masters, then?

You just need a bit of practice,
Winky, I’m quite sure Mr. Crouch is getting along perfectly well without you. We’ve seen him, you know —
Yes, he and Mr. Bagman are judges in the Triwizard Tournament.

Tell you what, Dobby, I’ll give you the one my mum knits me this Christmas, I always get one from her. You don’t mind maroon, do you? We might have to shrink it a bit to fit you, but it’ll go well with your tea cozy.
Thanks a lot! See you, Dobby! ’Course you can,
You know what? All these years I’ve been really impressed with Fred and George, nicking food from the kitchens — well, it’s not exactly difficult, is it? They can’t wait to give it away!

I think this is the best thing that could have happened to those elves, you know, Dobby coming to work here, I mean. The other elves will see how happy he is, being free, and slowly it’ll dawn on them that they want that too!
Let’s hope they don’t look too closely at Winky,
Oh she’ll cheer up, Once the shock’s worn off, and she’s got used to Hogwarts, she’ll see how much better off she is without that Crouch man.
She seems to love him,
Doesn’t think much of Bagman, though, does she? Wonder what Crouch says at home about him?
Probably says he’s not a very good Head of Department, and let’s face it . . . he’s got a point, hasn’t he?
I’d still rather work for him than old Crouch, At least Bagman’s got a sense of humor.
Don’t let Percy hear you saying that,
Yeah, well, Percy wouldn’t want to work for anyone with a sense of humor, would he? Percy wouldn’t recognize a joke if it danced naked in front of him wearing Dobby’s tea cozy.

Cheers, Hagrid,

No one, yet,

That egg!

But it might take weeks to work it out! You’re going to look a real idiot if everyone else knows what the next task is and you don’t!
Leave him alone, Hermione, he’s earned a bit of a break,

Dialogue.Dialogue: I suppose there’s always Moaning Myrtle,

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — Cho? Could I have a word with you?

no problem. That’s okay,
Yeah,
Who’re you going with?
All right, then,

Session-413.Scene: The Fat Lady straightened her tinsel hair band while opening the portrait.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Fairy lights,

Session-414.Scene: Ron impulsively asked Fleur Delacour to the ball but was rejected without a response.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’s up, Ron?
Why did I do it? I don’t know what made me do it!
Like what?
You what?

I don’t know what made me do it! What was I playing at? There were people — all around — I’ve gone mad — everyone watching! I was just walking past her in the entrance hall — she was standing there talking to Diggory — and it sort of came over me — and I asked her! She looked at me like I was a sea slug or something. Didn’t even answer. And then — I dunno — I just sort of came to my senses and ran for it.

She’s part veela, You were right — her grandmother was one. It wasn’t your fault, I bet you just walked past when she was turning on the old charm for Diggory and got a blast of it — but she was wasting her time. He’s going with Cho Chang. I asked her to go with me just now, and she told me.
This is mad, We’re the only ones left who haven’t got anyone — well, except Neville. Hey — guess who he asked?
Like what?
he said, He told me after Potions! Ha! As if! She just didn’t want to go with Neville . . . I mean, who would?
Why weren’t you two at dinner?
Thanks a bunch, Ginny,
All the good-looking ones taken, Ron? Eloise Midgen starting to look quite pretty now, is she? Well, I’m sure you’ll find someone somewhere who’ll have you. Oh well spotted,
Well — you can come with one of us!
No, I can’t,
Oh come on, we need partners, we’re going to look really stupid if we haven’t got any, everyone else has . . .
I can’t come with you, because I’m already going with someone.
No, you’re not! You just said that to get rid of Neville!
Oh did I? Just because it’s taken you three years to notice, Ron, doesn’t mean no one else has spotted I’m a girl!
Okay, okay, we know you’re a girl, That do? Will you come now? She’s lying,
Who is it then?
Right, this is getting stupid. Ginny, you can go with Harry, and I’ll just —
What’s got into them?

Session-415.Scene: Harry asked Parvati to the ball, eliciting excited giggles and an eventual acceptance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wait here, Parvati? Will you go to the ball with me?
Thanks, Lavender — will you go with Ron?
Can’t you think of anyone who’d go with Ron? She’s going with someone else.
No idea, So what about Ron?
Yeah, that would be great, Let me know, will you?

Session-416.Scene: Hermione revealed that Krum had targeted a dragon's eyes in the first task.

Yeah, okay, Come on, how’m I supposed to concentrate with all this noise going on? I won’t even be able to hear the egg over this lot.

Ah, no, Harry, how come you didn’t spot that? Tell you what, Dobby — here you go — take these two, and you can mix them up properly. And here’s your sweater.

They’re . . . they’re really . . . well, thanks, Dobby,

Close enough,

What?
Hi,
It’s hot, isn’t it? Viktor’s just gone to get some drinks.

He’s from Durmstrang! He’s competing against Harry! Against Hogwarts! You — you’re — fraternizing with the enemy, that’s what you’re doing!
Don’t be so stupid! The enemy! Who was the one who wanted his autograph? Who’s got a model of him up in their dormitory?
I s’pose he asked you to come with him while you were both in the library?
How’s it going? So what?
What happened — trying to get him to join spew, were you?
No, I wasn’t! If you really want to know, he — he said he’d been coming up to the library every day to try and talk to me, but he hadn’t been able to pluck up the courage!
Yeah, well — that’s his story,
And what’s that supposed to mean?

Obvious, isn’t it? He’s Karkaroff’s student, isn’t he? He knows who you hang around with. . . . He’s just trying to get closer to Harry — get inside information on him — or get near enough to jinx him —
For your information, he hasn’t asked me one single thing about Harry, not one —
Then he’s hoping you’ll help him find out what his egg means! I suppose you’ve been putting your heads together during those cozy little library sessions —
I’d never help him work out that egg!
You’ve got a funny way of showing it,
This whole tournament’s supposed to be about getting to know foreign wizards and making friends with them!
No it isn’t! It’s about winning!
Hermione
Why don’t you go and find Vicky, he’ll be wondering where you are,
Don’t call him Vicky!
No,

Dialogue.Dialogue: We’re walking, Not against the law, is it?

Dialogue.Dialogue: So? What’s the problem with giants?

Who cares? There’s nothing wrong with Hagrid!
I know there isn’t, but . . . blimey, no wonder he keeps it quiet, I always thought he’d got in the way of a bad Engorgement Charm when he was a kid or something. Didn’t like to mention it. . . .
But what’s it matter if his mother was a giantess?

But . . . Harry, they’re just vicious, giants. It’s like Hagrid said, it’s in their natures, they’re like trolls . . . they just like killing, everyone knows that. There aren’t any left in Britain now, though.
What happened to them?
Well, they were dying out anyway, and then loads got themselves killed by Aurors. There’re supposed to be giants abroad, though. . . . They hide out in mountains mostly. . . .
I don’t know who Maxime thinks she’s kidding, If Hagrid’s half-giant, she definitely is. Big bones . . . the only thing that’s got bigger bones than her is a dinosaur.

Session-423.Scene: Hermione declared Ron should ask her to a ball before other potential suitors did.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Fairy lights!

Next time there’s a ball, ask me before someone else does, and not as a last resort!
Well,

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hurry up, now, the bell rang five minutes ago,

Where’s Hagrid?

good

“We weren’t trying to hear him!”
“I — well, I’m not going to pretend it didn’t make a nice change, having a proper Care of Magical Creatures lesson for once — but I do want Hagrid back, of course I do!”

“Well done!”

Have you offered Cedric help?
Well, thanks,

Session-429.Scene: Bagman surveyed Harry with disappointment after Harry declined a drink.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What did he want?
He offered to help me with the golden egg,
He shouldn’t be doing that! He’s one of the judges! And anyway, you’ve already worked it out — haven’t you?
Er . . . nearly, He’s not, I asked,
Who cares if Diggory’s getting help?

said Bagman. He’s still ill. Hasn’t been into work.
Maybe Percy’s poisoning him, Probably thinks if Crouch snuffs it he’ll be made Head of the Department of International Magical Cooperation.
Funny, goblins looking for Mr. Crouch. . . . They’d normally deal with the Department for the Regulation and Control of Magical Creatures.
Crouch can speak loads of different languages, though, Maybe they need an interpreter.
Worrying about poor ’ickle goblins, now, are you? Thinking of starting up S.P. U.G. or something? Society for the Protection of Ugly Goblins?
Ha, ha, ha, Goblins don’t need protection. Haven’t you been listening to what Professor Binns has been telling us about goblin rebellions?
Well, they’re quite capable of dealing with wizards, They’re very clever. They’re not like house-elves, who never stick up for themselves.
Uh-oh,

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hi, Hagrid,
Of course we still want to know you! You don’t think anything that Skeeter cow — sorry, Professor,

Hagrid, look what I’ve got for relatives! Look at the Dursleys!
Come back and teach, Hagrid, please come back, we really miss you.
Yeah, he is, Can I have one of these cakes, Hagrid?
’Lo, Really great.

Dialogue.Dialogue: banana fritters
Good luck,
“Pine fresh,”

Dialogue.Dialogue: Myrtle! I’m — I’m not wearing anything!

I got told off for going in there, I thought I’d better not come back after that.
Have you been spying on him too?
I’m honored, You keep your eyes shut!

Yeah . . . ‘Come seek us where our voices sound . . .’ and if I need persuading . . . hang on, I need to listen again. . . . I’ve got to go and look for people who can’t use their voices above the ground. . . . Er . . . who could that be?
Underwater . . . Myrtle . . . what lives in the lake, apart from the giant squid?
Well, does anything in there have a human voice? Hang on — Myrtle, there aren’t merpeople in there, are there?
That’s it, isn’t it? The second task’s to go and find the merpeople in the lake and . . . and . . . Myrtle, how am I supposed to breathe?
What’s tactless?
Sorry, I didn’t mean — I just forgot . . .
We’ve taken what you’ll sorely miss,
Good, Well, I’m a lot further on than I was. . . . Shut your eyes again, will you? I’m getting out.
Er . . . I’ll try, See you, Myrtle . . . thanks for your help.

Session-433.Scene: Harry desperately tried to free his leg, which was stuck in the magical step.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s mine! Mine!

Session-434.Scene: Harry identified Barty Crouch on the Marauder's Map as the intruder in Snape's office.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah . . . I — er . . . thanks,
Map of Hogwarts,
Yeah, it’s . . . quite useful, Er — Professor Moody, d’you think you could help me — ?

Positive,
Er . . . Professor Moody . . . why d’you reckon Mr. Crouch wanted to look around Snape’s office?
Professor Moody? D’you think . . . could this have anything to do with . . . maybe Mr. Crouch thinks there’s something going on. . . .
I don’t know, odd stuff’s been happening lately, hasn’t it? It’s been in the Daily Prophet . . . the Dark Mark at the World Cup, and the Death Eaters and everything. . . .
Oh! Yeah, okay.
