Dialogue.Dialogue: No,
Er — no, I’ve been working out the clue.

Session-436.Scene: Harry privately wondered what Snape had done to warrant needing a second chance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You said you’d already worked out that egg clue!
Keep your voice down! I just need to — sort of fine-tune it, all right? Just forget the egg for a minute, all right? I’m trying to tell you about Snape and Moody. . . .
Snape said Moody’s searched his office as well? What . . . d’you reckon Moody’s here to keep an eye on Snape as well as Karkaroff?
Well, I dunno if that’s what Dumbledore asked him to do, but he’s definitely doing it, Moody said Dumbledore only lets Snape stay here because he’s giving him a second chance or something. . . .
What? Harry . . . maybe Moody thinks Snape put your name in the Goblet of Fire!

Oh Ron, we thought Snape was trying to kill Harry before, and it turned out he was saving Harry’s life, remember? I don’t care what Moody says, Dumbledore’s not stupid. He was right to trust Hagrid and Professor Lupin, even though loads of people wouldn’t have given them jobs, so why shouldn’t he be right about Snape, even if Snape is a bit —
— evil, Come on, Hermione, why are all these Dark wizard catchers searching his office, then?
Why has Mr. Crouch been pretending to be ill? It’s a bit funny, isn’t it, that he can’t manage to come to the Yule Ball, but he can get up here in the middle of the night when he wants to?
You just don’t like Crouch because of that elf, Winky,
You just want to think Snape’s up to something,
I just want to know what Snape did with his first chance, if he’s on his second one,

Session-437.Scene: Harry experienced a brief moment of happiness at the sight of Sirius's owl, which quickly faded.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Of course, the ideal solution would be for you to Transfigure yourself into a submarine or something, If only we’d done human Transfiguration already! But I don’t think we start that until sixth year, and it can go badly wrong if you don’t know what you’re doing. . . .
Yeah, I don’t fancy walking around with a periscope sticking out of my head, I s’pose I could always attack someone in front of Moody; he might do it for me. . . .

I don’t think he’d let you choose what you wanted to be turned into, though, No, I think your best chance is some sort of charm. Weekend after next, Here — take my quill and send this owl back straight away.
What’s he want to know about the next Hogsmeade weekend for?
Dunno, Come on . . . Care of Magical Creatures.

Session-438.Scene: Hermione treated the library's lack of information on the task as a personal affront.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don’t reckon it can be done, There’s nothing.
There must be something, They’d never have set a task that was undoable.
Harry, Harry, just go down to the lake tomorrow, right, stick your head in, yell at the merpeople to give back whatever they’ve nicked, and see if they chuck it out. Best you can do, mate.
There’s a way of doing it! There just has to be!
Yeah, you could’ve turned into a goldfish any time you wanted!
Or a frog,

It takes years to become an Animagus, and then you have to register yourself and everything, Professor McGonagall told us, remember . . . you’ve got to register yourself with the Improper Use of Magic Office . . . what animal you become, and your markings, so you can’t abuse it. . . .
Hermione, I was joking, I know I haven’t got a chance of turning into a frog by tomorrow morning. . . .
Oh this is no use, Who on earth wants to make their nose hair grow into ringlets?
What? “What’re you two doing here?”
What? “What’re you two doing here?”
Harry, Bring as many of these books as you can, okay?
Right,

Session-439.Scene: Dobby revealed that Ron was the "Wheezy" to be rescued from the merpeople during the second task.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Lumos,
I can’t, Give it to me! That hurts — get off — ouch — Stop poking me — Stop poking me — Stop poking me — Ten minutes? Ten — ten minutes?
It’s too late, Dobby, I’m not doing the task, I don’t know how —
What?
What?
What? What?
What? They’ve got . . . they’ve got Ron? — ‘the prospect’s black,’ ‘Too late, it’s gone, it won’t come back. ’ Dobby — what’ve I got to do?

Session-440.Scene: Harry accidentally splattered mud on Fleur's robes while arriving late.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m . . . here . . .
Dunno,

Session-441.Scene: Harry wielded a jagged rock to sever Ron's bindings, despite the mermen's protests.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Relashio!
Myrtle!
Come ON!
No way!
She’s my friend too! And I don’t want them to die either!
Get out of the way! You’ve got until three! One . . . two . . .

Session-442.Scene: Harry rescued Ron and Fleur's sister from the lake during the challenge.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What? What did you bring her for?
Fleur didn’t turn up, I couldn’t leave her,
Harry, you didn’t take that song thing seriously, did you? Dumbledore wouldn’t have let any of us drown!
The song said —
It was only to make sure you got back inside the time limit! I hope you didn’t waste time down there acting the hero!
C’mon, help me with her, I don’t think she can swim very well.

Session-443.Scene: Fleur tearfully expressed relief at her sister Gabrielle's safety after the grindylow attack.

Dialogue.Dialogue: She’s fine!
Gerroff, Percy, I’m all right!
Harry, You did it, you found out how all by yourself!
Yeah, that’s right,
Harry,
No . . . I found you okay. . . .
Yeah, Yeah,
Yeah, Yeah, yeah, a bit —

Session-444.Scene: Snape threatened to use Veritaserum on Harry if he caught him breaking into his office again.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Scarlet woman? If that’s the best Rita can do, she’s losing her touch, What a pile of old rubbish. There’s something funny, though,
Known what? You haven’t been mixing up Love Potions, have you?
Don’t be stupid, No, it’s just . . . how did she know Viktor asked me to visit him over the summer?
Known what?

He asked me right after he’d pulled me out of the lake, After he’d got rid of his shark’s head. Madam Pomfrey gave us both blankets and then he sort of pulled me away from the judges so they wouldn’t hear, and he said, if I wasn’t doing anything over the summer, would I like to —
And what did you say?

And he did say he’d never felt the same way about anyone else, She wasn’t there ... or was she?  Maybe she has got an Invisibility Cloak;maybe she sneaked onto the grounds to watch the second task. . . .
And what did you say?
Well, I was too busy seeing whether you and Harry were okay to —
I haven’t been anywhere near your office!
I don’t know what you’re talking about,
Right, I’ll bear that in mind if I ever get the urge to go in there.
No,

Session-445.Scene: Karkaroff revealed a dark mark on his inner forearm to Snape.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Clearing up my armadillo bile, Professor,

Session-446.Scene: Sirius revealed that Crouch had been the one who ordered his imprisonment in Azkaban without a trial.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’re you doing here, Sirius?
What if they catch you? What if you’re seen?
They’re making it sound like he’s dying, But he can’t be that ill if he managed to get up here. . . .
My brother’s Crouch’s personal assistant, He says Crouch is suffering from overwork.
Mind you, he did look ill, last time I saw him up close, The night my name came out of the goblet. . . .
Getting his comeuppance for sacking Winky, isn’t he? I bet he wishes he hadn’t done it now — bet he feels the difference now she’s not there to look after him.
Hermione’s obsessed with house-elves,
Yeah, at the Quidditch World Cup,
No, I think he said he’d been too busy.

No, No, I didn’t need to use it before we got in the forest. And then I put my hand in my pocket, and all that was in there were my Omnioculars. Are you saying whoever conjured the Mark stole my wand in the Top Box?
Winky didn’t steal that wand!
Loads of people,
The Malfoys!
No one, Oh yeah . . .
He’s okay, He keeps offering to help me with the Triwizard Tournament.
Says he’s taken a liking to me,
We saw him in the forest just before the Dark Mark appeared, Remember?
Yeah, but he didn’t stay in the forest, did he? The moment we told him about the riot, he went off to the campsite.
How d’you know? How d’you know where he Disapparated to?
Come off it,
It’s more likely he did it than Winky,
Went to look in the bushes, but there wasn’t anyone else there.
Yes, he sacked her, just because she hadn’t stayed in her tent and let herself get trampled —
Hermione, will you give it a rest with the elf!
D’you know Crouch, then?
You’re kidding!
Crouch’s son was caught?
Was his son a Death Eater?
Did Crouch try and get his son off?
He gave his own son to the dementors?
So he’s still in Azkaban?
He died?
Moody says Crouch is obsessed with catching Dark wizards,
And he sneaked up here to search Snape’s office!
Yeah, it does!
So you think Snape could be up to something, then?
Look, I don’t care what you say, Dumbledore trusts Snape —
Oh give it a rest, Hermione, I know Dumbledore’s brilliant and everything, but that doesn’t mean a really clever Dark wizard couldn’t fool him —
Why did Snape save Harry’s life in the first year, then? Why didn’t he just let him die?
I dunno — maybe he thought Dumbledore would kick him out —
Snape knows Karkaroff pretty well, but he wants to keep that quiet,
Yep, Karkaroff wanted to talk to Snape, he says Snape’s been avoiding him. Karkaroff looked really worried. He showed Snape something on his arm, but I couldn’t see what it was.
Why are Moody and Crouch so keen to get into Snape’s office then?
I can try, Better not make it sound like I reckon Crouch is up to anything dodgy, though. Percy loves Crouch.
Bagman told me they hadn’t,
It’s half past three,
No one’s tried to attack me so far, except a dragon and a couple of grindylows,

Session-447.Scene: Winky consumed six bottles of butterbeer daily, an amount that significantly affected house-elf physiology.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You saved my life with that gillyweed, Dobby, you really did,
No chance of more of those eclairs, is there?
You’ve just had breakfast!
We should get some stuff to send up to Snuffles,
Good idea, Give Pig something to do. You couldn’t give us a bit of extra food, could you?
Dobby, where’s Winky?
Oh dear,
Well, it’s not strong, that stuff,
Hey, Winky, you don’t know what Mr. Crouch might be up to, do you? Because he’s stopped turning up to judge the Triwizard Tournament.
Yeah, we haven’t seen him since the first task. The Daily Prophet’s saying he’s ill.
But we’re not sure if that’s true,
Other people manage to do their own housework, you know, Winky,
What?
She’s unhappy! Why don’t you try and cheer her up instead of covering her up?

Oh for heaven’s sake! Listen to me, all of you! You’ve got just as much right as wizards to be unhappy! You’ve got the right to wages and holidays and proper clothes, you don’t have to do everything you’re told — look at Dobby!
You couldn’t keep your mouth shut, could you, Hermione? They won’t want us visiting them now! We could’ve tried to get more stuff out of Winky about Crouch!
Oh as if you care about that! You only like coming down here for the food!

Session-448.Scene: A niffler attempted to bite Pansy Parkinson's watch.

Dialogue.Dialogue: She had to go to the hospital wing,
We’ll explain later,
Can you buy these as pets, Hagrid?

Session-449.Scene: Hagrid disclosed to Hermione that he, too, had received hateful letters after Rita Skeeter wrote about his mother.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh for heaven’s sake!
You missed a really good lesson, They’re good, nifflers, aren’t they, Ron? What’s up? Wrong flavor?
No, Why didn’t you tell me about the gold?
What gold?
The gold I gave you at the Quidditch World Cup, The leprechaun gold I gave you for my Omnioculars. In the Top Box. Why didn’t you tell me it disappeared?
Oh . . . I dunno . . . I never noticed it had gone. I was more worried about my wand, wasn’t I?

Session-450.Scene: Ron expressed resentment towards Harry's perceived wealth and the vanished leprechaun gold.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Must be nice, To have so much money you don’t notice if a pocketful of Galleons goes missing.
Listen, I had other stuff on my mind that night! We all did, remember?
I didn’t know leprechaun gold vanishes, I thought I was paying you back. You shouldn’t’ve given me that Chudley Cannon hat for Christmas.
Forget it, all right?
I hate being poor. It’s rubbish, I don’t blame Fred and George for trying to make some extra money. Wish I could. Wish I had a niffler.

Well, we know what to get you next Christmas, Come on, Ron, it could be worse. At least your fingers aren’t full of pus. I hate that Skeeter woman! I’ll get her back for this if it’s the last thing I do!

Session-451.Scene: Hermione voiced her frustration about the source of leaked private conversations.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’ll die down, though, if we just ignore it. . . . People got bored with that stuff she wrote about me last time —
I want to know how she’s listening into private conversations when she’s supposed to be banned from the grounds!

Session-452.Scene: Hermione was determined to discover how Rita Skeeter gathered information, suspecting a magical eavesdropping method.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Well, Rita’s definitely not using an Invisibility Cloak! Moody says he didn’t see her anywhere near the judges’ table at the second task, or anywhere near the lake!
Hermione, is there any point in telling you to drop this?
No! I want to know how she heard me talking to Viktor! And how she found out about Hagrid’s mum!
Maybe she had you bugged,
Bugged? What . . . put fleas on her or something?
Aren’t you two ever going to read Hogwarts: A History?
What’s the point? You know it by heart, we can just ask you.

All those substitutes for magic Muggles use — electricity, computers, and radar, and all those things — they all go haywire around Hogwarts, there’s too much magic in the air. No, Rita’s using magic to eavesdrop, she must be. . . . If I could just find out what it is . . . ooh, if it’s illegal, I’ll have her . . .
Haven’t we got enough to worry about?
I’m not asking you to help! I’ll do it on my own!

Session-453.Scene: Hermione felt disheartened by the diminutive size of her Easter egg compared to Harry's and Ron's.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Your mum doesn’t read Witch Weekly, by any chance, does she, Ron?
Yeah, Gets it for the recipes.
“Don’t you want to see what Percy’s written?”

Session-454.Scene: Harry considered enlisting Hagrid's help with a niffler for treasure hunting.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That wouldn’t be too bad,

Session-455.Scene: Harry identified the strange structures on the Quidditch field as hedges.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They’re hedges!

Session-456.Scene: Krum led Harry away from the others, desiring a private conversation.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, all right,
Okay,
No, it’s okay, Mr. Bagman, I think I can find the castle on my own, thanks. What’re we going this way for?

Session-457.Scene: Krum questioned Harry about his relationship with Hermione, displaying a jealous undertone.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nothing, We’re friends. She’s not my girlfriend and she never has been. It’s just that Skeeter woman making things up.
Yeah, because we’re friends.
No,
Thanks, I saw you at the Quidditch World Cup. The Wronski Feint, you really —

Session-458.Scene: Mr. Crouch hallucinated giving instructions to Weatherby about the Triwizard Tournament while in a disheveled state.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mr. Crouch?
Mr. Crouch? Are you all right?
No idea, Listen, you’d better go and get someone —

Session-459.Scene: Crouch incoherently implicated himself in Bertha's death and his son's fate while warning about the Dark Lord.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Okay, if you get up, Mr. Crouch, we can go up to the —
I’m a student at the school,
No
That’s right,
I’ll get Dumbledore if you let go of me, Just let go, Mr. Crouch, and I’ll get him. . . .
You stay here with him! I’ll get Dumbledore, I’ll be quicker, I know where his office is —
Just stay with him,
I’ll get Dumbledore if you let me go, Mr. Crouch! Help me, will you? Just keep him here, I’ll be back with Dumbledore.

Session-460.Scene: Karkaroff spat at Dumbledore's feet after accusing him of treachery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Over here, Viktor? They were here, They were definitely somewhere around here. . . .
Should I go and get someone? Madam Pomfrey?
Er — yes,
Krum’s all right! He wasn’t trying to jinx me, he just wanted to talk about Hermione —
You were getting on all right with Madame Maxime,

Session-461.Scene: Ron excitedly proposed the unlikely theory that Krum attacked Crouch and then Stunned himself.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It must’ve been Crouch, That’s why he was gone when Harry and Dumbledore got there. He’d done a runner.
I don’t think so, He seemed really weak — I don’t reckon he was up to Disapparating or anything.
You can’t Disapparate on the Hogwarts grounds, haven’t I told you enough times?
Okay . . . how’s this for a theory, Krum attacked Crouch — no, wait for it — and then Stunned himself!
And Mr. Crouch evaporated, did he?
Oh yeah . . .
Just go through it again, Harry, What did Mr. Crouch actually say?
I’ve told you, he wasn’t making much sense, He said he wanted to warn Dumbledore about something.
Well, that was his fault,
He was out of his mind, Half the time he seemed to think his wife and son were still alive, and he kept talking to Percy about work and giving him instructions.
And . . . remind me what he said about You-Know-Who?
I’ve told you, He said he’s getting stronger.
He was out of his mind,

He was sanest when he was trying to talk about Voldemort, He was having real trouble stringing two words together, but that was when he seemed to know where he was, and know what he wanted to do. He just kept saying he had to see Dumbledore. If Snape hadn’t held me up,we might’ve got there in time.  The headmaster is busy, Potter . . . what’s this rubbish, Potter? ’ Why couldn’t he have just got out of the way?
Maybe he didn’t want you to get there! Maybe — hang on — how fast d’you reckon he could’ve gotten down to the forest? D’you reckon he could’ve beaten you and Dumbledore there?
Not unless he can turn himself into a bat or something,
Wouldn’t put it past him,
We need to see Professor Moody, We need to find out whether he found Mr. Crouch.
If he had the Marauder’s Map on him, it would’ve been easy,
Unless Crouch was already outside the grounds, because it only shows up to the boundaries, doesn’t —
Shh!

Session-462.Scene: Fred mockingly bowed to Harry, Ron, and Hermione while ushering them to leave.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who’re you blackmailing?
Didn’t sound like that,
It’s my business if you’re blackmailing someone, George’s right, you could end up in serious trouble for that.
No, I won’t!
You don’t think they know something about all this, do you? About Crouch and everything?
No, If it was something that serious, they’d tell someone. They’d tell Dumbledore.
What’s the matter?
Well . . . I dunno if they would. They’re . .
We weren’t talking. Yeah, but blackmail . . .
It’s this joke shop idea they’ve got, I thought they were only saying it to annoy Mum, but they really mean it, they want to start one.
Yes, but . . . they wouldn’t do anything against the law to get gold.
Wouldn’t they? I dunno . . . they don’t exactly mind breaking rules, do they?
Yes, but this is the law, This isn’t some silly school rule. . . . They’ll get a lot more than detention for blackmail! Ron . . . maybe you’d better tell Percy. . . .
Are you mad? Tell Percy? He’d probably do a Crouch and turn them in. Come on, let’s get some breakfast.
D’you think it’s too early to go and see Professor Moody?
Yes, He’d probably blast us through the door if we wake him at the crack of dawn; he’ll think we’re trying to attack him while he’s asleep. Let’s give it till break.

Session-463.Scene: Moody revealed Dumbledore had notified the Ministry about Mr. Crouch's disappearance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor Moody?
Did you find him?
Did you use the map?
So he did Disapparate?
You can’t Disapparate on the grounds, Ron! There are other ways he could have disappeared, aren’t there, Professor?
Well, he wasn’t invisible, The map shows invisible people. He must’ve left the grounds, then.
But under his own steam? or because someone made him?
Yeah, someone could’ve — could’ve pulled him onto a broom and flown off with him, couldn’t they?
So, said Ron, d’you reckon he’s somewhere in Hogsmeade?
What? Oh yeah . . .
We helped, Me and Hermione helped.

Session-464.Scene: Harry expressed mild indignation about Sirius's perceived hypocrisy regarding his past actions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Ha! She hasn’t got wind of Crouch!
“Who’s he, to lecture me about being out-of-bounds?” After all the stuff he did at school!” Look
“They couldn’t have made it look like an accident if they’d murdered you in the forest! But if you die during a task —”

Session-465.Scene: Fred and George, in the Owlery, concealed the recipient's name on a sealed blackmail letter.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry! Harry! You all right?
Nothing,
I need to go to the hospital wing, I think, Bad headache.
I don’t want to see anything except a headache cure, See you later,

Session-466.Scene: Harry implied Madame Maxime's size made her difficult to conceal.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes, I didn’t see Madame Maxime anywhere, though, and she’d have a job hiding, wouldn’t she?
Wait here for me, Harry, he said. Our examination of the grounds will not take long. Hello, Fawkes,

Session-467.Scene: Bartemius Crouch disowned his own son in the dungeons during his son's trial.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor,
What is it?
Er,
You mean . . . that stuff’s your thoughts?
I’m sorry,
Bertha?
No, Professor — I was in Divination just now, and — er — I fell asleep.
Well, I had a dream, A dream about Lord Voldemort. He was torturing Wormtail . . . you know who Wormtail —

Voldemort got a letter from an owl. He said something like, Wormtail’s blunder had been repaired. He said someone was dead. Then he said, Wormtail wouldn’t be fed to the snake — there was a snake beside his chair. He said — he said he’d be feeding me to it, instead. Then he did the Cruciatus Curse on Wormtail — and my scar hurt, Harry said. It woke me up, it hurt so badly. Er — that’s all,
No, I — how did you know it woke me up over the summer?
Professor? I’m sorry, D’you — d’you know why my scar’s hurting me?
But . . . why?
So you think . . . that dream . . . did it really happen?
No, Just the back of his chair. But — there wouldn’t have been anything to see, would there? I mean, he hasn’t got a body, has he? But . . . but then how could he have held the wand?
Professor, do you think he’s getting stronger?
Professor?
Er . . . could I ask you about . . . that court thing I was in . . . in the Pensieve?
You know — you know the trial you found me in? The one with Crouch’s son? Well . . . were they talking about Neville’s parents?
So they’re dead?
Then Mr. Crouch’s son might not have been involved?
Er, Mr. Bagman . . .
I see, And . . . er . . .
Yes, Professor,

Session-468.Scene: Hermione connected Rita Skeeter's comments about Ludo Bagman to Bagman's trial and Crouch's potential fury.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Dumbledore reckons You-Know-Who’s getting stronger again as well?  And he trusts Snape? He really trusts Snape, even though he knows he was a Death Eater?
Yes,
How can you be worrying about her now?

I’m not worrying about her, I’m just thinking . . . remember what she said to me in the Three Broomsticks? ’ This is what she meant, isn’t it? She reported his trial, she knew he’d passed information to the Death Eaters. ’ Mr. Crouch would have been furious he got off, he would have talked about it at home.
Yeah, but Bagman didn’t pass information on purpose, did he? And Fudge reckons Madame Maxime attacked Crouch?
Yeah, but he’s only saying that because Crouch disappeared near the Beauxbatons carriage.
We never thought of her, did we? Mind you, she’s definitely got giant blood, and she doesn’t want to admit it —

Of course she doesn’t, Look what happened to Hagrid when Rita found out about his mother. Look at Fudge, jumping to conclusions about her, just because she’s part giant. Who needs that sort of prejudice? I’d probably say I had big bones if I knew that’s what I’d get for telling the truth. We haven’t done any practicing! We were going to do the Impediment Curse! We’ll have to really get down to it tomorrow! Come on, Harry, you need to get some sleep.

Session-469.Scene: Malfoy mysteriously spoke into his hand while Crabbe and Goyle kept watch.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
“He looks like he’s using a walkie-talkie,”

Session-470.Scene: Hermione suddenly experienced a breakthrough about Rita Skeeter's information source, suspecting an illegal eavesdropping method.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “No, “No,
“It’s about me, isn’t it?”
“No,” “No,”
“Gone off me a bit, hasn’t she?”
“Are you all right?”
“Yes,”
“S’pose so,
“But the task’s not till tonight!” “She doesn’t expect the Dursleys to turn up, does she?”

Session-471.Scene: Mrs. Weasley revealed that she and Mr. Weasley had once been caught during a nighttime stroll by Apollyon Pringle when they were students.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This is really nice of you,
Oh yeah,
Yeah, okay,
“What?” “What?”
Didn’t bother to correct her, though, did he? Still . . . you’ll show him, Ced. Beaten him once before, haven’t you?

Session-472.Scene: Amos Diggory loudly referenced Ced's previous victory over someone.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How’s Percy?

Session-473.Scene: Fact: Ron fabricated goblin rebel names for his exam, such as Bodrod the Bearded and Urg the Unclean.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mum — Bill! What’re you doing here?
Oh . . . okay, Couldn’t remember all the goblin rebels’ names, so I invented a few. It’s all right,
Are you going to tell us — ?
Hello,
Because Hermione’s not my girlfriend.

Session-474.Scene: Fact: Harry mentally reviewed hexes and spells to calm his nerves before the final task.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m okay,

Session-475.Scene: Harry solved a riddle from a sphinx that required stringing together clues to name a spider.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Lumos, See you, Point Me,
Expecto Patronum! Hang on! You’re a boggart! Riddikulus! Reducto! Fleur? Stupefy! Impedimenta!
Stupefy! Stupefy! Stupefy! “Are you all right?”
I can’t believe this . . . I thought he was all right,
Did you hear Fleur scream earlier?
I don’t know,
No, I reckon we should send up red sparks. Someone’ll come and collect him . . . otherwise he’ll probably be eaten by a skrewt.
What? Oh . . . yeah . . . right . . .
So . . . so will you move, please?
Okay, Can I hear the riddle? Could I have it again . . . more slowly? All the clues add up to a creature I wouldn’t want to kiss?

A person in disguise, who lies . . . er . . . that’d be a — an imposter. No, that’s not my guess! A — a spy? I’ll come back to that . . . could you give me the next clue again, please? ‘The last thing to mend,’ Er . . . no idea . . . ‘middle of middle’ . . . could I have the last bit again? Spy . . . er . . . spy . . . er . . . A creature I wouldn’t want to kiss . . . a spider! . . a spider! Thanks! Point Me! Cedric! On your left! Stupefy! Stupefy! Stupefy! Impedimenta! Stupefy! Impedimenta! Stupefy!
Expelliarmus! Stupefy! Stupefy! Stupefy!
No  Take it, then, Go on, take it. You’re there.
That’s not how it’s supposed to work, The one who reaches the cup first gets the points.That’s you.  I’m telling you, I’m not going to win any races on this leg.
Take it, then, Just take it, then we can get out of here.
I had help on that too, You helped me with the egg — we’re square.
We’re still square,
I was the only one who was thick enough to take that song seriously! Just take the cup!
Both of us,
We’ll take it at the same time. It’s still a Hogwarts victory. We’ll tie for it.
Yeah, Yeah . . . we’ve helped each other out, haven’t we? We both got here. Let’s just take it together.
On three, right?

Session-476.Scene: Wormtail severed his own hand to revive his master, Voldemort.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where are we?
Nope, Is this supposed to be part of the task?
Yeah, Someone’s coming,
You!

Session-477.Scene: Harry defied Voldemort's Imperius Curse, asserting his will in the graveyard duel.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I WON’T!
Expelliarmus!
Yes,
I will,
NOW!
Impedimenta!
Accio!

Session-478.Scene: Harry told Moody that his parents emerged from Voldemort's wand.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He’s back, He’s back. Voldemort.
He wanted me to bring him back, He wanted me to bring him back to his parents. . . .
Dumbledore said stay,
Cup was a Portkey, Took me and Cedric to a graveyard . . . and Voldemort was there . . . Lord Voldemort . . .
Killed Cedric . . . they killed Cedric. . . .
Made a potion . . . got his body back. . . .
And the Death Eaters came . . . and then we dueled. . . .
Got away . . . my wand . . . did something funny. . . . I saw my mum and dad . . . they came out of his wand. . . .

Session-479.Scene: Moody confessed that he had put Harry's name in the Goblet of Fire under a different school.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He took stuff from his father’s grave, and from Wormtail, and me,
Blood,
Yes, Loads of them . . .
There’s a Death Eater at Hogwarts! There’s a Death Eater here — they put my name in the Goblet of Fire, they made sure I got through to the end —
Karkaroff? Where is he? Have you got him? Is he locked up? Karkaroff?
Karkaroff’s gone? He ran away? But then — he didn’t put my name in the goblet?
No, you didn’t, You didn’t do that . . . you can’t have done . . .
What
You fired . . . What are you talking about . . . ?
You didn’t . . . it — it can’t be you. . . .
No,

Session-480.Scene: Moody confessed to murdering his father in the name of the Dark Lord.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You’re mad, you’re mad!

Session-481.Scene: Dumbledore blasted Moody's office door apart with a powerful spell.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Moody, How can it have been Moody?

Session-482.Scene: Dumbledore’s voice faltered when mentioning Professor Sprout comforting Mr. and Mrs. Diggory.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor, where are Mr. and Mrs. Diggory?

Session-483.Scene: Fawkes' tears healed the wound on Harry's leg caused by Wormtail's dagger.

Dialogue.Dialogue: ’Lo, Fawkes,
He said my blood would make him stronger than if he’d used someone else’s, He said the protection my — my mother left in me — he’d have it too.
My wand’s feather came from Fawkes?
He spoke to me, The . . . the ghost Cedric, or whatever he was, spoke.
An old man,
Yes,

Session-484.Scene: Harry assured Ron and Hermione that he felt alright, despite their apprehensive expressions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is he okay?

Session-485.Scene: Fudge stubbornly refused to acknowledge Voldemort's return despite multiple accounts and visible evidence.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look, I saw Voldemort come back! I saw the Death Eaters! I can give you their names!
Macnair!
Avery — Nott — Crabbe — Goyle —

Session-486.Scene: Sirius momentarily transformed from a large black dog back into his human form.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mum, shut up! It’s okay!
but —
Yeah, Yeah . . . of course I do.

Session-487.Scene: Harry expressed he did not want the Triwizard Tournament winnings, as he felt Cedric Diggory should have won.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don’t want that gold, You have it. Anyone can have it. I shouldn’t have won it. It should’ve been Cedric’s.
I told him to take the Cup with me,

Session-488.Scene: Harry offered Mrs. Diggory the Triwizard Tournament winnings, believing they rightfully belonged to Cedric.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You take this, It should’ve been Cedric’s, he got there first, you take it —

Session-489.Scene: Hagrid revealed he had known for years that Voldemort would return.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who?
You two made up, have you?
Yeah,
What’s Dumbledore asked you to do, Hagrid? He sent Professor McGonagall to ask you and Madame Maxime to meet him — that night.
Is it to do with Voldemort?

Session-490.Scene: Krum abruptly expressed his fondness for Diggory because of Diggory's consistent politeness towards him despite his Durmstrang affiliation.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s very good already,
Wonder how the Durmstrang students are getting back, D’you reckon they can steer that ship without Karkaroff?
Oh . . . yes . . . all right,
You’d better hurry up! The carriages’ll be here in a minute!
Have you got a new headmaster yet?

Session-491.Scene: Hermione revealed that she had captured Rita Skeeter in her beetle form and imprisoned her in a jar.

Dialogue.Dialogue: There’s nothing in there. You can look for yourself, but there’s nothing at all. I’ve been checking every day. Just a small piece the day after the third task saying you won the tournament. They didn’t even mention Cedric. Nothing about any of it. If you ask me, Fudge is forcing them to keep quiet.
He’ll never keep Rita quiet, Not on a story like this.
Oh, Rita hasn’t written anything at all since the third task, As a matter of fact, Not unless she wants me to spill the beans on her.
What are you talking about?
I found out how she was listening in on private conversations when she wasn’t supposed to be coming onto the grounds,
How was she doing it?
How did you find out?
Well, it was you, really, who gave me the idea, Harry,
Did I? How?
Bugging,
But you said they didn’t work —
Oh not electronic bugs, She can turn — — into a beetle.
You’re kidding, You haven’t . . . she’s not . . .
Oh yes she is,
That’s never — you’re kidding —
No, I’m not, I caught her on the windowsill in the hospital wing. Look very closely, and you’ll notice the markings around her antennae are exactly like those foul glasses she wears.
There was a beetle on the statue the night we heard Hagrid telling Madame Maxime about his mum!

Exactly, And Viktor pulled a beetle out of my hair after we’d had our conversation by the lake. And unless I’m very much mistaken, Rita was perched on the windowsill of the Divination class the day your scar hurt. She’s been buzzing around for stories all year.
When we saw Malfoy under that tree . . .

He was talking to her, in his hand, He knew, of course. That’s how she’s been getting all those nice little interviews with the Slytherins. They wouldn’t care that she was doing something illegal, as long as they were giving her horrible stuff about us and Hagrid. I’ve told her I’ll let her out when we get back to London, I’ve put an Unbreakable Charm on the jar, you see, so she can’t transform. And I’ve told her she’s to keep her quill to herself for a whole year. See if she can’t break the habit of writing horrible lies about people.
Get out,

Session-492.Scene: Fred and George revealed that Ludo Bagman had paid them with leprechaun gold after their Quidditch World Cup bet, which vanished overnight.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who? Who you were blackmailing?
Bagman?
Well, what, then?
Yeah,
So?
But — it must’ve been an accident, mustn’t it?
He didn’t refuse!
But that was all your savings!
How?
Oh, Well — I did win, didn’t I? So he can pay you your gold!

Session-493.Scene: Harry collided with the Dursleys' open window while reacting to a sudden loud crack outside.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I didn’t make that noise, Listening to the news, Well, it changes every day, you see, That’s all you know,
The owls . . . aren’t bringing me news,
Well, that’s news to me,

Session-494.Scene: Dudley threatened violence toward an unseen entity.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Dudley, shut —

Session-495.Scene: Mrs. Figg repeatedly hit Mundungus with a string bag full of cat food.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ll do it.
I’ve got an owl, you can borrow her,
So,
I want to know —

Session-496.Scene: Dudley weakly accused Harry of causing his sudden illness.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nothing, I didn’t do anything to him, it wasn’t me, it was —

Session-497.Scene: Harry threatened to jinx Uncle Vernon with his wand after being expelled.

Dialogue.Dialogue: If you don’t get out of the way I’m going to jinx you, The madhouse has chucked me out, So I can do whatever I like. You’ve got three seconds.

Session-498.Scene: Dudley remembered feeling a clammy cold and the sensation of hope being sucked out of him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Right, I’ve changed my mind, I’m staying. “Ministry of Magic The second one was from my friend Ron’s dad, he works at the Ministry.
Because I did magic.
Nothing,
Yeah, I did, but I didn’t use —
As if you’d never be happy again, It wasn’t me! Two of them.

Session-499.Scene: Petunia clutched Dudley's shoulders, exhibiting fear for the first time in Harry's memory.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ve got to go to a hearing, I suppose so.
Right, Dudley and I were in the alleyway between Magnolia Crescent and Wisteria Walk, Dudley thought he’d be smart with me, I pulled out my wand but didn’t use it. Then two dementors turned up —

Of course they didn’t get his soul, you’d know if they had, You can’t give a dementor the old one-two, Because I used the Patronus — I can’t stop the owls coming, I did the Patronus Charm to get rid of the dementors, It’s the only thing that works against them. Couldn’t tell you, No idea. I don’t know why they were here . . . Yes, Yes. Of course I’m not, He must have sent them, Lord Voldemort,
Murdered my parents, yes,
He’s back, Him. He came back a month ago. I saw him.
Yes, Yes. Yes, Yes. Looks like it,

Session-500.Scene: Vernon explicitly forbade Harry from leaving his locked bedroom or touching any of the family's possessions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Fine,
Okay.
Right.
Okay.
You do that.

Session-501.Scene: Tonks lured the Dursleys away by sending them a fake letter about a lawn competition.

Dialogue.Dialogue: A stag,
F-fine . . .
“Yeah, I know,”

Session-502.Scene: Tonks demonstrated her Metamorphmagus ability by changing her hair to bubble-gum pink.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — yeah,
No, I wouldn’t mind,

Session-503.Scene: Moody's wand tap gave Harry a cold, egg-like sensation on his head.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They won’t, That’ll just depress them.

Session-504.Scene: Moody used a Put-Outer borrowed from Dumbledore to darken the square.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where are we?

Session-505.Scene: Moody incinerated Harry's parchment message to maintain secrecy.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’s the Order of the — ?
But where’s — ?

Session-506.Scene: Mrs. Weasley cautioned Harry to be quiet in the hall to avoid waking something up.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why?
What d’you — ?
“Mrs. Weasley, why — ?”

Session-507.Scene: Harry, driven by isolation and resentment, unleashed his pent-up frustrations about being kept uninformed and confined to the Dursleys.

Dialogue.Dialogue: HARRY! Ron, he’s here, Harry’s here! We didn’t hear you arrive! Oh, how are you? Are you all right? Have you been furious with us?
Let him breathe, Hermione,
“Hedwig!”
She’s been in a right state, Pecked us half to death when she brought your last letters, look at this —
Oh yeah, Sorry about that, but I wanted answers, you know . . .
We wanted to give them to you, mate,
— swear not to tell me, Yeah, Hermione’s already said.
He seemed to think it was best, Dumbledore, I mean.
Right,
I think he thought you were safest with the Muggles —
Yeah? Have either of you been attacked by dementors this summer?
Well, no — but that’s why he’s had people from the Order of the Phoenix tailing you all the time —
Didn’t work that well, though, did it? Had to look after myself after all, didn’t I?
He was so angry, Dumbledore. We saw him. When he found out Mundungus had left before his shift had ended. He was scary.
Well, I’m glad he left, If he hadn’t, I wouldn’t have done magic and Dumbledore would probably have left me at Privet Drive all summer.
Aren’t you . . . aren’t you worried about the Ministry of Magic hearing?
No, So why’s Dumbledore been so keen to keep me in the dark? Did you — er — bother to ask him at all?
We told Dumbledore we wanted to tell you what was going on, We did, mate.
He could still’ve kept me informed if he’d wanted to, You’re not telling me he doesn’t know ways to send messages without owls.
I thought that too. But he didn’t want you to know anything.
Maybe he thinks I can’t be trusted,
Don’t be thick,
Or that I can’t take care of myself —
Of course he doesn’t think that!
So how come I have to stay at the Dursleys’ while you two get to join in everything that’s going on here? How come you two are allowed to know everything that’s going on — ?
We’re not! Mum won’t let us near the meetings, she says we’re too young —

SO YOU HAVEN’T BEEN IN THE MEETINGS, BIG DEAL! YOU’VE STILL BEEN HERE, HAVEN’T YOU? YOU’VE STILL BEEN TOGETHER! ME, I’VE BEEN STUCK AT THE DURSLEYS’ FOR A MONTH! AND I’VE HANDLED MORE THAN YOU TWO’VE EVER MANAGED AND DUMBLEDORE KNOWS IT — WHO SAVED THE SORCERER’S STONE? WHO GOT RID OF RIDDLE? WHO SAVED BOTH YOUR SKINS FROM THE DEMENTORS? WHO HAD TO GET PAST DRAGONS AND SPHINXES AND EVERY OTHER FOUL THING LAST YEAR? WHO SAW HIM COME BACK? WHO HAD TO ESCAPE FROM HIM? ME! BUT WHY SHOULD I KNOW WHAT’S GOING ON? WHY SHOULD ANYONE BOTHER TO TELL ME WHAT’S BEEN HAPPENING?
Harry, we wanted to tell you, we really did —
CAN’T’VE WANTED TO THAT MUCH, CAN YOU, OR YOU’D HAVE SENT ME AN OWL, BUT DUMBLEDORE MADE YOU SWEAR —
Well, he did —
FOUR WEEKS I’VE BEEN STUCK IN PRIVET DRIVE, NICKING PAPERS OUT OF BINS TO TRY AND FIND OUT WHAT’S BEEN GOING ON —
We wanted to —
I SUPPOSE YOU’VE BEEN HAVING A REAL LAUGH, HAVEN’T YOU, ALL HOLED UP HERE TOGETHER —
No, honest — Harry, we’re really sorry! You’re absolutely right, Harry — I’d be furious if it was me!
What is this place anyway?
Headquarters of the Order of the Phoenix,
Is anyone going to bother telling me what the Order of the Phoenix — ?
It’s a secret society, Dumbledore’s in charge, he founded it. It’s the people who fought against You-Know-Who last time.
Who’s in it?
Quite a few people —
— we’ve met about twenty of them, but we think there are more . . .
Well?
Er, Well what?
Voldemort! What’s happening? What’s he up to? Where is he? What are we doing to stop him?
Fred and George have invented Extendable Ears, see, They’re really useful.
Extendable — ?

Ears, yeah. Only we’ve had to stop using them lately because Mum found out and went berserk. Fred and George had to hide them all to stop Mum binning them. But we got a good bit of use out of them before Mum realized what was going on. We know some of the Order are following known Death Eaters, keeping tabs on them, you know —
— some of them are working on recruiting more people to the Order —
— and some of them are standing guard over something, They’re always talking about guard duty.
Couldn’t have been me, could it?
Oh yeah,
So what have you two been doing, if you’re not allowed in meetings? You said you’d been busy.

We have, We’ve been decontaminating this house, it’s been empty for ages and stuff’s been breeding in here. We’ve managed to clean out the kitchen, most of the bedrooms, and I think we’re doing the drawing room tomo — AARGH!

Session-508.Scene: Ginny used Dungbombs to test if the kitchen door was Imperturbed.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Stop doing that!
You two passed your Apparation tests, then?
It would have taken you about thirty seconds longer to walk down the stairs,
Snape? Is he here?
He’s on our side now,
Doesn’t stop him being a git. The way he looks at us when he sees us . . .
Is Bill here? I thought he was working in Egypt.
What d’you mean?
Couldn’t Percy do that?
Whatever you do, don’t mention Percy in front of Mum and Dad,
Why not?
What’s happened?
Order of the Phoenix We were about to come and join the Order. Percy came home and told us he’d been promoted.
You’re kidding?
So how come they promoted him?

That’s exactly what we wondered, He came home really pleased with himself — even more pleased than usual if you can imagine that — and told Dad he’d been offered a position in Fudge’s own office. He expected Dad to be all impressed, I think.
Why not?
But what’s this got to do with Percy?
“Bet Percy loved that.”
What?

I know, And it got worse. He said Dad was an idiot to run around with Dumbledore, that Dumbledore was heading for big trouble and Dad was going to go down with him, and that he — Percy — knew where his loyalty lay and it was with the Ministry. And if Mum and Dad were going to become traitors to the Ministry he was going to make sure everyone knew he didn’t belong to our family anymore. And he packed his bags the same night and left. He’s living here in London now. Mum’s been in a right state, You know — crying and stuff. She came up to London to try and talk to Percy but he slammed the door in her face. I dunno what he does if he meets Dad at work — ignores him, I s’pose.
But Percy must know Voldemort’s back, He’s not stupid, he must know your mum and dad wouldn’t risk everything without proof —
Yeah, Percy said the only evidence was your word and . . . I dunno . . . he didn’t think it was good enough.
Percy takes the Daily Prophet seriously,
What are you talking about?
Haven’t — haven’t you been getting the Daily Prophet?
Yeah,
Have you — er — been reading it thoroughly?
Not cover to cover, If they were going to report anything about Voldemort it would be headline news, wouldn’t it!
Well, you’d need to read it cover to cover to pick it up, but they — um — they mention you a couple of times a week.
But I’d have seen —
Not if you’ve only been reading the front page, you wouldn’t, I’m not talking about big articles. They just slip you in, like you’re a standing joke.
What d’you — ?
It’s quite nasty, actually, They’re just building on Rita’s stuff.
But she’s not writing for them anymore, is she?
Oh no, she’s kept her promise — not that she’s got any choice, But she laid the foundation for what they’re trying to do now.
What?
Okay, you know she wrote that you were collapsing all over the place and saying your scar was hurting and all that?
Yeah
Well, they’re writing about you as though you’re this deluded, attention-seeking person who thinks he’s a great tragic hero or something, They keep slipping in snide comments about you.
I don’t want anyone to worship —

I know, I know, Harry. But you see what they’re doing? They want to turn you into someone nobody will believe. Fudge is behind it, I’ll bet anything. They want wizards on the street to think you’re just some stupid boy who’s a bit of a joke, who tells ridiculous tall stories because he loves being famous and wants to keep it going.
I didn’t ask — I didn’t want — Voldemort killed my parents! I got famous because he murdered my family but couldn’t kill me! Who wants to be famous for that? Don’t they think I’d rather it’d never —
And of course, they didn’t report a word about the dementors attacking you,

Session-509.Scene: Ginny blamed Crookshanks for the Dungbombs outside the kitchen.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “Look …”
“We knew you’d be angry, Harry, we really don’t blame you, but you’ve got to understand, we did try and persuade Dumble-dore —”
Yeah, I know, Who’s Kreacher?
The house-elf who lives here,
He’s not a nutter, Ron —
His life’s ambition is to have his head cut off and stuck up on a plaque just like his mother, Is that normal, Hermione?
Well — well, if he is a bit strange, it’s not his fault — It’s not ‘spew’!
Yeah, C’mon, I’m starving. Hold it! They’re still in the hall, we might be able to hear something —
Snape never eats here,
And don’t forget to keep your voice down in the hall, Harry,

Session-510.Scene: Sirius revealed he had offered his family home to Dumbledore as headquarters.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “Your — ?”
But what’s a portrait of your mother doing here?

Session-511.Scene: Sirius explained to Harry that he had offered his parents' house to Dumbledore as headquarters.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah,

Session-512.Scene: Tonks enthusiastically offered to help with dinner, overturning a chair in her haste.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, I haven’t seen anyone.

Session-513.Scene: Fred and George's charmed stew pot caused a near miss for Sirius.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, it’s been lousy,
“What?”
How come?
At least you’ve known what’s been going on,
What cleaning?
Do that one like a pig snout, Tonks . . .

Session-514.Scene: Mundungus admitted he had acquired toads from Will and resold them to him for twice the original price.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How come he’s in the Order?
I did! I asked Ron and Hermione but they said we’re not allowed in the Order, so —
What’s wrong with that?
I want to know what’s been going on,

Session-515.Scene: Mrs. Weasley initially forbade Fred and George from staying, despite their legal adulthood.

Dialogue.Dialogue: If Harry’s allowed, why can’t I?
Harry’ll tell me and Hermione everything you say anyway! Won’t — won’t you?
’Course I will,
What?
How come he’s stopped killing people?
How?
How has that helped?
So what’s the Order been doing?
How d’you know what his plans are?
So what does Dumbledore reckon he’s planning?
So you’re trying to stop him getting more followers?
How?
Why?
Why? Why’s he being so stupid? If Dumbledore —
Frightened of Dumbledore?
But Dumbledore doesn’t want —
How can he think that? How can he think Dumbledore would just make it all up — that I’d make it all up?
But you’re telling people, aren’t you? You’re letting people know he’s back?
But if none of you’s putting the news out that Voldemort’s back —
What d’you mean?
But if Voldemort’s trying to recruit more Death Eaters, it’s bound to get out that he’s come back, isn’t it?
What’s he after apart from followers? When he was powerful before?
Like what kind of weapon? Something worse than the Avada Kedavra — ?

Session-516.Scene: Fred and George Apparated onto Ron's bed, causing him pain and prompting a warning to keep quiet.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We can’t let them out to hunt every night, Dumbledore doesn’t want too many owls swooping around the square, thinks it’ll look suspicious. Oh yeah . . . I forgot . . .
What’re you doing that for?
Kreacher, First night I was here he came wandering in at three in the morning. Trust me, you don’t want to wake up and find him prowling around your room. Anyway . . . What d’you reckon?

Well, they didn’t tell us much we couldn’t have guessed, did they? I mean, all they’ve really said is that the Order’s trying to stop people joining Vol — — demort , When are you going to start using his name? Sirius and Lupin do.
Yeah, OUCH!
You two just Apparated on my knees!
The weapon Sirius mentioned?
What d’you reckon it is?
But there can’t be anything worse than the Avada Kedavra curse, can there? What’s worse than death?
Maybe it’s some particularly painful way of killing people,
He’s got the Cruciatus Curse for causing pain, He doesn’t need anything more efficient than that.
I hope it’s our side,
Where? Hogwarts?
A weapon’s going to be a lot bigger than the Stone, though!
What d’you mean?
She doesn’t trust us at all, you know,

Session-517.Scene: Fred secretly pocketed a paralyzed doxy to experiment with its venom for their Skiving Snackboxes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Kreacher’s really old, he probably couldn’t manage —
What are Skiving Snackboxes?
Testers?
Joke shop still on, then?

Session-518.Scene: Kreacher, the house-elf, verbally degraded several people in the room while pretending they could not hear him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mundungus! What’s he brought all those cauldrons for?
Probably looking for a safe place to keep them, Isn’t that what he was doing the night he was supposed to be tailing me? Picking up dodgy cauldrons?
Kreacher, Harry Potter.
It doesn’t matter, he’s not in his right mind, he doesn’t know what he’s —

Session-519.Scene: Sirius's mother blasted him off the Black family tapestry after he ran away from home at sixteen.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sirius, he’s not right in the head, I don’t think he realizes we can hear him.
If you just set him free,
You’re not on here!
You ran away from home?
Where did you go?
But . . . why did you . . . ?
But he died,
You’re kidding!
Were — were your parents Death Eaters as well?
Was he killed by an Auror?

Session-520.Scene: Sirius revealed his family's tradition of disowning those who married Muggles or supported Muggle rights.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You and Tonks are related?
You’re related to the Malfoys!
Lestrange . . .
You never said she was your —
Sorry? I didn’t mean — I was just surprised, that’s all —
But if they do expel me, can I come back here and live with you?
I’d feel a lot better about the hearing if I knew I didn’t have to go back to the Dursleys,

Session-521.Scene: Harry learned he was to be accompanied by Mr. Weasley to his hearing after Mrs. Weasley's announcement.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How am I getting there?
“When did Dumbledore tell you that?”

Session-522.Scene: Tonks's hair was blonde and curly after an apparent sleepless night.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah,
Just — just toast, thanks,
Okay,
Right, Well . . . see you later then.

Session-523.Scene: Mr. Weasley expressed fascination with out-of-order Muggle ticket machines.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You don’t normally walk to work, do you?
They’re out of order,

Session-524.Scene: Mr. Weasley confessed that he had never used the visitor's entrance to the Ministry of Magic before.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mr. Weasley, I think this might be out of order too,

Session-525.Scene: Harry considered donating ten Galleons to St. Mungo's if he wasn't expelled from Hogwarts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,
thanks

Session-526.Scene: Kingsley subtly suggested Harry be given a magazine related to Sirius, hinting at his continued interest in the case.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mr. Weasley, aren’t we underground?

Session-527.Scene: Mr. Weasley expressed amusement at something in *The Quibbler* magazine before being interrupted by news of a toilet incident.

Dialogue.Dialogue: A regurgitating toilet?
Plumbers?
Will it be Aurors who catch them?

Session-528.Scene: Mr. Weasley abandoned his sentence mid-thought when a witch with a smoking goblet entered the lift.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why have they changed the time?

Session-529.Scene: Fudge became visibly flustered when Dumbledore declared he'd arrived three hours early due to a lucky mistake.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sorry, I-I didn’t know the time had changed.
Yes.
Yes, Yes, Yes, but — Yes, but —
Yes, Yes, Yes, but — Yes, but —
Yes, Yes, Yes, but — Yes, but —
Yes, Yes, Yes, but — Yes, but —
Yes,
Yes,
A — what?
Yes, it’s a stag, it’s always a stag.
Yes,
Yes,
Yes,
I did it because of the dementors!
I mean there were two dementors down that alleyway and they went for me and my cousin!
I’m not lying! There were two of them, coming from opposite ends of the alley, everything went dark and cold and my cousin felt them and ran for it —
That wasn’t me, it was a house-elf!

Session-530.Scene: Harry declared he had been cleared of all charges.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Cleared, of all charges!
I think so,
So what will you have to do about the toilet?

Session-531.Scene: Lucius Malfoy's robes clinked with the sound of a full pocket of gold, suggesting a clandestine transaction.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, yeah, I’m good at escaping . . .
What are you doing here anyway?
Why wasn’t he waiting outside Fudge’s office if they’ve got business to do together? What was he doing down here?
What private business have they got together anyway?
Mr. Weasley, if Fudge is meeting Death Eaters like Malfoy, if he’s seeing them alone, how do we know they haven’t put the Imperius Curse on him?

Session-532.Scene: Harry emptied his entire money bag into the fountain, anticipating Hermione's reaction to the house-elf statue.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wait . . .
I knew it! You always get away with stuff!
They were bound to clear you, There was no case against you, none at all . . .
Everyone seems quite relieved, though, considering they all knew I’d get off,
’Course, once Dumbledore turned up on your side, there was no way they were going to convict you,
Yeah,
What’s up?
Scar, But it’s nothing. . . . It happens all the time now . . .
I bet Dumbledore turns up this evening to celebrate with us, you know.

Session-533.Scene: Hermione speculated that Sirius had secretly hoped for Harry's expulsion so they could be outcasts together.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Don’t you go feeling guilty! You belong at Hogwarts and Sirius knows it. Personally, I think he’s being selfish.
That’s a bit harsh you wouldn’t want to be stuck inside this house without company.
He’ll have company! It’s headquarters to the Order of the Phoenix, isn’t it? He just got his hopes up that Harry would be coming to live here with him.
I don’t think that’s true, He wouldn’t give me a straight answer when I asked him if I could.

He just didn’t want to get his own hopes up even more, And he probably felt a bit guilty himself, because I think a part of him was really hoping you’d be expelled. Then you’d both be outcasts together.
Suit yourselves. But I sometimes think Ron’s mum’s right, and Sirius gets confused about whether you’re you or your father, Harry.
So you think he’s touched in the head?
No, I just think he’s been very lonely for a long time,
I thought you might be here to tell us to have a break! D’you know how much mold we’ve got rid of since we arrived here?
I feel like a house-elf,

Yeah, You know, maybe it wouldn’t be a bad idea to show people exactly how horrible it is to clean all the time — we could do a sponsored scrub of Gryffindor common room, all proceeds to S.P. E.W., it would raise awareness as well as funds —
I’ll sponsor you to shut up about spew,

Session-534.Scene: Ron received a prefect badge bearing a Gryffindor lion superimposed with a large P.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Booklists have arrived, About time, I thought they’d forgotten, they usually come much earlier than this . . .
Only two new ones, The Standard Book of Spells, Grade 5, by Miranda Goshawk and Defensive Magical Theory, by Wilbert Slinkhard.
What d’you mean?
Yeah, Yeah, I see what you mean.
Did you — did you get — ? I knew it! Me too, Harry, me too!
No, It’s Ron, not me.
What?
Ron’s prefect, not me,
Ron? But . . . are you sure? I mean —
It’s my name on the letter,
I . . . I . . . well . . . wow! Well done, Ron! That’s really —
No, no, it’s not . . . Ron’s done loads of . . . he’s really . . .

Session-535.Scene: Mrs. Weasley kissed Ron all over his face upon discovering he was made prefect.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mum . . . don’t . . . Mum, get a grip . . .
What?
Mum, can I have a new broom? Not a really good one! Just — just a new one for a change . . .
SHUT UP!
He could if you don’t watch out!
Drop it, Hermione.
Those two! Don’t pay any attention to them, Ron, they’re only jealous!

I don’t think they are, They’ve always said only prats become prefects. . . . Still, they’ve never had new brooms! I wish I could go with Mum and choose. . . . She’ll never be able to afford a Nimbus, but there’s the new Cleansweep out, that’d be great. . . . Yeah, I think I’ll go and tell her I like the Cleansweep, just so she knows .
Harry?
Well done, Great.
Thanks, They’ll be really pleased — I mean, prefect is something they can understand —
Yeah, no problem, Take her!
Just caught her! She says she’ll get the Cleansweep if she can.
Cool, Listen — Ron — well done, mate.
I never thought it would be me! I thought it would be you!
No,
Yeah, yeah, I suppose. . . . Well, we’d better get our trunks packed, hadn’t we?

Session-536.Scene: Harry awkwardly deflected Mrs. Weasley's opinion request about Bill's hair.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh — I dunno —

Session-537.Scene: Mundungus reluctantly accepted ten Galleons from the twins for the Venomous Tentacula seeds.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Be careful,
But Moody could have his eye on you,

Session-538.Scene: Moody showed Harry an old photograph of the original Order of the Phoenix, which included Harry's deceased parents and Wormtail.

Dialogue.Dialogue: . . . the handle’s made of Spanish oak with anti-jinx varnish and in-built vibration control —
Yeah, fine,
Yeah, Er . . . listen, I’ve just remembered, I haven’t packed my . . .
Hello

Session-539.Scene: Mrs. Weasley, overwhelmed by fear, repeatedly cast the Riddikulus charm on a boggart that transformed into the dead bodies of her loved ones.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mrs. Weasley?
Mrs. Weasley, just get out of here!
Don’t be stupid,

Session-540.Scene: Harry spoke to a painting that had no one physically present.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Cut it out,

Session-541.Scene: Fred and George's bewitched trunks collided with Ginny, causing her to tumble down the stairs.

Dialogue.Dialogue: . . . better hurry up, Mum’s going ballistic, she says we’re going to miss the train . . .
Mrs. Weasley’s patched her up, But now Mad-Eye’s complaining that we can’t leave unless Sturgis Podmore’s here, otherwise the guard will be one short.
Guard? We have to go to King’s Cross with a guard?
You have to go to King’s Cross with a guard,
Why? I thought Voldemort was supposed to be lying low, or are you telling me he’s going to jump out from behind a dustbin to try and do me in?
I don’t know, it’s just what Mad-Eye says, But if we don’t leave soon we’re definitely going to miss the train . . .

Session-542.Scene: Mrs. Weasley lamented the Ministry's refusal to lend Arthur cars, highlighting the inconvenience of Muggle travel.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s Tonks?

Session-543.Scene: Sirius momentarily stood on his hind legs and placed his paws on Harry's shoulders.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Thanks, Lee,

Session-544.Scene: Luna wore a necklace made of butterbeer caps while reading a magazine upside down.

Dialogue.Dialogue: See you!
He shouldn’t have come with us,
Oh lighten up, he hasn’t seen daylight for months, poor bloke.
Shall we go and find a compartment, then?
Er,
We’re — well — Ron and I are supposed to go into the prefect carriage,
Oh, Right. Fine.
I don’t think we’ll have to stay there all journey, Our letters said we just get instructions from the Head Boy and Girl and then patrol the corridors from time to time.
Fine, Well, I-I might see you later, then.
Yeah, definitely, It’s a pain having to go down there, I’d rather — but we have to — I mean, I’m not enjoying it, I’m not Percy,
I know you’re not,
Right,
I know I am,

Session-545.Scene: Neville's Mimbulus mimbletonia defensively sprayed foul-smelling Stinksap when he prodded it with a quill.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Another Remembrall?
Does it — er — do anything?
Oh . . . hi,

Session-546.Scene: Luna's prolonged laughter at Ron's impression of Goyle caused Hedwig to wake up indignantly and Crookshanks to leap into the luggage rack.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m starving,
Well, there are two fifth-year prefects from each House, Boy and girl from each.
And guess who’s a Slytherin prefect?
Malfoy,
’Course,
And that complete cow Pansy Parkinson, How she got to be a prefect when she’s thicker than a concussed troll . . .
Who’s Hufflepuff?
Ernie Macmillan and Hannah Abbott,
And Anthony Goldstein and Padma Patil for Ravenclaw,
Yes,
We’re supposed to patrol the corridors every so often, and we can give out punishments if people are misbehaving. I can’t wait to get Crabbe and Goyle for something . . .
You’re not supposed to abuse your position, Ron!
Yes,
So you’re going to descend to his level?
No, I’m just going to make sure I get his mates before he gets mine.
For heaven’s sake, Ron —
I’ll make Goyle do lines, it’ll kill him, he hates writing, I . . . must . . . not . . . look . . . like . . . a . . . baboon’s . . . backside . . .
Are you taking the mickey?
Can I have a look at this?
Anything good in there?
Of course not, The Quibbler’s rubbish, everyone knows that.
I — oh, Well . . . it’s got some interesting . . . I mean, it’s quite . . .

Session-547.Scene: Malfoy threatened to closely monitor Harry's actions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
Yeah, but you, unlike me, are a git, so get out and leave us alone.
Malfoy,
Get out!
Chuck us another Frog,
We’d better change,
Thanks,

Session-548.Scene: Professor Grubbly-Plank was unexpectedly overseeing the arrival of first years.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s Hagrid?
Oh,

Session-549.Scene: Harry and Luna were revealed to share the ability to see the skeletal, winged horses pulling the carriages.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s Pig? — Hagrid is? I dunno, He’d better be okay . . .
Ginny’s got him, There she is . . .
Come on, Come on, let’s get a carriage together before they all fill up . . .
I haven’t got Pig yet!
What are those things, d’you reckon? What things?
What are those things, What things?
Those horse —
Well, Well, come on then, let’s get in. . . . what were you saying, Harry?
I was saying, what are those horse things?
What horse things?
The horse things pulling the carriages!
What are you talking about?
I’m talking about — look!
What am I supposed to be looking at?
At the — there, between the shafts! Harnessed to the coach! It’s right there in front — Can’t . . . can’t you see them?
See what?
Can’t you see what’s pulling the carriages?
Are you feeling all right, Harry?
I . . . yeah . . .
“Shall we get in, then?”
“Yeah,”
“Can you?”

Session-550.Scene: Harry quietly speculated about Hagrid's absence, suggesting he might still be away on a mission for Dumbledore.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh . . . yeah, “He’s not there.”
He can’t have left,
Of course he hasn’t,
You don’t think he’s . . . hurt, or anything, do you?
Of course he hasn’t,
But where is he, then?
Maybe he’s not back yet. You know — from his mission — the thing he was doing over the summer for Dumbledore.
Yeah . . . yeah, that’ll be it,
Who’s that?
It’s that Umbridge woman!
Who?
She was at my hearing, she works for Fudge!
Nice cardigan,
She works for Fudge? What on earth’s she doing here, then?
Dunno . . .
No, no, surely not . . .

Session-551.Scene: The Sorting Hat deviated from its traditional role by offering the school advice.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Branched out a bit this year, hasn’t it?
Too right it has,
I wonder if it’s ever given warnings before?

Session-552.Scene: Nearly Headless Nick, annoyed by Ron's impertinent questioning, floated away to the other end of the table.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Excellent,
What were you saying before the Sorting? About the hat giving warnings?
Ow kunnit nofe skusin danger ifzat?
And it wants all the Houses to be friends? Fat chance.
Only because you’re terrified of him,
What blood? Surely you haven’t still got — ?
Nick, he wasn’t really laughing at you!
“node iddum eentup sechew,”
Well done, Ron,
What? I’m not allowed to ask a simple question?
Oh forget it,

Session-553.Scene: Hermione interpreted the speech as an indication of the Ministry's looming interference at Hogwarts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes, it certainly was illuminating,
You’re not telling me you enjoyed it? That was about the dullest speech I’ve ever heard, and I grew up with Percy.
I said illuminating, not enjoyable, It explained a lot.
Did it? Sounded like a load of waffle to me. Was there?
There was some important stuff hidden in the waffle,
Did it?
How about ‘progress for progress’s sake must be discouraged’? How about ‘pruning wherever we find practices that ought to be prohibited’?
Well, what does that mean?
I’ll tell you what it means, It means the Ministry’s interfering at Hogwarts. Ron, we’re supposed to show the first years where to go!
Oh yeah, Hey — hey you lot! Midgets!
Well done, Ron,
Well, they are, they’re titchy . . .
I know, but you can’t call them midgets. . . . First years! This way, please!
See you later,

Session-554.Scene: Harry's grin vanished when Euan Abercrombie stared at him with fright.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Erm . .

Session-555.Scene: Seamus hesitantly revealed his mother's distrust of Harry and Dumbledore due to the Daily Prophet's reporting.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hi,
Not bad, You?
“What?”
But — why?
What d’you mean?
She believes the Daily Prophet? She thinks I’m a liar and Dumbledore’s an old fool?
“I’ll have a go at anyone who calls me a liar,”

Session-556.Scene: Seamus abruptly departed the dormitory, fleeing before Harry finished dressing.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Does he think he’ll turn into a nutter if he stays in a room with me too long?

Session-557.Scene: Fred admitted to putting Bulbadox Powder in Kenneth Towler's pajamas during their fifth year.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What are you still getting that for? I’m not bothering . . . load of rubbish.
It’s best to know what the enemy are saying, Nothing, Nothing about you or Dumbledore or anything.

Look at today! History of Magic, double Potions, Divination, and double Defense Against the Dark Arts . . . Binns, Snape, Trelawney, and that Umbridge woman all in one day! I wish Fred and George’d hurry up and get those Skiving Snackboxes sorted . . .
Look what we’ve got today, That’s the worst Monday I’ve ever seen.
Why’s it cheap? Cheers, but I think I’ll take the lessons.
And speaking of your Skiving Snackboxes, you can’t advertise for testers on the Gryffindor notice board.
Says me, And Ron.
Leave me out of it,
And why would starting fifth year mean I want a Skiving Snackbox?
So?
Yeah . . . you got, what was it, three O. W.L.s each?
But where are you going to get the gold to start a joke shop? You’re going to need all the ingredients and materials — and premises too, I suppose . . .
What did that mean? ‘Ask us no questions . . . ’ Does that mean they’ve already got some gold to start a joke shop?
You know, I’ve been wondering about that, They bought me a new set of dress robes this summer, and I couldn’t understand where they got the Galleons . . .
D’you reckon it’s true this year’s going to be really tough? Because of the exams?

Oh yeah, Bound to be, isn’t it? O.W.L.s are really important, affect the jobs you can apply for and everything. We get career advice too, later this year, Bill told me. So you can choose what N. E.W.T.s you want to do next year.
D’you know what you want to do after Hogwarts?
Not really, Except . . . well . . .
Why?
Well, it’d be cool to be an Auror,
Yeah, it would,
But they’re, like, the elite, You’ve got to be really good. What about you, Hermione?
I don’t know, I think I’d really like to do something worthwhile.
An Auror’s worthwhile!
Yes, it is, but it’s not the only worthwhile thing, I mean, if I could take S.P. E.W. further . . . if I refused to lend you my notes this year?
We’d fail our O. W.L.s, If you want that on your conscience, Hermione . . .
Well, you’d deserve it, You don’t even try to listen to him, do you?
We do try, We just haven’t got your brains or your memory or your concentration — you’re just cleverer than we are — is it nice to rub it in?

Session-558.Scene: Ron challenged Cho about her Quidditch team loyalty.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh, don’t give me that rubbish,
Hi,
Yeah, it would, So did you . . . er . . . have a good summer?
Is that a Tornados badge? You don’t support them, do you?
Have you always supported them, or just since they started winning the league?
You are so tactless!
What? I only asked her if —
Couldn’t you tell she wanted to talk to Harry on her own?
So? She could’ve done, I wasn’t stopping —
What on earth were you attacking her about her Quidditch team for? Attacking?
Attacking? I wasn’t attacking her, I was only — Who cares if she supports the Tornados?
Oh, come on, half the people you see wearing those badges only bought them last season —
But what does it matter?
It means they’re not real fans, they’re just jumping on the bandwagon —
That’s the bell,

Session-559.Scene: Harry forgot to add syrup of hellebore to his Draught of Peace potion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: The Draught of Peace,
Yes, I can,
‘Add powdered moonstone, stir three times counterclockwise, allow to simmer for seven minutes, then add two drops of syrup of hellebore.
No,
No, I forgot the hellebore . . .

Session-560.Scene: Harry abruptly left Hermione and Ron at the table, overwhelmed by their constant bickering.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That was really unfair, Your potion wasn’t nearly as bad as Goyle’s, when he put it in his flagon the whole thing shattered and set his robes on fire.
Yeah, well, since when has Snape ever been fair to me?
I did think he might be a bit better this year, I mean . . . you know . . . . . . Now he’s in the Order and everything.
Poisonous toadstools don’t change their spots,
I think Dumbledore’s probably got plenty of evidence, even if he doesn’t share it with you, Ron,
Oh, shut up, the pair of you, Can’t you give it a rest? You’re always having a go at each other, it’s driving me mad.

Session-561.Scene: Ron relayed Hermione's request for Harry to curb his anger towards them.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione and me have stopped arguing,
Good,
said Hermione.
I’m not —
I’m just passing on the message, But I reckon she’s right. It’s not our fault how Seamus and Snape treat you.
I never said it —

Session-562.Scene: Umbridge assigned Harry detention for claiming Voldemort had returned and murdered Cedric Diggory.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I never remember my dreams, You say one.
You must remember one of them,
What? What d’you reckon that means?
Probably that you’re going to be eaten by a giant marshmallow or something,

D’you realize how much homework we’ve got already?  now we’ve got a month’s dream diary from Trelawney!  Fred and George weren’t wrong about O.W.L. year, were they? That Umbridge woman had better not give us any . . .
Not about the chapter, no,
I’ve got a query about your course aims,
Hermione Granger,
Well, I don’t, There’s nothing written up there about using defensive spells.
We’re not going to use magic?
Weasley,
Defense Against the Dark Arts Surely the whole point of Defense Against the Dark Arts is to practice defensive spells?
No,
No,
And what good’s theory going to be in the real world?
So we’re not supposed to be prepared for what’s waiting out there?
Oh yeah?
Hmm, let’s think . . . maybe Lord Voldemort?
Yep, but yeah, he’s returned!
It is NOT a lie! I saw him, I fought him!
Harry, no!
So, according to you, Cedric Diggory dropped dead of his own accord, did he?
It was murder,

Session-563.Scene: Peeves taunted Harry with a mocking rhyme while sliding down the banister.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Get out of it, Peeves.
I said, leave me ALONE!
SHUT UP!

Session-564.Scene: McGonagall abruptly offered Harry a biscuit from a tartan tin to ease the tension after questioning him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ve been sent to see you,
Is what true? Professor?
Yes, Yes. Yes.
Yes, Yes. Yes.
Yes, Yes. Yes.
What?
What do you — ?
Every evening this week! But, Professor, couldn’t you — ?
“But —”
But I was telling the truth!
No, thanks,
No, thanks,

Session-565.Scene: Hermione threatened to write Fred and George's mother about their dangerous pranks on first-year students.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How can Dumbledore have let this happen? And in our O.W.L. year too!
Well, we’ve never had great Defense Against the Dark Arts teachers, have we? You know what it’s like, Hagrid told us, nobody wants the job, they say it’s jinxed.
Yes, but to employ someone who’s actually refusing to let us do magic! What’s Dumbledore playing at?
And she’s trying to get people to spy for her, Remember when she said she wanted us to come and tell her if we hear anyone saying You-Know-Who’s back?
Of course she’s here to spy on us all, that’s obvious, why else would Fudge have wanted her to come?
Don’t start arguing again, Can’t we just . . . Let’s just do that homework, get it out of the way . . .
Shall we do Snape’s stuff first? ‘The properties . . . of moonstone . . . and its uses . . . in potion-making . . .’ There. So what are the properties of moonstone and its uses in potion-making?
No, I’m sorry, they’ve gone too far, Come on, Ron.
I — what? No — come on, Hermione — we can’t tell them off for giving out sweets . . .
You know perfectly well that those are bits of Nosebleed Nougat or — or Puking Pastilles or —
Fainting Fancies?
She’s got it under control,
That’s enough!
I told you this morning, you can’t test your rubbish on students!
I don’t care, it could be dangerous!
It is NOT excellent!
You can’t do this, what if you made one of them really ill?
If you don’t stop doing it, I’m going to —
No, but I will write to your mother.
Oh, yes, I would, I can’t stop you eating the stupid things yourselves, but you’re not giving them to first years. Thank you for your support, Ron,
You handled it fine by yourself,
Oh, it’s no good, I can’t concentrate now. I’m going to bed.
What in the name of Merlin are you doing?
They’re hats for house-elves, I did them over the summer. I’m a really slow knitter without magic, but now I’m back at school I should be able to make lots more.
You’re leaving out hats for the house-elves? And you’re covering them up with rubbish first?
Yes,
That’s not on, You’re trying to trick them into picking up the hats. You’re setting them free when they might not want to be free.
Of course they want to be free! Don’t you dare touch those hats, Ron!
They should at least see what they’re picking up, Anyway . . . have you?”
I’m going to bed too.

Session-566.Scene: Harry gripped a bowtruckle so hard that it retaliated, leaving him with deep cuts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They’re tree-guardians, usually live in wand-trees.
Wood lice, But fairy eggs if they can get them.
Where’s Hagrid?
Maybe you will if you don’t shut up,

Dumbledore would know if something had happened to Hagrid, It’s just playing into Malfoy’s hands to look worried, it tells him we don’t know exactly what’s going on. We’ve got to ignore him, Harry. Here, hold the bowtruckle for a moment, just so I can draw its face . . .
Oooooh! If he calls Hagrid a moron one more time . . .
Harry, don’t go picking a row with Malfoy, don’t forget, he’s a prefect now, he could make life difficult for you . . .
Wow, I wonder what it’d be like to have a difficult life? I just wish Hagrid would hurry up and get back, that’s all, And don’t say that Grubbly-Plank woman’s a better teacher!

Session-567.Scene: Luna declared her belief in Voldemort's return and Harry's escape without greeting Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I wasn’t going to,
Because she’ll never be as good as Hagrid,
Yes,
Well, they were right, weren’t they? There weren’t any such things as the Blibbering Humdinger or the Crumple-Horned Snorkack.

Session-568.Scene: Ernie publicly declared his complete belief in Harry, distancing himself from those he considered "weirdos".

Dialogue.Dialogue: D’you mind not offending the only people who believe me?
Oh, for heaven’s sake, Harry, you can do better than her, Well, I wouldn’t expect anything else from someone whose father runs The Quibbler.
Er — thanks very much, Ernie,

Session-569.Scene: Angelina angrily demanded that Harry persuade Umbridge to release him from detention for the Quidditch tryouts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You know what?
What d’you reckon are the odds of Umbridge letting you off on Friday?

Less than zero, Better try, though, hadn’t I? I’ll offer to do two more detentions or something, I dunno . . . I hope she doesn’t keep me too long this evening. You realize we’ve got to write three essays, practice Vanishing Spells for McGonagall, work out a countercharm for Flitwick, finish the bowtruckle drawing, and start that stupid dream diary for Trelawney?
And it looks like it’s going to rain.
What’s that got to do with our homework?
Nothing,

Session-570.Scene: Umbridge gave Harry a quill that used his own blood as ink.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Come in,
Evening,
Er, Professor Umbridge? Er — before we start, I-I wanted to ask you a . . . a favor.

Well I’m . . . I’m on the Gryffindor Quidditch team. And I was supposed to be at the tryouts for the new Keeper at five o’clock on Friday and I was — was wondering whether I could skip detention that night and do it — do it another night . . . instead . . .
How many times?
You haven’t given me any ink,
Nothing,

Session-571.Scene: Ron quickly fabricated a dream about buying new shoes to satisfy a request.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How come you didn’t do it last night?

“doing other stuff,” That’ll have to do, I’ve said I dreamed I was buying a new pair of shoes, she can’t make anything weird out of that, can she? How was detention with Umbridge, anyway? What did she make you do?
Lines.
That’s not too bad, then, eh?
Nope,
Hey — I forgot — did she let you off for Friday?
No,

Session-572.Scene: Harry concealed the disturbing reality of his detention from Ron and Hermione.
