I do not blame you, Rookwood, You are sure of your facts, Rookwood?
Avery told me Bode would be able to remove it.

Stand up, Rookwood, You have done well to tell me this, Very well . . . I have wasted months on fruitless schemes, it seems. . . . But no matter . . . We begin again, from now. You have Lord Voldemort’s gratitude, Rookwood . . .
I shall need your help. I shall need all the information you can give me.
Very well . . . you may go. Send Avery to me. NOOOOOOOOO!
what Has someone been attacked again? Is it Dad? Is it that snake?
No, But Rookwood’s going to help him now. . . . He’s on the right track again . . .
What are you talking about? D’you mean . . . did you just see You-Know-Who?
I was You-Know-Who, He was with Rookwood, he’s one of the Death Eaters who escaped from Azkaban, remember? Rookwood’s just told him Bode couldn’t have done it . . .
what
Remove something. . . . He said Bode would have known he couldn’t have done it. . . . Bode was under the Imperius Curse. . . . I think he said Malfoy’s dad put it on him . . .
Bode was bewitched to remove something? But — Harry, that’s got to be —
The weapon, I know.
Did you say, that you were You-Know-Who?
Yeah,
Harry,
I haven’t got to tell anyone, I wouldn’t have seen it at all if I could do Occlumency. I’m supposed to have learned to shut this stuff out. That’s what they want.

Session-662.Scene: Hermione deduced that Lucius Malfoy likely cursed Sturgis Podmore to steal the weapon.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So that’s why they killed him, When Bode tried to steal this weapon, something funny happened to him. I think there must be defensive spells on it, or around it, to stop people from touching it. That’s why he was in St. Mungo’s, his brain had gone all funny and he couldn’t talk. But remember what the Healer told us? He was recovering. And they couldn’t risk him getting better, could they? I mean, the shock of whatever happened when he touched that weapon probably made the Imperius Curse lift. Once he’d got his voice back, he’d explain what he’d been doing, wouldn’t he? They would have known he’d been sent to steal the weapon. Of course, it would have been easy for Lucius Malfoy to put the curse on him. Never out of the Ministry, is he?

He was even hanging around that day I had my hearing, In the — hang on . . . He was in the Department of Mysteries corridor that day! Your dad said he was probably trying to sneak down and find out what happened in my hearing, but what if —
Sturgis,
what

Harry, Arrested for trying to get through a door. Lucius Malfoy got him too. I bet he did it the day you saw him there, Harry. Sturgis had Moody’s Invisibility Cloak, right? So what if he was standing guard by the door, invisible, and Malfoy heard him move, or guessed he was there, or just did the Imperius Curse on the off chance that a guard was there? So when Sturgis next had an opportunity — probably when it was his turn on guard duty again — he tried to get into the department to steal the weapon for Voldemort — Ron, be quiet — but he got caught and sent to Azkaban . . . And now Rookwood’s told Voldemort how to get the weapon?
Yes, it was, Rookwood used to work there. . . . Maybe Voldemort’ll send Rookwood to do it?
But you shouldn’t have seen this at all, Harry.
“What?
You’re supposed to be learning how to close your mind to this sort of thing,
I know I am,
Well, I think we should just try and forget what you saw, And you ought to put in a bit more effort on your Occlumency from now on.

Session-663.Scene: Harry accidentally saw Snape's childhood memories of being shouted at and alone.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don’t know, You mean the one where my cousin tried to make me stand in the toilet?
It’s . . . nothing,
it was — just a dream I had.
I know.
So I can learn Occlumency,
Just that one,
No, they don’t,
No — that’s your job, isn’t it?
Protego!
I . . . dunno what happened, I’ve never seen that before. I mean, I told you, I’ve dreamed about the door . . . but it’s never opened before . . .
Can you tell me something, sir?

Session-664.Scene: Parvati used her wand to curl her eyelashes while examining the effect in a spoon's reflection.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Not really, I’ve never really liked horses.
Either way, he’s still got four legs, Anyway, I thought you two were all upset that Trelawney had gone?
How is she?
I’ve got a feeling Umbridge has only just started being horrible,
Impossible, She can’t get any worse than she’s been already.

You mark my words, she’s going to want revenge on Dumbledore for appointing a new teacher without consulting her, Especially another part-human. You saw the look on her face when she saw Firenze . . .

Session-665.Scene: The classroom floor inexplicably transformed into a mossy forest with growing trees.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What the — ?
Er — hi, Er — good to see you . . .
Blimey!
He’s not very definite on anything, is he? I mean, I could do with a few more details about this war we’re about to have, couldn’t you?

Session-666.Scene: Firenze, banished from the forest, used Harry as an intermediary to warn Hagrid about a failing endeavor.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,
His attempt is not working?
But — what’s Hagrid attempting to do?

Session-667.Scene: Hagrid nervously dropped a basin full of knarl droppings while dismissing Harry's concerns.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid, what’re you up to? Because you’ve got to be careful, Umbridge has already sacked Trelawney and if you ask me, she’s on a roll. If you’re doing anything you shouldn’t be —

Session-668.Scene: Dobby's urgent warning about Umbridge caused a chaotic escape from the Room of Requirement.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They’re not supposed to be pretty, they’re supposed to protect you, What we really need is a boggart or something; that’s how I learned, I had to conjure a Patronus while the boggart was pretending to be a dementor —
You’ve got to think of something happy,
They are sort of nice, aren’t they?
Hi, Dobby! What are you — what’s wrong?
What’s happened, Dobby?
Who’s ‘she,’ Dobby? Umbridge? What about her? Dobby — she hasn’t found out about this — about us — about the D. A.? Is she coming?
WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? RUN!
Harry, come on!
Dobby — this is an order — get back down to the kitchen with the other elves, and if she asks you whether you warned me, lie and say no! And I forbid you to hurt yourself!

Session-669.Scene: Dumbledore claimed leadership of Dumbledore's Army to protect Harry and his friends.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeh — no.
No, No, I don’t,
No, No, I don’t,
School rules? No.
Not that I’m aware of,
Yes, it is,
NO! No — Professor Dumbledore!
Professor Dumbledore . . .

Session-670.Scene: The Head's office had sealed itself against Umbridge, preventing her entry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh, I expect she really fancied herself sitting up there in the Head’s office, Lording it over all the other teachers, the stupid puffed-up, power-crazy old —
Yeah, we’re prefects too, remember?
The what? The what?
Don’t!
Malfoy just docked us all about fifty points,
What do you mean, ‘tried’?
But you’ll get into terrible trouble!
Have you ever?
But now?
You mustn’t! You really mustn’t! She’d love a reason to expel you!
Anything to do with what?
I think we should get out of here, you know, Just in case . . .

Session-671.Scene: Filch revealed his long-held desire to physically punish students, anticipating the enforcement of Educational Decree Twenty-nine.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, all right,
I didn’t do it,
Things are changing around here, Potter. I’ve noticed,

Session-672.Scene: Harry secretly emptied his tea into a vase of dried flowers to avoid drinking it.

Dialogue.Dialogue: what? What?
Nothing, thank you,
Fine . . . tea then,
No,
No idea,
I don’t know where he is.
I don’t know,
No idea, Haven’t got a clue.

Session-673.Scene: Umbridge's Stupefy spell inadvertently caused a painting to explode.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Impressive, Very impressive . . . You’ll put Dr. Filibuster out of business, no problem . . .

Session-674.Scene: Harry warned Cho not to cry before stalking off.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Over here, Are you okay? Umbridge hasn’t been asking you about the D. A., has she?
Yeah, well,
A lovely person who made a mistake? She sold us all out, including you!
Ron’s dad works for the Ministry too! And in case you hadn’t noticed, he hasn’t got ‘sneak’ written across his face —
I think it was a brilliant idea,
Don’t start crying again,
Good, I’ve got enough to cope with at the moment.

Session-675.Scene: Snape dismissed Harry's presence as remedial potions following Malfoy's interruption.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,

Session-676.Scene: Harry experienced a jarring return from a memory as he landed abruptly in Snape's dungeon.

Dialogue.Dialogue: N-no . . .
I — didn’t —
No, No, of course I w —

Session-677.Scene: Harry forcefully dismissed Hermione's suggestion to resume Occlumency lessons with Snape.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But why haven’t you got Occlumency lessons anymore?
I’ve told you, Snape reckons I can carry on by myself now I’ve got the basics . . .
So you’ve stopped having funny dreams?
Pretty much,
Well, I don’t think Snape should stop until you’re absolutely sure you can control them! Harry, I think you should go back to him and ask — No,
No, Just drop it, Hermione, okay?
How can that come as a shock?
I dunno . . . there’s been a lot going on . . .
Well, there you are, if you follow that you should do fine.
You’ve given me an evening off every week!
That’s for Quidditch practice,
What’s the point? We’ve got about as much chance of winning the Quidditch Cup this year as Dad’s got of becoming Minister of Magic . . .
What’s wrong, Harry?
What? Nothing . . .
I saw Cho earlier, and she looked really miserable too. . . . Have you two had a row again?
Wha — oh yeah, we have,
What about?
That sneak friend of hers, Marietta,
Yeah, well, I don’t blame you! If it hadn’t been for her . . .

Session-678.Scene: Ginny shared Easter eggs from her mother with Harry in the library.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Huh? Oh hi, How come you’re not at practice?
What?
Yeah, I’m fine,
It’s not Cho I want to talk to,
I . . . I wish I could talk to Sirius, But I know I can’t.
Come on, With Umbridge policing the fires and reading all our mail?

Session-679.Scene: Harry considered contacting Sirius in Umbridge's office, despite the risks.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Well, It says here you need at least an E at N. E.W.T. level in Potions, Herbology, Transfiguration, Charms, and Defense Against the Dark Arts. I mean . . . blimey. . . . Don’t want much, do they?

Well, it’s a very responsible job, isn’t it? You don’t seem to need many qualifications to liaise with Muggles. . . . All they want is an O. W.L. in Muggle Studies . . . ‘Much more important is your enthusiasm, patience, and a good sense of fun! ’
What?
Yeah . . . yeah, I thought I’d like —
Don’t be so ridiculous, With Umbridge groping around in the fires and frisking all the owls?
Yes, but still, even if you do cause a diversion, how is Harry supposed to talk to him?
Umbridge’s office,
Are — you — insane?
I don’t think so,
And how are you going to get in there in the first place?
Sirius’s knife,
Excuse me?
Christmas before last Sirius gave me a knife that’ll open any lock, So even if she’s bewitched the door so Alohomora won’t work, which I bet she has —
What do you think about this?
I dunno, If Harry wants to do it, it’s up to him, isn’t it?
What sort of diversion is it?

Session-680.Scene: McGonagall vehemently pledged to assist Potter in becoming an Auror, even if it was her last act.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sorry, Professor, I forgot . . .
Er,
Well,
Yes, Defense Against the Dark Arts, I suppose?
Yes, What sort of character and aptitude tests do the Ministry do on you, if you get enough N. E.W.T.s?

Session-681.Scene: Harry used Floo powder to transport only his head to Grimmauld Place.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sirius?
Yes, I just wondered — I mean, I just fancied a — a chat with Sirius.

Session-682.Scene: Harry inhaled a mouthful of ashes when Sirius shouted in reaction to Snape discontinuing Occlumency lessons.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, it’s nothing like that. . . . I just wanted to talk . . . about my dad . . .
Well, but he just attacked Snape for no good reason, just because — well, just because you said you were bored,
He kept messing up his hair,
Yes, Well . . . I thought he was a bit of an idiot.
Yes, he kept looking over at the girls by the lake, hoping they were watching him!
She hated him!
Even Snape?
And my mum was okay with that?
Yeah, okay, I just never thought I’d feel sorry for Snape.
He told me he’d never teach me Occlumency again,
Yeah,
he said.
Okay, okay, I’ll . . . I’ll try and say something to him. . . . But it won’t be . . . Is that Kreacher coming downstairs?

Session-683.Scene: Harry confessed he secretly funded Fred and George's joke shop using his Triwizard Tournament winnings.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Should we say something? About what happened to him? In case it helps Madam Pomfrey cure him?
’Course not, he’ll recover,
Anyway, more trouble for Umbridge, isn’t it?
Reparo! That’s all very well, but what if Montague’s permanently injured?
Who cares? Montague shouldn’t have tried to take all those points from Gryffindor, should he? If you want to worry about anyone, Hermione, worry about me!
You? Why should I be worried about you?
When Mum’s next letter finally gets through Umbridge’s screening process, I’m going to be in deep trouble. I wouldn’t be surprised if she’s sent a Howler again.
But —

It’ll be my fault Fred and George left, you wait, She’ll say I should’ve stopped them leaving, I should’ve grabbed the ends of their brooms and hung on or something. . . . Yeah, it’ll be all my fault . . .

Well, if she does say that it’ll be very unfair, you couldn’t have done anything! But I’m sure she won’t, I mean, if it’s really true they’ve got premises in Diagon Alley now, they must have been planning this for ages . . .
Yeah, but that’s another thing, how did they get premises? It’s a bit dodgy, isn’t it?
Well, yes, that occurred to me too, I’ve been wondering whether Mundungus has persuaded them to sell stolen goods or something awful . . .
He hasn’t,
Because they got the gold from me. I gave them my Triwizard winnings last June.
Oh, Harry, you didn’t!
Yes, I did,
But this is excellent! It’s all your fault, Harry — Mum can’t blame me at all! Can I tell her?

Yeah, I suppose you’d better, ’Specially if she thinks they’re receiving stolen cauldrons or something . . . It’s no good nagging me, it’s done, Fred and George have got the gold — spent a good bit of it too, by the sounds of it — and I can’t get it back from them and I don’t want to. So save your breath, Hermione.

I wasn’t going to say anything about Fred and George! No, I wasn’t! As a matter of fact, I was going to ask Harry when he’s going to go back to Snape and ask for Occlumency lessons again! You can’t tell me you’ve stopped having funny dreams, because Ron told me last night you were muttering in your sleep again . . .
You were only muttering a bit, Something about ‘just a bit farther. ’
I dreamed I was watching you lot play Quidditch, I was trying to get you to stretch out a bit farther to grab the Quaffle.
You are trying to block your mind, aren’t you? You are keeping going with your Occlumency?
Of course I am,
You know, if Montague doesn’t recover before Slytherin play Hufflepuff, we might be in with a chance of winning the Cup.
Yeah, I s’pose so, Yeah, that’s right,
I mean, we’ve won one, lost one — if Slytherin lose to Hufflepuff next Saturday —
Yeah, I s’pose so, Yeah, I s’pose so,

Session-684.Scene: Hagrid urgently requested Harry and Hermione's assistance while concealing his bruised face and bleeding nose during the Quidditch match.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er . . . can’t it wait, Hagrid? Till the match is over?
’Course, ’course we’ll come . . .
You mean Umbridge? She won’t, she’s got her whole Inquisitorial Squad sitting with her, didn’t you see? She must be expecting trouble at the match.
What is it, Hagrid?
It’ll be Ravenclaw,
Into the forest?

Session-685.Scene: Hagrid revealed that he and Madame Maxime split up on their journey home because she grew tired of Grawp.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid, why are you armed?
You didn’t bring your crossbow the day you showed us the thestrals,
Why does Firenze leaving make a difference?
Firenze said that they’re angry because he went to work for Dumbledore?
They attacked him?
And you stopped it? By yourself?
Is that why we’re here, Hagrid? The centaurs?
Hagrid? Where are we going?
Hagrid, would it be all right if we lit our wands?
Good! Lumos!
And was it?
Of course we’ll help you, What do you want us to do?
Hagrid, who is he?
What is it?
Hagrid, you told us none of them wanted to come!
Hagrid? Why — what — oh, Hagrid!
Harmless!
Hagrid,
Small? Small?
Hagrid,
Grawp?
Yeah, Absolutely minuscule!
Did Madame Maxime want to bring him back?
How on earth did you get him back without anyone noticing?
Hagrid, What do you think you’re going to do with a violent giant who doesn’t even want to be here!
What are those ropes for, then?
You have to keep him tied up? So what is it you want Harry and Ron and me to do?
What — what does that involve, exactly?
You want us to teach him,
Kind of makes you wish we had Norbert back, doesn’t it?
We’ll . . . We’ll try, Hagrid . . .
Hagrid, Hagrid, no, don’t wake him, really, we don’t need —
Oh my . . .
Hagrid,
No, not at all,

Session-686.Scene: The centaurs warned Hagrid to stay away from the forest after he helped Firenze escape.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid, let’s go, please let’s go!
Hagrid, if the centaurs don’t want humans in the forest, it doesn’t really look as though Harry and I will be able —
Nice try,
I don’t know,
Good idea, Well . . . see you later, then, Hagrid . . .
I don’t believe him, I don’t believe him. I really don’t believe him . . .
Calm down,

Calm down! A giant! A giant in the forest! And we’re supposed to give him English lessons! Always assuming, of course, we can get past the herd of murderous centaurs on the way in and out! I — don’t — believe — him!

Session-687.Scene: Hermione initially defended Umbridge's potential actions against someone.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh come off it, Harry! Of course he’s going to be chucked out and to be perfectly honest, after what we’ve just seen, who can blame Umbridge?
You didn’t mean that,
No . . . well . . . all right . . . I didn’t, But why does he have to make life so difficult for himself — for us?
I dunno —
And I wish they’d stop singing that stupid song, haven’t they gloated enough? Oh, let’s get in before we have to meet the Slytherins,
Hermione . . .
No!
YES!
HARRY! HERMIONE! WE DID IT! WE WON!
We’ll save our news till tomorrow, shall we?
Righ’, I’m not in any hurry . . .

Session-688.Scene: Hagrid confided in Harry and Hermione about hiding a giant named Grawp in the forest and tasked them with teaching him English.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Well, I mean, I’d already let in that one of Davies’s, so I wasn’t feeling that confident, but I dunno, when Bradley came toward me, just out of nowhere, I thought — you can do this! And I had about a second to decide which way to fly, you know, because he looked like he was aiming for the right goal hoop — my right, obviously, his left — but I had a funny feeling that he was feinting, and so I took the chance and flew left — his right, I mean — and — well — you saw what happened, And then, when Chambers came at me about five minutes later — what? Why are you grinning?
I’m not, I’m just glad we won, that’s all.
Yeah,
I suppose she cried, did she?
Well, yeah — more out of temper than anything, though . . . But you saw her chuck her broom away when she got back to the ground, didn’t you?
Er —
Well, actually . . . no, Ron, As a matter of fact, the only bit of the match Harry and I saw was Davies’s first goal.
You didn’t watch? You didn’t see me make any of those saves?
Well — no, But Ron, we didn’t want to leave — we had to!
Yeah? How come?

It was Hagrid, He decided to tell us why he’s been covered in injuries ever since he got back from the giants. He wanted us to go into the forest with him, we had no choice, you know how he gets. . . . Anyway . . .
He brought one back and hid it in the forest?
Yep,
No, No, he can’t have . . .
Well, he has, Grawp’s about sixteen feet tall, enjoys ripping up twenty-foot pine trees, and knows me, as Hermy. And Hagrid wants us to . . . ?
Teach him English, yeah,
He’s lost his mind,
Yeah, Yes, Yes, I’m starting to think he has. But unfortunately, he made Harry and me promise.

Well, you’re just going to have to break your promise, that’s all, I mean, come on . . . We’ve got exams and we’re about that far, from being chucked out as it is. And anyway . . . remember Norbert? Remember Aragog? Have we ever come off better for mixing with any of Hagrid’s monster mates?
I know, it’s just that — we promised,
Well, Hagrid hasn’t been sacked yet, has he? He’s hung on this long, maybe he’ll hang on till the end of term and we won’t have to go near Grawp at all.

Session-689.Scene: Hermione revealed that the supposed dragon claw powder was actually dried doxy droppings.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione, we wanted to buy that!
Don’t be stupid, You might as well take Harold Dingle’s powdered dragon claw and have done with it.
Dingle’s got powdered dragon claw?
Not anymore, I confiscated that too. None of these things actually works you know —
Dragon claw does work!
This stuff can, I’ve had a look at it, and it’s actually dried doxy droppings.
Please, Professor, when will we find out our results?
Why don’t you just do it yourself?

Session-690.Scene: Harry's Patronus took the form of a stag during his examination.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Expecto Patronum!

Session-691.Scene: Harry gave Hagrid a thumbs-up after his Care of Magical Creatures practical exam.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Only! I’ve got Arithmancy and it’s probably the toughest subject there is!
Well, we were always going to fail that one,
We shouldn’t have taken the stupid subject in the first place,
Still, at least we can give it up now.
Yeah, No more pretending we care what happens when Jupiter and Uranus get too friendly . . .
And from now on, I don’t care if my tea leaves spell die, Ron, die — I’m just chucking them in the bin where they belong.
Well, I think I’ve done all right in Arithmancy, Just time for a quick look over our star charts before dinner, then . . .

Session-692.Scene: Lee Jordan confessed that he had been levitating nifflers into Umbridge's office.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Umbridge hates part-humans, She was always going to try and get Hagrid out.
That’s true,

Session-693.Scene: Harry's body, possessed by a dark force, tortured Sirius with the Cruciatus Curse.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Take it for me. . . . Lift it down, now. . . . I cannot touch it . . . but you can . . .
“Lord Voldemort is waiting . . .”

Session-694.Scene: Harry desperately tried to convince Professor Tofty that he was fine after experiencing a distressing episode during his examination.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m not going. . . . I don’t need the hospital wing. . . . I don’t want . . . I’m — I’m fine, sir, Really . . . I just fell asleep. . . . Had a nightmare . . .
Yes, I mean . . . no . . . I’ve done — done as much as I can, I think . . .
I’ll do that, Thanks very much.

Session-695.Scene: Madam Pomfrey revealed that Professor McGonagall was transferred to St. Mungo's after being struck by four Stunning Spells.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I need to see Professor McGonagall, Now . . . It’s urgent . . .
She’s . . . gone?
Yes,

Session-696.Scene: Harry envisioned Sirius being tortured by Voldemort in the Department of Mysteries after collapsing during an exam.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry! What happened? Are you all right? Are you ill?
Where have you been?
Come with me, Come on, I’ve got to tell you something . . . Voldemort’s got Sirius.
what What? How d’you — ?
Saw it. Just now.
But — but where? How?

I dunno how, But I know exactly where. There’s a room in the Department of Mysteries full of shelves covered in these little glass balls, and they’re at the end of row ninety-seven . . . He’s trying to use Sirius to get whatever it is he wants from in there. . . . He’s torturing him. . . . Says he’ll end by killing him . . . How’re we going to get there?
G-get there?
Get to the Department of Mysteries, so we can rescue Sirius!
But — Harry . . .
What? What?
Harry, er . . . how . . . how did Voldemort get into the Ministry of Magic without anybody realizing he was there?
How do I know? The question is how we’re going to get in there!

Harry, it’s five o’clock in the afternoon. . . . The Ministry of Magic must be full of workers. . . . How would Voldemort and Sirius have got in without being seen? Harry . . . they’re probably the two most wanted wizards in the world. . . . You think they could get into a building full of Aurors undetected?
I dunno, Voldemort used an Invisibility Cloak or something! Anyway, the Department of Mysteries has always been completely empty whenever I’ve been —
Harry, You’ve dreamed about the place, that’s all.
They’re not normal dreams! how come I knew what had happened to him?”
He’s got a point,
Harry, Harry, how on earth could Voldemort have got hold of Sirius when he’s been in Grimmauld Place all the time?
Sirius might’ve cracked and just wanted some fresh air,
But why, why on earth would Voldemort want to use Sirius to get the weapon, or whatever the thing is? I dunno, there could be loads of reasons!
You know what, I’ve just thought of something, Sirius’s brother was a Death Eater, wasn’t he? Maybe he told Sirius the secret of how to get the weapon!
Yeah — and that’s why Dumbledore’s been so keen to keep Sirius locked up all the time!
Look, I’m sorry, but neither of you are making sense, and we’ve got no proof for any of this, no proof Voldemort and Sirius are even there —
Hermione, Harry’s seen them!
Right,
What? What?
Harry! But you do . . . sort of . . . I mean — don’t you think you’ve got a bit of a — a — saving-people-thing?
what’s that supposed to mean, a ‘saving-people-thing’?

Well . . . you . . . I mean . . . last year, for instance . . . in the lake . . . during the Tournament . . . you shouldn’t have . . . I mean, you didn’t need to save that little Delacour girl. . . . You got a bit . . . carried away . . . . . . I mean, it was really great of you and everything,
That’s funny, because I definitely remember Ron saying I’d wasted time acting the hero. . . . Is that what you think this is? You reckon I want to act the hero again?
No, no, no! That’s not what I mean at all!
Well, spit out what you’ve got to say, because we’re wasting time here!

Harry! He took Ginny down into the Chamber of Secrets to lure you there, it’s the kind of thing he does, he knows you’re the — the sort of person who’d go to Sirius’s aid! What if he’s just trying to get you into the Department of Myst — ?

Hermione, it doesn’t matter if he’s done it to get me there or not — they’ve taken McGonagall to St. Mungo’s, there isn’t anyone left from the Order at Hogwarts who we can tell, and if we don’t go, Sirius is dead!
But Harry — what if your dream was — was just that, a dream?

You don’t get it! I’m not having nightmares, I’m not just dreaming! What d’you think all the Occlumency was for, why d’you think Dumbledore wanted me prevented from seeing these things? And if I remember rightly, you didn’t have a problem with my saving-people-thing when it was you I was saving from the dementors, or
I never said I had a problem!
Harry, Dumbledore wanted you to learn to shut these things out of your mind, if you’d done Occlumency properly you’d never have seen this —
IF YOU THINK I’M JUST GOING TO ACT LIKE I HAVEN’T SEEN —
Sirius told you there was nothing more important than you learning to close your mind!
WELL, I EXPECT HE’D SAY SOMETHING DIFFERENT IF HE KNEW WHAT I’D JUST —

Session-697.Scene: Hermione desperately pleaded with Harry to verify Sirius's location before rushing to London.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Never you mind,
Well, you can’t,
Harry, Wait . . . Harry, they can help. Harry, Harry, we need to establish whether Sirius really has left headquarters —
I’ve told you, I saw —
Harry, I’ll come, I’ll d-do whatever it takes to try and save him —” Harry,
How? How’re we going to check?
We’ll have to use Umbridge’s fire and see if we can contact him, We’ll draw Umbridge away again, but we’ll need lookouts, and that’s where we can use Ginny and Luna.
Okay, Okay, if you can think of a way of doing this quickly, I’m with you, otherwise I’m going to the Department of Mysteries right now —

Right, Right . . . well . . . One of us has to go and find Umbridge and — and send her off in the wrong direction, keep her away from her office. They could tell her — I don’t know — that Peeves is up to something awful as usual . . .

I’ll do it, I’ll tell her Peeves is smashing up the Transfiguration department or something, it’s miles away from her office. Come to think of it, I could probably persuade Peeves to do it if I met him on the way . . .
Okay, Now, we need to keep students away from her office while we force entry, or some Slytherin’s bound to go and tip her off . . .
Harry, well then, Harry, you and I will be under the Invisibility Cloak, and we’ll sneak into the office and you can talk to Sirius —
He’s not there, Hermione! Right,
Right, well, even if we do all of that, I don’t think we’re going to be able to bank on more than five minutes, not with Filch and the wretched Inquisitorial Squad floating around.
Five minutes’ll be enough, C’mon, let’s go —
Now?
Of course now! What did you think, we’re going to wait until after dinner or something? Hermione, Sirius is being tortured right now!
I — oh all right, You go and get the Invisibility Cloak and we’ll meet you at the end of Umbridge’s corridor, okay?

Session-698.Scene: Harry, driven by urgency, thrust his head into the fireplace and yelled the address of Grimmauld Place.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Got it, Ready to go, then? Right, So Ron — you go and head Umbridge off. . . . Ginny, Luna, if you can start moving people out of the corridor. . . . Harry and I will get the Cloak on and wait until the coast is clear . . .
Get over here, Are — are you sure you’re okay, Harry? You’re still very pale . . .
I’m fine, Here,
That’s because it’s colorless, but if you want to walk through it, carry on, then we’ll have your body as proof for the next idiot who didn’t believe us . . .
I think that’s as good as we’re going to get, Harry — come on, let’s do it. Good one . . . don’t forget the signal . . .
What’s the signal?
A loud chorus of ‘Weasley Is Our King’ if they see Umbridge coming, I thought she might have added extra security after the second niffler . . .
Number twelve, Grimmauld Place!

Session-699.Scene: Harry believed he had witnessed Voldemort torturing Sirius in a Department of Mysteries room within a dream.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sirius? Sirius, are you there? Who’s there?
Where’s Sirius, Kreacher?
Where’s he gone? Where’s he gone, Kreacher? I’m warning you! What about Lupin? Mad-Eye? Any of them, are any of them here?
Where has Sirius gone? Kreacher, has he gone to the Department of Mysteries?
But you know! Don’t you? You know where he is!
You — !

Session-700.Scene: Kreacher gleefully revealed Sirius would not return from the Department of Mysteries.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I was — trying to get my Firebolt!
No one —
It’s none of your business who I talk to,
He’s got Padfoot! He’s got Padfoot at the place where it’s hidden!

Session-701.Scene: Under threat of the Cruciatus Curse, Hermione falsely claimed she and Harry had finished a weapon Dumbledore ordered them to make.

Dialogue.Dialogue: NO! The Minister wouldn’t want you to break the law, Professor Umbridge!
It was you? You sent the dementors after me?
NO! No — Harry — Harry, we’ll have to tell her!
NO! No way!
Harry,
NO!
I’m — I’m sorry everyone,
Well, well, he was trying to speak to Professor Dumbledore . . .
NO!
But — but we needed to tell him something important!
We . . . we wanted to tell him it’s r-ready!
The . . . the weapon,
Yes, But he had to leave before it was finished and n-n-now we’ve finished it for him, and we c-c-can’t find him t-t-to tell him!
We don’t r-r-really understand it, We j-j-just did what P-P-Professor Dumbledore told us t-t-to do . . .
I’m not showing . . . them,

Right, fine . . . let them see it, I hope they use it on you! In fact, I wish you’d invite loads and loads of people to come and see! Th-that would serve you right — oh, I’d love it if the wh-whole school knew where it was, and how to u-use it, and then if you annoy any of them they’ll be able to s-sort you out!

Session-702.Scene: Umbridge sweety refused to give her wand to Harry because the Ministry valued her life more.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Of course not, Hagrid might have set it off accidentally.
In there, of course, It had to be somewhere that students weren’t going to find it accidentally, didn’t it?
Can we have your wand, then, if we’re going first?
Yes, Yes, it’s well hidden.
Er — are you sure this is the right way?
Oh yes,
Hermione, keep your voice down,
I want us heard, You’ll see . . .
Not far now!

Session-703.Scene: Umbridge was abducted by Bane while screaming and wriggling.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Don’t call them that!
Be quiet!
Please, please, don’t attack us, we don’t think like her, we aren’t Ministry of Magic employees! We only came in here because we hoped you’d drive her off for us —
No! Please — I didn’t mean that! I just hoped you’d be able to — to help us —
You said you didn’t hurt the innocent! We haven’t done anything to hurt you, we haven’t used wands or threats, we just want to go back to school, please let us go back —
Harry! I think he’s trying to say ‘Hagrid’!
he — he remembered!
I don’t know! I’m sorry, Grawp, I don’t know!
Goodness, Oh, that was horrible. And he might kill them all . . .
I’m not that fussed, to be honest, Smart plan, Really smart plan. Where do we go from here?
We need to get back up to the castle,
By the time we’ve done that, Sirius’ll probably be dead!
Well, we can’t do anything without wands, Anyway, Harry, how exactly were you planning to get all the way to London?
Yeah, we were just wondering that, So, had any ideas?
How did you get away?

Couple of Stunners, a Disarming Charm, Neville brought off a really nice little Impediment Jinx, But Ginny was best, she got Malfoy — Bat-Bogey Hex — it was superb, his whole face was covered in the great flapping things. Anyway, we saw you heading into the forest out of the window and followed. What’ve you done with Umbridge?
She got carried away, By a herd of centaurs.
That’s right!
Hagrid’s little brother, Anyway, never mind that now. Harry, what did you find out in the fire? Has You-Know-Who got Sirius or — ?
That’s right! and I’m sure Sirius is still alive, but I can’t see how we’re going to get there to help him.
Okay,
Yeah, but you’re not coming,
“You’re too —”
Yeah, but —
No — of course it wasn’t —
Well, it doesn’t matter anyway,
Yes!
Is it those mad horse things? Those ones you can’t see unless you’ve watched someone snuff it?
Yeah,
How many?
Just two.
Well, we need three,
Don’t be stupid, we can’t all go! Look, you three you’re not involved in this, you’re not —
What makes you think that?
Okay, then, Ron and I will take these two and go ahead, and Hermione can stay here with you three and she’ll attract more thestrals —
I’m not staying behind!

Session-704.Scene: Luna obligingly helped Ron, Hermione, and Ginny onto their respective thestrals.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
How’re we supposed to get on? When we can’t see the things?
This is mad, Mad . . . if I could just see it —
You’d better hope it stays invisible, We all ready, then? Okay . . . Ministry of Magic, visitors’ entrance, London, then, Er . . . if you know . . . where to go . . . This is bizarre!

Session-705.Scene: Ron vowed to never repeat the thestral ride after struggling with an unseen one.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Never again, Never, ever again . . . that was the worst —
Over here, Come on! Whoever’s nearest the receiver, dial six two four four two!
Harry Potter, Ron Weasley, Hermione Granger, Ginny Weasley, Neville Longbottom, Luna Lovegood . . . We’re here to save someone, unless your Ministry can do it first!
Fine! Now can we move?

Session-706.Scene: Harry's sense of foreboding intensified due to the deserted security desk.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Come on,
Let’s go, Okay, listen, Maybe . . . maybe a couple of people should stay here as a — as a lookout, and —
Let’s get on with it,

Session-707.Scene: The circular wall rotated suddenly, blurring the blue flames into neon lines.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Someone shut the door,
What was that about? What?
Don’t go calling for him, though!
Where do we go, then, Harry?

In the dreams I went through the door at the end of the corridor from the lifts into a dark room — that’s this one — and then I went through another door into a room that kind of . . . glitters. We should try a few doors, I’ll know the right way when I see it. C’mon.

Session-708.Scene: Hermione cast a fiery 'X' on the door to mark their passage.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’re those things?
Dunno,
No,
Brains?
Yes . . . I wonder what they’re doing with them?
Let’s get out of here, This isn’t right, we need to try another door —
There are doors here too,
In my dream I went through that dark room into the second one, I think we should go back and try from there.
Wait! Flagrate!
Good thinking, Okay, let’s try this one —

Session-709.Scene: Harry felt an intense pull to walk through the swaying veil despite Hermione's warnings.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Who’s there?
Careful!
Sirius?
Let’s go, This isn’t right, Harry, come on, let’s go . . . Harry, let’s go, okay?
Okay, What are you saying? What?
Nobody’s talking, Harry!
Someone’s whispering behind there, Is that you, Ron?
I’m here, mate,
Can’t anyone else hear it?
What do you mean, ‘in there’? There isn’t any ‘in there,’ it’s just an archway, there’s no room for anybody to be there — Harry, stop it, come away — Harry, we are supposed to be here for Sirius!
Sirius, Yeah . . . Let’s go,
That’s what I’ve been trying to — well, come on, then!
What d’you reckon that arch was?
I don’t know, but whatever it was, it was dangerous,

Session-710.Scene: Luna guided Ron, Hermione, and Ginny onto thestrals they couldn't see.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
It’s . . . locked . . .
This is it, then, isn’t it? Bound to be!
Get out of the way! Alohomora!
Sirius’s knife!
Right, we’re leaving that room,
But what if that’s the one?
It can’t be, Harry could get through all the doors in his dream,
Something blibbering, no doubt,
This is it! This way!
Keep going!
This is it,

Session-711.Scene: Harry discovered a dusty glass sphere bearing his name and a cryptic inscription on its label.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You said it was row ninety-seven,
Yeah,
We need to go right, I think, Yes . . . that’s fifty-four. . . .
Keep your wands out, he might already be dead. . . .
Ninety-seven!
He’s right down at the end, You can’t see properly from here . . . He should be near here, Anywhere here . . . really close . . .
Harry?
Somewhere about . . . here . . . He might be . . . Or maybe . . .
Harry?
What What?
I . . . I don’t think Sirius is here.
Harry?
What What?
Have you seen this?
What What? What What?
It’s — it’s got your name on,
My name?
What? What? What’s your name doing down here? I’m not here, None of the rest of us are here . . .
Harry, I don’t think you should touch it,
Why not? It’s something to do with me, isn’t it?
It’s got my name on,

Session-712.Scene: Bellatrix mocked Harry with a childish voice, calling him a frightened baby.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s Sirius?
I want to know where Sirius is! I want to know where Sirius is!
You’ve got him, He’s here. I know he is.
Don’t do anything,
I know Sirius is here, I know you’ve got him!
Go on, then,
Yeah, right! I give you this — prophecy, is it? And you’ll just let us skip off home, will you?
Protego!
You’ll have to smash this if you want to attack any of us, I don’t think your boss will be too pleased if you come back without it, will he? So, what kind of prophecy are we talking about anyway?
Nope, not jesting, How come Voldemort wants it?
Yeah, Yeah, I’ve got no problem saying Vol —
Did you know he’s a half-blood too? Voldemort? Yeah, his mother was a witch but his dad was a Muggle — or has he been telling you lot he’s pureblood?
You haven’t told me what’s so special about this prophecy I’m supposed to be handing over,
I’m not playing games,
What? What?
What? What about my scar? What?
What? What?
Smash shelves —
— when I say go —
Did he? So he wanted me to come and get it, did he? Why? Why?
So,
Someone made a prophecy about Voldemort and me? And he’s made me come and get it for him? Why couldn’t he come and get it himself?
So he’s got you doing his dirty work for him, has he? Like he tried to get Sturgis to steal it — and Bode? NOW!
RUN!
STUPEFY! STUBEFY!

Session-713.Scene: Neville's accidental spell transformed a Death Eater's head into that of a baby within a bell jar.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where — where are the others?”
They must have gone the wrong way!
What do we do?
Well, we don’t stand here waiting for them to find us, for a start, Let’s get away from this door . . .
Stupefy!  STUPEFY! STUBEFY!
STUBE —
Stupefy!  STUPEFY! STUBEFY! Accio Wand!
Thanks, right, let’s get out of —
It’s time, Time . . .
RON? GINNY? LUNA?
Harry! You can’t hurt a baby!
Come on!

Session-714.Scene: Hermione collapsed after a purple flame struck her chest.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Collo —
Silencio!
Petrificus Totalus!
Well done, Ha —
HERMIONE! Like you won’t kill us all the moment I hand it over anyway!
Petrificus Totalus! Hermione, Hermione, wake up . . .
I dunno . . .
She’s alive?

Neville, we’re not far from the exit, We’re right next to that circular room. . . . If we can just get you across it and find the right door before any more Death Eaters come, I’ll bet you can get Hermione up the corridor and into the lift. . . . Then you could find someone. . . . Raise the alarm . . .
I’ve got to find the others,
But Hermione —
Wait, you’d better take this . . .
He’s never going to notice us, C’mon . . . keep close behind me . . .

Session-715.Scene: After using the Reductor Curse on Pluto, Luna gestured hopelessly at Ginny's injured state.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So which way d’you reck — ? Ron! Ginny — are you all — ?
Harry, There you are. . . . Ha ha ha . . . You look funny, Harry. . . . You’re all messed up . . .
GINNY? What happened?
Harry, Get it, Harry? We saw Uranus — ha ha ha —
What?
Harry, you know who this girl is, Harry?  She’s Loony .. . Loony Lovegood . . . ha ha ha . . .
We’ve got to get out of here, Luna, can you help Ginny?
“Colloportus!”
Luna — Neville — help me! “Colloportus!”
Harry, Hey, Harry, there are brains in here, ha ha ha, isn’t that weird, Harry?
Ron, get out of the way, get down —
Harry, Harry,
RON, NO!
Harry,
Diffindo!
Let — let the others go, and I’ll give it to you!
Neville — no — go back to Ron —
Are you okay?
And Ron?
STUBEFY, STUPEFY! STUBEFY! Thanks! Protego!
Petrificus Totalus!
Can you stand?
No — get — off — me . . . Neville — catch it! IMPEDIMENTA!
Come on!
It doesn’t matter! Just try and stand, let’s get out of —
I — what? Why?
SIRIUS! SIRIUS!
Get him, save him, he’s only just gone through!
We can still reach him —

Session-716.Scene: Harry's intense hatred inspired him to cast the Crucio curse on Bellatrix, though it lacked the necessary force.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s the exit? Where’s the way out?
I am! I am! I am! I am!
Crucio!
Stupefy!
Well, you’re going to have to kill me, because it’s gone! And he knows! Your dear old mate Voldemort knows it’s gone! He’s not going to be happy with you, is he?
The prophecy smashed when I was trying to get Neville up the steps! What do you think Voldemort’ll say about that, then?
Nothing there! Nothing to summon! It smashed and nobody heard what it said, tell your boss that —
Don’t waste your breath! He can’t hear you from here!
Look out!
Yes, Yeah, I’m — where’s Voldemort, where — who are all these — what’s —

Session-717.Scene: Dumbledore revealed he purposely distanced himself from Harry to protect him from Voldemort's potential possession.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, you don’t,
My greatest strength, is it? You haven’t got a clue. . . . You don’t know . . .
I don’t want to talk about how I feel, all right?
THEN — I — DON’T — WANT — TO — BE — HUMAN!
I DON’T CARE! I’VE HAD ENOUGH, I’VE SEEN ENOUGH, I WANT OUT, I WANT IT TO END, I DON’T CARE ANYMORE —
I — DON’T!
YOU DON’T KNOW HOW I FEEL! Let me out,
Let me out,
If you don’t — if you keep me in here — if you don’t let me —
Let me out,
Do you — do you think I want to — do you think I give a — I DON’T CARE WHAT YOU’VE GOT TO SAY! I don’t want to hear anything you’ve got to say!
What are you talking — ?
You’ve told me this before, Professor,
I know,
Yeah, Snape told me,
Yes, Yeah, I wondered.
But I didn’t, I tried to check he’d really taken Sirius, I went to Umbridge’s office, I spoke to Kreacher in the fire, and he said Sirius wasn’t there, he said he’d gone!
He — he sent me on purpose? How? He hasn’t been out of Grimmauld Place for years.
How do you know all this?
He was laughing?
Like what?
So . . . when I asked Kreacher if Sirius was there last night . . .
And Kreacher told you all this . . . and laughed?
And,
DON’T TALK ABOUT SIRIUS LIKE THAT! What about Snape? You’re not talking about him, are you?
Snape — Snape g-goaded Sirius about staying in the house — he made out Sirius was a coward —
Snape stopped giving me Occlumency lessons! He threw me out of his office!
Snape made it worse, my scar always hurt worse after lessons with him — How do you know he wasn’t trying to soften me up for Voldemort, make it easier for him to get inside my —
But that’s okay, is it? It’s okay for Snape to hate my dad, but it’s not okay for Sirius to hate Kreacher?
SO SIRIUS DESERVED WHAT HE GOT, DID HE?
Yeah, he did hate it! You made him stay shut up in that house and he hated it, that’s why he wanted to get out last night —
People don’t like being locked up!
She doesn’t love me,
I still don’t —
“You sent that Howler. You told her to remember — it was your voice —” Yes,  “But what’s this got to do with …”
“I don’t —”
“I still don’t understand.”
“Who heard it?”

“It means — me?” “But then … but then, why was it my name on the prophecy and not Neville’s?” Then — it might not be me?”  “But you said — Neville was born at the end of July too — and his mum and dad —”
“So he only heard … ?”
“I don’t understand what you’re saying,”
The end of the prophecy . . . it was something about . . . ‘neither can live . . . ’
So, so does that mean that . . . that one of us has got to kill the other one . . . in the end?

Session-718.Scene: Luna's father sold Harry's Quibbler interview for a good price.

Dialogue.Dialogue: There you are, Harry, I knew they’d drag you into it somehow,
He’s ‘the Boy Who Lived’ again now, though, isn’t he? Not such a show-off maniac anymore, eh?

Yes, they’re very complimentary about you now, Harry, ‘A lone voice of truth . . . perceived as unbalanced, yet never wavered in his story . . . forced to bear ridicule and slander . . . ’ Hmmm, I notice they don’t mention the fact that it was them doing all the ridiculing and slandering, though . . . ‘You-Know-Who’s Last Attempt to Take Over, pages two to four,  Exclusive Interview with Harry Pot-ter, page nine … . .’ Well,’ it’s certainly given them lots to write about. And that interview with Harry isn’t exclusive, it’s the one that was in The Quibbler months ago . . .
That sounds lovely. So anyway, what’s going on in school?
Why?
I think he left it as a monument to Fred and George, They sent me all these, you know, Must be doing all right out of that joke shop, eh?
So has all the trouble stopped now Dumbledore’s back?
I s’pose Filch is happy, is he?
Madam Pomfrey says she’s just in shock,
Yeah, she shows signs of life if you do this,
Speaking of centaurs, who’s Divination teacher now? Is Firenze staying?
He’s got to, the other centaurs won’t take him back, will they?
Bet Dumbledore wishes he could’ve got rid of Trelawney for good, Mind you, the whole subject’s useless if you ask me, Firenze isn’t a lot better . . .
How can you say that? After we’ve just found out that there are real prophecies? It is a pity it broke,
Yeah, it is, Still, at least You-Know-Who never found out what was in it either — where are you going?
Er — Hagrid’s, You know, he just got back and I promised I’d go down and see him and tell him how you two are . . .
Oh all right then, Wish we could come . . .
Say hello to him for us! And ask him what’s happening about . . . about his little friend!

Session-719.Scene: Malfoy threatened Harry, vowing revenge for his father's imprisonment.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Funny, you’d think I’d have stopped walking around . . .
Well, I’m terrified now, I s’pose Lord Voldemort’s just a warm-up act compared to you three — what’s the matter? He’s your dad’s mate, isn’t he? Not scared of him, are you?
I thought I just had,
Yeah, I expect they will, Still, at least everyone knows what scumbags they are now —
I’m trying to decide what curse to use on Malfoy, sir,

Session-720.Scene: Hagrid revealed his consideration of finding a female companion for Grawp.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m fine, So, where’ve you been?
You — you look better,
He didn’t want to go at all!
I’ve got to go and visit Ron and Hermione in the hospital wing,
Yeah . . . right . . .

Session-721.Scene: Harry received a two-way mirror from Sirius, enabling them to communicate across distances.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Just do it tomorrow! Come on, I’m starving . . .
I won’t be long. . . . Look, you go ahead . . .
Sirius. “Sirius Black!”

Session-722.Scene: Nearly Headless Nick confessed to Harry that he had chosen to remain as a ghost due to his fear of death.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hey — hey Nick! NICK!
Nick, can I ask you something?
No — Nick — please, I really need to talk to you. Can we go in here?
What?
That’s right, isn’t it? You died, but I’m talking to you. . . . You can walk around Hogwarts and everything, can’t you?
What d’you mean?
Oh, Well, that’s okay then, the person I’m asking about is a wizard. So he can come back, right?
who
Why? Anyway — it doesn’t matter — Sirius won’t care if it’s unusual, he’ll come back, I know he will!
What? Gone on where? Listen — what happens when you die, anyway? Where do you go? Why doesn’t everyone come back? Why isn’t this place full of ghosts? Why — ?
You’re dead, aren’t you? Who can answer better than you?
Don’t talk to me about that place!

Session-723.Scene: Luna calmly stated that she believed she would see her deceased mother again, having heard her behind the veil.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How come you’re not at the feast?
How come people hide your stuff?
That’s no reason for them to take your things, D’you want help finding them?
Just didn’t feel like it.
Have you . . . I mean, who . . . has anyone you’ve known ever died?
I’m sorry,
Er — isn’t it?
You mean . . .
Are you sure you don’t want me to help you look for your stuff?
Yeah . . . yeah, you too.

Session-724.Scene: Ginny revealed she had left Michael Corner due to his sulkiness over Gryffindor's Quidditch victory.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Goyle’s mum’ll be really pleased, though, He’s loads better-looking now. . . . Anyway, Harry, the food trolley’s just stopped if you want anything . . .
It hasn’t really started yet, But it won’t be long now . . .
Hey, Harry, What’s — er — going on with you and her anyway?
Nothing,
I — er — heard she’s going out with someone else now,
You’re well out of it, mate, I mean, she’s quite good-looking and all that, but you want someone a bit more cheerful.
She’s probably cheerful enough with someone else,
Who’s she with now anyway?
But you were going out with him!
Well, I always thought he was a bit of an idiot, Good for you. Just choose someone — better — next time.
Why?

Session-725.Scene: Ginny casually revealed her new relationship with Dean Thomas after ending things with her previous boyfriend.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Good for you.
What are they supposed to be?
What? I didn’t expect . . . what are you all doing here?
I dunno if that’s a good idea,

Session-726.Scene: Dumbledore magically conjured mead and glasses in the Dursleys' sitting room.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don’t mean to be rude —
Aren’t — aren’t we leaving, sir?
Sir — what happened to your — ?
Oh. Right.
You can keep using it as headquarters, I don’t care. You can have it, I don’t really want it.
Why?
I bet there has,
No
But how are you going to find out if I’m allowed to own it?
I don’t care, I don’t want him.
Kreacher, shut up!
Do I — do I have to keep him with me? Yeah,
No, he can stay with Hagrid. I think Buckbeak would prefer that.
Erm . . .
I’ll just go and — er — finish off,

Session-727.Scene: Dumbledore used magic to summon a bottle of mead and glasses, offering the group refreshment.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Bye Bye,

Session-728.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that Voldemort was using Occlumency against Harry to block Harry's access to his thoughts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m fine, But I think I might prefer brooms. . . .
No,
Well, I’m not complaining,

Session-729.Scene: Dumbledore revealed their destination as the village of Budleigh Babberton to Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “Professor?”
Er — where exactly are we?
And what are we doing here?
How can I help with that, sir?

Session-730.Scene: Harry referenced Hermione's explanation about Apparition restrictions at Hogwarts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor, why couldn’t we just Apparate directly into your old colleague’s house?
— you can’t Apparate anywhere inside the buildings or grounds, Hermione Granger told me.

Session-731.Scene: Dumbledore confirmed Fudge's dismissal and Scrimgeour's appointment as Minister for Magic.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sir, I saw in the Daily Prophet that Fudge has been sacked. . . .
Is he . . . Do you think he’s good?
You do,

Session-732.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that raspberry was his preferred flavor of jam as a security check against impostors.

Dialogue.Dialogue: And . . . sir . . . I saw about Madam Bones.
Professor, what happened to your — ?
Sir — I got a Ministry of Magic leaflet by owl, about security measures we should all take against the Death Eaters. . . .
Not really.
I didn’t . . .
Er . . . right, Well, on that leaflet, it said something about Inferi. What exactly are they? The leaflet wasn’t very clear.

Session-733.Scene: Slughorn concealed himself as an armchair to avoid potential Death Eater recruitment.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor?
You mean he’s — ?
Sorry, It’s just — I didn’t like her either.
Yeah, I’ve been told,
My mother’s eyes, yeah.
Which was your House?
One of my best friends is Muggle-born, and she’s the best in our year.
Not really,
And all these people know where to find you, to send you stuff?

You don’t have to join the Order to teach at Hogwarts, Most of the teachers aren’t in it, and none of them has ever been killed — well, unless you count Quirrell, and he got what he deserved seeing as he was working with Voldemort. I reckon the staff are safer than most people while Dumbledore’s headmaster; he’s supposed to be the only one Voldemort ever feared, isn’t he?
Bye,

Session-734.Scene: Dumbledore warned Harry about Slughorn's tendency to collect influential people.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I didn’t do anything,
Er . . .

Session-735.Scene: Harry vowed to avenge Sirius by fighting against Voldemort and the Death Eaters.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s just hard, to realize he won’t write to me again.

But while I was at the Dursleys’ . . . I realized I can’t shut myself away or — or crack up.  Sirius wouldn’t have wanted that, would he? . . . Look at Madam Bones, look at Emmeline Vance. . . . It could be me next, couldn’t it? But if it is, I’ll make sure I take as many Death Eaters with me as I can, and Voldemort too if I can manage it.

Session-736.Scene: Dumbledore informed Harry that he would be giving him private lessons that year.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Private — with you?
What will you be teaching me, sir?
If I’m having lessons with you, I won’t have to do Occlumency lessons with Snape, will I?
Wonderful,
Well, that means I won’t see much of Professor Snape from now on,
I understand,

Session-737.Scene: Tonks abruptly disapparated into the yard after expressing gratitude for tea and sympathy.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hi, Tonks.

Session-738.Scene: Mrs. Weasley carried the Weasley family clock around the house, which was set to "mortal peril" for each member.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That’s great!
What exactly — ?
Is Mr. Weasley still at work?

Session-739.Scene: Mrs. Weasley whispered "Mollywobbles" as her secret name for her husband to confirm his identity.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why, where are they?
’Night, Mr. Weasley,

Session-740.Scene: Harry found a Puking Pastille hidden inside his pillowcase in Fred and George's room.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wuzzgoinon?
We didn’t know you were here already!
Ron, don’t hit him!
All right?
Never been better, You?
Not bad, When did you get here? Mum’s only just told us!
About one o’clock this morning.
Were the Muggles all right? Did they treat you okay?
Same as usual, they didn’t talk to me much, but I like it better that way. How’re you, Hermione?
Oh, I’m fine,
What’s the time? Have I missed breakfast?
Don’t worry about that, Mum’s bringing you up a tray; she reckons you look underfed, So, what’s been going on?
Nothing much, I’ve just been stuck at my aunt and uncle’s, haven’t I?
Come off it! You’ve been off with Dumbledore!
It wasn’t that exciting. He just wanted me to help him persuade this old teacher to come out of retirement. His name’s Horace Slughorn.
Oh, — we thought it’d be something like that.
You did?
Yeah . . . yeah, now Umbridge has left, obviously we need a new Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, don’t we? So, er, what’s he like?
He looks a bit like a walrus, and he used to be Head of Slytherin, Something wrong, Hermione?
No, of course not! So, um, did Slughorn seem like he’ll be a good teacher?
Dunno, He can’t be worse than Umbridge, can he?
What’s up with you?
What’s she done now?
I know, She’s so full of herself.
Can’t you two lay off her for five seconds?
Who are you — ?

Session-741.Scene: Fleur announced that she and Bill were going to be married.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh . . . is she here too?
Oh, Wow. Er — congratulations!
They’ve known each other a year,

Session-742.Scene: Hermione revealed that Tonks was struggling to control her Metamorphosing abilities due to depression.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Don’t you get used to her if she’s staying in the same house?
Well, you do, but if she jumps out at you unexpectedly, like then . . .
It’s pathetic,
How’s she going to manage that?
Yeah, that’ll work, Listen, no bloke in his right mind’s going to fancy Tonks when Fleur’s around. I mean, Tonks is okay-looking when she isn’t doing stupid things to her hair and her nose, but —
And she’s more intelligent, she’s an Auror!
Fleur’s not stupid, she was good enough to enter the Triwizard Tournament,
Not you as well!
Yes, I was just saying, Phlegm — I mean, Fleur —
She hasn’t been much of a laugh lately, Every time I’ve seen her she’s looked more like Moaning Myrtle.
That’s not fair, She still hasn’t got over what happened . . . you know . . . I mean, he was her cousin! That’s not the point, She thinks it was her fault he died!
How does she work that one out?
Well, she was fighting Bellatrix Lestrange, wasn’t she? I think she feels that if only she had finished her off, Bellatrix couldn’t have killed Sirius.
That’s stupid,
It’s survivor’s guilt, I know Lupin’s tried to talk her round, but she’s still really down. She’s actually having trouble with her Metamorphosing!
With her — ?
She can’t change her appearance like she used to, I think her powers must have been affected by shock, or something.
I didn’t know that could happen,
Nor did I, but I suppose if you’re really depressed . . .

Session-743.Scene: Hermione suffered a black eye from a self-punching telescope.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’s this?
Dunno, but if Fred and George’ve left it here, it’s probably not ready for the joke shop yet, so be careful.
Your mum said the shop’s going well, Said Fred and George have got a real flair for business.
That’s an understatement, They’re raking in the Galleons!
And what about Percy? Is he talking to your mum and dad again?
Nope,
But he knows your dad was right all along now about Voldemort being back —
said Dumbledore. I heard him telling your mum, Ron.
Sounds like the sort of mental thing Dumbledore would say,
He’s going to be giving me private lessons this year,
You kept that quiet!
I only just remembered, He told me last night in your broom shed.
Blimey . . . private lessons with Dumbledore! I wonder why he’s . . . ?
I don’t know exactly why he’s going to be giving me lessons, but I think it must be because of the prophecy. You know, the one they were trying to steal at the Ministry.
Nobody knows what it said, though, It got smashed.
Although the Prophet says —
Shh!

The Prophet’s got it right, That glass ball that smashed wasn’t the only record of the prophecy. I heard the whole thing in Dumbledore’s office, he was the one the prophecy was made to, so he could tell me. From what it said, it looks like I’m the one who’s got to finish off Voldemort. . . . At least, it said neither of us could live while the other survives. Hermione!
I squeezed it and it — it punched me!
Don’t worry, Mum’ll fix that, she’s good at healing minor injuries —

Oh, Harry, oh, Harry . . . We wondered, after we got back from the Ministry . . . Obviously, we didn’t want to say anything to you, but from what Lucius Malfoy said about the prophecy, how it was about you and Voldemort, well, we thought it might be something like this. . . . Oh, Harry . . . Are you scared?
Not as much as I was, When I first heard it, I was . . . but now, it seems as though I always knew I’d have to face him in the end. . . .

When we heard Dumbledore was collecting you in person, we thought he might be telling you something or showing you something to do with the prophecy, And we were kind of right, weren’t we? He wouldn’t be giving you lessons if he thought you were a goner, wouldn’t waste his time — he must think you’ve got a chance!

That’s true, I wonder what he’ll teach you, Harry? Really advanced defensive magic, probably .powerful countercurses . . . anti-jinxes . . . . . . and evasive enchantments generally, Well, at least you know one lesson you’ll be having this year, that’s one more than Ron and me. I wonder when our O. W.L. results will come?
Can’t be long now, it’s been a month,
Hang on, I think Dumbledore said our O. W.L. results would be arriving today!
Today? Today? But why didn’t you — oh my God — you should have said — I’m going to see whether any owls have come. . . .

Session-744.Scene: Hermione expressed distress about a prank that was affecting her appearance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But it’s got to come off! I can’t go around looking like this forever!
Yes, I can hardly breathe for laughing, Mrs. Weasley, you’re quite, quite sure no owls have arrived this morning?

I know I messed up Ancient Runes, I definitely made at least one serious mistranslation. And the Defense Against the Dark Arts practical was no good at all. I thought Transfiguration went all right at the time, but looking back —
Hermione, will you shut up, you’re not the only one who’s nervous! And when you’ve got your ten ‘Outstanding’ O. W.L.s . . .
Don’t, don’t, don’t! I know I’ve failed everything!
What happens if we fail?
We discuss our options with our Head of House, I asked Professor McGonagall at the end of last term.
They’re definitely owls,
And there are three of them,
One for each of us, Oh no . . . oh no . . . oh no . . . Oh no!
Here you are — Knew you’d be top at Defense Against the Dark Arts, We’ve done all right, haven’t we?
I — not bad,

You did? Yep — nine ‘Outstandings’ and one ‘Exceeds Expectations’ at Defense Against the Dark Arts. You’re actually disappointed, aren’t you? Well, we’re N. E.W.T. students now! Mum, are there any more sausages?

Session-745.Scene: Harry recalled Florean Fortescue's generosity in providing him with complimentary ice cream.

Dialogue.Dialogue: — the ice-cream place in Diagon Alley? He used to give me free ice creams. What’s happened to him?
Why?

Session-746.Scene: Ginny mimed vomiting into her cereal behind Fleur.Ginny humorously expressed her distaste for Fleur's affection toward Bill.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s mine?
Thanks, Bill,

Session-747.Scene: Hagrid revealed that Dumbledore had advocated for him to serve as Harry's security detail instead of Aurors.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Glad he’s pleased, We didn’t know ‘security’ meant you!

Session-748.Scene: Narcissa implied that Harry would die before she was reunited with her imprisoned husband.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Really? Going to get a few Death Eater pals to do us in, are you?
Wow . . . look at that . . . he’s not here now! So why not have a go? They might be able to find you a double cell in Azkaban with your loser of a husband!
Harry, no! Think. . . . You mustn’t. . . . You’ll be in such trouble. . . .

Session-749.Scene: Hagrid dismissed any potential threat from the Malfoys in Diagon Alley.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Just about, Did you see the Malfoys?

Session-750.Scene: Arkie Philpott had a Probity Probe stuck up him two days earlier due to the goblins' heightened security.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Handy,

Session-751.Scene: Harry, Ron, and Hermione concealed themselves under the Invisibility Cloak to secretly follow Malfoy.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Get under here, quick,
Oh — I don’t know, Harry,
He was going in that direction, C’mon.
That’s him, isn’t it? Turning left?
Big surprise,
Quick, or we’ll lose him,
/ Just hurry! Ouch!
/ Look! He’s in there! /
/ Oh, I hope the door isn’t Imperturbable —
/ Listen!

Session-752.Scene: Borgin's unctuous smile disappeared after Malfoy left the shop.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What was that about?
Dunno, He wants something mended . . . and he wants to reserve something in there. . . . Could you see what he pointed at when he said ‘that one’?
No, he was behind that cabinet —
You two stay here,
What are you — ?

Session-753.Scene: Harry theorized that Malfoy had become a Death Eater and possessed the Dark Mark after witnessing Malfoy's reaction in Madam Malkin's.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes, I’ve already agreed it was fishy, Harry, But haven’t we agreed there could be a lot of explanations?
Remember that shriveled-up arm Malfoy had?
But what about when he said, ‘Don’t forget to keep that one safe’? That sounded to me like Borgin’s got another one of the broken objects, and Malfoy wants both.
You reckon?
Yeah, I do, Malfoy’s father’s in Azkaban. Don’t you think Malfoy’d like revenge?
Malfoy, revenge? What can he do about it?
That’s my point, I don’t know! But he’s up to something and I think we should take it seriously. His father’s a Death Eater and —
Harry? What’s wrong?
Your scar’s not hurting again, is it?
He’s a Death Eater, He’s replaced his father as a Death Eater!
Malfoy? He’s sixteen, Harry! You think You-Know-Who would let Malfoy join?
It seems very unlikely, Harry, What makes you think — ?
In Madam Malkin’s. She didn’t touch him, but he yelled and jerked his arm away from her when she went to roll up his sleeve. It was his left arm. He’s been branded with the Dark Mark.
Well . . .
I think he just wanted to get out of there, Harry,
He showed Borgin something we couldn’t see, Something that seriously scared Borgin. It was the Mark, I know it — he was showing Borgin who he was dealing with, you saw how seriously Borgin took him!
I’m not sure, Harry. . . .
Yeah, I still don’t reckon You-Know-Who would let Malfoy join. . . .

Session-754.Scene: Harry joked about the potentially hazardous amount of Phlegm in the kitchen.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ll be careful not to slip in it.

Session-755.Scene: Fleur openly critiqued Tonks' appearance while admiring her own reflection.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is Tonks going to be there?

Session-756.Scene: Harry revealed to Mr. Weasley his suspicion that Draco Malfoy had been branded with the Dark Mark.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I can walk, thanks,
We can’t, Harry, Ron and I’ve got to go to the prefects’ carriage first and then patrol the corridors for a bit.
Oh yeah, I forgot,
Mr. Weasley, can I have a quick word?
When we were in Diagon Alley How did you — ?
Er . . . yeah, all right, we weren’t in the back room.
Well, we followed Draco Malfoy. We used my Invisibility Cloak. Because I thought Malfoy was up to something, He’d given his mother the slip and I wanted to know why.

He went into Borgin and Burkes, and started bullying the bloke in there, Borgin, to help him fix something. And he said he wanted Borgin to keep something else for him. He made it sound like it was the same kind of thing that needed fixing. Like they were a pair. And . . . He’s been branded with the Dark Mark. We saw Malfoy jump about a mile when Madam Malkin tried to touch his left arm. I think he’s been branded with the Dark Mark. I think he’s replaced his father as a Death Eater.

Does anyone really know what You-Know-Who would or wouldn’t do? Mr. Weasley, I’m sorry, but isn’t it worth investigating? If Malfoy wants something fixing, and he needs to threaten Borgin to get it done, it’s probably something Dark or dangerous, isn’t it?
I think you missed something,

Session-757.Scene: Harry experienced a novel feeling of irritation as Ginny departed.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Fancy trying to find a compartment?
Right,

Session-758.Scene: Harry, Neville, and Luna sought refuge from the stares of other students in an empty train compartment.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Neville!
Luna, hi, how are you?
Quibbler still going strong, then?
Let’s find seats,
They’re staring at you because you were at the Ministry too, Our little adventure there was all over the Daily Prophet, you must’ve seen it.
No point now we’ve got rid of Umbridge, is there?

Session-759.Scene: Harry momentarily considered the alternate reality where Neville was the "Chosen One."

Dialogue.Dialogue: They’re friends of mine,
You are cool, None of them was at the Ministry. They didn’t fight with me.
Sorry — I —
I — what?

Session-760.Scene: Fact: Ron speculated about Malfoy's unusual absence from prefect duties.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wish the lunch trolley would hurry up, I’m starving, Hi, Neville.Hi, Luna.  Guess what? Malfoy’s not doing prefect duty. He’s just sitting in his compartment with the other Slytherins, we saw him when we passed.
What did he do when he saw you?
The usual, Not like him, though, is it? Well — that is but why isn’t he out there bullying first years?
Dunno,
Maybe he preferred the Inquisitorial Squad, Maybe being a prefect seems a bit tame after that.
I don’t think so,

Session-761.Scene: A third-year girl blushed intensely while delivering invitations tied with violet ribbons to Harry and Neville.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What is it?
An invitation,
New teacher, Well, I suppose we’ll have to go, won’t we?
No idea, Listen, let’s go under the Invisibility Cloak, then we might get a good look at Malfoy on the way, see what he’s up to.

Session-762.Scene: Ginny revealed she hexed Zacharias Smith, leading to an unexpected lunch invitation from Slughorn.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, he is a bit, How come you ended up in there, Ginny?
Better reason for inviting someone than because their mother’s famous, I’ll see you two later,
Later!

Session-763.Scene: Tonks repaired Harry's broken nose with a quick Episkey spell.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Draco Malfoy, Thanks for . . . well . . .
Thanks a lot!
Was that a Patronus?
How did you find me?
But what are you doing here, anyway?
Is it just you who’s stationed up here, or — ?
Dawlish, that Auror Dumbledore attacked last year?

Session-764.Scene: Snape taunted Tonks about the weakness of her new Patronus.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Alohomora!
I could climb a wall,
Well then, I suppose I’ll just have to sleep out here and wait for morning.
I couldn’t change, I didn’t have my —
Good night, Thanks for . . . everything.

Session-765.Scene: Hermione magically removed the dried blood from Harry's face using the Tergeo spell.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’ve you — blimey, what’ve you done to your face?
Why, what’s wrong with it?
You’re covered in blood! Tergeo!
Thanks, How’s my nose looking?
Normal, Why shouldn’t it? Harry, what happened? We’ve been terrified!
I’ll tell you later,
But —
Not now, Hermione,
You missed the Sorting, anyway,
Hat say anything interesting?
More of the same, really . . . advising us all to unite in the face of our enemies, you know.
“Dumbledore mentioned Voldemort at all?”
“Not yet, but he always saves his proper speech for after the feast, doesn’t he? It can’t be long now.”
Snape said Hagrid was late for the feast —”
“You’ve seen Snape? How come?”
“Bumped into him,”
So what did Professor Slughorn want?
To know what really happened at the Ministry,
Him and everyone else here, People were interrogating us about it on the train, weren’t they, Ron?
Yeah,
That’s not saying much, seeing as you’re already dead,

Session-766.Scene: Harry hoped Madam Pomfrey would have healed Dumbledore's blackened hand after seeing it during the summer.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What happened to his hand?
His hand was like that when I saw him over the summer, I thought he’d have cured it by now, though . . . or Madam Pomfrey would’ve done.
It looks as if it’s died, But there are some injuries you can’t cure . . . old curses . . . and there are poisons without antidotes. . . .
No!
But Harry, you said that Slughorn was going to be teaching Defense Against the Dark Arts!
I thought he was! Well, there’s one good thing, Snape’ll be gone by the end of the year.
What do you mean?
That job’s jinxed. No one’s lasted more than a year. . . . Quirrell actually died doing it. . . . Personally, I’m going to keep my fingers crossed for another death. . . .
Harry!
He might just go back to teaching Potions at the end of the year, That Slughorn bloke might not want to stay long-term. Moody didn’t.

Session-767.Scene: Harry confided in Ron about the circumstances surrounding his injured nose.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What really happened to your nose? I saw Malfoy miming something to do with a nose,
Yeah, well, never mind that, Listen to what he was saying before he found out I was there. . . .
Come on, Harry, he was just showing off for Parkinson. . . . What kind of mission would You-Know-Who have given him?
How d’you know Voldemort doesn’t need someone at Hogwarts? It wouldn’t be the first —

Session-768.Scene: Hagrid mentioned Dumbledore's role in finding Grawp a cave home in the mountains.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Dumbledore uses that name,
Got held up on the train, Why were you late?
Really?

Session-769.Scene: Ron confiscated a Fanged Frisbee from Hermione after she took it from a fourth-year student.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But he was obviously showing off for Parkinson, wasn’t he?
Well, I don’t know. . . . It would be like Malfoy to make himself seem more important than he is . . . but that’s a big lie to tell. . . .
Exactly,
It’s rude to point, I love being a sixth year. And we’re going to be getting free time this year. Whole periods when we can just sit up here and relax.
We’re going to need that time for studying, Ron!
Yeah, but not today, Today’s going to be a real doss, I reckon.
Hold it! Fanged Frisbees are banned, hand it over,
Excellent, I’ve always wanted one of these.

Session-770.Scene: Professor McGonagall offered to write Augusta Longbottom to defend the worth of Charms, a subject Augusta had previously failed.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It was, but you told me I had to get an ‘Outstanding’ in my O. W.L., Professor.
Yes,
Look, we’ve got a free period now . . . and a free period after break . . . and after lunch . . . excellent!

Session-771.Scene: Harry told Katie she did not need to try out for the team due to his years of watching her play.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Don’t be stupid, you don’t need to try out, I’ve watched you play for five years. . . .

Session-772.Scene: Harry's instinctive Shield Charm blasted Snape off balance and into a desk.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Your adversary has no warning about what kind of magic you’re about to perform, which gives you a split-second advantage.
Protego!
Yes,
There’s no need to call me ‘sir,’ Professor.

Session-773.Scene: Harry likened Snape's teaching methods to his own experiences facing Voldemort.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That was brilliant, Harry!
You really shouldn’t have said it, What made you?

He tried to jinx me, in case you didn’t notice! I had enough of that during those Occlumency lessons! Why doesn’t he use another guinea pig for a change? What’s Dumbledore playing at, anyway, letting him teach Defense? Did you hear him talking about the Dark Arts? He loves them! All that unfixed, indestructible stuff —
Well, I thought he sounded a bit like you.
Like me?

Well, You said it wasn’t just memorizing a bunch of spells, you said it was just you and your brains and your guts — well, wasn’t that what Snape was saying? That it really comes down to being brave and quick-thinking?

Session-774.Scene: Harry abruptly left Sloper without explanation after recognizing Dumbledore's handwriting.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m not sure yet, I’ll let you know.
He enjoys Acid Pops?
It’s the password to get past the gargoyle outside his study, Ha! Snape’s not going to be pleased. . . . I won’t be able to do his detention!

Session-775.Scene: Harry won Slughorn's Felix Felicis after using a scribbled instruction in a borrowed book.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sir?
I haven’t got a book or scales or anything — nor’s Ron — we didn’t realize we’d be able to do the N. E.W.T., you see —
It’s Veritaserum, a colorless, odorless potion that forces the drinker to tell the truth,
It’s Polyjuice Potion, sir,
It’s Amortentia!
It’s the most powerful love potion in the world!
And the steam rising in characteristic spirals,
Hermione Granger, sir.
No, I don’t think so, sir. I’m Muggle-born, you see.
Yes, sir,
Harry! Oh, Harry!
Well, what’s so impressive about that? You are the best in the year — I’d’ve told him so if he’d asked me!
It’s liquid luck, It makes you lucky!
Can I borrow your silver knife?
How are you doing that?
Add a clockwise stir —
No, no, the book says counterclockwise!
How are you doing that?
Got lucky, I suppose,

Session-776.Scene: Hermione cast a revealing spell on Harry's potions textbook, but nothing happened.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I s’pose you think I cheated?
Well,

Look, Could’ve been a catastrophe, couldn’t it? But he took a risk and it paid off. Slughorn could’ve handed me that book, but no, I get the one no one’s ever written on. Puked on, by the look of page fifty-two, but —
It’s nothing, It’s not like, you know, Riddle’s diary. It’s just an old textbook someone’s scribbled on.
I just tried a few of the tips written in the margins, honestly, Ginny, there’s nothing funny —
Ginny’s got a point, We ought to check that there’s nothing odd about it. I mean, all these funny instructions, who knows?
Hey!
Specialis Revelio!
Finished? Or d’you want to wait and see if it does a few backflips?
It seems all right, I mean, it really does seem to be . . . just a textbook.
Good. Then I’ll have it back,

Session-777.Scene: Hermione speculated that the Half-Blood Prince might have been a girl based on the handwriting.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Or herself, It might have been a girl. I think the handwriting looks more like a girl’s than a boy’s.
The Half-Blood Prince, he was called, How many girls have been Princes? It’s five to eight, I’d better go, I’ll be late for Dumbledore.
Ooooh! Good luck!
Hope it goes okay,
