Session-778.Scene: Trelawney incorrectly identified the knave of spades as someone disliking the questioner.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Acid Pops,

Session-779.Scene: Dumbledore revealed he had arranged for Harry's detention with Snape to be postponed to the following Saturday.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Good evening, sir,
Yes, thanks, sir,
Er,
Right,
Yes, sir.
You said, at the end of last term, you were going to tell me everything, Sir,
But you think you’re right?
Sir, does what you’re going to tell me have anything to do with the prophecy? Will it help me . . . survive?
Where are we going, sir?
Who was Bob Ogden?
Shall — shall I, sir?
Sir — how did you injure your hand?

Session-780.Scene: Morfin assaulted Ogden, causing him to fall while clutching his injured nose.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He’s speaking Parseltongue?

Session-781.Scene: Merope stopped giving Tom Riddle the love potion, hoping he would stay with her without magical compulsion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What happened to the girl in the cottage?
Marvolo?
That old man was — ?
Sir, so Merope was . . . Sir, does that mean she was . . . Voldemort’s mother?
The Muggle Morfin attacked? The man on the horse?
And they ended up married?
The Imperius Curse? Or a love potion?
And Merope? She . . . she died, didn’t she? Wasn’t Voldemort brought up in an orphanage?
But she did have his baby.
What went wrong? Why did the love potion stop working?
Sir, Sir . . . is it important to know all this about Voldemort’s past?
And it . . . it’s got something to do with the prophecy?
Right, Sir,
Sir, Good night. Sir,

Session-782.Scene: Dumbledore revealed to Harry that he acquired the ring shortly before retrieving him from his relatives.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sir,
You were wearing it when we visited Professor Slughorn that night.
Sir,
But how come — ? Have you always had it?
That would be around the time you injured your hand, then, sir?
Sir,
Sir,

Session-783.Scene: Hermione declared Harry more 'fanciable' than ever before.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We’ve got to go and explain,
We’ve got Quidditch tryouts this morning! And we’re supposed to be practicing that Aguamenti Charm from Flitwick! Anyway, explain what? How are we going to tell him we hated his stupid subject?
We didn’t hate it!

Speak for yourself, I haven’t forgotten the skrewts, And I’m telling you now, we’ve had a narrow escape. You didn’t hear him going on about his gormless brother — we’d have been teaching Grawp how to tie his shoelaces if we’d stayed.
I hate not talking to Hagrid,
We’ll go down after Quidditch, But trials might take all morning, the number of people who have applied. I dunno why the team’s this popular all of a sudden.

Oh, come on, Harry, It’s not Quidditch that’s popular, it’s you! You’ve never been more interesting, and frankly, you’ve never been more fanciable. Everyone knows you’ve been telling the truth now, don’t they? The whole Wizarding world has had to admit that you were right about Voldemort being back and that you really have fought him twice in the last two years and escaped both times. And now they’re calling you ‘the Chosen One’ — well, come on, can’t you see why people are fascinated by you? And you’ve been through all that persecution from the Ministry when they were trying to make out you were unstable and a liar. You can still see the marks on the back of your hand where that evil woman made you write with your own blood, but you stuck to your story anyway. . . .
You can still see where those brains got hold of me in the Ministry, look,
And it doesn’t hurt that you’ve grown about a foot over the summer either,
I’m tall,

Session-784.Scene: Harry magically swapped the covers of his old and new potion-making books.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Ha!
Oh good, Now you can give that graffitied copy back.
Are you mad? I’m keeping it! Look, I’ve thought it out — Diffindo! I’ll give Slughorn back the new one, he can’t complain, it cost nine Galleons.

Session-785.Scene: McLaggen consumed a pound of doxy eggs for a wager, resulting in his hospitalization during Quidditch tryouts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You didn’t try out last year, did you?
Right, Well . . . if you wait over there . . . If there’s anyone else here who’s not from Gryffindor, leave now, please!

Session-786.Scene: McLaggen menacingly accused Ron's sister of intentionally making an easy save for him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That’s my final decision and if you don’t get out of the way for the Keepers I’ll hex you,
Rubbish, That was the one he nearly missed.
No, You’ve had your go. You saved four. Ron saved five. Ron’s Keeper, he won it fair and square. Get out of my way. Well done,
You did brilliantly, Ron!

Session-787.Scene: Harry addressed Buckbeak while stroking the hippogriff's feathery head.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh dear, He’s still a bit scary, isn’t he?
Come off it, you’ve ridden him, haven’t you?
How are you? Missing him? But you’re okay here with Hagrid, aren’t you?

Session-788.Scene: Harry sarcastically mirrored Hagrid's formal address after Hagrid had addressed Harry as 'Potter'.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh dear!
Don’t worry about it, Hagrid! Open up, we want to talk to you! If you don’t open the door, we’ll blast it open!
Harry!
Yeah, I can!
I’m sorry, sir,
Since when have you called me ‘Potter’?
No, We wanted to see you.
We’ve missed you!
Hagrid, we really wanted to carry on with Care of Magical Creatures, you know. We did! But none of us could fit it into our schedules!

Session-789.Scene: Hagrid revealed his giant spider, Aragog, was dying.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What are they, Hagrid?
And they grow into . . . ?
Hagrid! What is it?
Is there — is there anything we can do?
Yeah, I think we saw a bit of that side of them,
We couldn’t have done, We smashed the entire stock of Ministry Time-Turners when we were there last summer. It was in the Daily Prophet.
I’m starving, And I’ve got that detention with Snape tonight, I haven’t got much time for dinner. . . .

Session-790.Scene: Slughorn invited Harry and Hermione to a supper party in his rooms, pointedly ignoring Ron.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I can’t come, Professor, I’ve got a detention with Professor Snape.
He’s got no chance of persuading Snape, This detention’s already been postponed once; Snape did it for Dumbledore, but he won’t do it for anyone else.
Oh, I wish you could come, I don’t want to go on my own!
I doubt you’ll be alone, Ginny’ll probably be invited,

Session-791.Scene: Crabbe had a shrunken head confiscated by Filch's Secrecy Sensors upon arrival.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Anything new?

Right, Oh, look, your dad’s in here, Ron — he’s all right! It just says he’s been to visit the Malfoys’ house. ‘This second search of the Death Eater’s residence does not seem to have yielded any results. Arthur Weasley of the Office for the Detection and Confiscation of Counterfeit Defensive Spells and Protective Objects said that his team had been acting upon a confidential tip-off. /
Yeah, mine! I told him at King’s Cross about Malfoy and that thing he was trying to get Borgin to fix! Well, if it’s not at their house, he must have brought whatever it is to Hogwarts with him —
But how can he have done, Harry? We were all searched when we arrived, weren’t we?
What? I wasn’t!
Right, Any Dark object would have been found, I know for a fact Crabbe had a shrunken head confiscated. So you see, Malfoy can’t have brought in anything dangerous!
Someone’s sent it to him by owl, then, His mother or someone.
All the owls are being checked too, Filch told us so when he was jabbing those Secrecy Sensors everywhere he could reach.
Can you think of any way Malfoy — ?
Oh, drop it, Harry,
Listen, it’s not my fault Slughorn invited Hermione and me to his stupid party, neither of us wanted to go, you know!
Well, as I’m not invited to any parties, I think I’ll go to bed.

Session-792.Scene: Snape scheduled Harry’s detention involving rotten flobberworms and a lack of protective gloves.

Dialogue.Dialogue: From Professor Slughorn?
Right, Thanks a lot, Demelza.

Session-793.Scene: Harry accidentally jinxed Ron, causing him to dangle upside down in the air.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Aaaaaaaargh!
Sorry! Sorry,
Tomorrow, I’d rather you set the alarm clock.

Session-794.Scene: Ron accidentally hit Ernie Macmillan with a piece of sausage while arguing with Hermione.

Dialogue.Dialogue: . . . and then there was another flash of light and I landed on the bed again!
Was this spell, by any chance, another one from that potion book of yours?
Always jump to the worst conclusion, don’t you?
Was it?
Well . . . yeah, it was, but so what?
So you just decided to try out an unknown, handwritten incantation and see what would happen?
Why does it matter if it’s handwritten?
Because it’s probably not Ministry of Magic–approved, And also, because I’m starting to think this Prince character was a bit dodgy.
It was a laugh! Just a laugh, Hermione, that’s all!
Dangling people upside down by the ankle? Who puts their time and energy into making up spells like that?
Fred and George, it’s their kind of thing. And, er —
My dad,
My dad used this spell, I — Lupin told me.

Maybe your dad did use it, Harry, but he’s not the only one. We’ve seen a whole bunch of people use it, in case you’ve forgotten. Dangling people in the air. Making them float along, asleep, helpless.
That was different, They were abusing it. Harry and his dad were just having a laugh. You don’t like the Prince, Hermione,
It’s got nothing to do with that!
I don’t see where you get that from, If he’d been a budding Death Eater he wouldn’t have been boasting about being ‘half-blood,’ would he?

The Death Eaters can’t all be pure-blood, there aren’t enough pure-blood wizards left, I expect most of them are half-bloods pretending to be pure. It’s only Muggle-borns they hate, they’d be quite happy to let you and Ron join up.
There is no way they’d let me be a Death Eater! My whole family are blood traitors! That’s as bad as Muggle-borns to Death Eaters!
And they’d love to have me, We’d be best pals if they didn’t keep trying to do me in.

Session-795.Scene: Ginny mentioned she had plans with Dean when Harry invited her to Hogsmeade.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Thanks, Ginny . . . It’s Dumbledore’s next lesson! Monday evening! Want to join us in Hogsmeade, Ginny?

Session-796.Scene: Harry strategically scheduled Quidditch practices to avoid Professor Slughorn's suppers.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh no,
Yes,
Well, I’ve had Quidditch practice, Professor,
I can’t, Professor, I’ve got — er — an appointment with Professor Dumbledore that evening.
I can’t believe you’ve wriggled out of another one, They’re not that bad, you know. . . . They’re even quite fun sometimes. . . . Oh, look — they’ve got deluxe sugar quills — those would last hours!
Let’s go to the Three Broomsticks, It’ll be warm.

Session-797.Scene: Harry angrily pinned Mundungus against the pub wall by the throat for stealing items.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mundungus!
Are you selling this stuff?
Hang on,
Harry
You took that from Sirius’s house, That had the Black family crest on it.
What?
Give it to me!
Harry, you mustn’t!
COME BACK, YOU THIEVING — !
He’s nicked Sirius’s stuff! Nicked it!
He was nicking Sirius’s stuff!
I know, Harry, but please don’t shout, people are staring, Go and sit down, I’ll get you a drink.
Can’t the Order control Mundungus?
Shh! Harry, I’d be annoyed too, I know it’s your things he’s stealing —
Yeah, it’s my stuff! No wonder he wasn’t pleased to see me! Well, I’m going to tell Dumbledore what’s going on, he’s the only one who scares Mundungus.
Good idea, Ron, what are you staring at?
Nothing,
I expect ‘nothing’s’ in the back getting more firewhisky, Shall we call it a day and go back to school, then?

Session-798.Scene: Katie inexplicably levitated, then emitted piercing screams, expressing anguish.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Stay there! I’m going for help!

Session-799.Scene: Harry believed Malfoy intended to buy the cursed necklace during a Borgin and Burkes visit four years prior.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid!
Hagrid, someone’s hurt back there, or cursed, or something —
Someone’s been cursed!
No, it’s not them, it’s Katie Bell — this way . . .
It’s Leanne, isn’t it? Did it just happen all of a sudden, or — ?
Don’t touch it! I’ve seen that before, It was on display in Borgin and Burkes ages ago. The label said it was cursed. Katie must have touched it. How did Katie get hold of this?
She didn’t say who’d given it to her, Leanne?
We’d better get up to school, We’ll be able to find out how she is. Come on. . . .

We’ll need to show this to Madam Pomfrey, Malfoy knows about this necklace. It was in a case at Borgin and Burkes four years ago, I saw him having a good look at it while I was hiding from him and his dad. This is what he was buying that day when we followed him! He remembered it and he went back for it!
And also, Loads of people go to Borgin and Burkes . . . and didn’t that girl say Katie got it in the girls’ bathroom?
She said she came back from the bathroom with it, she didn’t necessarily get it in the bathroom itself —
McGonagall!
It’s the thing she touched,
She rose up in the air, and then began to scream, and collapsed. Professor, can I see Professor Dumbledore, please?
Away?
I think Draco Malfoy gave Katie that necklace, Professor.
No, but . . .

No, Professor, he just wanted Borgin to tell him how to mend something, he didn’t have it with him. But that’s not the point, the thing is that he bought something at the same time, and I think it was that necklace —
No, Professor, he told Borgin to keep it in the shop for him —
But Harry, Borgin asked him if he wanted to take it with him, and Malfoy said no —
Because he didn’t want to touch it, obviously!
Well, he would look a bit of a prat carrying a necklace,

And also, it would be all wrapped up, so he wouldn’t have to touch it, and quite easy to hide inside a cloak, so nobody would see it! I think whatever he reserved at Borgin and Burkes was noisy or bulky, something he knew would draw attention to him if he carried it down the street — and in any case, I asked Borgin about the necklace, don’t you remember? When I went in to try and find out what Malfoy had asked him to keep, I saw it there. And Borgin just told me the price, he didn’t say it was already sold or anything —
And also,
— that’s what I said —
But —
How do you know, Professor?

Session-800.Scene: Harry suspected Malfoy orchestrated the necklace delivery but used an accomplice since Malfoy was not in Hogsmeade.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So who do you reckon Katie was supposed to give the necklace to?
Goodness only knows, But whoever it was has had a narrow escape. No one could have opened that package without touching the necklace.

It could’ve been meant for loads of people, Dumbledore — the Death Eaters would love to get rid of him, he must be one of their top targets. Or Slughorn — Dumbledore reckons Voldemort really wanted him and they can’t be pleased that he’s sided with Dumbledore. Or —
Or you,

Couldn’t have been, or Katie would’ve just turned around in the lane and given it to me, wouldn’t she? I was behind her all the way out of the Three Broomsticks. It would have made much more sense to deliver the parcel outside Hogwarts, what with Filch searching everyone who goes in and out. I wonder why Malfoy told her to take it into the castle?
Harry, Malfoy wasn’t in Hogsmeade!
He must have used an accomplice, then, Crabbe or Goyle — or, come to think of it, another Death Eater, he’ll have loads better cronies than Crabbe and Goyle now he’s joined up —
There’s no point arguing with him.
Dilligrout,
It wasn’t a very slick attack, really, when you stop and think about it, The curse didn’t even make it into the castle. Not what you’d call foolproof.
You’re right, It wasn’t very well thought-out at all.
But since when has Malfoy been one of the world’s great thinkers?

Session-801.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that Merope Riddle sold Slytherin's locket for only ten Galleons to Caractacus Burke shortly before Christmas, many years prior.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why him? Why not Madam Pomfrey?
Where were you this weekend, sir?
You will?
Sir, I met Mundungus in Hogsmeade.
Professor, did Professor McGonagall tell you what I told her after Katie got hurt? About Draco Malfoy?
And do you — ?
How do you know she was in London, sir?
He only gave her ten Galleons?
But she could do magic! She could have got food and everything for herself by magic, couldn’t she?
She wouldn’t even stay alive for her son?
No, but she had a choice, didn’t she, not like my mother —
Where are we going?

Session-802.Scene: Younger Dumbledore's flamboyant plum velvet suit drew curious glances from passersby.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nice suit, sir,

Session-803.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that the mouth organ had never been anything more than an ordinary musical instrument.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He believed it much quicker than I did — I mean, when you told him he was a wizard, I didn’t believe Hagrid at first, when he told me.
Did you know — then?
And he was a Parselmouth,
The ring’s gone, But I thought you might have the mouth organ or something.

Session-804.Scene: Hermione had planned to invite Ron to Slughorn's Christmas party before Ron ridiculed the Slug Club.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wow, scary thought, the boy You-Know-Who, But I still don’t get why Dumbledore’s showing you all this. I mean, it’s really interesting and everything, but what’s the point?
Dunno, But he says it’s all important and it’ll help me survive.
I think it’s fascinating, It makes absolute sense to know as much about Voldemort as possible. How else will you find out his weaknesses?
So how was Slughorn’s latest party?

Oh, it was quite fun, really, I mean, he drones on about famous ex-pupils a bit, and he absolutely fawns on McLaggen because he’s so well-connected, but he gave us some really nice food and he introduced us to Gwenog Jones.
Gwenog Jones? The Gwenog Jones? Captain of the Holyhead Harpies?
That’s right, Personally, I thought she was a bit full of herself, but —
Okay, Professor, we’re starting now! should’ve used Muffliato, Harry.
No, we shouldn’t! Well, come on . . . we’d better get going. . . .
You know, I don’t think I’ll be having any of these in my garden when I’ve got my own place,
Pass me a bowl,

Anyway, Slughorn’s going to have a Christmas party, Harry, and there’s no way you’ll be able to wriggle out of this one because he actually asked me to check your free evenings, so he could be sure to have it on a night you can come.
And this is another party just for Slughorn’s favorites, is it?
Just for the Slug Club, yes, Look, I didn’t make up the name ‘Slug Club’ —
‘Slug Club,’ It’s pathetic. Well, I hope you enjoy your party. Why don’t you try hooking up with McLaggen, then Slughorn can make you King and Queen Slug —
We’re allowed to bring guests, and I was going to ask you to come, but if you think it’s that stupid then I won’t bother!
You were going to ask me?
Yes, But obviously if you’d rather I hooked up with McLaggen . . .
No, I wouldn’t,
Reparo,
Hand that over, Harry, It says we’re supposed to puncture them with something sharp. . . .
Gotcha!

Session-805.Scene: Dean excitedly accepted Harry's offer to play Chaser, eager to share the news with Ginny.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Are you still interested in playing Chaser?
Well then, you’re in, There’s a practice tonight, seven o’clock.
It was an accident, I’m sorry, Demelza, really sorry!
You —
In the air, everyone, let’s go. . . . Good work, everyone, I think we’ll flatten Slytherin,
I played like a sack of dragon dung,
No, you didn’t, You’re the best Keeper I tried out, Ron. Your only problem is nerves.

Session-806.Scene: Ginny angrily revealed that Harry had kissed Cho Chang.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oi!
I don’t want to find my own sister snogging people in public!
Yeah, it is!
He doesn’t mean anything, Ginny —
Shut your mouth!
You don’t know what you’re talking about! Just because I don’t do it in public — !
You —
Don’t be stupid —
C’mon,

Session-807.Scene: Harry fantasized about kissing Ginny in a deserted corridor.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oi, out of the way! D’you think Hermione did snog Krum?
What? Oh . . . er . . .
Dilligrout,

Session-808.Scene: Harry physically grabbed Ron by the robes after Ron offered to resign.

Dialogue.Dialogue: ENOUGH! Peakes, go and pack up the Bludgers. Demelza, pull yourself together, you played really well today. Ron . . . you’re my best mate, but carry on treating the rest of them like this and I’m going to kick you off the team. You’re not pathetic and you’re not resigning! You can save anything when you’re on form, it’s a mental problem you’ve got!
You calling me mental?
Yes,
I know you haven’t got any time to find another Keeper, so I’ll play tomorrow, but if we lose, and we will, I’m taking myself off the team.

Session-809.Scene: Harry secretly slipped something into Ron's pumpkin juice, causing Hermione to accuse him of adding an unknown substance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Tea? Coffee? Pumpkin juice?
Anything,
How are you both feeling?
Fine, There you go, Ron. Drink up.
Don’t drink that, Ron!
What?
You just put something in that drink.
What?
You heard me. You’ve got the bottle in your hand right now!
I don’t know what you’re talking about,
Ron, I warn you, don’t drink it! Stop bossing me around, Hermione.
Hark who’s talking, Confunded anyone lately? Nearly time,

Session-810.Scene: Harry slyly avoided confirming whether he had tampered with Ron's pumpkin juice.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Right,
Yeah,
What? He’s ill? What’s wrong with him?
Fishy, isn’t it? Malfoy not playing?
Lucky, I call it, And Vaisey off too, he’s their best goal scorer, I didn’t fancy — hey!
What?
I . . . you . . . My drink . . . my pumpkin juice . . . you didn’t . . . ?
We’ll be starting in about five minutes, you’d better get your boots on.

Session-811.Scene: Ginny crashed into the commentator's podium, feigning an accidental brake failure.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That’s right,
Hit a Bludger at him!
Oi, Harper! How much did Malfoy pay you to come on instead of him? YES! Ginny, where’re you going?

Session-812.Scene: Harry revealed he had faked spiking Ron's juice with Felix Felicis to boost his confidence.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I want a word with you, Harry. You shouldn’t have done it. You heard Slughorn, it’s illegal.
What are you going to do, turn us in?
What are you two talking about?
You know perfectly well what we’re talking about! You spiked Ron’s juice with lucky potion at breakfast! Felix Felicis!
No, I didn’t,
Yes you did, Harry, and that’s why everything went right, there were Slytherin players missing and Ron saved everything!
I didn’t put it in! You saved everything because you felt lucky. You did it all yourself.

There really wasn’t anything in my pumpkin juice? But the weather’s good . . . and Vaisey couldn’t play. . . . I honestly haven’t been given lucky potion? You added Felix Felicis to Ron’s juice this morning, that’s why he saved everything! See! I can save goals without help, Hermione!
I never said you couldn’t — Ron, you thought you’d been given it too!
Er, shall . . . shall we go up to the party, then?
You go! I’m sick of Ron at the moment, I don’t know what I’m supposed to have done. . . .

Session-813.Scene: Hermione angrily unleashed a flock of conjured birds upon Ron, who was caught in an embrace with Lavender.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione?
Right, I was just practicing.
Yeah . . . they’re — er — really good. . . .
Ron seems to be enjoying the celebrations.
Er . . . does he?
Don’t pretend you didn’t see him, He wasn’t exactly hiding it, was — ?
Oh,
Hi, Harry! Wondered where you’d got to!
You shouldn’t leave Lavender waiting outside, She’ll wonder where you’ve gone. Oppugno!
Gerremoffme!

Session-814.Scene: Hermione furiously punctured her parchment with her quill while denying any feelings about someone kissing someone.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He’s at perfect liberty to kiss whomever he likes, I really couldn’t care less. And incidentally, you need to be careful.
For the last time, I am not giving back this book, I’ve learned more from the Half-Blood Prince than Snape or Slughorn have taught me in —

I’m not talking about your stupid so-called Prince, I’m talking about earlier. I went into the girls’ bathroom just before I came in here and there were about a dozen girls in there, including that Romilda Vane, trying to decide how to slip you a love potion. They’re all hoping they’re going to get you to take them to Slughorn’s party, and they all seem to have bought Fred and George’s love potions
Why didn’t you confiscate them then?

They didn’t have the potions with them in the bathroom, They were just discussing tactics. As I doubt whether even the Half-Blood Prince could dream up an antidote for a dozen different love potions at once, I’d just invite someone to go with you, that’ll stop all the others thinking they’ve still got a chance. It’s tomorrow night, they’re getting desperate.
There isn’t anyone I want to invite,
Well, just be careful what you drink, because Romilda Vane looked like she meant business,
Hang on a moment, I thought Filch had banned anything bought at Weasleys’ Wizard Wheezes?
And when has anyone ever paid attention to what Filch has banned?
But I thought all the owls were being searched. So how come these girls are able to bring love potions into school?
Fred and George send them disguised as perfumes and cough potions. It’s part of their Owl Order Service.
You know a lot about it.
It was all on the back of the bottles they showed Ginny and me in the summer, I don’t go around putting potions in people’s drinks . . . or pretending to, either, which is just as bad. . . .

Yeah, well, never mind that, The point is, Filch is being fooled, isn’t he? These girls are getting stuff into the school disguised as something else! So why couldn’t Malfoy have brought the necklace into the school — ?
Oh, Harry . . . not that again . . .
Come on, why not?

Look, Secrecy Sensors detect jinxes, curses, and concealment charms, don’t they? They’re used to find Dark Magic and Dark objects. They’d have picked up a powerful curse, like the one on that necklace, within seconds. But something that’s just been put in the wrong bottle wouldn’t register — and anyway, love potions aren’t Dark or dangerous —
Easy for you to say,
— so it would be down to Filch to realize it wasn’t a cough potion, and he’s not a very good wizard, I doubt he can tell one potion from — The library is now closed,
It isn’t the library’s, it’s mine!
Despoiled! Desecrated! Befouled!
It’s just a book that’s been written on!
She’ll ban you from the library if you’re not careful. Why did you have to bring that stupid book?
It’s not my fault she’s barking mad, Hermione. Or d’you think she overheard you being rude about Filch? I’ve always thought there might be something going on between them. . . .
Oh, ha ha . . .

Session-815.Scene: Romilda gifted Harry a box of firewhiskey-filled Chocolate Cauldrons that her gran had sent.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Baubles,
what-did-I-tell-you?
No thanks, I don’t like it much.
Oh — right — thanks a lot, Er — I’m just going over here with . . .
Told you, Sooner you ask someone, sooner they’ll all leave you alone and you can — Well, good night, Harry,

Session-816.Scene: Harry impulsively invited Luna to Slughorn's party as friends, marking her first invitation of its kind.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hi, Luna Hermione, you left your stuff.
Oh yes, Thank you, Harry. Well, I’d better get going. . . .
Yeah, they’ve had a row
I s’pose, So have you had a good term?
How would you like to come to Slughorn’s party with me tonight?
Yeah, We’re supposed to bring guests, so I thought you might like . . . I mean . . . I mean, just as friends, you know. But if you don’t want to . . .
No, that was a mistake. I’ll get Hermione to put it right for me. So, I’ll meet you in the entrance hall at eight o’clock then.

Session-817.Scene: Hermione feigned a relationship with Cormac McLaggen to impress Parvati.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nice to keep these things private,
You could’ve taken anyone! Anyone! And you chose Loony Lovegood?
You could say sorry, What did you have to imitate her for?
She laughed at my mustache!
So did I, it was the stupidest thing I’ve ever seen.
Hi, How’re you? You’re staying at Hogwarts, then? I heard your parents wanted you to leave.
Hi, Are you going to Slughorn’s party tonight?
Yes, I’m meeting Cormac at eight, and we’re — — we’re going up to the party together.
Yeah, became Gryffindor Keeper.
Oh — yes — didn’t you know?
I like really good Quidditch players, Well, see you . . . Got to go and get ready for the party. . . .

Session-818.Scene: Luna asserted that her father had written an unpublished article claiming Rufus Scrimgeour was a vampire.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hi! Shall we get going then?
Slughorn’s office, Did you hear, there’s supposed to be a vampire coming?
I — what? You mean the Minister of Magic?
Er, were you?
I’m definitely not interested, and I’ve just seen a friend of mine, sorry.

Session-819.Scene: Hermione admitted she debated taking Zacharias Smith to the party.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione! Hermione!
Hi, There you are, thank goodness! Hi, Luna!
What’s happened to you? Serves you right for coming with him,
I thought he’d annoy Ron most, I debated for a while about Zacharias Smith, but I thought, on the whole —
You considered Smith?
Yes, I did, and I’m starting to wish I’d chosen him, McLaggen makes Grawp look a gentleman. Let’s go this way, we’ll be able to see him coming, he’s so tall. . . .
Let’s get something straight. Are you planning to tell Ron that you interfered at Keeper tryouts?
Do you really think I’d stoop that low?
Hermione, if you can ask out McLaggen —
There’s a difference, I’ve got no plans to tell Ron anything about what might, or might not, have happened at Keeper tryouts.
Good, Because he’ll just fall apart again, and we’ll lose the next match —

Quidditch! Is that all boys care about? Cormac hasn’t asked me one single question about myself, no, I’ve just been treated to ‘A Hundred Great Saves Made by Cormac McLaggen’ nonstop ever since — oh no, here he comes!
No, sorry,
Hello,

Session-820.Scene: Luna Lovegood unexpectedly warned Harry against becoming an Auror due to a conspiracy theory.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Defense Against the Dark Arts, Charms, Transfiguration, Herbology . . .
Yeah, well, that’s what I’d like to do,

Session-821.Scene: Malfoy confessed to gate-crashing the party after Filch caught him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ll be back in a bit, Luna — er — bathroom.

Session-822.Scene: Ron recounted how Fred and George's attempt to make him take an Unbreakable Vow as a child resulted in their father's rare display of intense anger.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So Snape was offering to help him? He was definitely offering to help him?
If you ask that once more,
I’m only checking!
Yes, Snape was offering to help him! He said he’d promised Malfoy’s mother to protect him, that he’d made an Unbreakable Oath or something —
An Unbreakable Vow? Nah, he can’t have. . . . Are you sure?
Yes, I’m sure, Why, what does it mean?
Well, you can’t break an Unbreakable Vow. . . .
I’d worked that much out for myself, funnily enough. What happens if you break it, then?

You die, Fred and George tried to get me to make one when I was about five. I nearly did too, I was holding hands with Fred and everything when Dad found us. He went mental, Only time I’ve ever seen Dad as angry as Mum. Fred reckons his left buttock has never been the same since.
Yeah, well, passing over Fred’s left buttock —
I’ll be seventeen in two and a bit months’ time, and then I’ll be able to do it by magic!
You made me do that! You wait, when I’m seventeen —
“Mind your own business.
What d’you mean?
What?

Session-823.Scene: Fred turned Ron's knife into a paper airplane with magic.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What are you two up to? Can’t you help us with these sprouts? You could just use your wand and then we’ll be free too!
Gits, Would’ve only taken them ten seconds and then we could’ve gone too.
I couldn’t, I promised Dumbledore I wouldn’t wander off while I’m staying here.
Oh yeah, Are you going to tell Dumbledore what you heard Snape and Malfoy saying to each other?
Yep, I’m going to tell anyone who can put a stop to it, and Dumbledore’s top of the list. I might have another word with your dad too.
Pity you didn’t hear what Malfoy’s actually doing, though.
I couldn’t have done, could I? That was the whole point, he was refusing to tell Snape.
’Course, you know what they’ll all say? Dad and Dumbledore and all of them? They’ll say Snape isn’t really trying to help Malfoy, he was just trying to find out what Malfoy’s up to.
They didn’t hear him, No one’s that good an actor, not even Snape.
Yeah . . . I’m just saying, though,
You think I’m right, though?”
Yeah, I do! Seriously, I do! But they’re all convinced Snape’s in the Order, aren’t they?
Obviously, Harry, he was pretending to offer help so he could trick Malfoy into telling him what he’s doing. . . .

Session-824.Scene: Lupin revealed that Fenrir Greyback had been the werewolf who bit him as a child.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What?
What?
How come they like Voldemort?
Who’s Greyback?
What? When — when you were a kid, you mean?
But you are normal!
Have you ever heard of someone called the Half-Blood Prince?
Prince, Prince,
It’s nothing to do with me! He wrote spells all over it, spells he invented. One of them was Levicorpus —
My dad used it, I saw him in the Pensieve, he used it on Snape.
But it sounds like it was invented while you were at school, And it wasn’t Sirius? Or you?
Prince, I just thought — well, he’s helped me out a lot in Potions classes, the Prince has.
I dunno, I’ve never checked.

Session-825.Scene: Ron received a 'My Sweetheart' necklace from Lavender, much to his revulsion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: She’s got to be joking. . . .
What?
It’s from Lavender, She can’t honestly think I’d wear . . .
Nice, Classy. You should definitely wear it in front of Fred and George.
If you tell them,
Stutter at me? Come on, would I?
How could she think I’d like something like that, though?
My Sweetheart Have you ever let it slip that you’d like to go out in public with the words ‘My Sweetheart’ round your neck?
Well . . . we don’t really talk much, It’s mainly . . .
Snogging
Well, yeah, Is Hermione really going out with McLaggen?
I dunno. They were at Slughorn’s party together, but I don’t think it went that well. D’you reckon this is safe to open?
Can’t be anything dangerous, all our mail’s still being searched at the Ministry,
I didn’t think of giving Kreacher anything. Do people usually give their house-elves Christmas presents?
Hermione would. But let’s wait and see what it is before you start feeling guilty. Nice, Very thoughtful.
I’d rather have them than that necklace,

Session-826.Scene: Ron accidentally knocked over the gravy boat in his eagerness to help Fleur.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes, isn’t it? Gravy, Fleur?
Tonks’s Patronus has changed its form. Snape said so anyway. I didn’t know that could happen. Why would your Patronus change?
It looked big, and it had four legs, Hey . . . it couldn’t be — ?

Session-827.Scene: Percy awkwardly greeted his mother with a stiff "Merry Christmas".

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, all right,

Session-828.Scene: Harry revealed the scars Dolores Umbridge inflicted on him to Scrimgeour, reminding him of the Ministry's past disbelief.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No,
Yeah, we’ve discussed it.
Sorry, but that’s between us,
I don’t really know what you mean, Minister.
What d’you mean? ‘Stand alongside the Ministry’ . . . What does that mean?
So basically, you’d like to give the impression that I’m working for the Ministry?
But if I keep running in and out of the Ministry, won’t that seem as though I approve of what the Ministry’s up to?
No, I don’t think that’ll work, You see, I don’t like some of the things the Ministry’s doing. Locking up Stan Shunpike, for instance.
Dumbledore’s a lot older than sixteen, and he doesn’t think Stan should be in Azkaban either, You’re making Stan a scapegoat, just like you want to make me a mascot.
I don’t want to be used
Yeah, and others might say it’s your duty to check that people really are Death Eaters before you chuck them in prison, You’re doing what Barty Crouch did. You never get it right, you people, do you?
I thought you said it didn’t matter either way? Not to you anyway.

No, it was honest, One of the only honest things you’ve said to me. You don’t care whether I live or die, but you do care that I help you convince everyone you’re winning the war against Voldemort. I haven’t forgotten, Minister. . . . I don’t remember you rushing to my defense when I was trying to tell everyone Voldemort was back. The Ministry wasn’t so keen to be pals last year.
No,
No, I wouldn’t

You can try, But you seem cleverer than Fudge, so I’d have thought you’d have learned from his mistakes. He tried interfering at Hogwarts.You might have noticed he’s not Minister anymore, but Dumbledore’s still headmaster. I’d leave Dumbledore alone, if I were you.
Yeah, I am, Glad we straightened that out.

Session-829.Scene: Percy angered Mrs. Weasley when he stormed out after a parsnip incident on Christmas.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, don’t worry about us, or about Percy. He’s such a prat, it’s not really a loss, is it?
I always do, Mrs. Weasley, I like a quiet life, you know me.
“Hogwarts!”

Session-830.Scene: Hermione reminded Harry about Malfoy's threat to Borgin using Fenrir Greyback in Knockturn Alley.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, Professor.
Baubles,
What d’you mean, ‘no’?
But we’ve been away, how’re we supposed to — ?
Harry! Ginny! Did you have a good Christmas?
Yeah, pretty eventful, Rufus Scrim —
I’ve got something for you, Harry, Oh, hang on — password. Abstinence.
What’s up with her?
Overindulged over Christmas, apparently, She and her friend Violet drank their way through all the wine in that picture of drunk monks down by the Charms corridor. Anyway . . .
Great, I’ve got loads to tell him — and you. Let’s sit down —
There’s a table over here. . . . Coming, Ginny?
So how was your Christmas?
Oh, fine, Nothing special. How was it at Won-Won’s?
I’ll tell you in a minute, Look, Hermione, can’t you — ?
No, I can’t, So don’t even ask.
I thought maybe, you know, over Christmas —
It was the Fat Lady who drank a vat of five-hundred-year-old wine, Harry, not me. So what was this important news you wanted to tell me? Don’t you think — ?
— he was pretending to offer help so that he could trick Malfoy into telling him what he’s doing?
Yeah,
Ron’s dad and Lupin think so, But this definitely proves Malfoy’s planning something, you can’t deny that.
No, I can’t,
And he’s acting on Voldemort’s orders, just like I said!
Hmm . . . did either of them actually mention Voldemort’s name?
I’m not sure . . . Snape definitely said ‘your master,’ and who else would that be?
I don’t know, Maybe his father? How’s Lupin?
Not great, Have you heard of this Fenrir Greyback?
Harry! And so have you, Harry!
When, History of Magic? You know full well I never listened . . .

No, no, not History of Magic — Malfoy threatened Borgin with him! Back in Knockturn Alley, don’t you remember? He told Borgin that Greyback was an old family friend and that he’d be checking up on Borgin’s progress!
I forgot! But this proves Malfoy’s a Death Eater, how else could he be in contact with Greyback and telling him what to do?
It is pretty suspicious, Unless . . .
Oh, come on, you can’t get round this one!
Well . . . there is the possibility it was an empty threat.
You’re unbelievable, you are, We’ll see who’s right. . . . You’ll be eating your words, Hermione, just like the Ministry. Oh yeah, I had a row with Rufus Scrimgeour as well. . . .

Session-831.Scene: Lavender surprised Ron by covering his eyes and calling him "Won-Won".

Dialogue.Dialogue: So — Apparition, Should be a laugh, eh?
I dunno, Maybe it’s better when you do it yourself, I didn’t enjoy it much when Dumbledore took me along for the ride. Charlie failed, though, didn’t he?
Yeah, but Charlie’s bigger than me so Fred and George didn’t go on about it much . . . not to his face anyway . . .
When can we take the actual test?
Soon as we’re seventeen. That’s only March for me!
Yeah, but you wouldn’t be able to Apparate in here, not in the castle . . .
Not the point, is it? Everyone would know I could Apparate if I wanted.
Dum — er — someone took him. Side-Along-Apparition, you know.

Session-832.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that Scrimgeour had assigned Dawlish to follow him, leading to Dumbledore jinxing Dawlish twice.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes. He’s not very happy with me.
He wanted me to tell the Wizarding community that the Ministry’s doing a wonderful job.
After everything Fudge did last year? After Umbridge?
So that’s why you argued! It was in the Daily Prophet.
He accused me of being ‘Dumbledore’s man through and through. ’
I told him I was.
Scrimgeour wanted to know where you go when you’re not at Hogwarts,
So they still don’t know where you go?
There is, actually, sir, It’s about Malfoy and Snape.
Yes, I overheard them during Professor Slughorn’s party .. . well, I followed them, actually. . . .
Not of great importance? Professor, did you understand — ?
I don’t think what you’ve got to say is unimportant, sir,

Session-833.Scene: Morfin lamented losing Marvolo's ring to his captors as he was taken to Azkaban.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is that all? Why did it go dark, what happened?
So Voldemort stole Morfin’s wand and used it?
And Morfin never realized he hadn’t done it?
But he had this real memory in him all the time!
But how come the Ministry didn’t realize that Voldemort had done all that to Morfin? He was underage at the time, wasn’t he? I thought they could detect underage magic!
Dobby, So if you’re underage and you do magic inside an adult witch or wizard’s house, the Ministry won’t know?
Well, that’s rubbish, Look what happened here, look what happened to Morfin!

Session-834.Scene: Dumbledore assigned Harry the task of retrieving Slughorn's unaltered memory about Horcruxes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is that all?
Tampered with?
But why would he do that?
But surely, sir, you don’t need me — you could use Legilimency . . . or Veritaserum. . . .
“Good night, sir.”

Session-835.Scene: Hermione sarcastically agreed with Ron's judgment on a plan.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He loves you, Won’t refuse you anything, will he? Not his little Potions Prince. Just hang back after class this afternoon and ask him.
You haven’t?

They must be really advanced Dark Magic, or why would Voldemort have wanted to know about them? I think it’s going to be difficult to get the information, Harry, you’ll have to be very careful about how you approach Slughorn, think out a strategy. . . .
Ron reckons I should just hang back after Potions this afternoon. . . .
Oh, well, if Won-Won thinks that, you’d better do it, After all, when has Won-Won’s judgment ever been faulty?
Hermione, can’t you — ?
No!

Session-836.Scene: Harry circumvented complex potion-making by presenting a bezoar as an antidote, impressing Slughorn.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What’ve you done?
Golpalott’s-Third-Law-states-that-the-antidote-for-a-blended-poison-will-be-equal-to-more-than-the-sum-of-the-antidotes-for-each-of-the-separate-components.
It’s a shame that the Prince won’t be able to help you much with this, Harry, You have to understand the principles involved this time. No shortcuts or cheats!
You sure the Prince hasn’t got any tips?
Nothing,
And you thought of a bezoar all by yourself, did you, Harry?

Session-837.Scene: Hermione failed to find any information about Horcruxes, even within the Hogwarts' restricted section.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It would’ve just looked stupid if we’d both done it! Look, I had to try and soften him up so I could ask him about Voldemort, didn’t I? Oh, will you get a grip!

I haven’t found one single explanation of what Horcruxes do! Not a single one! I’ve been right through the restricted section and even in the most horrible books, where they tell you how to brew the most gruesome potions — nothing! All I could find was this, in the introduction to Magick Moste Evile — listen — ‘Of the Horcrux, wickedest of magical inventions, we shall not speak nor give direction. . . .’ I mean, why mention it then? Oh, shut up,

Session-838.Scene: Malfoy's clandestine operation was taking longer than anticipated, straining his patience and raising concerns with Crabbe.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry, where are you going?
I tell my friends what I’m up to, if I want them to keep a lookout for me,

Session-839.Scene: Ron reported feeling a tingling sensation in his feet during Apparition practice.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How did you do? I think I felt something the last time I tried — a kind of tingling in my feet.
I expect your trainers are too small, Won-Won,
I didn’t feel anything,
What d’you mean, you don’t care? Don’t you want to learn to Apparate?
I’m not fussed, really, I prefer flying, Look, hurry up, will you, there’s something I want to do. . . .

Session-840.Scene: Harry used his wand to reveal the Marauder's Map, hoping to track Malfoy's activities.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Are you going to tell me what we’re doing, then?
Up here,
Harry . . .
Malfoy’s using Crabbe and Goyle as lookouts. He was arguing with Crabbe just now. I want to know — aha. I solemnly swear that I am up to no good . . . or Malfoy is anyway. Help me find Malfoy,
There! He’s in the Slytherin common room, look . . . with Parkinson and Zabini and Crabbe and Goyle . . .

Well, I’m keeping an eye on him from now on, And the moment I see him lurking somewhere with Crabbe and Goyle keeping watch outside, it’ll be on with the old Invisibility Cloak and off to find out what he’s —

Session-841.Scene: Ron expressed his disappointment about the canceled Hogsmeade trip, which was scheduled for his birthday.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It was on my birthday! I was looking forward to that!
Not a big surprise, though, is it? Not after what happened to Katie.
But now all I’ve got to look forward to is stupid Apparition!

Session-842.Scene: Ron attacked Harry after Harry insulted Romilda Vane while Ron was under the influence of a love potion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Happy birthday, Ron, Have a present.
Cheers,
Right, I solemnly swear that I am up to no good,
Nice one, Harry!
No problem, Hey . . . I don’t think he’s in his bed. . . .
Seriously good haul this year! See what Mum and Dad got me? Blimey, I think I’ll come of age next year too. . . .
Cool,
Want one?
No thanks, Malfoy’s gone again!
Can’t have done, Come on, if you don’t hurry up, you’ll have to Apparate on an empty stomach. . . . Might make it easier, I suppose . . .
Mischief managed, Ready? Ron? Breakfast.
I’m not hungry.
I thought you just said — ?
Well, all right, I’ll come down with you, but I don’t want to eat.
You’ve just eaten half a box of Chocolate Cauldrons, haven’t you?
It’s not that, You . . . you wouldn’t understand.
Fair enough,
Harry
What
Harry, I can’t stand it!
You can’t stand what?
I can’t stop thinking about her!
Why does that stop you having breakfast?
I don’t think she knows I exist,
She definitely knows you exist, She keeps snogging you, doesn’t she?
“Who are you talking about?” Who are you talking about?
“Who are you talking about?” Who are you talking about?
Romilda Vane,
This is a joke, right? You’re joking.
I think . . . Harry, I think I love her,
Okay, okay . . . Say that again with a straight face.
I love her, Have you seen her hair, it’s all black and shiny and silky . . . and her eyes? Her big dark eyes? And her —
This is really funny and everything, but joke’s over, all right? Drop it. What?
Harry! You said it was a joke!
Where did you get those Chocolate Cauldrons?
They were a birthday present! I offered you one, didn’t I?
You just picked them up off the floor, didn’t you?
Let me go!
They didn’t fall off your bed, you prat, don’t you understand?
Romilda? he repeated. Did you say Romilda? Harry — do you know her? Can you introduce me?
Yeah, I’ll introduce you, I’m going to let you down now, okay? She’ll be in Slughorn’s office,
Why will she be in there?
Oh, she has extra Potions lessons with him,
Maybe I could ask if I can have them with her?
Great idea,
Leave me alone, Harry’s going to introduce me to Romilda Vane.

Session-843.Scene: Ron unknowingly drank poisoned mead intended for Dumbledore.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor, I’m really sorry to disturb you, but my friend Ron’s swallowed a love potion by mistake. You couldn’t make him an antidote, could you? I’d take him to Madam Pomfrey, but we’re not supposed to have anything from Weasleys’ Wizard Wheezes and, you know . . . awkward questions . . .
Er, well, I’ve never mixed an antidote for a love potion, sir, and by the time I get it right, Ron might’ve done something serious —
I can’t see her, Harry — is he hiding her?
That would explain a lot, It’s his birthday, Professor,
She didn’t see that, did she?
She’s not here yet,
Okay, How do I look?
Brilliant,
Back to normal, then?   Thanks a lot, Professor.
Ron
Ron! Professor! Do something!

Session-844.Scene: The Weasley twins had planned to surprise Ron in Hogsmeade with a gift before his poisoning.

Dialogue.Dialogue: . . . and then I got the bezoar down his throat and his breathing eased up a bit, Slughorn ran for help, McGonagall and Madam Pomfrey turned up, and they brought Ron up here. They reckon he’ll be all right. Madam Pomfrey says he’ll have to stay here a week or so . . . keep taking essence of rue . . .
Lucky there was one in the room,
Yes, Slughorn poured it out —
Probably, but why would Slughorn want to poison Ron?

Dumbledore reckons Voldemort wanted Slughorn on his side, Slughorn was in hiding for a year before he came to Hogwarts. And . . . And maybe Voldemort wants him out of the way, maybe he thinks he could be valuable to Dumbledore.
Then the poisoner didn’t know Slughorn very well, Anyone who knew Slughorn would have known there was a good chance he’d keep something that tasty for himself.
Er-my-nee,

Session-845.Scene: Hagrid had been reading to Aragog in the forest all day, causing him to miss dinner.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Not bad, They say he’ll be okay.
That’s just what we were discussing, We don’t know.
Well, I don’t think it’s Quidditch, but I think there’s a connection between the attacks,

Well, for one thing, they both ought to have been fatal and weren’t, although that was pure luck. And for another, neither the poison nor the necklace seems to have reached the person who was supposed to be killed. Of course, that makes the person behind this even more dangerous in a way, because they don’t seem to care how many people they finish off before they actually reach their victim.
Don’t be . . . I didn’t . . .

Session-846.Scene: Hagrid accidentally snapped his crossbow in two while uncomfortably discussing Snape with Harry and Hermione.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hasn’t he got any ideas, Hagrid?
Surely not?
What? Dumbledore’s angry with Snape?
Hagrid, why is Dumbledore angry with Snape?
What? What’s Snape done?
Well?
What?
Yeah, but Dumbledore’s not having rows with the rest of them, is he?
Look out,

Session-847.Scene: McLaggen ambushed Harry in the common room after falling asleep while waiting for him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh . . . right . . . Quidditch, Yeah . . . he might not make it.
Yeah, Yeah, I suppose so. . . .
What? Oh . . . there’s one tomorrow evening.
Right, Well, I’ll hear them tomorrow, then. I’m pretty tired now . . . see you . . .

Session-848.Scene: Harry escaped Lavender by feigning an urgent need to discuss Quidditch with McLaggen before darting away to Potions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look, why don’t you talk to Ron about all this?
Is he?
Yeah, I think so. Well, they’re friends, aren’t they?
Would you call getting poisoned being interesting? asked Harry. Anyway — sorry, got to go — there’s McLaggen coming for a talk about Quidditch

Session-849.Scene: Ron tried to inquire about Hermione’s presence despite his relationship with Lavender.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So how’s McLaggen shaping up?

I’ve told you, he could be world-class and I wouldn’t want to keep him. He keeps trying to tell everyone what to do, he thinks he could play every position better than the rest of us. I can’t wait to be shot of him. And speaking of getting shot of people, will you stop pretending to be asleep when Lavender comes to see you? She’s driving me mad as well.
Oh, Yeah. All right.
If you don’t want to go out with her anymore, just tell her
No, she’s already gone down to the pitch with Ginny.
Oh, Right. Well, good luck. Hope you hammer McLag — I mean, Smith.
I’ll try, See you after the match.

Session-850.Scene: Luna Lovegood's unusual commentary included observations about oddly shaped clouds and a player potentially suffering from "Loser's Lurgy."

Dialogue.Dialogue: I met Malfoy,
So I wanted to know how come he’s up at the castle with a couple of girlfriends while everyone else is down here. . . .
Well, I’m not likely to find out, am I? Come on then!
I’m the Captain, McLaggen, shut up giving them instructions, Just get up by the goalposts! Make sure you do fly out of the sun,
McLaggen, will you pay attention to what you’re supposed to be doing and leave everyone else alone!
Will you give him back his bat and get back to the goalposts!

Session-851.Scene: Harry remembered regrowing an armful of bones after Professor Lockhart removed them, which was his most painful injury to date.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nice of you to drop in,
What happened?
I don’t want to stay here overnight, I want to find McLaggen and kill him.
D’you know how much we lost by?
Well, yeah I do, Final score was three hundred and twenty to sixty.
Brilliant, Really brilliant! When I get hold of McLaggen —

You don’t want to get hold of him, he’s the size of a troll, Personally, I think there’s a lot to be said for hexing him with that toenail thing of the Prince’s. Anyway, the rest of the team might’ve dealt with him before you get out of here, they’re not happy. . . . I could hear the match commentary from here, I hope Luna always commentates from now on. . . . Loser’s Lurgy . . . Ginny came in to visit while you were unconscious, She reckons you only just arrived on time for the match. How come? You left here early enough.

. . Yeah . . . well, I saw Malfoy sneaking off with a couple of girls who didn’t look like they wanted to be with him, and that’s the second time he’s made sure he isn’t down on the Quidditch pitch with the rest of the school; he skipped the last match too, remember? Wish I’d followed him now, the match was such a fiasco. . . .
Don’t be stupid, You couldn’t have missed a Quidditch match just to follow Malfoy, you’re the Captain!
I want to know what he’s up to. And don’t tell me it’s all in my head, not after what I overheard between him and Snape —

. . but there’s no rule saying only one person at a time can be plotting anything in this place! You’re getting a bit obsessed with Malfoy, Harry. I mean, thinking about missing a match just to follow him . . .
I want to catch him at it! I mean, where’s he going when he disappears off the map?
I’ve never seen him going along any of the secret passageways on the map. I thought they were being watched now anyway?
Well then, I dunno, said Ron.
Kreacher?
What’s going — ?
Muffliato!
Langlock!
Nice one, That was another Prince hex, wasn’t it?
Yeah, Right — I’m forbidding you to fight each other! Well, Kreacher, you’re forbidden to fight Dobby. Dobby, I know I’m not allowed to give you orders —
Okay then,

Session-852.Scene: Harry tasked Kreacher and Dobby with discreetly surveilling Draco Malfoy around the clock.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah, I did, I’ve got a job for you.
. . Okay then . . . I want you to tail Draco Malfoy. I want to know where he’s going, who he’s meeting, and what he’s doing. I want you to follow him around the clock.
There won’t be any need for that,
. . And you’re forbidden to tip him off, Kreacher, or to show him what you’re up to, or to talk to him at all, or to write him messages or . . . or to contact him in any way. Got it?

That’s settled, then, I’ll want regular reports, but make sure I’m not surrounded by people when you turn up.Ron and Hermione are okay.  And don’t tell anyone what you’re doing. Just stick to Malfoy like a couple of wart plasters.

Session-853.Scene: Trelawney dramatically declared that she was being thrown out of Dumbledore's office.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor Trelawney still isn’t happy Firenze is teaching, then?
Ah, Well, I asked Professor Slughorn about it at the end of Potions, sir, but, er, he wouldn’t give it to me.
Well, Well . . . the day Ron swallowed love potion by mistake I took him to Professor Slughorn. I thought maybe if I got Professor Slughorn in a good enough mood —
Sir, it isn’t that I wasn’t bothered or anything, I’ve just had other — other things . . .
Professor Dumbledore, I’m really sorry. I should have done more. . . . I should have realized you wouldn’t have asked me to do it if it wasn’t really important.
Sir,

Session-854.Scene: Voldemort initially sought a teaching position in Defense Against the Dark Arts at Hogwarts, but was turned down due to his young age.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sir, Voldemort killed his father and his grandparents and made it look as though his Uncle Morfin did it. Then he went back to Hogwarts and he asked . . . he asked Professor Slughorn about Horcruxes,
Yes, sir.
At Borgin and Burkes?
He wanted to stay here?
But he didn’t get the job, sir?
How did you feel about that, sir?
Which job did he want, sir? What subject did he want to teach?
I’ll bet he was,

Session-855.Scene: Dumbledore revealed that Voldemort murdered Hepzibah Smith for her cup and locket, not for revenge.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No way!
Hokey confessed?
Voldemort modified her memory, just like he did with Morfin!
— because she was a house-elf,
But, it seems mad. . . . Risking everything, throwing away his job, just for those . . .
The locket maybe, but why take the cup as well?
Whose memory is it?

Session-856.Scene: Harry's hope was ignited by the news of Ginny and Dean's argument.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why? Why did he come back? Did you ever find out?
What ideas, sir?
Was he after the Defense Against the Dark Arts job again, sir? He didn’t say. . . .

Session-857.Scene: Hermione doubted Harry's ability to uncover helpful information.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You won’t find anything in there,
Don’t start, Hermione, If it hadn’t been for the Prince, Ron wouldn’t be sitting here now.
He would if you’d just listened to Snape in our first year,

Session-858.Scene: Ron inadvertently confessed his affection for Hermione while lamenting his relationship woes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: At least you can Apparate, though! You’ll have no trouble come July!
I’ve only done it once,
I’m telling you, the stupid Prince isn’t going to be able to help you with this, Harry! There’s only one way to force someone to do what you want, and that’s the Imperius Curse, which is illegal —
Yeah, I know that, thanks, That’s why I’m looking for something different. Dumbledore says Veritaserum won’t do it, but there might be something else, a potion or a spell. . . .

You’re going about it the wrong way, Only you can get the memory, Dumbledore says. That must mean you can persuade Slughorn where other people can’t. It’s not a question of slipping him a potion, anyone could do that —
How d’you spell ‘belligerent’?
No, it isn’t, And ‘augury’ doesn’t begin O — R — G either. What kind of quill are you using?
It’s one of Fred and George’s Spell-Check ones . . . but I think the charm must be wearing off. . . .
Yes, it must, because we were asked how we’d deal with dementors, not ‘Dugbogs,’ and I don’t remember you changing your name to ‘Roonil Wazlib’ either.
Don’t say I’ll have to write the whole thing out again!
It’s okay, we can fix it,
I love you, Hermione,
Don’t let Lavender hear you saying that.
I won’t, Or maybe I will . . . then she’ll ditch me . . .
Why don’t you ditch her if you want to finish it?
You haven’t ever chucked anyone, have you?
Sort of fell apart, yeah,
Wish that would happen with me and Lavender, But the more I hint I want to finish it, the tighter she holds on. It’s like going out with the giant squid.
There,
Thanks a million, Can I borrow your quill for the conclusion?

Session-859.Scene: Harry realized Malfoy had been using Polyjuice Potion to disguise Crabbe and Goyle.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Kreacher!
What is this? What’s going on, Harry?
Well . . . they’ve been following Malfoy for me, he said.
You haven’t slept, Dobby? But surely, Harry, you didn’t tell him not to —
No, of course I didn’t, Dobby, you can sleep, all right? But has either of you found out anything?
Yeah, we don’t need to hear about you being in love with Malfoy, Let’s fast forward to where he’s actually been going.
Dobby, you tell me, Has he been going anywhere he shouldn’t have?

The Room of Requirement! That’s where he’s been sneaking off to! That’s where he’s doing . . . whatever he’s doing! And I bet that’s why he’s been disappearing off the map — come to think of it, I’ve never seen the Room of Requirement on there!
Maybe the Marauders never knew the room was there,
I think it’ll be part of the magic of the room, If you need it to be Unplottable, it will be.
Dobby, have you managed to get in to have a look at what Malfoy’s doing?
No, it’s not, Malfoy got into our headquarters there last year, so I’ll be able to get in and spy on him, no problem.

But I don’t think you will, Harry, Malfoy already knew exactly how we were using the room, didn’t he, because that stupid Marietta had blabbed. He needed the room to become the headquarters of the D. A., so it did. But you don’t know what the room becomes when Malfoy goes in there, so you don’t know what to ask it to transform into.
There’ll be a way around that, You’ve done brilliantly, Dobby.
Kreacher’s done well too,
Get out of it, You’d better go and get some sleep too, Dobby.
How good’s this? We know where Malfoy’s going! We’ve got him cornered now!
Yeah, it’s great,
But what’s all this about him going up there with a ‘variety of students’? How many people are in on it? You wouldn’t think he’d trust lots of them to know what he’s doing. . . .

Yeah, that is weird, I heard him telling Crabbe it wasn’t Crabbe’s business what he was doing . . . so what’s he telling all these . . . all these . . . God, I’ve been stupid, It’s obvious, isn’t it? There was a great vat of it down in the dungeon. . . . He could’ve nicked some any time during that lesson. . . .
Nicked what?

Polyjuice Potion. He stole some of the Polyjuice Potion Slughorn showed us in our first Potions lesson. . . . There aren’t a whole variety of students standing guard for Malfoy . . . it’s just Crabbe and Goyle as usual. Yeah, it all fits! They’re stupid enough to do what they’re told even if he won’t tell them what he’s up to . . . but he doesn’t want them to be seen lurking around outside the Room of Requirement, so he’s got them taking Polyjuice to make them look like other people. . . . Those two girls I saw him with when he missed Quidditch — ha! Crabbe and Goyle!
Do you mean to say, that that little girl whose scales I repaired — ?

Yeah, of course! Of course! Malfoy must’ve been inside the room at the time, so she — what am I talking about? — he dropped the scales to tell Malfoy not to come out, because there was someone there! And there was that girl who dropped the toadspawn too! We’ve been walking past him all the time and not realizing it!
He’s got Crabbe and Goyle transforming into girls? Blimey . . . No wonder they don’t look too happy these days. . . . I’m surprised they don’t tell him to stuff it. . . .
I won’t,
Hmmm . . . the Dark Mark we don’t know exists,
We’ll see,
Yes, we will,
We’ll see,

Yes, we will, But, Harry, before you get all excited, I still don’t think you’ll be able to get into the Room of Requirement without knowing what’s there first. And I don’t think you should forget that what you’re supposed to be concentrating on is getting that memory from Slughorn. Good night.
What d’you think?
Wish I could Disapparate like a house-elf, I’d have that Apparition Test in the bag.

Session-860.Scene: Hermione's exclamation about Mundungus's arrest caused Harry and Ron to gag on their breakfast.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look, I haven’t forgotten about Slughorn, but I haven’t got a clue how to get that memory off him, and until I get a brain wave why shouldn’t I find out what Malfoy’s doing?
I’ve already told you Instead of messing around outside the Room of Requirement you should go and find Slughorn and start appealing to his better nature.
Anyone we know — ?

Yes! But it’s all right, he’s not dead — it’s Mundungus, he’s been arrested and sent to Azkaban!  Something to do with impersonating an Inferius during an attempted burglary .. . and someone called Octavius Pepper has vanished. . . . Oh, and how horrible, a nine-year-old boy has been arrested for trying to kill his grandparents, they think he was under the Imperius Curse. . . .

Session-861.Scene: Snape revealed Mundungus Fletcher was labeled as a smelly sneak thief in a news article.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — well — ghosts are transparent —
Yeah, ghosts are transparent, but Inferi are dead bodies, aren’t they? So they’d be solid —
Well, what Harry said is the most useful if we’re trying to tell them apart!
No! There’s no point, you’ll just end up in detention again, leave it!

Session-862.Scene: Moaning Myrtle revealed she had once visited Harry while he was bathing.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Snape’s right, though, isn’t he? I dunno whether it’s worth me taking the test. I just can’t get the hang of Apparition.

You might as well do the extra practice sessions in Hogsmeade and see where they get you, It’ll be more interesting than trying to get into a stupid hoop anyway. Then, if you’re still not — you know — as good as you’d like to be, you can postpone the test, do it with me over the summ — Myrtle, this is the boys’ bathroom!
Who were you expecting?
I thought you lived in that girls’ bathroom?
Vividly,
When you say you had lots in common, d’you mean he lives in an S-bend too?
There’s been a boy in here crying? A young boy?
— not the grave, surely? The sewers, maybe . . . You’re right, I’ll do the practice sessions in Hogsmeade before I decide about taking the test.

Session-863.Scene: Harry concealed himself with an Invisibility Cloak after leaving the entrance hall.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You’d do better, when he confided this plan to Ron and her in the entrance hall, to go straight to Slughorn’s office and try and get that memory from him.
I’ve been trying! He doesn’t want to talk to me, Hermione! He can tell I’ve been trying to get him on his own again, and he’s not going to let it happen!
Well, you’ve just got to keep at it, haven’t you?
I solemnly swear that I am up to no good,

Session-864.Scene: Harry frightened Gregory Goyle by whispering to him while impersonating a little girl.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hello . . . you’re very pretty, aren’t you? OUCH!
What’re you doing here?
His office isn’t here, it’s round the other side of the castle, behind the gargoyle —
Has he? Hey — you don’t know where he goes, I suppose?
What did you want to see him about?
I do,
I’m sorry, I mean . . . I miss him, as well. . . .

Session-865.Scene: Ron slightly overshot his Apparition attempt, landing near Scrivenshaft's instead of Madam Puddifoot's Tea Shop.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I did it — well, kind of! I was supposed to be Apparating to outside Madam Puddifoot’s Tea Shop and I overshot it a bit, ended up near Scrivenshaft’s, but at least I moved!
Good one, How’d you do, Hermione?
Oh,  I’ll be surprised if he doesn’t pop the question soon
And what about you? Have you been up at the Room of Requirement all this time?
Yep, And guess who I ran into up there? Tonks!
Yeah, she said she’d come to visit Dumbledore. . . . If you ask me, she’s cracking up a bit. Losing her nerve after what happened at the Ministry.
It’s a bit odd, She’s supposed to be guarding the school, why’s she suddenly abandoning her post to come and see Dumbledore when he’s not even here?
I had a thought, You don’t think she can have been . . . you know . . . in love with Sirius?
What on earth makes you say that?
I dunno, but she was nearly crying when I mentioned his name . . . and her Patronus is a big four-legged thing now. . . . I wondered whether it hadn’t become . . . you know . . . him.
It’s a thought, But I still don’t know why she’d be bursting into the castle to see Dumbledore, if that’s really why she was here. . . .
Goes back to what I said, doesn’t it? She’s gone a bit funny. Lost her nerve. Women, they’re easily upset.
Yep, I doubt you’d find a woman who sulked for half an hour because Madam Rosmerta didn’t laugh at their joke about the hag, the Healer, and the Mimbulus mimbletonia.

Session-866.Scene: Harry considered using his Felix Felicis potion to acquire a memory from Slughorn, despite originally saving it for personal romantic pursuits involving Ginny.

Dialogue.Dialogue: For the last time, just forget about Malfoy, It isn’t Lavender,
Oh, good,
Thanks . . . Dumbledore said we wouldn’t be having any more lessons until I got the memory!
Maybe he wants to check on how you’re doing?
Look at this,
Oh, for heaven’s sake,
Hagrid That thing told its mates to eat Harry and me! Told them to help themselves! And now Hagrid expects us to go down there and cry over its horrible hairy body!
It’s not just that, He’s asking us to leave the castle at night and he knows security’s a million times tighter and how much trouble we’d be in if we were caught.
We’ve been down to see him by night before,
Hagrid We’ve risked a lot to help Hagrid out, but after all — Aragog’s dead. If it were a question of saving him —
Hagrid You didn’t meet him, Hermione. Believe me, being dead will have improved him a lot.
Harry, you can’t be thinking of going, It’s such a pointless thing to get detention for.
Hagrid
Yes, he will, Look, Potions will be almost empty this afternoon, with us all off doing our tests. . . . Try and soften Slughorn up a bit then!
Fifty-seventh time lucky, you think?
Lucky, Harry, that’s it — get lucky!
What d’you mean?
Use your lucky potion!
Ron, that’s — that’s it! Of course! Why didn’t I think of it?
Felix Felicis? I dunno . . . I was sort of saving it. . . .
What for?
What on earth is more important than this memory, Harry?
Yes, of course,
Oh, stop that, I feel sick enough as it is — quick, hide me!
It isn’t Lavender!
Cool, Blimey, they don’t look happy, do they?
They’re the Montgomery sisters and of course they don’t look happy, didn’t you hear what happened to their little brother?
I’m losing track of what’s happening to everyone’s relatives, to be honest,
Well, their brother was attacked by a werewolf. The rumor is that their mother refused to help the Death Eaters. Anyway, the boy was only five and he died in St. Mungo’s, they couldn’t save him.
He died? But surely werewolves don’t kill, they just turn you into one of them?
They sometimes kill, I’ve heard of it happening when the werewolf gets carried away.
What was the werewolf’s name?

Well, the rumor is that it was that Fenrir Greyback, Harry, you’ve got to get that memory. It’s all about stopping Voldemort, isn’t it? These dreadful things that are happening are all down to him. . . .
You’ll do fine, Good luck.
And you too!

Session-867.Scene: Malfoy's sulky demeanor suggested his mission was progressing poorly.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh . . . yeah, maybe, Sir, Professor — Professor, don’t you want to taste my po — ?

Session-868.Scene: Ron's practical exam was failed due to the examiner noticing half an eyebrow was left behind.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Harry! Harry, I passed!
Well done! And Ron?
He — he just failed, It was really unlucky, a tiny thing, the examiner just spotted that he’d left half an eyebrow behind. . . . How did it go with Slughorn?
No joy,
Yeah, I s’pose, But half an eyebrow! Like that matters!
I know, it does seem really harsh. . . .

Session-869.Scene: Ron fondly recalled a feeling he associated with taking Felix Felicis, despite never actually having done so.

Dialogue.Dialogue: So, Harry — you going to use the Felix Felicis or what?
Yeah, I s’pose I’d better, I don’t reckon I’ll need all of it, not twelve hours’ worth, it can’t take all night. . . . I’ll just take a mouthful. Two or three hours should do it.
It’s a great feeling when you take it, Like you can’t do anything wrong.
What d’you mean? You’ve never taken any!
Yeah, but I thought I had, didn’t I? Same difference really . . .

Session-870.Scene: Slughorn revealed his opportunistic nature by contemplating collecting venom from the deceased Aragog.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Good evening, Professor.
I think Filch must’ve forgotten to lock the doors,
He’s pretty upset. . . . But you won’t tell anyone, Professor? I don’t want trouble for him. . . .
But this one, Aragog, the first one Hagrid ever got, it died last night. He’s devastated. He wants company while he buries it and I said I’d go.
well, if you wanted to come, Professor, Hagrid would probably be really pleased. . . . Give Aragog a better send-off, you know . . .

Session-871.Scene: Aragog's spider colony had previously only refrained from eating Hagrid at Aragog's command.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah — Ron and Hermione couldn’t, though. They’re really sorry.
Where are we burying him?  The forest?
No,

Session-872.Scene: Under Felix Felicis's influence, Harry successfully performed the Refilling Charm nonverbally on Slughorn's emptying bottles of wine.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He was talking about my mum and dad dying.
No — well, I was only one when they died, But I’ve found out pretty much what happened since. My dad died first. Did you know that?
Yeah . . . Voldemort murdered him and then stepped over his body toward my mum,  He told her to get out of the way, He told me she needn’t have died. He only wanted me. She could have run.
It is, isn’t it? But she didn’t move. Dad was already dead, but she didn’t want me to go too.  She tried to plead with Voldemort .. . but he just laughed. . . .
I forgot, You liked her, didn’t you?
But you won’t help her son. She gave me her life, but you won’t give me a memory.
It can, Dumbledore needs information. I need information. I am the Chosen One. I have to kill him. I need that memory.
Of course I am,
You don’t want to get rid of the wizard who killed Lily Evans?
You’re scared he’ll find out you helped me? Be brave like my mother, Professor. . . .
You’d cancel out anything you did by giving me the memory, It would be a very brave and noble thing to do. Thank you very much, Professor.

Session-873.Scene: The Fat Lady falsely claimed the password had changed to punish Harry for his late return.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m really sorry — I had to go out for something important —
You’re joking! Why did it have to change at midnight?
Fantastic, Really brilliant. Yeah, I would go and take it up with Dumbledore if he was here, because he’s the one who wanted me to —
Where is he?
Not the Bloody Baron — Dumbledore!
toffee éclairs

Session-874.Scene: Dumbledore eagerly emptied Slughorn's memory into the Pensieve after Harry presented it.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sir — I’ve got it. I’ve got the memory from Slughorn.

Session-875.Scene: Riddle subtly inquired about dividing the soul into seven pieces to create multiple Horcruxes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I was ripped from my body, I was less than spirit, less than the meanest ghost . . . but still, I was alive.

Session-876.Scene: Dumbledore revealed he had destroyed Marvolo's ring, which was one of Voldemort's Horcruxes, and suffered a terrible curse as a result.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You think he succeeded then, sir? He made a Horcrux? And that’s why he didn’t die when he attacked me? He had a Horcrux hidden somewhere? A bit of his soul was safe?
Where? How?
I don’t understand, sir,
I still don’t understand,
Well, He wanted people to know he was Slytherin’s heir, because he couldn’t take credit at the time.
So he’s made himself impossible to kill by murdering other people? Why couldn’t he make a Sorcerer’s Stone, or steal one, if he was so interested in immortality?
He made seven Horcruxes?
But the six Horcruxes, then, how are we supposed to find them?
You have?
But how did you find it?
And they could be anything? They could be old tin cans or, I dunno, empty potion bottles. . . .
The diary wasn’t that special.
So, the other Horcruxes? Do you think you know what they are, sir?
The locket! Hufflepuff’s cup!
Do you think that’s why he really wanted to come back to Hogwarts, sir?
Even if he got something of Ravenclaw’s or of Gryffindor’s, that leaves a sixth Horcrux, Unless he got both?
The snake? You can use animals as Horcruxes?
So, said Harry, the diary’s gone, the ring’s gone. The cup, the locket, and the snake are still intact, and you think there might be a Horcrux that was once Ravenclaw’s or Gryffindor’s?
So . . . are you still looking for them, sir?
And if you do, can I come with you and help get rid of it?
I can?
Does Voldemort know when a Horcrux is destroyed, sir? Can he feel it?
But I thought he meant Lucius Malfoy to smuggle it into Hogwarts?
So if all of his Horcruxes are destroyed, Voldemort could be killed?
But I haven’t got uncommon skill and power,
I know! I can love! Big deal!
So, when the prophecy says that I’ll have ‘power the Dark Lord knows not,’ it just means — love?
But it comes to the same —
But,
But, but last year, you said one of us would have to kill the other —
But —
Of course not! He killed my mum and dad!
But, it all comes to the same thing, doesn’t it? I’ve got to try and kill him, or —
I’d want him finished, And I’d want to do it.
That one of us is going to end up killing the other,

Session-877.Scene: Ron accidentally made it snow during Charms, leading to Lavender's tears and the revelation of their breakup.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wow, Wow. You’re actually going to go with Dumbledore . . . and try and destroy . . . wow.
Ron, you’re making it snow,

Oh yeah, Sorry . . . looks like we’ve all got horrible dandruff now. . . . We split up, Last night. When she saw me coming out of the dormitory with Hermione. Obviously she couldn’t see you, so she thought it had just been the two of us.
Ah, Well — you don’t mind it’s over, do you?
No, It was pretty bad while she was yelling, but at least I didn’t have to finish it.
Coward, Well, it was a bad night for romance all around. Ginny and Dean split up too, Harry.
How come?

Oh, something really silly . . . She said he was always trying to help her through the portrait hole, like she couldn’t climb in herself . . . but they’ve been a bit rocky for ages. Of course, this puts you in a bit of a dilemma, doesn’t it?
What d’you mean?
The Quidditch team, said Hermione. If Ginny and Dean aren’t speaking . . .
Oh — oh yeah,
Flitwick,
“It’s a nice day.

Session-878.Scene: Katie Bell remembered pushing open the door to the ladies' room in the Three Broomsticks before her memory became blank.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Katie! You’re back! Are you okay?

Ah, well, now you’re back and Ron’s fit, we’ll have a decent chance of thrashing Ravenclaw, which means we could still be in the running for the Cup. Listen, Katie . . . . . . that necklace . . . can you remember who gave it to you now?
You definitely went into the bathroom, then?
So it must have been a girl or a woman who gave Katie the necklace, to be in the ladies’ bathroom.

Or someone who looked like a girl or a woman, Don’t forget, there was a cauldron full of Polyjuice Potion at Hogwarts. We know some of it got stolen. . . . I think I’m going to take another swig of Felix, said Harry, and have a go at the Room of Requirement again.

That would be a complete waste of potion, Luck can only get you so far, Harry.
