The situation with Slughorn was different; you always had the ability to persuade him, you just needed to tweak the circumstances a bit. Luck isn’t enough to get you through a powerful enchantment, though. Don’t go wasting the rest of that potion! You’ll need all the luck you can get if Dumbledore takes you along with him . . .
Couldn’t we make some more? It’d be great to have a stock of it. . . . Have a look in the book . . .
Blimey, it’s seriously complicated, And it takes six months . . . You’ve got to let it stew. . . .
Typical,

Session-879.Scene: Harry used Sectumsempra, a spell he found in the Half-Blood Prince's book, on Malfoy, causing severe bleeding.

Dialogue.Dialogue: SECTUMSEMPRA! No No No — I didn’t —
I didn’t mean it to happen, I didn’t know what that spell did.
I — read about it somewhere.
It was — a library book,
Where’ve you — ? Why are you soaking — ? Is that blood?
I need your book, Your Potions book. Quick . . .give it to me . . .
But what about the Half-Blood —
I’ll explain later!

Session-880.Scene: Harry desperately claimed "Roonil Wazlib" was his nickname to conceal the book's true owner.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,
Yes, Yes,
Yes, Yes,
“That’s my nickname,
Yeah . . . that’s what my friends call me
I — I don’t agree, sir,
But sir . . . Quidditch . . . the last match of the . . .

Session-881.Scene: Moaning Myrtle had spread the news of Harry's actions by appearing in every bathroom of the castle.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I won’t say ‘I told you so,’
Leave it, Hermione,
I told you there was something wrong with that Prince person, And I was right, wasn’t I?

Yes, Yes, Will you stop harping on about the book! The Prince only copied it out! It’s not like he was advising anyone to use it! For all we know, he was making a note of something that had been used against him!
I don’t believe this, said Hermione. You’re actually defending —

I’m not defending what I did! I wish I hadn’t done it, and not just because I’ve got about a dozen detentions. And get the book? Yeah, I am, Listen, without the Prince I’d never have won the Felix Felicis. I’d never have known how to save Ron from poisoning, I’d never have —
— got a reputation for Potions brilliance you don’t deserve,
Well, of course I’m glad Harry wasn’t cursed! But you can’t call that Sectumsempra spell good, Ginny

Session-882.Scene: Snape assigned Harry the task of recopying old files detailing Hogwarts students' misdeeds and punishments, explicitly forbidding the use of magic.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Right, Professor,
Yes, sir.

Session-883.Scene: Ron brandished the silver Cup, announcing Gryffindor's overwhelming victory.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Quid agis?
We won! We won! Four hundred and fifty to a hundred and forty! We won!

Session-884.Scene: Ginny jokingly claimed Harry had a Hungarian Horntail tattoo.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What did you tell her?
Thanks, And what did you tell her Ron’s got?
Yeah, I would,

Session-885.Scene: Hermione slammed a yellowed newspaper clipping featuring Eileen Prince's picture as captain of the Hogwarts Gobstones team onto the table.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I want to talk to you, Harry.
What about?
The so-called Half-Blood Prince.
Oh, not again, Will you please drop it?
I’m not dropping it, until you’ve heard me out. Now, I’ve been trying to find out a bit about who might make a hobby of inventing Dark spells —
He didn’t make a hobby of it —
He, he — who says it’s a he?
We’ve been through this, Prince, Hermione, Prince!
Right! Look at that! Look at the picture!
“So?” No way.
What? What?
You think she was the Half-Blood . . . ? Oh, come on.

Well, why not? Harry, there aren’t any real princes in the Wizarding world! It’s either a nickname, a made-up title somebody’s given themselves, or it could be their actual name, couldn’t it? No, listen! If, say, her father was a wizard whose surname was Prince, and her mother was a Muggle, then that would make her a ‘half-blood Prince’!
Yeah, very ingenious, Hermione . . .
But it would! Maybe she was proud of being half a Prince!
Listen, Hermione, I can tell it’s not a girl. I can just tell.
The truth is that you don’t think a girl would have been clever enough,

How can I have hung round with you for five years and not think girls are clever? It’s the way he writes, I just know the Prince was a bloke, I can tell. This girl hasn’t got anything to do with it. Where did you get this anyway?
The library, There’s a whole collection of old Prophets up there. Well, I’m going to find out more about Eileen Prince if I can.
Enjoy yourself,
She’s just never got over you outperforming her in Potions,
You don’t think I’m mad, wanting that book back, do you?
’Course not, He was a genius, the Prince. Anyway . . . without his bezoar tip . . . I wouldn’t be here to discuss it, would I? I mean, I’m not saying that spell you used on Malfoy was great —
Nor am I,
But he healed all right, didn’t he? Back on his feet in no time.
Yeah, Thanks to Snape . . .
You still got detention with Snape this Saturday?

Yeah, and the Saturday after that, and the Saturday after that, And he’s hinting now that if I don’t get all the boxes done by the end of term, we’ll carry on next year. Thanks, Jimmy . . . Hey, it’s from Dumbledore! He wants me to go to his office as quick as I can!
Blimey, You don’t reckon . . . he hasn’t found . . . ?
Better go and see, hadn’t I?

Session-886.Scene: Trelawney revealed that Severus Snape had interrupted her interview with Dumbledore at the Hog's Head.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor — What happened, Professor?
Professor, were you trying to get into the Room of Requirement?
The Room of Requirement, Were you trying to get in there?
Not all of them do, But what happened? You screamed. . . . It sounded as though you were hurt. . . .
Right, But you couldn’t get in and hide them?
Somebody in — ? Who? Who was in there?
What? Saying what?
Whooping?
Was it male or female?
And it sounded happy?
What?
And then — ?
You couldn’t have found out who it was without asking?
Right, And did the voice say who was there?
And you didn’t see that coming?
I think you’d better tell Professor Dumbledore, He ought to know Malfoy’s celebrating — I mean, that someone threw you out of the room.
Right,
What? What?
You stay here, You stay here!
You stay here, You stay here!

Session-887.Scene: Harry loudly confronted Dumbledore with Trelawney's revelation about Snape's role in relaying the prophecy to Voldemort.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Come . . . with you . . . ?
If I . . . You’ve found one? You’ve found a Horcrux?
I’m not scared! Which Horcrux is it? Where is it?
Yes, How is it protected?
I’m coming,
Nothing,
I’m not upset.
Snape! Snape’s what’s happened! He told Voldemort about the prophecy, it was him, he listened outside the door, Trelawney told me!
Just now! AND YOU LET HIM TEACH HERE AND HE TOLD VOLDEMORT TO GO AFTER MY MUM AND DAD!
Don’t tell me it was a mistake, sir, he was listening at the door!
He hated my dad like he hated Sirius! Haven’t you noticed, Professor, how the people Snape hates tend to end up dead?

But he’s a very good Occlumens, isn’t he, sir? And isn’t Voldemort convinced that Snape’s on his side, even now? Professor . . . how can you be sure Snape’s on our side? Well, I don’t! He’s up to something with Draco Malfoy right now, right under your nose, and you still —
You’re leaving the school tonight, and I’ll bet you haven’t even considered that Snape and Malfoy might decide to —
I . . . they’re up to something! Professor Trelawney was just in the Room of Requirement, trying to hide her sherry bottles, and she heard Malfoy whooping, celebrating!
I didn’t —
Yes,
Of course.
Of course.
Yes. Yes.
Yes Yes.
I-
Yes, sir.

Session-888.Scene: Harry entrusted Ron with socks concealing the Felix Felicis potion for Ron, Hermione, and Ginny.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, listen! Dumbledore won’t be here tonight, so Malfoy’s going to have another clear shot at whatever he’s up to. No, listen to me! I know it was Malfoy celebrating in the Room of Requirement. Here — You’ve got to watch him and you’ve got to watch Snape too. Dumbledore says he’s put extra protection in the school, but if Snape’s involved, he’ll know what Dumbledore’s protection is, and how to avoid it — but he won’t be expecting you lot to be on the watch, will he?
Harry-
I haven’t got time to argue,
Thanks, Er — why do I need socks?
You need what’s wrapped in them, it’s the Felix Felicis. Share it between yourselves and Ginny too. Say good-bye to her for me. I’d better go, Dumbledore’s waiting —
No! We don’t want it, you take it, who knows what you’re going to be facing?
I’ll be fine, I’ll be with Dumbledore, I want to know you lot are okay. . . . Don’t look like that, Hermione, I’ll see you later. . . .

Session-889.Scene: Fact: Dumbledore flippantly suggested his destination was a Hogsmeade pub to disguise his true plans.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But what will people think when they see you leaving, Professor?
Professor, will we be Apparating?
Yes, Yes, Yes, but I haven’t got a license.

Session-890.Scene: Dumbledore cut his own arm to provide a blood payment for entry into the cave.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They brought the kids from the orphanage here?
No,
How can you tell?
You’ve d-done it!
Thank you,
What is it, Professor?
Payment? You’ve got to give the door something?
Blood?
Yeah, but still, if you can avoid it . . .
Professor! I’ll do it, I’m —

Session-891.Scene: Harry unexpectedly cast a Summoning Charm at Dumbledore's suggestion in the dark cavern.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor? Do you think the Horcrux is here?
We couldn’t . . . we couldn’t just try a Summoning Charm?
Me? Oh . . . okay . . . Accio Horcrux!

Session-892.Scene: Dumbledore conjured a coppery green chain from thin air, revealing a ghostly green boat hidden beneath the lake's surface.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What was that?
Did you think that would happen, sir?
But we don’t know what the thing was,
Professor?
Do you think we’re going to have to go into the lake?
You don’t think the Horcrux is at the bottom?
So we’re going to have to cross the lake to get to it?
How did you know that was there?
Is . . . is this boat safe?
So the things in the water won’t do anything to us if we cross in Voldemort’s boat?
But why have they let us?
It doesn’t look like it was built for two people. Will it hold both of us? Will we be too heavy together?
But then — ?
Professor!
I think I saw a hand in the water — a human hand!
So that thing that jumped out of the water — ? There are bodies in here!
At the moment?
But one of them jumped, When I tried to Summon the Horcrux, a body leapt out of the lake.
Oh . . . right . . .

Session-893.Scene: Dumbledore forced Harry to promise he would force him to drink the potion even if Dumbledore protested.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What is it?
Sir, no, don’t touch — !
You think the Horcrux is in there, sir?
What? No!
But what if — what if it kills you?
Sir, sir, this is Voldemort we’re —
But what if — ?
Yes, but — Yes,
Yes, but — Yes,
Why can’t I drink the potion instead?
Couldn’t — ?
Yes, but — but- but —
But — I — all right, but —
Professor? How do you feel? Professor? Can you hear me? Can you hear me?
You . . . you can’t stop, Professor, You’ve got to keep drinking, remember? You told me you had to keep drinking. Here . . .
It’s all right, Professor, It’s all right, I’m here —
Yes . . . yes, this’ll make it stop,
It’s all right, Professor, Nothing’s happening to you, you’re safe, it isn’t real, I swear it isn’t real — take this, now, take this. . . .
This will make it stop, Professor,
Here, drink this, drink this, you’ll be all right,
Just drink, Professor, just drink . . .
We’re nearly there, Professor. Drink this, drink it. . . .
Drink this, Professor. Drink this. . . .
This — this one will! Just drink this . . . It’ll be over . . . all over! No! No, no, you’re not dead, you said it wasn’t poison, wake up, wake up — Rennervate! Rennervate — sir — please — Sir,

Water, Aguamenti! Aguamenti! Sir, Aguamenti — Aguamenti — AGUAMENTI! Sir — here! Petrificus Totalus! Petrificus Totalus! Impedimenta! Incarcerous! Sectumsempra! SECTUMSEMPRA! Sir, sir, I forgot — about fire — they were coming at me and I panicked —

Session-894.Scene: Harry cut his arm on a rock to reopen the archway, offering his blood as tribute.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Sir, Don’t worry, I’ll get us back. . . . Lean on me, sir. . . .
Don’t talk now, Save your energy, sir. . . . We’ll soon be out of here. . . .
There’s no need, I got cut on the rock, Just tell me where. . . .
Sir, We’re nearly there. . . . I can Apparate us both back. . . . Don’t worry. . . .

Session-895.Scene: Dumbledore weakly requested Snape's presence after drinking a debilitating potion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We did it, Professor! We did it! We got the Horcrux! Sir, are you all right?
Sir — it’s okay, sir, you’re going to be all right, don’t worry — We need to get you up to the school, sir. . . . Madam Pomfrey . . .
Right — sir, listen — I’m going to knock on a door, find a place you can stay — then I can run and get Madam

Session-896.Scene: Rosmerta spotted Harry Apparating as she drew her bedroom curtains.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He’s hurt, Madam Rosmerta, can he come into the Three Broomsticks while I go up to the school and get help for him?
If you help me support him,
Accio Rosmerta’s Brooms!

Session-897.Scene: Dumbledore, with a blackened hand, instructed Harry to summon Severus.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What does it mean? Is it the real Mark? Has someone definitely been — Professor?
But —

Session-898.Scene: Harry desperately wanted to bring Snape and Dumbledore together, believing it could somehow reverse Dumbledore's fate.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Petrificus Totalus!
Petrificus Totalus!
Impedimenta!

Session-899.Scene: Snape prevented Harry from completing the Cruciatus Curse twice by blocking his spell.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Neville, are you — ?
I know, I’m on it!
Out of the way! not Hagrid . . . not Hagrid too . . . Impedimenta! Stupefy!
Cruc —
Cruc —
Incarc — Fight back! Fight back, you cowardly —
Stupe —
Impedi —
Sectum — ! Levi —
Kill me then, Kill me like you killed him, you coward —
Hagrid, HAGRID?

Session-900.Scene: Hagrid dismissed Harry's claim about Snape, assuming Harry was confused due to a head injury.

Dialogue.Dialogue: M’all right, Are you?
We should put out your house, the charm’s ‘Aguamenti’ . . .
Aguamenti! Aguamenti!
Hagrid . . .
not Hagrid . . . not Hagrid too . . .
Hagrid, Hagrid, he killed . . .
Dumbledore, Snape killed . . . Dumbledore.
He . . . Snape killed him.
I saw it happen.
I saw it, Hagrid.

Session-901.Scene: Ginny led Harry away from Dumbledore's side, guiding him back into the castle with a comforting hand.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No No.
No No.
I’m not hurt,
Ginny, who else is dead?
But the Dark Mark — Malfoy said he stepped over a body —
Are you sure?
But the others . . . There were other bodies on the ground. . . .

Session-902.Scene: Madam Pomfrey declared that no charm could heal the werewolf bites on Bill.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m fine. . . . How’s Bill? Can’t you fix them with a charm or something?
But he wasn’t bitten at the full moon, Greyback hadn’t transformed, so surely Bill won’t be a — a real — ?
Dumbledore might know something that’d work, though, Where is he? Bill fought those maniacs on Dumbledore’s orders, Dumbledore owes him, he can’t leave him in this state —

Snape killed him, I was there, I saw it. We arrived back on the Astronomy Tower because that’s where the Mark was. . . . Dumbledore was ill, he was weak, but I think he realized it was a trap when we heard footsteps running up the stairs. He immobilized me, I couldn’t do anything, I was under the Invisibility Cloak — and then Malfoy came through the door and disarmed him — — more Death Eaters arrived — and then Snape — and Snape did it. The Avada Kedavra.

Session-903.Scene: McGonagall sent Filius to fetch Snape, unknowingly alerting him to the ongoing events at the castle.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Snape killed Dumbledore,
I know, Snape passed Voldemort the information that made Voldemort hunt down my mum and dad.
And he didn’t think my mother was worth a damn either, because she was Muggle-born. . . . ‘Mudblood,’ he called her. . . .
So when he arrived at the fight, he joined in on the Death Eaters’ side?
I know, So they got in through the Room of Requirement.

I messed up, Harry, We did like you told us: We checked the Marauder’s Map and we couldn’t see Malfoy on it, so we thought he must be in the Room of Requirement, so me, Ginny, and Neville went to keep watch on it . . . but Malfoy got past us.
His Hand of Glory, Gives light only to the holder, remember?
— Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder, Fred and George’s. I’m going to be having a word with them about who they let buy their products.
To set off the Mark?
So if Ron was watching the Room of Requirement with Ginny and Neville, were you — ?

Outside Snape’s office, yes, with Luna. We hung around for ages outside it and nothing happened.. . . We didn’t know what was going on upstairs, Ron had taken the map. . . . It was nearly midnight when Professor Flitwick came sprinting down into the dungeons.He was shouting about Death Eaters in the castle, I don’t think he really registered that Luna and I were there at all, he just burst his way into Snape’s office
What?

We went into his office to see if we could help Professor Flitwick and found him unconscious on the floor . . . and oh, it’s so obvious now, Snape must have Stupefied Flitwick, but we didn’t realize, Harry, we didn’t realize, we just let Snape go!”
None of us could break through, and that massive Death Eater was still firing off jinxes all over the place, they were bouncing off the walls and barely missing us. . . .
What? but to help them, not to stop them . . . and I’ll bet you had to have a Dark Mark to get through that barrier — so what happened when he came back down?
He’d done what he’d meant to do.

Session-904.Scene: Fleur declared that it would take more than a werewolf to stop Bill from being loved by her.

Dialogue.Dialogue: “See you in a bit”

Session-905.Scene: Madam Rosmerta had been imperiused, aiding Malfoy and the Death Eaters.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I can’t tell you that, Professor,
It is, very, but he didn’t want me to tell anyone.
I don’t think so, Professor Dumbledore never told me to stop following his orders if he died.

There’s one thing you should know before the Ministry gets here, though. Madam Rosmerta’s under the Imperius Curse, she was helping Malfoy and the Death Eaters, that’s how the necklace and the poisoned mead —
What about Dumbledore’s funeral?
Then that’s what’ll happen, isn’t it?
And in that case, you shouldn’t send the students home until the funeral’s over. They’ll want to say —
Can I leave, Professor?

Session-906.Scene: Harry confirmed Dumbledore's death to the Fat Lady.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,

Session-907.Scene: Harry presented Ron with a fake locket he had retrieved.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They’re talking about closing the school,
Lupin said they would, So? Did you find one? Did you get it? A — a Horcrux? You didn’t get it? It wasn’t there? “Already taken — ?” R.A.B., but who was that?
We don’t yet know,

Session-908.Scene: Hermione discovered Eileen Prince, Snape's mother, had married a Muggle named Tobias Snape, based on old *Prophet* announcements.

Dialogue.Dialogue: She’s not that bad, Ugly, though,
Anyone else we know died?
No, They’re still looking for Snape but no sign . . .
Of course there isn’t, They won’t find Snape till they find Voldemort, and seeing as they’ve never managed to do that in all this time . . .
Harry, I found something out this morning, in the library.
R.A.B.? . . the cup . . . the snake . . . something of Gryffindor’s or Ravenclaw’s .

No, I’ve been trying, Harry, but I haven’t found anything. . . . There are a couple of reasonably well-known wizards with those initials — Rosalind Antigone Bungs . . . Rupert ‘Axebanger’ Brookstanton . . . but they don’t seem to fit at all. Judging by that note, the person who stole the Horcrux knew Voldemort, and I can’t find a shred of evidence that Bungs or Axebanger ever had anything to do with him. . . . No, actually, it’s about . . . well, Snape.
What about him?
Well, it’s just that I was sort of right about the Half-Blood Prince business,
D’you have to rub it in, Hermione? How d’you think I feel about that now?
No — no — Harry, I didn’t mean that! It’s just that I was right about Eileen Prince once owning the book. You see . . . she was Snape’s mother!
I thought she wasn’t much of a looker,

I was going through the rest of the old Prophets and there was a tiny announcement about Eileen Prince marrying a man called Tobias Snape, and then later an announcement saying that she’d given birth to a —
— murderer,
Well . . . yes, So . . . I was sort of right. Snape must have been proud of being ‘half a Prince,’ you see? Tobias Snape was a Muggle from what it said in the Prophet.

Yeah, that fits, He’d play up the pure-blood side so he could get in with Lucius Malfoy and the rest of them. . . . He’s just like Voldemort. Pure-blood mother, Muggle father . . . ashamed of his parentage, trying to make himself feared using the Dark Arts, gave himself an impressive new name — Lord Voldemort — the Half-Blood Prince — how could Dumbledore have missed — ?
I still don’t get why he didn’t turn you in for using that book, He must’ve known where you were getting it all from.

He knew, He knew when I used Sectumsempra.  He didn’t really need Legilimency.. . . He might even have known before then, with Slughorn talking about how brilliant I was at Potions. . . . Shouldn’t have left his old book in the bottom of that cupboard, should he?
But why didn’t he turn you in?

I don’t think he wanted to associate himself with that book, I don’t think Dumbledore would have liked it very much if he’d known. And even if Snape pretended it hadn’t been his, Slughorn would have recognized his writing at once. Anyway, the book was left in Snape’s old classroom, and I’ll bet Dumbledore knew his mother was called ‘Prince. ’
I should’ve shown the book to Dumbledore, All that time he was showing me how Voldemort was evil even when he was at school, and I had proof Snape was too —
‘Evil’ is a strong word,
You were the one who kept telling me the book was dangerous!
I’m trying to say, Harry, that you’re putting too much blame on yourself. I thought the Prince seemed to have a nasty sense of humor, but I would never have guessed he was a potential killer. . . .
None of us could’ve guessed Snape would . . . you know,

Session-909.Scene: Harry told Ginny that they needed to end their relationship to protect her from Voldemort.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No,
What do you want?
What do you want?
Whose word?
Glad to hear it, Well, where I went with Dumbledore and what we did is my business. He didn’t want people to know.
He will only be gone from the school when none here are loyal to him,
I am not saying he can. You wouldn’t understand. But I’ve got nothing to tell you.
Voldemort wants to kill me himself, and Aurors won’t stop him. So thanks for the offer, but no thanks.
What request? Oh yeah . . . the one where I tell the world what a great job you’re doing in exchange for —
Released Stan Shunpike yet?
Dumbledore’s man through and through, That’s right.

Session-910.Scene: Harry folded the obituary and tucked it into a book of defensive magic.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What do you see when you look in the mirror?
Lies!

Session-911.Scene: Uncle Vernon repeatedly packed and unpacked the car, changing his mind every twenty-four hours.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes?
What a surprise,
Some of ‘my lot,’ right,
The house? What house?
The house? A plot to get this house? Are you actually as stupid as you look?
Just in case you’ve forgotten, I’ve already got a house, my godfather left me one. So why would I want this one? All the happy memories?

— Voldemort, and we’ve been through this about a hundred times already. This isn’t a claim, it’s fact, Dumbledore told you last year, and Kingsley and Mr. Weasley — — Kingsley and Mr. Weasley explained it all as well, Once I’m seventeen, the protective charm that keeps me safe will break, and that exposes you as well as me. The Order is sure Voldemort will target you, whether to torture you to try and find out where I am, or because he thinks by holding you hostage I’d come and try to rescue you. You’ve got to go into hiding and the Order wants to help. You’re being offered serious protection, the best there is.
There is,
You heard what Mr. Weasley and Kingsley said, We think the Ministry has been infiltrated.
As I’ve told you, Kingsley is protecting the Mug — I mean, your Prime Minister.
Well, he’s taken,

These accidents aren’t accidents — the crashes and explosions and derailments and whatever else has happened since we last watched the news. People are disappearing and dying and he’s behind it — Voldemort. I’ve told you this over and over again, he kills Muggles for fun. Even the fogs — they’re caused by dementors, and if you can’t remember what they are, ask your son!
More? More? More than the two that attacked us, you mean? Of course there are, there are hundreds, maybe thousands by this time, seeing as they feed off fear and despair —

I hope so, because once I’m seventeen, all of them — Death Eaters, dementors, maybe even Inferi — which means dead bodies enchanted by a Dark wizard — will be able to find you and will certainly attack you. And if you remember the last time you tried to outrun wizards, I think you’ll agree you need help.
Don’t you understand? They will torture and kill you like they did my parents!
Dudley, for the first time in your life, you’re talking sense. They’ll be here in about five minutes,

Session-912.Scene: Dudley surprised everyone by expressing that he did not think Harry was a waste of space.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Thanks, Dedalus, It’s really good of you to do this . . . They’re through here, my aunt and uncle and cousin. . . .
What d’you mean? I thought Mad-Eye was going to come and take me by Side-Along-Apparition?
There’s no need,
Not in the slightest,
It’s fine, It doesn’t matter, honestly.
Er — no, they don’t, They think I’m a waste of space, actually, but I’m used to —
Well . . . er . . . thanks, Dudley.
Not really, It was your soul the dementor would have taken. . . .
Yeah, but coming from Dudley that’s like ‘I love you,’
Oh, right. Thanks.
I hope everything’s okay,
Dudley, did the dementors blow a different personality into you?
Yeah . . .
Good-bye,

Session-913.Scene: Moody arrived with bulging sacks, surprising Harry with the larger-than-expected group.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Definitely, But I wasn’t expecting this many of you!

Session-914.Scene: Tonks revealed her marriage by wiggling her left hand to show Harry her ring.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Kingsley, I thought you were looking after the Muggle Prime Minister?
You got married?
That’s brilliant, congrat —
I don’t —
So what are we going to do?
Yeah,
Er — yes, Maybe they won’t know which of the twelve secure houses I’m heading for at first, but won’t it be sort of obvious oncefourteen of us fly off toward Tonks’s parents’?
No! No way!
I told them you’d take it like this,
If you think I’m going to let six people risk their lives — !
— because it’s the first time for all of us,
This is different, pretending to be me —
You can’t do it if I don’t cooperate, you need me to give you some hair.
Funny, really amusing.
But this is mad, there’s no need —
So, Potter — some of your hair, if you please.
Harry glanced at Ron, who grimaced at him in a just-do-it sort of way.
Ooh, you look much tastier than Crabbe and Goyle, Harry, Oh, you know what I mean — Goyle’s potion looked like bogies.
I knew Ginny was lying about that tattoo,
Harry, your eyesight really is awful,
Why’m I with you?
That’s great,
Is this it? Is this Sirius’s bike?

Session-915.Scene: Hedwig died from a burst of green light while trapped inside her cage on the motorbike.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No — HEDWIG! No — NO! Hedwig — Hedwig — Hagrid, we’ve got to go back, we’ve got to go back! Hagrid, TURN AROUND!
Hagrid! No! Let me! REPARO!
Impedimenta!
Confringo!
It’s not a problem, just keep flying! Expelliarmus!
I don’t know! Hagrid, do the dragon-fire thing again, let’s get out of here!
Hagrid! Hagrid — Accio Hagrid!

Session-916.Scene: Ted Tonks healed Harry's ribs, tooth, and arm after the crash.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid? Hagrid? Hagrid, talk to me —
He crawled out of the pond and stumbled toward the great dark mass on the ground that was Hagrid. Hagrid?
Voldemort —
No, Death Eaters, loads of them — we were chased —
They knew,
Yeah, me too. I can’t believe — You!
Oh, I’m — I’m sorry. I —

Session-917.Scene: Harry felt responsible for the fear he instilled in Mrs. Tonks due to the uncertain fate of the plan's participants.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don’t know, We don’t know what happened to anyone else. The Portkey, We’ve got to get back to the Burrow and find out — then we’ll be able to send you word, or — or Tonks will, once she’s —
Yeah, we do, I — I — I — I’ll tell Tonks — Dora — to send word, when she . . . Thanks for patching us up, thanks for everything. I —
Thanks,
She . . . she got hit,

Session-918.Scene: Harry felt grief and shame about Hedwig's death during the flight.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What d’you mean? Isn’t anyone else back? The Death Eaters were waiting for us, We were surrounded the moment we took off — they knew it was tonight — I don’t know what happened to anyone else, four of them chased us, it was all we could do to get away, and then Voldemort caught up with us —

Session-919.Scene: George, despite losing his ear, lightened the mood with a pun about being "holey."

Dialogue.Dialogue: The last words Albus Dumbledore spoke to the pair of us?
Fly, I saw him too, he came after Hagrid and me.
Stan? But I thought he was in Azkaban?
Lost an — ?
Snape?
How is he?
Yeah, Thank God.
Hermione and Kingsley,
Yeah, I am,

Session-920.Scene: Mad-Eye's death and Mundungus' disappearance prompted immediate suspicion of betrayal among the gathered group.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, I mean . . . if somebody made a mistake, and let something slip, I know they didn’t mean to do it. It’s not their fault, We’ve got to trust each other. I trust all of you, I don’t think anyone in this room would ever sell me to Voldemort.
You think I’m a fool?

Session-921.Scene: Harry felt blackmailed by the others' efforts to keep him safe, intensifying his desire to leave.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ve got to go too,
I can’t stay here. You’re all in danger while I’m here. I don’t want —
If Voldemort finds out I’m here —
It’s not me I’m worried for!
I know that —
I KNOW!
It wasn’t me, It was my wand. My wand acted of its own accord.
But that’s impossible, Harry. You mean that you did magic without meaning to; you reacted instinctively.

No, The bike was falling, I couldn’t have told you where Voldemort was, but my wand spun in my hand and found him and shot a spell at him, and it wasn’t even a spell I recognized. I’ve never made gold flames appear before.
It wasn’t like that,

Session-922.Scene: Ron cautioned Harry about Mrs. Weasley's relentless attempts to uncover their mission.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Well, you can’t do anything about thetill you’re seventeen. You’ve still got the Trace on you. And we can plan here as well as anywhere, can’t we? Or, d’you reckon you already know where the You-Know-Whats are?
No,
I think Hermione’s been doing a bit of research, She said she was saving it for when you got here.
The Trace’ll break on the thirty-first, That means I only need to stay here four days. Then I can —
Five days, We’ve got to stay for the wedding. They’ll kill us if we miss it. It’s one extra day,
Don’t they realize how important — ?

No, They haven’t got a clue. And now you mention it, I wanted to talk to you about that. Mum’s been trying to get it out of Hermione and me. What we’re off to do. She’ll try you next, so brace yourself. Dad and Lupin’ve both asked as well, but when we said Dumbledore told you not to tell anyone except us, they dropped it. Not Mum, though. She’s determined.

Session-923.Scene: Harry returned a sock patterned with golden bulrushes, clarifying it wasn't his due to his lack of support for Puddlemere United.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh, Well, yeah. We are.
Well, Dumbledore left me . . . stuff to do, Ron and Hermione know about it, and they want to come too.
I’m sorry, I can’t —
Dumbledore didn’t want anyone else to know, Mrs. Weasley. I’m sorry. Ron and Hermione don’t have to come, it’s their choice —
I didn’t misunderstand, It’s got to be me. And that’s not mine, I don’t support Puddlemere United.

Session-924.Scene: Ginny inferred that Harry, Ron, and Hermione were plotting something secret due to Mrs. Weasley's efforts to keep them separated.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No — I — of course not,
And then what does she think’s going to happen? Someone else might kill off Voldemort while she’s holding us here making vol-au-vents?
I — not — I was joking,

Session-925.Scene: Mad-Eye cast curses to prevent Snape from entering the headquarters and revealing its location.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But surely Snape will have told the Death Eaters the address by now?

Session-926.Scene: Harry gripped his knife, revealing the stark white scars on his hand.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No news about Mad-Eye?

And they still haven’t called a hearing about all the underage magic I used escaping the Death Eaters? Because they know I had no choice or because they don’t want me to tell the world Voldemort attacked me?
Yeah, why tell the public the truth?
Isn’t anyone at the Ministry prepared to stand up to him?

Session-927.Scene: Hermione modified her parents' memories, convincing them they were Wendell and Monica Wilkins with a life ambition to move to Australia.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m doing it, I’m doing — ! Oh, it’s you,
Hi, Harry,
And how did you manage to get away?
Oh, Ron’s mum forgot that she asked Ginny and me to change the sheets yesterday,
We were just talking about Mad-Eye, I reckon he might have survived.
But Bill saw him hit by the Killing Curse,
Yeah, but Bill was under attack too, How can he be sure what he saw?
Even if the Killing Curse missed, Mad-Eye still fell about a thousand feet,
He could have used a Shield Charm —
Fleur said his wand was blasted out of his hand,
Well, all right, if you want him to be dead,
Of course we don’t want him to be dead! It’s dreadful that he’s dead! But we’re being realistic!
The Death Eaters probably tidied up after themselves, that’s why no one’s found him,
Yeah, Like Barty Crouch, turned into a bone and buried in Hagrid’s front garden. They probably transfigured Moody and stuffed him —
Don’t!
Oh, Hermione, I wasn’t trying to upset —
Tergeo.
Oh . . . thanks, Ron. . . . I’m sorry. . . . It’s just so awf-ful, isn’t it? R-right after Dumbledore . . . I j-just n-never imagined Mad-Eye dying, somehow, he seemed so tough!
Yeah, But you know what he’d say to us if he was here?
‘C-constant vigilance,’
That’s right, He’d tell us to learn from what happened to him. And what I’ve learned is not to trust that cowardly little squit, Mundungus.
I’m sorry, I’m sorry!
What are you doing with all those books anyway?
Just trying to decide which ones to take with us, said Hermione. When we’re looking for the Horcruxes.
Oh, of course, I forgot we’ll be hunting down Voldemort in a mobile library.
Ha ha, I wonder . . . will we need to translate runes? It’s possible. . . . I think we’d better take it, to be safe.
Listen, I know you said after Dumbledore’s funeral that you wanted to come with me,
Here he goes,
As we knew he would, You know, I think I will take Hogwarts: A History. Even if we’re not going back there, I don’t think I’d feel right if I didn’t have it with —
Listen!
No, Harry, you listen, We’re coming with you. That was decided months ago — years, really.
But —
Shut up,
— are you sure you’ve thought this through?

Let’s see, I’ve also modified my parents’ memories so that they’re convinced they’re really called Wendell and Monica Wilkins, and that their life’s ambition is to move to Australia, which they have now done. That’s to make it more difficult for Voldemort to track them down and interrogate them about me — or you, because unfortunately, I’ve told them quite a bit about you. Assuming I survive our hunt for the Horcruxes, I’ll find Mum and Dad and lift the enchantment. If I don’t — well, I think I’ve cast a good enough charm to keep them safe and happy. Wendell and Monica Wilkins don’t know that they’ve got a daughter, you see.
I — Hermione, I’m sorry — I didn’t —
Didn’t realize that Ron and I know perfectly well what might happen if we come with you? Well, we do. Ron, show Harry what you’ve done.
Nah, he’s just eaten,
Go on, he needs to know!
Oh, all right. Harry, come here. C’mon.
Why?

Session-928.Scene: Hermione secretly summoned forbidden books from Dumbledore's study shortly after his funeral to research Horcruxes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Descendo,
That’s your ghoul, isn’t it?
That’s right, Come and have a look at him.
But it . . . it looks . . . do ghouls normally wear pajamas?
No, Nor have they usually got red hair or that number of pustules. He’s me, see?
No, I don’t.

I’ll explain it back in my room, the smell’s getting to me, Once we’ve left, the ghoul’s going to come and live down here in my room, I think he’s really looking forward to it — well, it’s hard to tell, because all he can do is moan and drool — but he nods a lot when you mention it. Anyway, he’s going to be me with spattergroit. Good, eh? It is! Look, when we three don’t turn up at Hogwarts again, everyone’s going to think Hermione and I must be with you, right? Which means the Death Eaters will go straight for our families to see if they’ve got information on where you are.
But hopefully it’ll look like I’ve gone away with Mum and Dad; a lot of Muggle-borns are talking about going into hiding at the moment,

We can’t hide my whole family, it’ll look too fishy and they can’t all leave their jobs, So we’re going to put out the story that I’m seriously ill with spattergroit, which is why I can’t go back to school. If anyone comes calling to investigate, Mum or Dad can show them the ghoul in my bed, covered in pustules. Spattergroit’s really contagious, so they’re not going to want to go near him. It won’t matter that he can’t say anything, either, because apparently you can’t once the fungus has spread to your uvula.
And your mum and dad are in on this plan?

Mum . . . well, you’ve seen what she’s like. She won’t accept we’re going till we’ve gone. Ginny’s probably left a speck of dust on a poxy napkin ring, I dunno why the Delacours have got to come two days before the wedding.
Fleur’s sister’s a bridesmaid, she needs to be here for the rehearsal, and she’s too young to come on her own,
Well, guests aren’t going to help Mum’s stress levels,
What we really need to decide, is where we’re going after we leave here.
If we knew where any of the Horcruxes were, I’d agree with you,
Don’t you think there’s a possibility that Voldemort’s keeping a watch on Godric’s Hollow? He might expect you to go back and visit your parents’ graves once you’re free to go wherever you like?
This R.A.B. person, You know, the one who stole the real locket? He said in his note he was going to destroy it, didn’t he? Yeah,
Or she,
Whichever, it’d be one less for us to do!
Yeah, to find out whether or not it’s destroyed.
And once we get hold of it, how do you destroy a Horcrux?
Well, I’ve been researching that.
How? I didn’t think there were any books on Horcruxes in the library?
There weren’t, Dumbledore removed them all, but he — he didn’t destroy them.
How in the name of Merlin’s pants have you managed to get your hands on those Horcrux books?

It — it wasn’t stealing! They were still library books, even if Dumbledore had taken them off the shelves. Anyway, if he really didn’t want anyone to get at them, I’m sure he would have made it much harder to —
Get to the point!
Well . . . it was easy, I just did a Summoning Charm. You know — Accio. And — they zoomed out of Dumbledore’s study window right into the girls’ dormitory.
But when did you do this?

Just after his — Dumbledore’s — funeral, Right after we agreed we’d leave school and go and look for the Horcruxes. When I went back upstairs to get my things it — it just occurred to me that the more we knew about them, the better it would be . . . and I was alone in there . . . so I tried .. . and it worked. They flew straight in through the open window and I — I packed them. I can’t believe Dumbledore would have been angry, it’s not as though we’re going to use the information to make a Horcrux, is it?
Can you hear us complaining? Where are these books anyway?

This is the one that gives explicit instructions on how to make a Horcrux. Secrets of the Darkest Art — it’s a horrible book, really awful, full of evil magic. I wonder when Dumbledore removed it from the library. . . . If he didn’t do it until he was headmaster, I bet Voldemort got all the instruction he needed from here.
Why did he have to ask Slughorn how to make a Horcrux, then, if he’d already read that?

He only approached Slughorn to find out what would happen if you split your soul into seven, Dumbledore was sure Riddle already knew how to make a Horcrux by the time he asked Slughorn about them. I think you’re right, Hermione, that could easily have been where he got the information.

And the more I’ve read about them, the more horrible they seem, and the less I can believe that he actually made six. It warns in this book how unstable you make the rest of your soul by ripping it, and that’s just by making one Horcrux!
Isn’t there any way of putting yourself back together?
Yes, but it would be excruciatingly painful.
Why? How do you do it?
Remorse, You’ve got to really feel what you’ve done. There’s a footnote. Apparently the pain of it can destroy you. I can’t see Voldemort attempting it somehow, can you?
That’s right, So does it say how to destroy Horcruxes in that book?

Yes, because it warns Dark wizards how strong they have to make the enchantments on them. From all that I’ve read, what Harry did to Riddle’s diary was one of the few really foolproof ways of destroying a Horcrux.
What, stabbing it with a basilisk fang?
Oh well, lucky we’ve got such a large supply of basilisk fangs, then, I was wondering what we were going to do with them.
It doesn’t have to be a basilisk fang, It has to be something so destructive that the Horcrux can’t repair itself. Basilisk venom only has one antidote, and it’s incredibly rare —
— phoenix tears,

Exactly, Our problem is that there are very few substances as destructive as basilisk venom, and they’re all dangerous to carry around with you. That’s a problem we’re going to have to solve, though, because ripping, smashing, or crushing a Horcrux won’t do the trick. You’ve got to put it beyond magical repair.
But even if we wreck the thing it lives in, why can’t the bit of soul in it just go and live in something else?
Because a Horcrux is the complete opposite of a human being. Look, if I picked up a sword right now, Ron, and ran you through with it, I wouldn’t damage your soul at all.
Which would be a real comfort to me, I’m sure,

But my point is that whatever happens to your body, your soul will survive, untouched, But it’s the other way round with a Horcrux. The fragment of soul inside it depends on its container, its enchanted body, for survival. It can’t exist without it.
That diary sort of died when I stabbed it,

And once the diary was properly destroyed, the bit of soul trapped in it could no longer exist. Ginny tried to get rid of the diary before you did, flushing it away, but obviously it came back good as new.
Hang on, The bit of soul in that diary was possessing Ginny, wasn’t it? How does that work, then?

While the magical container is still intact, the bit of soul inside it can flit in and out of someone if they get too close to the object. I don’t mean holding it for too long, it’s nothing to do with touching it, I mean close emotionally. Ginny poured her heart out into that diary, she made herself incredibly vulnerable. You’re in trouble if you get too fond of or dependent on the Horcrux.
I wonder how Dumbledore destroyed the ring? Why didn’t I ask him? I never really . . .

Session-929.Scene: Hermione's abrupt departure scattered books across the room.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh yes, we will . . . we’re sorry . . .
It’s like being a house-elf, Except without the job satisfaction. The sooner this wedding’s over, the happier I’ll be.
Yeah, then we’ll have nothing to do except find Horcruxes. . . . It’ll be like a holiday, won’t it?

Session-930.Scene: Mrs. Weasley requested Harry's birthday celebration preferences amidst wedding preparations.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But she still won’t leave us alone!
I’m sorry,
I don’t want a fuss, Really, Mrs. Weasley, just a normal dinner would be fine. . . . It’s the day before the wedding. . . .
That’d be great, But please don’t go to loads of trouble.

Session-931.Scene: Harry awoke from a dream in which he repeatedly muttered the name "Gregorovitch".

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oi, wake up. You were muttering in your sleep.
Was I?
’ You kept saying ‘Gregorovitch. ’
Who’s Gregorovitch?
I dunno, do I? You were the one saying it.
I think Voldemort’s looking for him.
Poor bloke,
I think he’s abroad.
Who?
It didn’t look like anywhere in Britain.
You reckon you were seeing into his mind again?

Do me a favor and don’t tell Hermione, Although how she expects me to stop seeing stuff in my sleep . . . I think, he’s got something to do with Quidditch. There’s some connection, but I can’t — I can’t think what it is.
Quidditch? Sure you’re not thinking of Gorgovitch?
Who, Gregorovitch?
Dragomir Gorgovitch, Chaser, transferred to the Chudley Cannons for a record fee two years ago. Record holder for most Quaffle drops in a season.
No, I’m definitely not thinking of Gorgovitch.
I try not to either, Well, happy birthday anyway.
Wow — that’s right, I forgot! I’m seventeen! Accio Glasses!
Slick, I’d do your fly by hand, though, Here’s your present. Unwrap it up here, it’s not for my mother’s eyes.
A book? Bit of a departure from tradition, isn’t it?

This isn’t your average book, It’s pure gold: Twelve Fail-Safe Ways to Charm Witches. Explains everything you need to know about girls. If only I’d had this last year I’d have known exactly how to get rid of Lavender and I would’ve known how to get going with . . . Well, Fred and George gave me a copy, and I’ve learned a lot. You’d be surprised, it’s not all about wandwork, either.

Session-932.Scene: Ginny gifted Harry a passionate kiss as a birthday present.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah . . . thanks. Nice view, he said feebly, pointing toward the window.
I think dating opportunities are going to be pretty thin on the ground, to be honest.
Oh, Sorry.
Ron!
I’ll see you later,

Session-933.Scene: Harry envisioned Ginny marrying a faceless stranger, which emphasized his perceived inability to offer her a normal future.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You ditched her. What are you doing now, messing her around?
I’m not messing her around,
Ron —
She was really cut up when you ended it — Yeah, but you go snogging her now and she’s just going to get her hopes up again —
She’s not an idiot, she knows it can’t happen, she’s not expecting us to — to end up married, or —
If you keep groping her every chance you get —
It won’t happen again, Okay?
Right then, well, that’s . . . yeah.

Session-934.Scene: Mrs. Weasley magically floated Harry's birthday cake to the table.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That looks amazing, Mrs. Weasley.

Session-935.Scene: Ginny kissed Harry with unprecedented passion in her bedroom.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Vaguely, Didn’t you smash down the front door, give Dudley a pig’s tail, and tell me I was a wizard?
We’re fine, How are you?
Hagrid, thanks!
How can you tell?

Session-936.Scene: Scrimgeour noticed a giant Snitch cake at the party.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yeah . . . thanks.
Us? Why us?

Session-937.Scene: Scrimgeour singed a hole in Harry's T-shirt with his wand during a heated argument.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We’re not going anywhere, You can speak to us together, or not at all.
A-all of us? Me and Hermione too?
Us?

Isn’t it obvious? They wanted to examine whatever he’s left us. You had no right to do that! That law was created to stop wizards passing on Dark artifacts, and the Ministry is supposed to have powerful evidence that the deceased’s possessions are illegal before seizing them! Are you telling me that you thought Dumbledore was trying to pass us something cursed?
No, I’m hoping to do some good in the world!
So why have you decided to let us have our things now? Can’t think of a pretext to keep them?
No, it’ll be because the thirty-one days are up, They can’t keep the objects longer than that unless they can prove they’re dangerous. Right?
Me? Not — not really . . . It was always Harry who . . .
Ron looked around at Harry and Hermione, to see Hermione giving him a stop-talking-now! sort of look, but the damage was done:
I . . . dunno, I . . . when I say we weren’t close . . . I mean, I think he liked me. . . .
You’re being modest, Ron, Dumbledore was very fond of you.
Put out lights, I s’pose, What else could I do with it?
He . . . he knew I liked books,
I don’t know. He must have thought I’d enjoy it.
No, I didn’t, And if the Ministry hasn’t found any hidden codes in this book in thirty-one days, I doubt that I will.
No idea, For the reasons you just read out, I suppose . . . to remind me what you can get if you . . . persevere and whatever it was.
I suppose so, What else could it be?
Oh, it can’t be a reference to the fact Harry’s a great Seeker, that’s way too obvious, There must be a secret message from Dumbledore hidden in the icing!
Because Snitches have flesh memories,
No,
That was dramatic,
That’s all, then, is it?
What?
So where is it?
It belongs to Harry! It chose him, he was the one who found it, it came to him out of the Sorting Hat —
Me? Maybe he thought it would look nice on my wall.

Was I? Has anyone ever tried sticking a sword in Voldemort? Maybe the Ministry should put some people onto that, instead of wasting their time stripping down Deluminators or covering up breakouts from Azkaban. So is this what you’ve been doing, Minister, shut up in your office, trying to break open a Snitch? People are dying — I was nearly one of them — Voldemort chased me across three counties, he killed Mad-Eye Moody, but there’s been no word about any of that from the Ministry, has there? And you still expect us to cooperate with you!
Oi!
No! D’you want to give him an excuse to arrest us?
It’s time you earned it,

Session-938.Scene: Fact: Harry reminded Scrimgeour of his imposed detentions at Hogwarts by revealing the scarred message on his hand.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don’t like your methods, Minister, Remember?
To give us what Dumbledore left us, They’ve only just released the contents of his will.

Session-939.Scene: Ron surprised Hermione by knowing of "Babbitty Rabbitty and her Cackling Stump," a story she and Harry, raised by Muggles, had never heard.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Meet us upstairs, After everyone’s gone to bed.
Muffliato,
Thought you didn’t approve of that spell?
Times change, Now, show us that Deluminator. The thing is, we could have achieved that with Peruvian Instant Darkness Powder.
Still, it’s cool, And from what they said, Dumbledore invented it himself!
I know, but surely he wouldn’t have singled you out in his will just to help us turn out the lights!
D’you think he knew the Ministry would confiscate his will and examine everything he’d left us? asked Harry.
Definitely, He couldn’t tell us in the will why he was leaving us these things, but that still doesn’t explain . . .
Right?
Well, exactly, If these things are important enough to pass on right under the nose of the Ministry, you’d think he’d have let us know why . . . unless he thought it was obvious?
Was I? I always said he was mental. Brilliant and everything, but cracked. Leaving Harry an old Snitch — what the hell was that about?
No, When Scrimgeour made you take it, Harry, I was so sure that something was going to happen!
Yeah, well, I wasn’t going to try too hard in front of Scrimgeour, was I?
What do you mean?
The Snitch I caught in my first ever Quidditch match? Don’t you remember?
That was the one you nearly swallowed!
Exactly,
Writing! There’s writing on it, quick, look!
I open at the close . . . at the close . . . I open at the close . . .
And the sword, Why did he want Harry to have the sword?
And why couldn’t he just have told me? It was there, it was right there on the wall of his office during all our talks last year! If he wanted me to have it, why didn’t he just give it to me then?
And as for this book, The Tales of Beedle the Bard . . . I’ve never even heard of them!
You’ve never heard of The Tales of Beedle the Bard? You’re kidding, right?
No, I’m not! Do you know them, then?
Was I? All the old kids’ stories are supposed to be Beedle’s, aren’t they?  ‘The Fountain of Fair Fortune’ ...  ‘Babbitty Rabbitty and her Cackling Stump’ . . .
What? What was that last one?
Come off it!
Ron, you know full well Harry and I were brought up by Muggles! We didn’t hear stories like that when we were little, we heard ‘Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs’ and ‘Cinderella’ —
What’s that, an illness?
So these are children’s stories?
Yeah, I mean, that’s just what you hear, you know, that all these old stories came from Beedle. I dunno what they’re like in the original versions.
But I wonder why Dumbledore thought I should read them?
Probably just Charlie, now Mum’s asleep, sneaking off to regrow his hair,
All the same, we should get to bed, It wouldn’t do to oversleep tomorrow.
No, A brutal triple murder by the bridegroom’s mother might put a bit of a damper on the wedding. I’ll get the lights.

Session-940.Scene: Hagrid accidentally destroyed five seats after misinterpreting Fred's directions.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s fine, I understand,
Yes, Isn’t she with you?
Ours do know a lot of excellent swear words, but I think Fred and George taught them those.

Session-941.Scene: Luna explained to Harry that her father thought wearing sun colors brought luck to weddings.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — my name’s Barny,
How did you know — ?
Really? Are you sure you don’t want to put anything on that bite, though?

Session-942.Scene: Hermione dropped her beaded bag with a surprising thump upon Viktor's unexpected arrival.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Viktor! I didn’t know you were — goodness — it’s lovely to see — how are you?
How come you’re here?
Cousin,
Did you see he’s grown a stupid little beard?

Session-943.Scene: Krum revealed that Grindelwald carved his symbol into a wall at Durmstrang when he was a pupil.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Er — sort of,
Barny Weasley.
No, I only met him today. Why?
Sign?
Grindelwald . . . the Dark wizard Dumbledore defeated?
Are you — er — quite sure it’s Grindelwald’s — ?

Well,  there’s a chance that Xenophilius doesn’t actually know what the symbol means., The Lovegoods are quite . . . unusual. He could easily have picked it up somewhere and think it’s a cross section of the head of a Crumple-Horned Snorkack or something.
Well, I don’t know what they are, but apparently he and his daughter go on holiday looking for them. . . . That’s her,
Probably trying to get rid of a Wrackspurt, Gregorovitch!
He’s a wandmaker!
He made your wand! That’s why I thought — Quidditch —
I . . . I read it somewhere, I think, In a — a fan magazine,
So . . . er . . . where is Gregorovitch these days?

Session-944.Scene: Elphias offered Harry champagne out of honor and nervous excitement.

Dialogue.Dialogue: May I sit down?
Mr. Doge, I’m Harry Potter.
I saw the obituary you wrote for the Daily Prophet, I didn’t realize you knew Professor Dumbledore so well.
Speaking of the Daily Prophet . . . I don’t know whether you saw, Mr. Doge — ?
Elphias, I don’t know whether you saw the interview Rita Skeeter gave about Dumbledore?
well Rita Skeeter hinted that Professor Dumbledore was involved in the Dark Arts when he was young.

Session-945.Scene: Harry impersonated a Muggle boy named Barny to blend in with the Weasley relatives at the wedding.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What do you mean? Who said his sister was a Squib? I thought she was ill?
He never told me his sister was a Squib,
’ What is this?
Bathilda Bagshot? The author of A History of Magic?
Bathilda Bagshot lives in Godric’s Hollow?

Session-946.Scene: Hermione had secretly packed essentials, including clothes and the Invisibility Cloak, in her beaded handbag using an Undetectable Extension Charm.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Ron! Ron, where are you? Ron!
Ron! Ron!
Where are we?
Tottenham Court Road, Walk, just walk, we need to find somewhere for you to change.
Hermione, we haven’t got anything to change into,
Why didn’t I make sure I had the Invisibility Cloak with me?
It’s okay, I’ve got the Cloak, I’ve got clothes for both of you, Just try and act naturally until — this will do.
When you say you’ve got the Cloak, and clothes . . .
Yes, they’re here,
How the ruddy hell — ?

Undetectable Extension Charm, Tricky, but I think I’ve done it okay; anyway, I managed to fit everything we need in here. Oh, damn, that’ll be the books, and I had them all stacked by subject. . . . Oh well. . . . Harry, you’d better take the Invisibility Cloak. Ron, hurry up and change. . . .
When did you do all this?

I told you at the Burrow, I’ve had the essentials packed for days, you know, in case we needed to make a quick getaway. I packed your rucksack this morning, Harry, after you changed, and put it in here. . . . I just had a feeling. . . .
You’re amazing, you are,
Thank you, Please, Harry, get that Cloak on!
The others — everyone at the wedding —
We can’t worry about that now, It’s you they’re after, Harry, and we’ll just put everyone in even more danger by going back.
She’s right, Most of the Order was there, they’ll look after everyone.
Yeah.
Come on, I think we ought to keep moving,

Session-947.Scene: Hermione accidentally injured Ron while attempting to free him from binding ropes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Stupefy!
Petrificus Totalus! D-diffindo, Oh, I’m so sorry, Ron, my hand’s shaking! Diffindo!
I should’ve recognized him, he was there the night Dumbledore died,
That’s Dolohov, I recognize him from the old wanted posters. I think the big one’s Thorfinn Rowle.
Never mind what they’re called! How did they find us? What are we going to do?
Lock the door, and Ron, turn out the lights.
What are we going to do with them? Kill them? They’d kill us. They had a good go just now.
We just need to wipe their memories, It’s better like that, it’ll throw them off the scent. If we killed them it’d be obvious we were here.
You’re the boss, But I’ve never done a Memory Charm.
Nor have I, but I know the theory. Obliviate.
Brilliant! Take care of the other one and the waitress while Ron and I clear up.
Clear up? Why?
Don’t you think they might wonder what’s happened if they wake up and find themselves in a place that looks like it’s just been bombed?
Oh right, yeah . . . It’s no wonder I can’t get it out, Hermione, you packed my old jeans, they’re tight.
Oh, I’m so sorry,

Session-948.Scene: Harry suspected that the Death Eaters' discovery of their location stemmed from a Trace on him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But how did they find us? How did they know where we were? You — you don’t think you’ve still got your Trace on you, do you, Harry?
He can’t have, The Trace breaks at seventeen, that’s Wizarding law, you can’t put it on an adult.
As far as you know, What if the Death Eaters have found a way to put it on a seventeen-year-old?
If I can’t use magic, and you can’t use magic near me, without us giving away our position —he began
“We’re not splitting up!”
Grimmauld Place,
Don’t be silly, Harry, Snape can get in there!
Ron’s dad said they’ve put up jinxes against him — and even if they haven’t worked, so what? I swear, I’d like nothing better than to meet Snape!
But —
Hermione, where else is there? It’s the best chance we’ve got. Snape’s only one Death Eater. If I’ve still got the Trace on me, we’ll have whole crowds of them on us wherever else we go.

Session-949.Scene: Hermione suspected someone had entered the house they approached.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I think somebody’s been in here,
That could’ve happened as the Order left,
So where are these jinxes they put up against Snape?
Maybe they’re only activated if he shows up?
Well, we can’t stay here forever,

Session-950.Scene: Harry, Ron, and Hermione experienced the unpleasant sensation of the Tongue-Tying Curse, which was meant for Snape.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We’re not Snape!
That m-must have b-been the T-Tongue-Tying Curse Mad-Eye set up for Snape!
No! No! It wasn’t us! We didn’t kill you —
It’s all r-right. . . . It’s g-gone. . . .
And Grimmauld Place is out if Snape can get in there. . . . I suppose we could try my parents’ house, though I think there’s a chance they might check there. . . . Oh, I wish they’d shut up!
That . . . that was . . . .
Yeah, but it wasn’t really him, was it? Just something to scare Snape.
Before we go any farther, I think we’d better check, Homenum revelio.
Well, you’ve just had a big shock, What was that supposed to do?
It did what I meant it to do! That was a spell to reveal human presence, and there’s nobody here except us!
And old Dusty,

Session-951.Scene: Harry's scar burned intensely, causing him to experience a surge of Voldemort's anger.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Let’s go up,
But — And you’d think, if Harry still had a Trace on him, they’d have followed us here. I know they can’t get in the house, but — what’s up, Harry? What did you see? Did you see him at my place?
No, I just felt anger — he’s really angry —
But that could be at the Burrow, What else? Didn’t you see anything? Was he cursing someone?
No, I just felt anger — I couldn’t tell —
Your scar, again? I thought that connection had closed!
It did, for a while, I — I think it’s started opening again whenever he loses control, that’s how it used to —

But then you’ve got to close your mind! Harry, Dumbledore didn’t want you to use that connection, he wanted you to shut it down, that’s why you were supposed to use Occlumency! Otherwise Voldemort can plant false images in your mind, remember —
Yeah, I do remember, thanks,
They’re all right, they’re all right!
Harry,
It’s not a problem, It’s your family, ’course you’re worried. I’d feel the same way. I do feel the same way.
I don’t want to be on my own. Could we use the sleeping bags I’ve brought and camp in here tonight?
Bathroom,

Session-952.Scene: Voldemort threatened Draco with his own wrath if he failed to punish Rowle.

Dialogue.Dialogue: More, Rowle, or shall we end it and feed you to Nagini? Lord Voldemort is not sure that he will forgive this time. . . . You called me back for this, to tell me that Harry Potter has escaped again? Draco, give Rowle another taste of our displeasure . . . Do it, or feel my wrath yourself!
Harry, I’ve got it here.
Thank you,

Session-953.Scene: Harry unexpectedly located a sign with the initials R.A.B. belonging to Sirius's deceased brother.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hermione, Come back up here.
What’s the matter?
R.A.B. I think I’ve found him.
In your mum’s letter? But I didn’t see — Sirius’s brother?
He was a Death Eater, Sirius told me about him, he joined up when he was really young and then got cold feet and tried to leave — so they killed him.
That fits! If he was a Death Eater he had access to Voldemort, and if he became disenchanted, then he would have wanted to bring Voldemort down! Ron! RON! Get up here, quick!
What’s up? If it’s massive spiders again I want breakfast before I — What? That was Sirius’s brother, wasn’t it?   Regulus Arcturus . . . Regulus . The locket — you don’t reckon — ?
Let’s find out,
Alohomora.

Session-954.Scene: Hermione suddenly recalled an unopenable locket in a drawing-room cabinet from a previous visit.

Dialogue.Dialogue: They’re all about Voldemort, Regulus seems to have been a fan for a few years before he joined the Death Eaters. . . .
He played Seeker,
Why did you come up here anyway? What have you been doing?
He’s sitting in the middle of the front row, that’s where the Seeker . . . Never mind,
There’s an easier way, Accio Locket!
Is that it, then? It’s not here?
Oh, it could still be here, but under counter-enchantments, Charms to prevent it being summoned magically, you know.
Like Voldemort put on the stone basin in the cave,
How are we supposed to find it then?
We search manually,
That’s a good idea,

It could be somewhere else in the house, though, Whether he’d managed to destroy it or not, he’d want to keep it hidden from Voldemort, wouldn’t he? Remember all those awful things we had to get rid of when we were here last time? That clock that shot bolts at everyone and those old robes that tried to strangle Ron; Regulus might have put them there to protect the locket’s hiding place, even though we didn’t realize it at . . . at . . . . . . at the time,
Something wrong?
There was a locket.
Why did you come up here anyway? What have you been doing?
In the cabinet in the drawing room. Nobody could open it. And we . . . we . . .
Kreacher nicked loads of things back from us, He had a whole stash of stuff in his cupboard in the kitchen. C’mon.

Session-955.Scene: Regulus ordered Kreacher to switch a Horcrux locket with a fake and leave him to die in a cave filled with Inferi.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It’s not over yet, Kreacher! I forbid you to call anyone ‘blood traitor’ or ‘Mudblood,’ I’ve got a question for you, and I order you to answer it truthfully. Understand?
Two years ago, there was a big gold locket in the drawing room upstairs. We threw it out. Did you steal it back?
Where is it now?
Gone? What do you mean, it’s gone? Kreacher,
Kreacher,
Harry, let him up!
Kreacher, I don’t think so. Right, Kreacher, I want the truth: How do you know Mundungus Fletcher stole the locket?
What? Why? Where did it come from? What did Regulus have to do with it? Kreacher, sit up and tell me everything you know about that locket, and everything Regulus had to do with it!
Voldemort needed an elf?
How did you get away?
I know — but how did you escape the Inferi?
I know, but —
Harry? He Disapparated!
But . . . you couldn’t Apparate in and out of that cave,
Elf magic isn’t like wizard’s magic, is it? I mean, they can Apparate and Disapparate in and out of Hogwarts when we can’t.

Of course, Voldemort would have considered the ways of house-elves far beneath his notice, just like all the purebloods who treat them like animals . . . It would never have occurred to him that they might have magic that he didn’t.
Well then, You didn’t disobey orders at all!
What? What did Regulus say when you told him what had happened? And he made you drink the potion?
Kreacher!
I told you not to call her ‘Mudblood’!
Kreacher — stop, stop! Well then, And you tried to destroy it?

Kreacher, Voldemort tried to kill you, Regulus died to bring Voldemort down, but you were still happy to betray Sirius to Voldemort? You were happy to go to Narcissa and Bellatrix, and pass information to Voldemort through them. . . .

Harry, Kreacher doesn’t think like that, He’s a slave; house-elves are used to bad, even brutal treatment; what Voldemort did to Kreacher wasn’t that far out of the common way. What do wizard wars mean to an elf like Kreacher? He’s loyal to people who are kind to him, and Mrs. Black must have been, and Regulus certainly was, so he served them willingly and parroted their beliefs. I know what you’re going to say, that Regulus changed his mind . . . but he doesn’t seem to have explained that to Kreacher, does he? And I think I know why. Kreacher and Regulus’s family were all safer if they kept to the old pure-blood line. Regulus was trying to protect them all.
Kreacher, when you feel up to it, er . . . please sit up. Kreacher, Kreacher, We need to find out where the locket — where Master Regulus’s locket is. It’s really important.
And bring him here, to Grimmauld Place, Do you think you could do that for us?
Overkill, mate,

Session-956.Scene: Ron's fidgeting with the Deluminator repeatedly plunged the drawing room into darkness.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Death Eaters, for sure, Reckon they know we’re in here?
I don’t think so, or they’d have sent Snape in after us, wouldn’t they?
D’you reckon he’s been in here and had his tongue tied by Moody’s curse?
Yes, otherwise he’d have been able to tell that lot how to get in, wouldn’t he? But they’re probably watching to see whether we turn up. They know that Harry owns the house, after all.
How do they — ? began Harry.
Wizarding wills are examined by the Ministry, remember? They’ll know Sirius left you the place. Will you stop it!
Sorry, sorry! I don’t know I’m doing it!
Well, can’t you find something useful to occupy yourself? Dumbledore left me this book, Ron —
— and he left me the Deluminator, maybe I’m supposed to use it!

Session-957.Scene: Snape denied killing Albus in response to a dust-figure attack.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Don’t move!

Session-958.Scene: Lupin confessed that he regretted marrying Tonks, feeling he had made her an outcast.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh, thank goodness,
Show yourself! Oh, all right, but I had to check, didn’t I?
No, What’s going on? Is everyone okay?
We know —
No, only after we ran into a couple of Death Eaters in a café on Tottenham Court Road.
And it doesn’t seem likely they were just strolling down Tottenham Court Road at the time, does it?
We wondered, whether Harry could still have the Trace on him?
Tell us what happened after we left, we haven’t heard a thing since Ron’s dad told us the family were safe.
Were they Death Eaters or Ministry people?
The Death Eaters got through all those protective charms?
And are they bothering to give an excuse for torturing Harry’s whereabouts out of people?
So Death Eaters have taken over the Daily Prophet too? But surely people realize what’s going on?
Why didn’t Voldemort declare himself Minister of Magic?
And this dramatic change in Ministry policy, involves warning the Wizarding world against me instead of Voldemort?

‘Recent research undertaken by the Department of Mysteries reveals that magic can only be passed from person to person when Wizards reproduce.  ‘The Ministry is determined to root out such usurpers of magical power, and to this end has issued an invitation to every so-called Muggle-born to present themselves for interview by the newly appointed Muggle-born Registration Commission.
People won’t let this happen,
What if purebloods and half-bloods swear a Muggle-born’s part of their family? I’ll tell everyone Hermione’s my cousin —
Thank you, Ron, but I couldn’t let you —
You won’t have a choice, I’ll teach you my family tree so you can answer questions on it.

Ron, as we’re on the run with Harry Potter, the most wanted person in the country, I don’t think it matters. If I was going back to school it would be different. What’s Voldemort planning for Hogwarts?

It’s . . . it’s . . . he muttered, struggling to find words that did justice to the horror of his thoughts, but Lupin said quietly,I know It’s . . . it’s . . . he muttered, struggling to find words that did justice to the horror of his thoughts, but Lupin said quietly,I know
He did, and Ron and Hermione are in on it and they’re coming with me.
I can’t, Remus, I’m sorry. If Dumbledore didn’t tell you I don’t think I can.
But what about Tonks?
Well, you’re married! How does she feel about you going away with us?
Remus, is everything all right . . . you know . . . between you and —
Oh, how wonderful!
Excellent! said Ron enthusiastically.
Congratulations,
Just — just to be clear, You want to leave Tonks at her parents’ house and come away with us?
Well,
Explain, then,
I see, so you’re just going to dump her and the kid and run off with us?

Oh, I don’t know, Hermione, I’d be pretty ashamed of him. If the new regime thinks Muggle-borns are bad, what will they do to a half-werewolf whose father’s in the Order? My father died trying to protect my mother and me, and you reckon he’d tell you to abandon your kid to go on an adventure with us?
I think you’re feeling a bit of a daredevil,
Harry, no!
I’d never have believed this, The man who taught me to fight dementors — a coward.
Remus,
It was easy, Don’t look at me like that! he snapped at Hermione.
Don’t you start on her! snarled Ron.
No — no — we mustn’t fight! said Hermione, launching herself between them.
You shouldn’t have said that stuff to Lupin,
He had it coming to him, Parents, shouldn’t leave their kids unless — unless they’ve got to.
Harry — said Hermione, stretching out a consoling hand, but he shrugged it off and walked away, his eyes on the fire Hermione had conjured.
I know I shouldn’t have called him a coward.
No, you shouldn’t,
But he’s acting like one.
All the same . . .
I know, But if it makes him go back to Tonks, it’ll be worth it, won’t it?

Session-959.Scene: Mundungus sold the locket he stole to a Ministry worker in Diagon Alley to avoid a fine.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Expelliarmus!
You’re not in much of a position to make threats,
You’ve done really well, Kreacher, Right, we’ve got a few questions for you,
For your information, none of the rest of us Disapparated,
We’re not interested in why you ran out on Mad-Eye, We already knew you were an unreliable bit of scum.
It’s not about the goblets either, although you’re getting warmer, Shut up and listen. When you cleaned out this house of anything valuable, Harry began,
Kreacher, no!
We need him conscious, Kreacher, but if he needs persuading you can do the honors,
When you stripped this house of all the valuables you could find, you took a bunch of stuff from the kitchen cupboard. There was a locket there. What did you do with it?
You’ve still got it!
No, he hasn’t, He’s wondering whether he should have asked more money for it.
What do you mean?
Who was this woman?
Aguamenti!

Session-960.Scene: Hermione magically concealed Phineas Nigellus' portrait within her beaded bag to prevent Snape from using it to spy on them.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’ve got news, and you won’t like it.
What’s happened?

‘Severus Snape, long-standing Potions master at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry, was today appointed headmaster in the most important of several staffing changes at the ancient school. ‘I welcome the opportunity to uphold our finest Wizarding traditions and values —’ Like committing murder and cutting off people’s ears, I suppose! Snape, headmaster! Snape in Dumbledore’s study — Merlin’s pants! I’ll be back in a minute!

She must be upset. The other teachers won’t stand for this. McGonagall and Flitwick and Sprout all know the truth, they know how Dumbledore died. They won’t accept Snape as headmaster. And who are these Carrows?

Death Eaters, There are pictures of them inside. They were at the top of the tower when Snape killed Dumbledore, so it’s all friends together. And, I can’t see that the other teachers have got any choice but to stay. If the Ministry and Voldemort are behind Snape it’ll be a choice between staying and teaching, or a nice few years in Azkaban — and that’s if they’re lucky. I reckon they’ll stay to try and protect the students. Thanks, Kreacher, Well, at least we know exactly where Snape is now. There are still a load of Death Eaters watching the house, more than usual. It’s like they’re hoping we’ll march out carrying our school trunks and head off for the Hogwarts Express.
I’ve been thinking about that all day. It left nearly six hours ago. Weird, not being on it, isn’t it?
They nearly saw me coming back in just now, I landed badly on the top step, and the Cloak slipped.
I do that every time. Oh, here she is, And what in the name of Merlin’s most baggy Y Fronts was that about?
I remembered this, Phineas Nigellus,
Sorry? What d’you think I was doing?
Snape could send Phineas Nigellus to look inside this house for him, But let him try it now, all Phineas Nigellus will be able to see is the inside of my handbag.
Good thinking!
What’s happened? So, Harry, what else happened today?
Watched the Ministry entrance for seven hours. No sign of her. Saw your dad, though, Ron. He looks fine.
Dad always told us most Ministry people use the Floo Network to get to work, That’s why we haven’t seen Umbridge, she’d never walk, she’d think she’s too important.
And what about that funny old witch and that little wizard in the navy robes?
Oh yeah, the bloke from Magical Maintenance,
How do you know he works for Magical Maintenance?
Dad said everyone from Magical Maintenance wears navy blue robes.
But you never told us that! There’s nothing in here about navy blue robes, nothing!
Well, does it really matter?

Ron, it all matters! If we’re going to get into the Ministry and not give ourselves away when they’re bound to be on the lookout for intruders, every little detail matters! We’ve been over and over this, I mean, what’s the point of all these reconnaissance trips if you aren’t even bothering to tell us —
Blimey, Hermione, I forget one little thing —
You do realize, don’t you, that there’s probably no more dangerous place in the whole world for us to be right now than the Ministry of —
I think we should do it tomorrow,
Tomorrow? You aren’t serious, Harry?

I am, I don’t think we’re going to be much better prepared than we are now even if we skulk around the Ministry entrance for another month. The longer we put it off, the farther away that locket could be. There’s already a good chance Umbridge has chucked it away; the thing doesn’t open.
Unless, she’s found a way of opening it and she’s now possessed.

Wouldn’t make any difference to her, she was so evil in the first place, We know everything important, We know they’ve stopped Apparition in and out of the Ministry. We know only the most senior Ministry members are allowed to connect their homes to the Floo Network now, because Ron heard those two Unspeakables complaining about it. And we know roughly where Umbridge’s office is, because of what you heard that bearded bloke saying to his mate — Exactly, And we know you get in using those funny coins, or tokens, or whatever they are, because I saw that witch borrowing one from her friend —
But we haven’t got any!
If the plan works, we will have,
I don’t know, Harry, I don’t know. . . . There are an awful lot of things that could go wrong, so much relies on chance. . . .
That’ll be true even if we spend another three months preparing, It’s time to act.

Session-961.Scene: Harry concealed a sudden surge of pain from his scar while Ron and Hermione discussed their plans.

Dialogue.Dialogue: All right, let’s say we go for it tomorrow. . . . I think it should just be me and Harry.
Oh, don’t start that again! I thought we’d settled this.
It’s one thing hanging around the entrances under the Cloak, but this is different, Hermione. You’re on the list of Muggle-borns who didn’t present themselves for interrogation!
And you’re supposed to be dying of spattergroit at the Burrow! If anyone shouldn’t go, it’s Harry, he’s got a ten-thousand-Galleon price on his head —
All right, Let me know if you ever defeat Voldemort, won’t you?
Well, if all three of us go we’ll have to Disapparate separately, We can’t all fit under the Cloak anymore.
Thanks, Kreacher,

Session-962.Scene: Ron bluntly commented on Harry's disheveled appearance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You look terrible,
Not for long,

Session-963.Scene: Hermione transformed into Mafalda Hopkirk after adding the witch's hair to Polyjuice Potion.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nicely done, Hermione, She’s Mafalda Hopkirk, You’d better take this, Hermione, and here are the tokens.
