Session-1042.Scene: Lupin announced the birth of his son, Teddy, named after Tonks's father.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wha — ? Tonks — Tonks has had the baby?
Blimey, a baby!
M-me?
I — yeah — blimey —

Session-1043.Scene: Bill cautioned Harry about the significant dangers of breaking a promise to a goblin.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I’m sorry, Sorry, Bill.
What d’you mean, ‘gone on’?
I respect — Harry began, but Bill shook his head.
But if it was bought —
Right, I’ll bear that in mind.

Session-1044.Scene: Hermione expressed her intense dislike for the wand, associating it with torture and death.

Dialogue.Dialogue: And you’ll be using her actual wand, so I reckon you’ll be pretty convincing.
I hate this thing, I really hate it. It feels all wrong, it doesn’t work properly for me. . . . It’s like a bit of her.
It’ll probably help you get in character, though, Think what that wand’s done!

But that’s my point! This is the wand that tortured Neville’s mum and dad, and who knows how many other people? This is the wand that killed Sirius! I miss my wand, I wish Mr. Ollivander could have made me another one too.

Session-1045.Scene: Harry subtly drew his sword, prompting Griphook's observant awareness.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We’ve just been checking the last-minute stuff, Griphook. We’ve told Bill and Fleur we’re leaving tomorrow, and we’ve told them not to get up to see us off.
He could give my mother lessons,

Session-1046.Scene: Hermione disguised Ron's appearance with a thick brown beard, mustache, and altered nose to create a fake identity.

Dialogue.Dialogue: She tasted disgusting, worse than Gurdyroots! Okay, Ron, come here so I can do you. . . .
Right, but remember, I don’t like the beard too long —
Oh, for heaven’s sake, this isn’t about looking handsome —
It’s not that, it gets in the way! But I liked my nose a bit shorter, try and do it the way you did last time.
There, how does he look, Harry?
Well, he’s not my type, but he’ll do, Shall we go, then?

Session-1047.Scene: Tom seemed surprised as Harry passed by under the cloak.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Good morning,
Too polite, You need to treat people like they’re scum!
Okay, okay!

Session-1048.Scene: Harry surreptitiously cast the Imperius Curse on Travers to make him lead them away from the hall.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I wish to enter my vault,
Identification? I — I have never been asked for identification before!
Imperio!
What? No, no, that’s mine —
Imperio!
We’re in trouble; they suspect, I don’t think I did it strongly enough, I don’t know. . . .
What do we do? Shall we get out now, while we can?
If we can,
Let’s go.
Imperio!
What?
Hide,

Session-1049.Scene: The Thief's Downfall revealed Hermione and Ron's true appearances, stripping away their disguises.

Dialogue.Dialogue: C-Cushioning Charm,
It washes away all enchantment, all magical concealment! They know there are impostors in Gringotts, they have set off defenses against us!
Imperio!
Harry, I think I can hear people coming! Protego!
Good thinking, Lead the way, Griphook!
How are we going to get out again? Ron asked as they hurried on foot into the darkness after the goblin, Bogrod panting in their wake like an old dog.
Let’s worry about that when we have to, Griphook, how much farther?

Session-1050.Scene: The dragon retreated upon hearing the Clankers, remembering the pain associated with the sound.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Search, fast!

Session-1051.Scene: Griphook betrayed Harry by seizing the sword with Hufflepuff's cup skewered on it.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Lumos!
Harry, could this be — ? Aargh! It burned me!
Okay, don’t touch anything!
Stand still, don’t move!
Just look around! Remember, the cup’s small and gold, it’s got a badger engraved on it, two handles — otherwise see if you can spot Ravenclaw’s symbol anywhere, the eagle — It’s there, it’s up there!
And how the hell are we going to get up there without touching anything?
Accio Cup!

Then what do we do? If you want the sword, Griphook, then you’ll have to help us more than — wait! Can I touch stuff with the sword? Hermione, give it here! If I can just poke the sword through a handle — but how am I going to get up there? Hermione, I’ve got to get up there, we’ve got to get rid of it —
Levicorpus. Impervius!
Liberacorpus! Get it! Where’s the sword? It had the cup on it!
Stupefy! Relashio! This way!
What?
Get up, climb up, come on —
We’ll never get out, it’s too big!

Session-1052.Scene: Fact: Harry considered the possibility of the dragon realizing it carried edible humans.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What do you reckon it’s looking for?
No idea,
Is it my imagination, or are we losing height?
I say we jump when it gets low enough! Straight into the water before it realizes we’re here! NOW! I say we jump when it gets low enough!

Session-1053.Scene: Harry dripped dittany onto a burn on his leg after their escape.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Well, on the upside, we got the Horcrux. On the downside —
— no sword, No sword,
No sword, That double-crossing little scab . . . At least we can’t wear it this time, that’d look a bit weird hanging round our necks,
What’ll happen to it, do you think? Will it be all right?
You sound like Hagrid, It’s a dragon, Hermione, it can look after itself. It’s us we need to worry about.
What do you mean?
Well, I don’t know how to break this to you, but I think they might have noticed we broke into Gringotts.
What are we going to do, though? He’ll know, won’t he? You-Know-Who will know we know about his Horcruxes!
Maybe they’ll be too scared to tell him?

Session-1054.Scene: Harry realized Voldemort would likely check the Horcruxes' safety.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He knows.
How quickly would they realize what had been taken? But what did you see? How do you know?
I saw him find out about the cup, I — I was in his head, he’s he’s seriously angry, and scared too, he can’t understand how we knew, and now he’s going to check the others are safe, the ring first.
Did you see where in Hogwarts it is?
No, he was concentrating on warning Snape, he didn’t think about exactly where it is —
Wait, wait! We can’t just go, we haven’t got a plan, we need to —
What? Can you imagine what he’s going to do once he realizes the ring and the locket are gone? What if he moves the Hogwarts Horcrux, decides it isn’t safe enough?
But how are we going to get in?
We’ll go to Hogsmeade, and try to work something out once we see what the protection around the school’s like. Get under the Cloak, Hermione, I want to stick together this time.
But we don’t really fit —
It’ll be dark, no one’s going to notice our feet.

Session-1055.Scene: Harry's Patronus, in the form of a stag, dispersed the approaching dementors, revealing his location to the Death Eaters.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Let’s just leave! Disapparate now!
Great idea,
They were ready for us, They set up that spell to tell them we’d come. I reckon they’ve done something to keep us here, trap us —
It was of Ron and Hermione that he thought as he whispered, Expecto Patronum!

Session-1056.Scene: Aberforth revealed that he had purchased Sirius's mirror from Dung about a year prior to the encounter.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Thank you, We can’t thank you enough. You saved our lives.
You sent Dobby.
He’s dead, Bellatrix Lestrange killed him.
You’re Aberforth, How did you get this?
The silver doe! Was that you too?
Someone sent a doe Patronus to us!
Oh, Yeah . . . well, I’m hungry!

Session-1057.Scene: Ariana's magical abilities turned inward after a Muggle attack, causing her to become unstable and dangerous.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Mr. Dumbledore? Is that your sister? Ariana?
Elphias Doge mentioned her to us,
Professor Dumbledore cared about Harry, very much,
What do you mean?
But that’s a really serious thing to say! Are you — are you talking about your sister?
I’m so . . . I’m so sorry,
He was never free,

Never, The night that your brother died, he drank a potion that drove him out of his mind. He started screaming, pleading with someone who wasn’t there. ‘Don’t hurt them, please . . . hurt me instead. He thought he was back there with you and Grindelwald, I know he did, He thought he was watching Grindelwald hurting you and Ariana. . . . It was torture to him, if you’d seen him then, you wouldn’t say he was free.
I don’t believe it. Dumbledore loved Harry,
Because, sometimes you’ve got to think about more than your own safety! Sometimes you’ve got to think about the greater good! This is war!
I’m of age, and I’m going to keep fighting even if you’ve given up!
‘You-Know-Who’s won, it’s over, and anyone who’s pretending different’s kidding themselves.

No, it isn’t, Your brother knew how to finish You-Know-Who and he passed the knowledge on to me. I’m going to keep going until I succeed — or I die. Don’t think I don’t know how this might end. I’ve known it for years. We need to get into Hogwarts, If you can’t help us, we’ll wait till daybreak, leave you in peace, and try to find a way in ourselves. If you can help us — well, now would be a great time to mention it.

Session-1058.Scene: Neville brushed off his injuries, stating Seamus's condition was worse.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Neville — what the — how — ?
Neville, what’s happened to you?
Harry addressed Aberforth.I don’t know how to thank you. You’ve saved our lives twice.

Session-1059.Scene: Neville revealed that the Carrows had targeted his grandmother, leading to Dawlish being hospitalized and his grandmother going on the run.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How long’s this been here? It isn’t on the Marauder’s Map, is it, Harry? I thought there were only seven passages in and out of school?
Yeah, it’s true,
Released it into the wild,
You’re right, but tell us about Hogwarts, Neville, we haven’t heard anything.
Those two Death Eaters who teach here?
Like Umbridge?
Blimey, Neville, there’s a time and a place for getting a smart mouth.
But they’ve used you as a knife sharpener,
Neville, she’s all right, we’ve seen her —
You used to?
No kidding,
Cool,
But, aren’t — aren’t we heading straight back into Hogwarts?

Session-1060.Scene: Neville discovered the Room of Requirement's expanded features while seeking refuge from the Carrows.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where are we?
And the Carrows can’t get in?
Yeah,

Session-1061.Scene: Harry's burning scar signified Voldemort's awareness of a lost Horcrux.

Dialogue.Dialogue: No, We need to get going,
Plan?
We haven’t come back to stay,
I — I can’t tell you.
Well, yeah —
You don’t understand. We — we can’t tell you. We’ve got to do it — alone.
Because . . . Dumbledore left the three of us a job, and we weren’t supposed to tell — I mean, he wanted us to do it, just the three of us.
It hasn’t exactly been a picnic, mate,

Session-1062.Scene: Neville summoned Luna and Dean upon Harry's return, anticipating a revolution against Snape and the Carrows.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look,
What? what are you doing here? How did you — ?
Listen, I’m sorry, but that’s not what we came back for. There’s something we’ve got to do, and then —
No! What we’re doing will benefit everyone in the end, it’s all about trying to get rid of You-Know-Who —

Session-1063.Scene: Cho Chang offered to show Harry a statue of Ravenclaw wearing the diadem in their common room.

Dialogue.Dialogue: There isn’t one,
What? What did you call them all back for? This is insane —
Why can’t they help?
What?
They can help. We don’t know where it is. We’ve got to find it fast. We don’t have to tell them it’s a Horcrux.
I think Ron’s right. We don’t even know what we’re looking for, we need them. You don’t have to do everything alone, Harry.

All right, Okay, There’s something we need to find, Something — something that’ll help us overthrow You-Know-Who. It’s here at Hogwarts, but we don’t know where. It might have belonged to Ravenclaw. Has anyone heard of an object like that? Has anyone ever come across something with her eagle on it, for instance?
When was it lost?
Sorry, but what is a diadem?
And none of you have ever seen anything that looks like it?

He’s on the move, Listen, I know it’s not much of a lead, but I’m going to go and look at this statue, at least find out what the diadem looks like. Wait for me here and keep, you know — the other one — safe.
How do we get out?
No problem, See you in a bit.

Session-1064.Scene: Luna presented the riddle of the eagle door knocker to Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Get under here, We’re up on the fifth floor, Come on, this way.
What? Isn’t there just a password?
What if you get it wrong?
Thing was,

Session-1065.Scene: A first-year student gleefully prodded the unconscious Alecto with his toe, believing she might be dead.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Luna, where are you? I need to get under the Cloak!
Yeah . . . great . . .

Session-1066.Scene: Amycus spat in Professor McGonagall's face, prompting Harry to retaliate with the Cruciatus Curse.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You shouldn’t have done that. Crucio! I see what Bellatrix meant, you need to really mean it.
He spat at you,
Yeah, I do, Professor McGonagall, Voldemort’s on the way.
I don’t think it makes any difference what we call him, He already knows where I am.
I can’t, There’s something I need to do. Professor, do you know where the diadem of Ravenclaw is? Have you got any idea where the diadem of Ravenclaw is?
I had to, Professor, there’s something hidden here that I’m supposed to find, and it could be the diadem — if I could just speak to Professor Flitwick —

Time’s running out, Voldemort’s getting nearer. Professor, I’m acting on Dumbledore’s orders, I must find what he wanted me to find! But we’ve got to get the students out while I’m searching the castle — it’s me Voldemort wants, but he won’t care about killing a few more or less, not now —
Is that possible?
Let me —
There’s a way,
I know, Professor, but if Voldemort and the Death Eaters are concentrating on the school boundaries they won’t be interested in anyone who’s Disapparating out of the Hog’s Head.

Session-1067.Scene: Snape subtly flexed the arm bearing the Dark Mark while speaking with McGonagall.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You mean he’s dead?

Session-1068.Scene: McGonagall threatened Slughorn with lethal dueling if Slytherin opposed their resistance.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Professor! Professor, we’ve got to barricade the school, he’s coming now!
Professor, Professor, I’m sorry to interrupt, but this is important. Have you got any idea where the diadem of Ravenclaw is?
I only meant — do you know where it is? Have you ever seen it?

Session-1069.Scene: Ginny bitterly agreed to leave after Harry shook his head at her pleading look.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wh — ?
Voldemort’s on his way, they’re barricading the school — Snape’s run for it — What are you doing here? How did you know?
They’re evacuating the younger kids and everyone’s meeting in the Great Hall to get organized, We’re fighting.

Session-1070.Scene: Percy dramatically confessed his past mistakes to his family after arriving through a secret tunnel.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where’s Ron? Where’s Hermione?
I didn’t see them pass me,
A bathroom? You’re sure they said bath — ?

Session-1071.Scene: Harry momentarily forgot about the Horcrux and the reason for the battle due to Ron and Hermione's absence.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What? Oh, oh yeah!
Right — yeah —

Session-1072.Scene: Helena Ravenclaw revealed that the Bloody Baron murdered her after she refused to return with him to her dying mother.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Nick! NICK! I need to talk to you!
Nick, you’ve got to help me. Who’s the ghost of Ravenclaw Tower?
It’s got to be her — d’you know where she is?
Hey — wait — come back! You’re the Gray Lady? The ghost of Ravenclaw Tower?
Please: I need some help. I need to know anything you can tell me about the lost diadem.
WAIT! This is urgent, If that diadem’s at Hogwarts, I’ve got to find it, fast.
This isn’t about trying to get better marks! It’s about Voldemort — defeating Voldemort — or aren’t you interested in that?
Well, help me, then! Your mother’s?
You’re her daughter? But then, you must know what happened to it!

Haven’t I just told you, I’m not interested in wearing it! There’s no time to explain — but if you care about Hogwarts, if you want to see Voldemort finished, you’ve got to tell me anything you know about the diadem!
What?
The Baron? You mean — ?
And . . . and the diadem?
A hollow tree? What tree? Where was this?
Albania, You’ve already told someone this story, haven’t you? Another student?
Well, you weren’t the first person Riddle wormed things out of, He could be charming when he wanted. . . . — the night he asked for a job!

He hid the diadem in the castle, the night he asked Dumbledore to let him teach! He must’ve hidden the diadem on his way up to, or down from, Dumbledore’s office! But it was still worth trying to get the job — then he might’ve got the chance to nick Gryffindor’s sword as well — thank you, thanks!

Session-1073.Scene: Grawp had unintentionally shoved Hagrid through a castle window.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hagrid! What the — ?
Hagrid, where have you come from?
That, is a really good question. Come on.
I dunno exactly, but Ron and Hermione must be around here somewhere. . . .

Session-1074.Scene: Aberforth suggested holding Slytherin students hostage, a tactic Harry rejected.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I know, we’re evacuating,
It wouldn’t stop Voldemort, and your brother would never have done it.

Session-1075.Scene: Ron modestly revealed he had imitated Parseltongue to access the Chamber of Secrets.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Where the hell have you been?
Chamber of Secrets,
What?

It was Ron, all Ron’s idea! Wasn’t it absolutely brilliant? after you left, and I said to Ron, even if we find the other one, how are we going to get rid of it? We still hadn’t got rid of the cup! And then he thought of it! The basilisk!
What the — ?
Something to get rid of Horcruxes,
But how did you get in there? You need to speak Parseltongue!
He did! Show him, Ron!
It’s what you did to open the locket, I had to have a few goes to get it right, but, we got there in the end.
He was amazing! Amazing!
So . . . So . . .
So we’re another Horcrux down, Hermione stabbed it. Thought she should. She hasn’t had the pleasure yet.
Genius!
It was nothing, So what’s new with you?
Come on. He hid it exactly where I hid my old Potions book, where everyone’s been hiding stuff for centuries. He thought he was the only one to find it. Come on.

Session-1076.Scene: Ron's unexpected concern for the house-elves' safety prompted Hermione to passionately kiss him.

Dialogue.Dialogue: ’S far as we know, Are there still people in the passage to the Hog’s Head?
“He’s fighting,” said Harry. I thought you were supposed to be with Teddy at your mother’s?
He was planning to lead a group of fighters into the grounds — Ginny, I’m sorry, but we need you to leave too. Just for a bit. Then you can come back in. And then you can come back in!
WAIT! We’ve forgotten someone!
Who’s the ghost of Ravenclaw Tower?
The house-elves, they’ll all be down in the kitchen, won’t they?
You mean we ought to get them fighting?
No, I mean we should tell them to get out. We don’t want any more Dobbies, do we? We can’t order them to die for us —
Is this the moment? OI! There’s a war going on here!
I know, mate, so it’s now or never, isn’t it?
Never mind that, what about the Horcrux? D’you think you could just — just hold it in until we’ve got the diadem?
Yeah — right — sorry — said Ron, and he and Hermione set about gathering up fangs, both pink in the face.

Session-1077.Scene: **Fact:** Ginny shot a jinx into a crowd of fighters through a window with missing panes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Let’s hope he steps on some of them!
They’ll be all right, Ginny, we’ll be back in a moment, just keep out of the way, keep safe — come on!

Session-1078.Scene: Harry revealed he had experience hiding things, implying a past necessity.

Dialogue.Dialogue: And he never realized anyone could get in?
He thought he was the only one, Too bad for him I’ve had to hide stuff in my time . . . this way, I think it’s down here. . . .
Accio Diadem!

Let’s split up, Look for a stone bust of an old man wearing a wig and a tiara! It’s standing on a cupboard and it’s definitely somewhere near here. . . . Somewhere near here, Somewhere . . . somewhere . . .

Session-1079.Scene: Crabbe's uncontrolled Fiendfyre curse created sentient, monstrous flames that consumed the Room of Requirement.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Not anymore, Winners, keepers, Malfoy. Who’s lent you theirs?
So how come you three aren’t with Voldemort?
Good plan, So how did you get in here?
Harry? Are you talking to someone? Harry?
Ron! Finite!
Harry? What’s going on? Harry?
Expelliarmus!
Harry!
Aguamenti!
What can we do? What can we do?
Here!
Harry, let’s get out, let’s get out! It’s — too — dangerous — ! Harry!
He’s dead,
Where was this? She was here. She was supposed to be going back into the Room of Requirement.
Blimey, d’you reckon it’ll still work after that fire? Shall we split up and look — ?
What? Let’s stick together. I say we go — Harry, what’s that on your arm? What?
What? Oh, Oh yeah —
It must have been Fiendfyre!
What? Must’ve learned from the Carrows,
Shame he wasn’t concentrating when they mentioned how to stop it, really, If he hadn’t tried to kill us all, I’d be quite sorry he was dead.
But don’t you realize? This means, if we can just get the snake —

Session-1080.Scene: Hermione, Harry, and Ron argued vehemently over who would retrieve the Horcrux.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He’s in the Shrieking Shack. The snake’s with him, it’s got some sort of magical protection around it. He’s just sent Lucius Malfoy to find Snape.
Voldemort’s sitting in the Shrieking Shack? He’s not — he’s not even fighting?
He doesn’t think he needs to fight, He thinks I’m going to go to him.
But why?
He knows I’m after Horcruxes — he’s keeping Nagini close beside him — obviously I’m going to have to go to him to get near the thing —
Right, So you can’t go, that’s what he wants, what he’s expecting. You stay here and look after Hermione, and I’ll go and get it —
You two stay here, I’ll go under the Cloak and I’ll be back as soon as I —
No,
Don’t even think about it,
Ron, I’m just as capable —

Session-1081.Scene: Ron was hit in the head with Snargaluff tubers dropped by Peeves.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Argh!
LET’S GO!
And that’s the second time we’ve saved your life tonight, you two-faced bastard!

Session-1082.Scene: A giant smashed a fist through an upper window, showering glass upon Harry.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How do we get out?
NO! HAGRID, COME BACK! HAGRID! HAGRID! HAGRID! HAGRID!
Oh my — !
HAGGER? RUN!

Session-1083.Scene: Harry summoned a stag Patronus with immense effort to repel dementors.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Something happy?
Can’t thank you enough,
RUN!
Let’s get out of range!yelled Ron

Session-1084.Scene: Ron successfully used Wingardium Leviosa to paralyze the Whomping Willow.

Dialogue.Dialogue: The Whomping Willow,
How — how’re we going to get in?
Crookshanks? Are you a wizard, or what?
Oh — right — yeah —
Perfect!
Wait.
Harry, we’re coming, just get in there!

Session-1085.Scene: Harry extinguished his wandlight while covering himself with the cloak.

Dialogue.Dialogue: The Cloak! Put the Cloak on!

With difficulty he dragged it over himself, murmured, Nox, extinguishing his wandlight, and continued on his hands and knees, as silently as possible, all his senses straining, expecting every second to be discovered, to hear a cold clear voice, see a flash of green light.

Session-1086.Scene: Harry entrusted Neville with the crucial task of killing Voldemort's snake, Nagini, as a backup plan.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Neville.
It’s all part of the plan, There’s something I’ve got to do. Listen — Neville —
No, ’Course not . . . this is something else. But I might be out of sight for a while. You know Voldemort’s snake, Neville? He’s got a huge snake. . . . Calls it Nagini . . .
dying. Ron and Hermione know that, but just in case they — Just in case they’re — busy — and you get the chance —
dying.
Neville.
Yeah, I —

Session-1087.Scene: Sirius described dying as quicker and easier than falling asleep.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Would it hurt to die?
I didn’t want you to die, Any of you. I’m sorry — I’m sorry — — right after you’d had your son . . . Remus, I’m sorry —
You’ll stay with me?
They won’t be able to see you?
Stay close to me,

Session-1088.Scene: Voldemort held the Elder Wand while anticipating someone's arrival.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You weren’t.

Session-1089.Scene: Voldemort unknowingly tethered Harry to life by rebuilding his body with Harry's blood, which contained Lily's protective enchantment.

Dialogue.Dialogue: But you’re dead,
Then . . . I’m dead too?
Not?
But . . . But I should have died — I didn’t defend myself! I meant to let him kill me!
Explain,
I let him kill me, Didn’t I?
So the part of his soul that was in me . . . . . . has it gone?
But . . . What is that, Professor?
But if Voldemort used the Killing Curse, and nobody died for me this time — how can I be alive?
He took my blood,
Didn’t I? But I thought . . . I thought it was the other way round! I thought we both had to die? Or is it the same thing? Are you sure we can’t do anything?
Then explain . . . more,
And you knew this? You knew — all along? There’s more, There’s more to it. Why did my wand break the wand he borrowed?
Have a guess, then,
But if my wand was so powerful, how come Hermione was able to break it?
He killed me with your wand.
I feel great at the moment, though, Where are we, exactly?
It looks, like King’s Cross station. Except a lot cleaner and empty, and there are no trains as far as I can see.
Well, where do you think we are?
The Deathly Hallows,
Well?
What are you talking about?
But they’re real!
What do I know?
Of course you were, Of course — how can you ask that? You never killed if you could avoid it!
Not the way he did, Hallows, not Horcruxes.
Hallows, not Horcruxes.

Session-1090.Scene: Dumbledore confessed that he had selfishly desired the Resurrection Stone to bring back his deceased family members.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Grindelwald was looking for them too?
So it’s true? All of it? The Peverell brothers —
Me?
The Cloak wouldn’t have helped them survive, though, Harry said quickly. Voldemort knew where my mum and dad were. The Cloak couldn’t have made them curse-proof.
So you’d given up looking for the Hallows when you saw the Cloak?
But I don’t despise you —
But you’d have been better, much better, than Fudge or Scrimgeour!
You were the best —
Grindelwald tried to stop Voldemort going after the wand. He lied, you know, pretended he had never had it.
. . . or maybe from breaking into your tomb? You tried to use the Resurrection Stone.
Why? It was natural! You wanted to see them again. What’s wrong with that?

Session-1091.Scene: Dumbledore confessed his plan to manipulate Snape into possessing the Elder Wand after his death, though it ultimately failed.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why did you have to make it so difficult?
And Voldemort never knew about the Hallows?
But you expected him to go after the wand?
Would I?
Oh yes, That bit didn’t work out. Would I?
I’ve got a choice?
And where would it take me?

Session-1092.Scene: Narcissa confirmed Draco's safety to herself before falsely declaring Harry's death to the crowd.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Yes,

Session-1093.Scene: Harry revealed he was the Elder Wand's true master because he disarmed Draco weeks prior.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Protego!
I don’t want anyone else to try to help, It’s got to be like this. It’s got to be me.
Nobody, There are no more Horcruxes. It’s just you and me. Neither can live while the other survives, and one of us is about to leave for good. . . .
Accident, was it, when my mother died to save me? Accident, when I decided to fight in that graveyard? Accident, that I didn’t defend myself tonight, and still survived, and returned to fight again?
You won’t be killing anyone else tonight, You won’t be able to kill any of them ever again. Don’t you get it? I was ready to die to stop you from hurting these people —

— I meant to, and that’s what did it. I’ve done what my mother did. They’re protected from you. Haven’t you noticed how none of the spells you put on them are binding? You can’t torture them. You can’t touch them. You don’t learn from your mistakes, Riddle, do you?
Yes, I know lots of important things that you don’t. Want to hear some, before you make another big mistake?
Just one thing,
I believe both,
Oh, he dreamed of it, but he knew more than you, knew enough not to do what you’ve done.
No, he was cleverer than you, a better wizard, a better man.
You thought you did, but you were wrong.
Yes, but you didn’t have him killed. He chose his own manner of dying, chose it months before he died, arranged the whole thing with the man you thought was your servant.

Snape was Dumbledore’s, Dumbledore’s from the moment you started hunting down my mother. And you never realized it, because of the thing you can’t understand. You never saw Snape cast a Patronus, did you, Riddle? Snape’s Patronus was a doe, the same as my mother’s, because he loved her for nearly all of his life, from the time when they were children. You should have realized, he asked you to spare her life, didn’t he?
Of course he told you that, but he was Dumbledore’s spy from the moment you threatened her, and he’s been working against you ever since! Dumbledore was already dying when Snape finished him!
Yeah, it did, You’re right. But before you try to kill me, I’d advise you to think about what you’ve done. . . . Think, and try for some remorse, Riddle. . . .
It’s your one last chance, it’s all you’ve got left. . . . I’ve seen what you’ll be otherwise. . . . Be a man . . . try . . . Try for some remorse. . . .
Yes, because Dumbledore’s last plan hasn’t backfired on me at all. It’s backfired on you, Riddle. That wand still isn’t working properly for you because you murdered the wrong person.

Aren’t you listening? Snape never beat Dumbledore! Dumbledore’s death was planned between them! Dumbledore intended to die undefeated, the wand’s last true master! If all had gone as planned, the wand’s power would have died with him, because it had never been won from him!

You still don’t get it, Riddle, do you? Possessing the wand isn’t enough! Holding it, using it, doesn’t make it really yours. Didn’t you listen to Ollivander? The wand chooses the wizard. . . . The Elder Wand recognized a new master before Dumbledore died, someone who never even laid a hand on it. The new master removed the wand from Dumbledore against his will, never realizing exactly what he had done, or that the world’s most dangerous wand had given him its allegiance. . . .

But you’re too late, You’ve missed your chance. So it all comes down to this, doesn’t it? Does the wand in your hand know its last master was Disarmed? Because if it does . . . I am the true master of the Elder Wand.
Expelliarmus!

Session-1094.Scene: The gargoyle granted permission for passage upward.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Can we go up?

Session-1095.Scene: Harry repaired his broken holly wand with the Elder Wand.

Dialogue.Dialogue: The thing that was hidden in the Snitch, I dropped it in the forest. I don’t know exactly where, but I’m not going to go looking for it again. Do you agree?
Tell me whether he is dead. I’m going to keep Ignotus’s present, though,
And then there’s this. I don’t want it,
What? Are you mental?

I know it’s powerful, But I was happier with mine. So . . . Reparo. I’m putting the Elder Wand,back where it came from. It can stay there. If I die a natural death like Ignotus, its power will be broken, won’t it? The previous master will never have been defeated. That’ll be the end of it.
Are you sure?
I think Harry’s right,

Session-1096.Scene: Lily expressed her impatience to leave for school.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It won’t be long, and you’ll be going too,

Session-1097.Scene: Ginny revealed that they had written to James three times a week during his previous year at Hogwarts.

Dialogue.Dialogue: And you don’t want to believe everything he tells you about Hogwarts, He likes a laugh, your brother.
